Tide

 97 71

Environmental protection

Tide is actively engaged in several initiatives aimed at reducing environmental impact, particularly in the areas of energy and water conservation. The brand emphasizes the importance of washing laundry in cold water, highlighting that doing so can significantly reduce energy consumption. Tide's detergents are formulated to perform effectively in cold water, which not only conserves energy but can also lead to financial savings for consumers. By switching from hot to cold water for laundry, it's estimated that enough energy can be saved in a year to charge a smartphone for a lifetime, potentially saving more than $150 annually on energy bills. Additionally, Tide promotes the use of High Efficiency (HE) washing machines, which can use significantly less water than traditional models. The brand's detergents are concentrated, meaning they contain more cleaning ingredients and less water per dose compared to other brands, further contributing to water conservation. Tide also focuses on sustainable packaging, with bottles made from at least 25% post-consumer recycled plastic. Innovations like Tide HE Turbo Clean and Tide PODSÂ® are designed to optimize water use in HE washers and require less water to manufacture, respectively, showcasing Tide's commitment to water-saving initiatives and product innovation.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Paramount+

 97 68

Environmental protection

Paramount has been actively working on sustainable production practices since 2013, with a focus on reducing the environmental impact of its filming processes. They have implemented sustainable production guidelines across their operations, including scripted shows, films, live events, short-form work, and unscripted content. Paramount utilizes the Green Production Guide (GPG), a set of best practices developed by the Producers Guild of America, to mitigate environmental impacts such as energy use, greenhouse gas emissions, and waste. This guide has been effectively used in domestic productions like âSpecial Ops: Lionessâ and âLawmen: Bass Reeves.â

Internationally, Paramount's efforts have been recognized as well. In the UK, Paramount earned sustainable production certification for 145 projects in 2022, including 50% of projects produced for Channel 5, through the Albert sustainable production initiative. In Australia, Paramount Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) has become a foundational member and seed funder of Sustainable Screens Australia, working towards capturing production-related environmental data.

One notable example of Paramount's commitment to sustainability is the production of Mission: Impossible â Dead Reckoning Part One, which implemented green production practices such as digital paperwork, reusable water bottles, energy-efficient lighting, and recycling of set materials. This production, among others, received Green or Gold Seal recognition from the Environmental Media Association (EMA) for sustainable production practices.

MasterCard

 97 66

Environmental protection

Mastercard is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and combat climate change. The company has committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2040, emphasizing the reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across its operations and supply chain. Mastercard's operational strategy includes a commitment to reduce absolute Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions by 38% by 2025 and to reduce absolute Scope 3 GHG emissions by 20% from a 2016 base year. These targets have been approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi), aligning with the most ambitious 1.5Â°C trajectory. Furthermore, Mastercard has achieved green certifications for all its owned campuses and data centers and sources 100% renewable electricity for its global operations as part of its membership in RE100. The company also engages its suppliers in decarbonization efforts, earning an âAâ rating for Supplier Engagement from CDP since 2018.

Mastercard is also developing environmentally focused solutions, including a sustainable cards program that reduces first-use plastic in payment card production and a carbon calculator developed with Doconomy, enabling consumers to estimate the carbon footprint of their purchases. Additionally, the Priceless Planet Coalitionâ¢, led by Mastercard, aims to restore 100 million trees globally, focusing on projects with significant potential for positive climate, community, and biodiversity impacts.

Heinz Ketchup

 97 76

Environmental protection

Heinz is actively engaged in various sustainability initiatives aimed at environmental protection. The company is on track to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050, with a significant milestone of sourcing 100% of Heinz Ketchup tomatoes sustainably by 2025. Heinz emphasizes the importance of close proximity between tomato fields and processing plants to reduce carbon footprint and ensure product freshness. The company practices upcycling by repurposing leftover tomato skins and seeds into pet food or livestock feed, thereby minimizing waste. Additionally, Heinz is involved in agricultural development projects worldwide to educate farmers on tomato conservation and sustainable farming practices. These efforts extend to regenerative agriculture, with the goal of preserving soil health, which is crucial for food production and climate change mitigation. Heinz is also innovating in packaging to achieve 100% recyclability, reusability, or compostability and aims to reduce landfill intensity by 20% by 2025. The company has set ambitious goals for water use reduction, energy use reduction, and increasing the use of renewable energy sources within its operations.

sources: 1, 2

Frito-Lay

 97 75

Environmental protection

Frito-Lay has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact. The company has made significant strides in harnessing renewable energy, such as switching its Modesto, CA plant to solar power and aiming for its Casa Grande facility to run primarily on renewable energy and recycled water. Frito-Lay has also focused on sustainable agriculture, ensuring that 100% of the corn and potatoes used in its products in North America are sustainably sourced. The company has implemented water-saving measures, saving 31 million gallons of water by reducing water use intensity by 4.8% year over year. In addition, Frito-Lay has worked on reducing the environmental impact of its fleet by converting to 100% natural gas sourced from renewable resources and aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and diesel usage significantly. The company has also committed to sustainable packaging efforts, reducing packaging plastic by more than 7.8 million lbs since 2019 and reusing cardboard up to 5 times, saving 2 million trees each year. Frito-Lay's parent company, PepsiCo, has been recognized for its sustainability efforts, ranking #1 in sustainability according to the Kantar PoweRanking report. Frito-Lay is also investing in breakthrough packaging technology with the goal of being 100% recyclable, compostable, biodegradable, or reusable by 2025.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Frito-Lay has taken steps to ensure worker welfare through the creation of the Green Team at its Jonesboro facility. The initiative, led by co-founder Jon Melvin, aimed to create a more sustainable workplace and involved more than 66,000 North American associates. The Green Team introduced employee competitions, pledges, and sustainability checklists, which led to a significant reduction in water, natural gas, and electric use by 20% in certain operations. This initiative not only contributed to the company's environmental goals but also engaged employees in sustainable practices, fostering a culture of sustainability within the workplace.

sources: 3

Nothing found

    • Reducing water consumption by over 100 million gallons
    • Converting fleet to 100% natural gas sourced from renewable resources
    • 100% LED lighting in manufacturing facilities
    • 100% recyclable, compostable, biodegradable, or reusable packaging by 2025

CVS

 97 63

Environmental protection

CVS HealthÂ® has implemented several initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact and promoting sustainability. In 2021, the company achieved a 70% reduction in paper use by phasing out print circulars, saved 33.5K MWh of energy through efficiency programs, and diverted 50% of all waste to recycling or reuse. CVS Health is also focused on reimagining products and packaging to reduce plastic use and ensure recyclability, including a partnership with the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) to audit plastic packaging and a pilot program for aluminum prescription bottles. The company has invested $5 million in the Beyond the Bag initiative to address single-use plastic bags and has implemented digital solutions to reduce paper usage, with 7.3 million ExtraCareÂ® members enrolling in digital receipts as of 2021. Additionally, CVS Health is minimizing waste and water use across its operations and rethinking its supply chain to reduce packaging materials and carbon emissions, including installing charging stations for electric transport refrigeration units at distribution centers. These efforts are part of CVS Health's broader sustainability strategy to improve health equity and reduce resource consumption and waste generation.

Kit Kat

 97 76

Environmental protection

KitKat has committed to becoming carbon neutral by 2025, aiming to reduce emissions generated from sourcing ingredients, manufacturing, and distribution by over 50%. The brand acknowledges that a significant portion of its emissions comes from the production of key ingredients like cocoa and milk. To address this, KitKat is focusing on initiatives such as restoring forests and transitioning to regenerative agriculture practices. These efforts include reducing synthetic inputs, better soil management, and tree planting to draw down carbon from the atmosphere, enhance biodiversity, and improve farm productivity. KitKat plans to assist farmers in planting five million shade trees in cocoa sourcing areas by 2025. Additionally, the brand is working towards using 100% renewable electricity in all its factories by the end of 2025, having already made progress by utilizing solar power in some manufacturing sites in the Middle East and Brazil. This commitment builds on more than a decade of sustainability efforts, including the sourcing of 100% of its cocoa from the NestlÃ© Cocoa Plan since 2016, under which NestlÃ© has planted over 15 million cocoa trees and invested CHF 300 million in cocoa sustainability.

sources: 1, 2

Wells Fargo

 97 45

Environmental protection

Wells Fargo is actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at protecting the environment and promoting sustainability. The company has established a comprehensive framework focusing on climate action and community impact, with a significant emphasis on building a low-carbon economy. This includes scaling clean energy, increasing sustainability in their operations, advancing climate finance and innovation, and supporting an equity-focused transition to a more sustainable future. Wells Fargo has committed to deploying $500 billion in sustainable finance by 2030, with approximately $129 billion already allocated towards initiatives that support a low-carbon economy and community resilience. The company has also set ambitious operational sustainability goals for 2030, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions, energy usage, total waste stream, and water usage by significant percentages from 2019 levels. Additionally, Wells Fargo meets 100% of its electricity consumption with renewable energy, primarily through Renewable Energy Certificates, and aims to transition to long-term agreements that directly support new sources of renewable energy. The company's efforts are further supported by its memberships in organizations like the U.S. Green Building Council and the Sustainable Purchasing Leadership Council, which align with its commitment to environmental protection and sustainability.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Wells Fargo demonstrates a commitment to respecting human rights throughout its operations, products, and services. The company's efforts are guided by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights. These guidelines identify a responsibility for corporations to respect human rights in their operations and through their business relationships and to provide remedies when adverse impacts to these rights occur. Wells Fargo's commitment to worker welfare is further evidenced by its Human Rights Statement, which outlines the company's dedication to upholding human rights standards across its global operations.

sources: 1

    • Sustainable Purchasing Leadership Council

    • Reducing total waste stream from 2019 levels by 50% by 2030
    • Reducing water usage from 2019 levels by 45% by 2030
    • Meeting 100% of annual purchased electricity needs with renewable energy by 2030

Walmart+

 97 64

Environmental protection

Walmart is actively working towards becoming a regenerative company with a strong focus on environmental sustainability. The company has set ambitious goals to reach zero emissions across its global operations by 2040 without relying on carbon offsets. Key strategies include transitioning to 100% renewable energy by 2035, zeroing out emissions from its vehicle fleet by 2040, and transitioning to low-impact refrigerants and electrified equipment for heating and cooling by the same year. Walmart is also working with its suppliers to avoid one gigaton of greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, a project known as Project Gigaton, which has already seen over 416 million metric tons of emissions avoided since 2017. Additionally, Walmart aims to protect, manage, or restore at least 50 million acres of land and one million square miles of ocean by 2030. The company is also working towards zero waste in its operations in key markets and aims for 100% recyclable, reusable, or industrially compostable private-brand packaging by 2025. As of 2020, 59% of Walmart's global private brand packaging met these criteria, and the company has committed to a 15% absolute reduction in its total virgin plastic use by 2025 compared to the 2020 baseline.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Walmart has made significant commitments towards ensuring the welfare of its workers and those within its supply chain. The company aims to make responsible recruitment the standard by 2026, emphasizing the importance of sourcing responsibly and promoting human dignity. In fiscal year 2021, Walmart sourced over $13 billion in goods and services from over 2,900 diverse suppliers. The Walmart Foundation has invested over $40 million since 2015 to enhance worker and community voices, promoting fair and responsible labor and recruitment practices in global supply chains. Additionally, since 2018, the Walmart Foundation has invested more than $20 million to strengthen smallholders in farmer producer organizations and improve farm yields in India.

sources: 1, 3

Animal welfare

Walmart's commitment to environmental sustainability extends to animal welfare, although specific programs or certifications directly related to animal welfare were not detailed in the provided context. The company's broader environmental and sustainability goals indirectly support habitats and ecosystems, which can benefit animal welfare.

sources: 1, 3

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Zero emissions across global operations by 2040 without carbon offsets
    • 100% renewable energy by 2035
    • Zero emissions from vehicle fleet by 2040
    • Low-impact refrigerants and electrified equipment for heating and cooling by 2040
    • Avoid one gigaton of greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 (Project Gigaton)
    • Protect, manage, or restore at least 50 million acres of land and one million square miles of ocean by 2030
    • Zero waste in operations in key markets
    • 100% recyclable, reusable, or industrially compostable private-brand packaging by 2025
    • 15% absolute reduction in total virgin plastic use by 2025 compared to the 2020 baseline
    • Make responsible recruitment the standard by 2026

Windows

 97 68

Environmental protection

Microsoft has made significant strides in environmental protection, committing to ambitious sustainability goals. By 2030, Microsoft aims to be carbon negative, water positive, and zero waste across its direct operations. This includes removing all of its historical emissions since its founding in 1975 by 2050. The company has invested in 1.4 million tons of carbon removal from various sources in fiscal year 2022 and is adopting a more circular strategy for materials management, diverting over 12,000 metric tons of waste from landfills and incinerators. Additionally, Microsoft has reached nearly one million people with clean water and sanitation solutions and has protected more land than it uses, with 12,270 acres of land protected in Belize. These efforts are part of Microsoft's broader commitment to sustainability, which includes the development of a Planetary Computer to enable better environmental decision-making and the investment of $1 billion in the Climate Innovation Fund to support climate technologies and solutions.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Microsoft is committed to ensuring the welfare of its workers and those in its supply chain. The company works to ensure transparency and ethical standards across its global supply chain, collaborating with suppliers to protect the fundamental rights of people at every step of the processâfrom responsible sourcing to production and distribution. This includes efforts to empower employees, engage in public policy, and support the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Microsoft's approach to worker welfare is part of its broader commitment to corporate social responsibility, which encompasses expanding opportunity, earning trust, and protecting fundamental rights.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Remove historical emissions by 2050
    • Water positive by 2030
    • Zero waste by 2030
    • Protect more land than used by 2025

Subway

 97 66

Environmental protection

Subway is actively engaged in various environmental sustainability efforts, focusing on reducing its impact on the environment through sustainable packaging, agriculture, and other initiatives. The company has made significant strides in the US & Canada, reducing its greenhouse gas emissions by 292,936 metric tons of CO2, equivalent to 57,244 passenger cars not driven for a year, even as it grew by 12%. This reduction is part of Subway's broader commitment to environmental sustainability, which includes streamlining its supply chain to be more efficient and sustainable. Efforts include adding or moving vendor locations closer to distributors, establishing re-distribution centers to reduce shipping costs and emissions, and optimizing travel routes and driving techniques to ensure trucks are shipped full, further reducing mileage. Additionally, Subway has introduced a process that consolidates all equipment orders into one shipment for new and remodeled restaurants in the U.S. and Latin America, eliminating excess packaging and unnecessary waste at the building site. These efforts demonstrate Subway's commitment to reducing its environmental footprint and supporting the health of the planet.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Subway is committed to supporting the communities in which it operates, emphasizing the well-being of its workers and those within its supply chain. The company ensures that its suppliers' employment practices meet Subway's Supplier Code of Conduct and Supply Chain Employment Practices Policy, focusing on fair labor practices. Subway's purchasing strategy includes working with female and ethnic minority suppliers wherever possible, with over $100 million of products purchased from minority suppliers annually in the U.S. Additionally, Subway supports its tomato growers in Florida by paying their migrant workers an additional $.01 per pound above their regular salary, demonstrating a commitment to providing a safe, positive working environment for employees. These efforts reflect Subway's dedication to promoting well-being and supporting the communities it serves.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Subway is committed to ensuring the welfare of animals used in its products, supporting the highest standards of animal welfare practices based on scientific research and industry recommendations. The company supports the Five Freedoms principle for the protection of animals kept for farming purposes, which includes freedom from hunger, discomfort, pain, injury, disease, and fear and distress. Subway's suppliers are required to maintain legal compliance with animal welfare standards and are encouraged to support quality assurance schemes. By 2024, Subway aims for 100% of its chicken products in the US and Canada to be produced in alignment with GAP standards for breed with improved welfare, living environments, and processed using controlled or low atmospheric stunning. Additionally, Subway's commitment extends to sourcing eggs from free-range hens in Europe and transitioning to cage-free eggs in North America and Latin America by 2025. These efforts demonstrate Subway's dedication to improving animal welfare practices within its supply chain.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • By 2024, 100% of chicken products in the US and Canada will be produced in alignment with GAP standards.
    • Transition to 100% eggs from cage-free hens in North America and Latin America by 2025.
    • Transition to pork and beef products from animals raised without antibiotics in the U.S. by 2025.

Fritos

 97 73

Environmental protection

Frito-Lay has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact. The company has made significant strides in harnessing renewable energy, such as switching its Modesto, CA plant to solar power and aiming for net-zero operations at its Casa Grande facility by primarily using renewable energy and recycled water. Frito-Lay has also focused on sustainable agriculture, ensuring that 100% of the corn and potatoes used in its products in North America are sustainably sourced. Water conservation efforts have led to a reduction in water use intensity by 4.8% year over year, saving 31 million gallons of water. The company has transitioned its fleet towards all-electric vehicles and aims to convert its entire fleet to 100% natural gas sourced from renewable resources, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions and fossil fuel consumption. Additionally, Frito-Lay has committed to reducing waste through initiatives like using 100% LED lighting in manufacturing facilities and reducing packaging plastic by more than 7.8 million lbs since 2019. The company is also working towards making its packaging 100% recyclable, compostable, biodegradable, or reusable by 2025.

sources: 1, 2

    • Net water positive by 2030
    • Packaging to be 100% recyclable, compostable, biodegradable, or reusable by 2025

Starbucks

 97 51

Environmental protection

Starbucks has set ambitious goals to become a resource-positive company, aiming to give more than it takes from the planet. This includes storing more carbon than it emits, eliminating waste, and conserving and replenishing more freshwater than it uses. The company has committed to reducing its carbon, water, and waste footprints by half by 2030. To achieve these targets, Starbucks is focusing on expanding plant-based menu options, shifting from single-use to reusable packaging, investing in regenerative agriculture, reforestation, forest conservation, and water replenishment in its supply chain, managing waste more effectively, and innovating with more responsible stores, operations, manufacturing, and delivery. Starbucks is also committed to carbon-neutral green coffee and conserving water usage in green coffee processing by 50%, both by 2030. These efforts are part of Starbucks' broader strategy to address its largest source of greenhouse gas emissions in coffee before the rest of the coffee value chain, such as transportation, roasting, or packaging. The company is working on decreasing carbon emissions in its supply chain, promoting and distributing climate-resistant tree varietals, and protecting and restoring at-risk forests in key coffee landscapes. Additionally, Starbucks aims to conserve water by investing in new ecological wet mills for C.A.F.E. Practice farms, making current water processing technology more efficient, and developing water replenishment projects in coffee communities.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Starbucks is actively working to ensure the welfare of workers within its supply chain. The company has pledged to donate 100 million disease-resistant coffee trees by 2025 to support farmers and their communities. This initiative is part of Starbucks' broader commitment to sustainability and worker welfare, aiming to reduce landfill waste by 50 percent by 2030. Through its C.A.F.E. Practices program, Starbucks has demonstrated a commitment to sourcing coffee responsibly, which has positively impacted the lives of coffee farmers and their communities. The program has shown that farmers participating in it have higher productivity than country averages, contributing to a long-term supply of high-quality coffee while benefiting the communities involved. Starbucks' efforts to become a resource-positive company include a focus on the welfare of the people in its supply chain, recognizing that taking care of people is integral to taking care of the planet.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • C.A.F.E. Practices
  • Commitments
    • Reduce carbon, water, and waste footprints by half by 2030
    • Carbon Neutral Green Coffee by 2030
    • Conserve water usage in green coffee processing by 50% by 2030
    • Donate 100 million disease-resistant coffee trees by 2025
    • Reduce landfill waste by 50 percent by 2030

Kellogg's

 97 72

Environmental protection

Kellogg's has made significant strides in environmental protection, focusing on sustainable packaging and renewable energy usage. The company has committed to making 100% of its packaging reusable, recyclable, or compostable by the end of 2025. This initiative is part of Kellogg's broader sustainability commitments, which also include ensuring all timber-based packaging is either recycled or certified as sustainably sourced. Additionally, Kellogg's is working towards reducing plastic waste by transitioning cereal pouches in Europe to recycle-ready material, aiming to remove approximately 480 tonnes of non-recyclable packaging annually from its supply chain. Furthermore, by the end of a recent year, Kellogg's planned to switch to compostable and paper food-service products across all its plants and offices globally, eliminating single-use foam and plastic serviceware, plastic straws, and plastic water bottles. The company's Taloja plant in India is moving towards sustainability by consuming 60% of its total energy from renewable sources by the end of 2021, aligning with Kellogg's global goal of 100% renewable energy by 2050.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Kellogg's demonstrates its commitment to worker welfare through its global KelloggâsÂ® Better Days commitment, which includes supporting 1 million farmers, especially women smallholders and workers. The company has supported 16,945 smallholders in India to date, with a partnership initiated in 2015 in Madhya Pradesh aimed at training more than 12,000 smallholder farmers in climate-smart practices. This initiative has expanded to empower smallholder wheat farmers in five districts across Uttar Pradesh. These efforts are part of Kellogg's broader commitment to nurturing people and the planet by conserving natural resources across its value chain and supporting the communities where it operates.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • 100% reusable, recyclable or compostable packaging by the end of 2025
    • Recycling 100% of plastic created through Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) â circular economy
    • Converting to mono-layer 100% sustainable packaging by the end of 2025
    • 60% of total energy consumption from renewable sources at Taloja plant by the end of 2021
    • Global goal of 100% renewable energy by 2050

Lifesavers

 97 70

Environmental protection

LifeSaver is actively engaged in environmental protection through its product offerings and operational practices. The company's water purifiers, including portable bottles and jerrycans, are designed to reduce the reliance on single-use plastic bottles, thereby preventing plastic pollution. These purifiers use ultrafiltration technology that does not require power or chemicals, making the purification process sustainable. LifeSaver's products are long-lasting and durable, further contributing to waste minimization. Additionally, the company has taken steps to reduce its carbon footprint by sourcing and manufacturing components close to its factory in Britain, and by moving away from using plastics in packaging where possible. LifeSaver also emphasizes the recyclability of its filter cartridges, underscoring its commitment to environmental sustainability.

sources: 1, 2

  • Commitments
    • Reduction of single-use plastic bottles through the use of LifeSaver water purifiers
    • Minimization of carbon footprint by sourcing and manufacturing components close to the factory in Britain
    • Transition away from using plastics in packaging where possible

Disney+

 97 64

Environmental protection

The Walt Disney Company, under which Disney+ operates, has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing emissions, conserving water, minimizing waste, and sourcing lower impact products. The company has embarked on significant efforts to increase its renewable energy consumption, with the development of new solar facilities projected to supply nearly 40% of Walt Disney World Resort's annual power use. Disney has also focused on water conservation, employing reclaimed water and sophisticated irrigation systems to reduce potable water consumption. In terms of waste reduction, Disney has eliminated single-use plastic straws and stirrers across all owned and operated locations, diverting over 175 million straws and 13 million stirrers annually from landfills. Additionally, Disney has redesigned its Core Classic dolls to feature 100% recyclable, plastic-free packaging. The company is also committed to greening its production processes, as seen in the production of "The Mandalorian," where efforts were made to reduce waste and switch to low emissions energy sources. Disney's commitment to environmental stewardship is further evidenced by its investment in nature-based climate solutions and its ambitious 2030 Environmental Goals, which include reaching net zero greenhouse gas emissions, achieving zero waste in operations, and sourcing sustainable materials for its products.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

    • Achieve 90% diversion of construction waste across new projects in the U.S. and Europe by 2030

Pizza Hut

 97 63

Environmental protection

Pizza Hut has embarked on a comprehensive journey to achieve net-zero emissions by 2030. This ambitious goal involves consistently measuring their carbon footprint, reducing overall emissions against a science-based target, and finding ways to remove carbon from the atmosphere. They have already made significant strides in reducing their carbon footprint across Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions. In Scope 1, they've reduced gas usage per Hut by 23% since 2011 and absolute gas emissions by 45%, thanks to improvements in operational practices for gas, electricity, and water usage. Scope 2 efforts include purchasing renewable electricity since 2012 and installing energy-efficient equipment like LED light bulbs and smart meters. For Scope 3, Pizza Hut has focused on reducing operational food waste by 80% and donating surplus buffet pizza to good causes. Additionally, they have minimized waste by segregating recyclable materials in their restaurants, removed 99% of straws, and replaced glass bottles of mineral water with 100% recycled plastic bottles to lower their carbon footprint further. Pizza Hut Restaurants is also a founding member of the Zero Carbon Forum, an industry collaboration to set a roadmap to net zero, and has earned a 2 out of 3 Star rating from the Sustainable Restaurants Association for their environmental efforts.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Pizza Hut has partnered with Dairy Farmers of America (DFA) on an innovative farm-level sustainability project aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions from dairy farms that supply milk for Pizza Hut's cheese. This project provides participating farmers with technology and data to help reduce emissions and includes annual farm-level greenhouse gas and energy footprinting through the Farmers Assuring Responsible Management and Environmental Stewardship (FARM ES) evaluation. By 2025, Pizza Hut aims to source 50% of the dairy used in its pizza cheese from farms enrolled in the FARM ES program. This initiative not only aims to make Pizza Hut's supply chain more environmentally friendly but also supports the welfare of animals by promoting efficient and sustainable farming practices.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to being net-zero by 2030
    • Aiming to source 50% of the dairy used in pizza cheese from farms enrolled in the FARM ES program by 2025
    • Decreasing GHG emissions by 46% by 2030 with a focus on restaurants and supply chain and achieving net-zero emissions by 2050

Kellogg's Rice Krispies Treats

 97 69

Environmental protection

Kellogg's Rice Krispies Treats, through its parent company Kellogg Company, is actively engaging in efforts to reduce the environmental impact of rice production, which is known to be responsible for up to 12% of global methane emissions. The company has launched Kelloggâs Ingrainedâ¢, a $2 million, five-year initiative in collaboration with Walmart, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the Lower Mississippi River Basin. This program focuses on rewarding rice farmers for reducing their greenhouse gas emissions and provides them with training in irrigation management, nutrient management, and soil health. These efforts are part of a broader strategy to transition to more environmentally friendly farming practices. Additionally, Kellogg's support for woman-owned businesses like Kennedy Rice Mill in Northeast Louisiana highlights a commitment to both social and environmental sustainability. The company's targeted approach to tackling methane emissions from rice farming demonstrates a strategic effort to make a significant environmental impact.

sources: 1

Nothing found

  • Commitments

Nike

 97 65

Environmental protection

Nike is actively working towards environmental sustainability through its "Move to Zero" initiative, aiming for zero carbon and zero waste to protect the future of sport. The company has set ambitious targets for 2025, including reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 0.5 million tons by increasing the use of environmentally preferred materials to 50% across key materials like polyester, cotton, leather, and rubber. They also aim to divert 100% of waste from landfill in their extended supply chain, with at least 80% of waste recycled back into Nike products and other goods. Additionally, Nike is working towards a 25% reduction in fresh water usage per kilogram in textile dyeing and finishing processes. The company is also focusing on circular solutions to protect the future of sports by rethinking how products are brought into the world, made to last, and given new life. This includes recycling and donation programs for worn athletic shoes and apparel, a refurbished program for gently used shoes, and a re-creation initiative that uses local vintage and dead stock product materials to create newly designed and manufactured pieces. Nike's commitment to sustainability is further demonstrated through the development of innovative materials like Nike Air soles composed of at least 25% recycled manufacturing waste and powered by 100% renewable wind energy, Nike Flyknit fabric that reduces waste by an average of 60%, and Nike Flyleather which is made by binding at least 50% recycled leather fibers with synthetic fibers using a water-powered process. The company also utilizes recycled polyester made from plastic bottles, sustainable cotton sourced through the Better Cotton Initiative, and recycled nylon transformed from materials like carpet and used fish nets, all contributing to reduced carbon emissions and waste.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to zero carbon and zero waste under the "Move to Zero" initiative by 2025
    • Aiming for a 0.5 million tons reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
    • Targeting 100% waste diversion from landfill in the extended supply chain with at least 80% of waste recycled back into products
    • Working towards a 25% reduction in fresh water usage per kilogram in textile dyeing and finishing

Facebook

 97 53

Environmental protection

Meta (formerly known as Facebook) is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives aimed at combating climate change and promoting sustainability. The company has committed to reaching net zero emissions across its value chain by 2030, highlighting its dedication to reducing its carbon footprint. To support this goal, Meta has achieved 100% renewable energy for its global operations and is working towards becoming water positive by 2030, which involves returning more water to the environment than it consumes. Meta's efforts also extend to designing and operating some of the most efficient data centers in the world, integrating circular practices in its facilities and hardware, and engaging with suppliers to set targets and reduce emissions. Additionally, Meta has launched the Climate Science Information Center to provide access to authoritative, factual resources from leading climate organizations and has enabled significant fundraising for environmental protection through its platforms.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Meta is committed to ensuring the well-being of people in its operations and supply chain. The company takes bold climate action by not only minimizing its environmental footprint but also by protecting workers and the environment in its supply chain. Meta respects human, labor, and civil rights in its operations and supply chain, and cultivates diversity and inclusion within its workforce. The company's approach includes boosting energy and water efficiency in its data centers, which indirectly contributes to worker welfare by promoting a healthier and more sustainable working environment. Additionally, Meta works to ensure safe, healthy, and fair working conditions in its supply chain, demonstrating its commitment to responsible business practices that prioritize worker welfare.

sources: 1

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to reaching net zero emissions across its value chain by 2030
    • Committing to becoming water positive by 2030

The company has been actively involved in the communities where its stores are located for over a century, striving for operational excellence and social and environmental stewardship. Sears has developed and implemented several policies to support its sustainability efforts, including an Environmental Policy and a Paper Procurement Policy. These initiatives are part of Sears' broader commitment to responsibly manage its environmental, social, and economic resources, as detailed in their Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability Reports. However, specific actions, such as carbon reduction efforts, waste minimization, renewable energy usage, or designing environmentally friendly products, are not detailed in the provided context.

Honda

 97 73

Environmental protection

Honda is actively working towards achieving carbon neutrality by 2050 for all its products and corporate activities. This commitment is part of Honda's broader environmental strategy, which includes the "Triple Action to ZERO" concept focusing on carbon neutrality, clean energy, and resource circulation. Honda aims to minimize environmental impact not only through its products but across the entire product lifecycle, including all corporate activities. To reduce energy use and COâ emissions, Honda is introducing the latest energy-saving technologies and know-how at its new and renewed production plants. Additionally, the company is increasing its use of carbon-free electricity by proactively utilizing clean energy. Honda's motorcycle, automobile, and power products businesses have set targets for the ratio of electrified products to global unit sales by 2030, accelerating electrification through various measures, including collaboration with other companies. Furthermore, Honda is committed to reducing the consumption of finite natural resources and moving towards a circular value chain to achieve zero environmental impact from the procurement of raw materials to product disposal. The company's environmental initiatives also include conserving water resources, managing and reducing chemical substances, and biodiversity conservation.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Honda aims to grow by solving social issues and strives to be a company that society wants to exist. The company focuses on creating, sharing, and handing down joy to the next generation, pursuing initiatives that reduce environmental impact and meet stakeholders' expectations. Honda's social contribution activities include supporting youth for the future, protecting the global environment, promoting traffic safety, and addressing local community needs. Additionally, Honda has been pioneering traffic education in Southeast Asia along with Thailand for 33 years, supporting safe driving for young drivers, focusing on traffic safety education for children, aiming to expand safety awareness among Turkish people, and connecting safety awareness through the âOne Heartâ initiative. These efforts demonstrate Honda's commitment to enhancing worker welfare and contributing positively to society.

sources: 1, 2

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

    • Setting targets for the ratio of electrified products to global unit sales by 2030

Windex

 97 78

Environmental protection

Windex, a product of SC Johnson, has taken significant steps towards environmental protection through various initiatives. The company has committed to recycling over 1500 metric tons of Recovered Coastal Plastic in 2023 for use in Windex bottles, aiming to prevent this plastic from reaching oceans and landfills. This initiative is part of a broader effort to reduce reliance on virgin plastics, with Windex Original, Vinegar, and Ammonia-Free spray bottles, along with Vinegar refills, being made of 100% Recovered Coastal Plastic. Additionally, Windex offers product refills to encourage reuse of their bottles. The Recovered Coastal Plastic is collected by residents of impoverished communities, providing them with a source of income while addressing the issue of uncollected plastic waste.

SC Johnson, Windex's parent company, has also invested in renewable energy initiatives, including the installation of wind turbines at its largest global manufacturing facility, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The company has achieved zero landfill status at seven of its sites and has made strides in reducing waste and packaging, increasing recycling, and cutting greenhouse gas emissions. SC Johnson's commitment to environmental stewardship is further evidenced by its participation in the Consumer Goods Forum, contributing to the Global Packaging Project and committing to the Forumâs Resolution on Deforestation, aiming for zero net deforestation by 2020.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

SC Johnson's partnership with Plastic Bank not only addresses environmental concerns but also provides economic opportunities for residents living below the poverty level in communities affected by high volumes of uncontrolled plastic waste. This initiative offers a new source of income for these residents, thereby contributing to their welfare. Additionally, SC Johnson's efforts to educate Filipinos about fighting dengue through its products and educational caravans have reached over 1.65 million households, indicating the company's commitment to improving lives beyond its workforce.

sources: 1, 2

Hershey's Kisses

 97 75

Environmental protection

Hershey is actively working to reduce its environmental impact, particularly within its cocoa supply chain. The company has committed to achieving 100% visibility of its high-risk cocoa supply chain by 2025 and has already achieved 100% certified and sustainable cocoa as of January 2020. Hershey is also addressing the growing threat of climate change by strengthening its zero-deforestation commitment through the Cocoa and Forest Initiative. This includes increasing the coverage of satellite monitoring systems and mapping 100% of the West African cocoa farms in its supply chain for real-time and accurate monitoring. Additionally, Hershey supports solutions for farmers to obtain affordable land titles, promoting farm rehabilitation and increasing shade tree planting. In 2018, Hershey distributed almost 2.7 million cocoa and shade tree saplings as part of these efforts.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Hershey is committed to improving the lives of farmers and workers within its supply chain. The company is expanding its Child Labor Monitoring and Remediation Systems (CLMRS) to cover 100% of its high-risk sourcing in Cote dâIvoire and Ghana, assessing more than 125,000 childrenâa 350% increase. This system helps identify potential cases of child labor and provides remediation, often through education or assistance to the farmer. Hershey is also working to improve farmer incomes by paying the West African Living Income Differential, a premium that supports farmer income, on top of the premium already paid for certified cocoa. The company provides training and resources to farmers to diversify their income and supports income-generating activities for womenâs groups in local communities.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

  • Commitments
    • 100% visibility of high-risk cocoa supply chain by 2025
    • Expansion of Child Labor Monitoring and Remediation System across entire direct cocoa supply
    • 100% Satellite Mapping of West African supply chain

Hershey's

 97 76

Environmental protection

Hershey is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and mitigate climate change. The company has committed to the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi), setting ambitious goals to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions. Specifically, Hershey aims to reduce its absolute Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions by 50% and its absolute Scope 3 emissions by 25% by 2030, compared to a 2018 baseline. These targets align with the 1.5Â°C temperature pathways and the Paris Agreement. To achieve these goals, Hershey has invested in renewable energy through power purchase agreements (PPAs) for the construction of new utility-scale solar farms. Additionally, the company is focused on advancing sustainable packaging solutions, with a commitment to reducing packaging weight by 25 million pounds by 2025 and making all its plastic packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2030. Hershey is also dedicated to ending deforestation across its supply chain by 2030 and has integrated biodiversity protection into its environmental policies. The company is part of the Science Based Targets Networkâs (SBTN) Corporate Engagement Program to address water stewardship and has conducted a preliminary assessment to understand its water footprint better.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

    • Reduce absolute Scope 3 GHG emissions by 25% by 2030 (from 2018 levels)
    • Make 100% of plastic packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2030
    • End deforestation across the supply chain by 2030

Dove (chocolate)

 97 74

Environmental protection

Dove Chocolate is actively working towards a deforestation-free supply chain for the cocoa it sources, with a target set for 2025. This initiative includes the use of farm mapping to prevent sourcing cocoa from forest lands, National Parks and Reserves, and Classified Forests. In 2020, Dove distributed nearly 3.5 million cocoa seedlings to farmers in West Africa through its suppliers to promote sustainable farming practices. Additionally, about 1.2 million non-cocoa trees were distributed to increase shade and biodiversity in cocoa farming areas. These efforts are part of Dove's broader ambition to protect the natural environment in cocoa-growing communities and to ensure the sustainability of cocoa production for future generations. Dove's Dark Chocolate products, including Dove Dark Chocolate, Dove Dark Almond Promises, and Dove Dark Peanut Butter Promises, are sourced from Rainforest Alliance Certified farms, further emphasizing the brand's commitment to environmental protection and sustainable sourcing practices.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dove Chocolate, through its parent company Mars Wrigley's Cocoa For Generations Plan, is investing $1 billion over 10 years to ensure human rights are respected, the environment is protected, and cocoa farmers have the opportunity to thrive. This includes a commitment of $3.3 million over five years to work with the Jacobs Foundation to transform educational opportunities in cocoa-growing regions of CÃ´te d'Ivoire. Dove is also focused on eliminating child and forced labor in its cocoa supply chain and providing agricultural sustainability education and training through Cocoa Development Centers. These initiatives aim to improve farming practices, crop yields, and the overall well-being of communities in CÃ´te d'Ivoire. Additionally, Dove is committed to supply-chain transparency and ensuring farmers receive more money for their product, which is part of its broader effort to support sustainable growth for cocoa and communities.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

    • Rainforest Alliance Certified (for Dove Dark Chocolate, Dove Dark Almond Promises, Dove Dark Peanut Butter Promises)
  • Commitments
    • Achieving a deforestation-free supply chain for cocoa by 2025
    • Investing $1 billion over 10 years in the Cocoa For Generations Plan to ensure human rights are respected, the environment is protected, and cocoa farmers have the opportunity to thrive

Hyundai

 97 57

Environmental protection

Hyundai Motor Company is actively working towards environmental sustainability through various initiatives. They have made significant strides in eco-friendly vehicle sales, recording 506,793 units in 2022, including 210,352 electric vehicles (EVs) and 11,217 fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEVs). Hyundai has also increased the number of models subject to Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) to 16, encompassing all Genesis models, IONIQ 6, and NEXO. In a notable achievement, Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Czech (HMMC) has transitioned to using 100% renewable energy in its manufacturing process, achieving RE100 status. Additionally, Hyundai has improved its water reuse, with a year-on-year increase of 5%, reusing 2,284,154 tons of water in 2022, which represents a reuse ratio of 21%. These efforts are part of Hyundai's broader commitment to carbon neutrality and environmental stewardship, as outlined in their sustainability reports and ESG policies.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Hyundai Motor Company has taken significant steps to ensure worker welfare through various policies and initiatives. The company has disclosed its Hyundai Diversity & Inclusion Policy and the Non-Discrimination & Anti-Harassment Policy, establishing principles aimed at realizing the values of employee diversity & inclusion and preventing workplace human rights issues. Hyundai's commitment to quality and safety is evidenced by Genesis ranking No. 1 in the US Initial Quality Study (IQS) and US Vehicle Dependability Study (VDS) in 2022. Furthermore, Hyundai has recorded a continuous increase in the ratio of female executives, managers, and engineers as part of its efforts to expand employee diversity and build an inclusive organizational culture. The company has also strengthened its supply chain ESG management by conducting assessments on tier-1 and core tier-2 suppliers and performing on-site due diligence of high-risk suppliers. These actions reflect Hyundai's dedication to improving worker welfare and fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment.

sources: 1, 2

    • Continuous increase in the ratio of female executives, managers, and engineers to expand employee diversity and build an inclusive organizational culture

Bounty

 97 77

Environmental protection

Bounty is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on sustainable forestry and waste reduction. The company ensures that all pulp sourced for its products comes from 100% third-party certified lands, emphasizing its commitment to responsible sourcing. Bounty goes beyond mere replacement by regrowing at least two trees for every one used in their production process, aiming to cultivate lush and thriving forests. Additionally, Bounty has formed partnerships with conservation organizations to aid in forest restoration and wildlife protection. The company's packaging materials, including inner cores, cartons, and paperboard packing, are made from more than 95% recycled fiber, with over 84% being post-consumer recycled content. Furthermore, Bounty's paper products are produced from a blend of sustainably-sourced, fast-growing renewable fibers, with 100% of the virgin fibers coming from third-party certified sources that adhere to responsible sourcing principles. The company also ensures that the virgin fibers used in their products are elemental chlorine-free (ECF), highlighting their commitment to reducing environmental harm through safer bleaching processes.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Bounty products may contain animal-derived ingredients (ADMs). The company states that whenever possible, it opts for plant-derived or synthetically-derived ingredients as substitutes for ADMs. However, in cases where ADMs are necessary for product performance, Bounty requires its suppliers to provide ADMs that are safe and comply with all regulations and industry guidelines. This indicates an awareness of the use of animal products and a preference for alternatives when feasible, although it does not specifically address broader animal welfare practices.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

BMW

 97 60

Environmental protection

BMW is actively pursuing environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing carbon emissions and promoting a circular economy. The company is committed to using up to 30% recycled and reused materials in their vehicles, with a goal to increase this percentage. They are exploring innovative solutions for raw materials that are procured responsibly, processed with low carbon emissions, and highly recyclable. BMW has also developed materials from powdered cactus fibers and recycled PET bottles for use in their vehicles, significantly reducing CO2 emissions in the production of thermoplastic components. The company has set a firm goal to reduce CO2 emissions from its vehicles by at least 40% by 2030 across its entire value chain, aiming for total climate neutrality by 2050. BMW is also a member of the Science-Based Targets Initiative (SBTi) and has signed the âBusiness Ambition for 1.5Â°Câ pledge. Furthermore, BMW is focusing on the massive expansion of electromobility, with the goal of having ten million fully-electric vehicles on the roads by 2030. They are also working towards making their production facilities and locations completely climate neutral.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

BMW places a high value on the welfare of its employees, offering a wide range of development and advancement opportunities, attractive workplaces, health initiatives, and varied diversity programs. The company aims to provide an environment that reflects its high regard for its employees, supporting and developing them as an important aspect of sustainability. Lifelong learning is an integral part of day-to-day work at BMW, with a focus on innovation areas such as digitalization and electrification. In 2022, BMW invested 416 million euros in further education and training for its employees, demonstrating its commitment to their performance capabilities and employability.

sources: 1, 3

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to reducing CO2 emissions from its vehicles by at least 40% by 2030 across its entire value chain.
    • Aiming for total climate neutrality by 2050.
    • Massive expansion of electromobility with the goal of having ten million fully-electric BMW Group vehicles on the roads by 2030.
    • Making production facilities and locations completely climate neutral.

Fritos Original Corn Chips

 97 69

Environmental protection

Frito-Lay, the maker of FRITOSÂ® Original Corn Chips, has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability. The company has made significant strides in harnessing renewable energy, such as switching the Modesto, CA plant to solar power and aiming for the Casa Grande facility to run primarily on renewable energy and recycled water. Frito-Lay has also committed to sustainable sourcing, with 100% of its potatoes, corn, and direct oats being sustainably sourced. The company has launched a sustainable farming program and is working towards eliminating 1.4 million metric tons of greenhouse gases through regenerative agriculture practices. Additionally, Frito-Lay has reduced its environmental impact by converting its fleet to all-electric vehicles and aiming to switch the fleet to 100% natural gas sourced from renewable resources. The company has also achieved significant water savings, reducing water use intensity by 4.8% year over year, saving 31 million gallons of water. In its manufacturing facilities, Frito-Lay has implemented 100% LED lighting, further reducing its environmental footprint.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Frito-Lay has demonstrated a commitment to investing in communities and supporting worker welfare through various initiatives. The company's employees have volunteered nearly 4,000 hours to support their local communities. Frito-Lay has also made a significant impact on youth and underserved communities by supporting over 420,000 youth through school meal programming and providing over 108 million meals. These efforts reflect Frito-Lay's dedication to not only the welfare of its workers but also to the broader communities in which it operates.

sources: 1

Samsung Galaxy

 97 70

Environmental protection

Samsung Galaxy is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainability. The company is incorporating recycled materials into all Galaxy products, including recycled cobalt, rare earth elements, steel, and Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) for the first time in Galaxy devices. This effort extends to the packaging, where Samsung has achieved a significant reduction in single-use plastic, utilizing 100% recycled paper for packaging components. Samsung Galaxy is also committed to using 100% renewable energy across its U.S. facilities and aims to transition to 100% renewable energy for all overseas operations by 2027. The company has obtained 'Zero Waste to Landfill' Platinum Certification for all global business sites, aiming for a resource diversion rate of 99.5% or higher. Additionally, Samsung Galaxy products feature energy-efficient designs, contributing to lower power consumption and bills for users. The company's commitment to environmental sustainability is further demonstrated through its product lifecycle approach, from sourcing materials responsibly to facilitating the recycling of used phones through collection, trade-in, and upcycling programs.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Samsung Galaxy's sustainability efforts extend to ensuring worker welfare, although specific programs directly related to worker welfare within the context provided were not detailed. The company's broader sustainability and corporate responsibility initiatives suggest a commitment to ethical practices and human rights, which likely encompass aspects of worker welfare. However, without explicit information on living wage programs, community building activities, or similar initiatives specifically for workers involved in the production of Samsung Galaxy products, this section cannot be detailed further.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • ISO 14001 and ISO 50001 certification for all production sites

Kraft Foods

 97 69

Environmental protection

Kraft Heinz is actively working on various fronts to protect the environment, focusing on sustainable packaging, waste reduction, and energy conservation. The company has committed to achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050, with an interim goal of halving emissions by 2030. They are working towards reducing energy use intensity by 15% across their manufacturing facilities by 2025 and have made strides in procuring a majority of their electricity from renewable sources, achieving 14.21% as of the latest update. Water conservation is also a priority, with goals to reduce water use intensity by 20% in high-risk watershed areas and by 15% across all manufacturing facilities by 2025. Waste reduction efforts have led to an 18.4% reduction in waste-to-landfill intensity, aiming for a 20% reduction by 2025. In packaging innovation, Kraft Heinz aims to make 100% of its packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2025, with an 87% achievement rate so far. They have also created a fully circular Heinz tomato ketchup bottle in Europe and aim to reduce the use of virgin plastic globally by 20% by 2030. These efforts are part of a broader strategy to address environmental challenges through innovation and collaboration across the operational footprint and value chain.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Kraft Heinz is committed to enhancing worker welfare through various initiatives focused on diversity, inclusion, and community support. The company has set ambitious goals to improve the representation of women and people of color within its workforce. By 2025, Kraft Heinz aims to have women fill 50% of its global management positions and 30% of its salaried U.S. employee population to identify as people of color. Progress towards these goals includes increasing the representation of women in global management positions to 41% and people of color in U.S. salaried positions to 28%. Additionally, Kraft Heinz is working to alleviate global hunger by providing 1.5 billion meals to people in need by 2025, with 66% of this goal already achieved. These efforts reflect the company's commitment to caring for its people and communities, enhancing the nutrition and health of its products, and creating moments that matter.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Kraft Heinz is actively working to promote animal welfare through responsible sourcing practices. The company has committed to sourcing 100% of its eggs globally from cage-free or better hens by 2025, with 67% of this goal achieved so far. In Europe, Kraft Heinz has already reached its goal of sourcing 100% of eggs from free-range hens by 2020. Additionally, the company is working to improve broiler chicken welfare in the U.S. by 2024 and align with the European chicken commitment by 2026. These initiatives are part of Kraft Heinz's broader efforts to advance sustainable practices across the entire value chain, ensuring responsible choices that include considerations for human rights, deforestation, and sustainable agriculture.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2050, halving same by 2030
    • Reduce energy use intensity by 15% across manufacturing facilities by 2025
    • Procure majority of electricity from renewable sources by 2025
    • Reduce water use intensity by 20% in high-risk watershed areas by 2025
    • Reduce water use intensity by 15% across manufacturing facilities by 2025
    • Reduce waste to landfill intensity by 20% across manufacturing facilities by 2025
    • Make 100% recyclable, reusable or compostable packaging by 2025
    • Create a fully circular Heinz tomato ketchup bottle in Europe by 2022
    • Reduce use of virgin plastic globally by 20% by 2030
    • Source 100% of eggs globally from cage-free or better hens by 2025
    • Source 100% of eggs in Europe from free-range hens by 2020
    • Improve broiler chicken welfare in the U.S. by 2024 and European chicken commitment by 2026
    • Purchase 100% sustainably-sourced Heinz ketchup tomatoes by 2025
    • Purchase 100% sustainable palm oil by 2022
    • Purchase 100% traceable palm oil to the mill by 2022

Nesquik

 97 66

Environmental protection

Nesquik, a brand under NestlÃ©, has taken significant steps towards environmental protection, particularly in its packaging initiatives. The brand launched Nesquik All Natural cocoa powder, featuring a simplified list of natural ingredients and packaged in a recyclable paper pouch. This move is part of NestlÃ©'s broader commitment to tackle plastic waste and enhance the sustainability of its packaging. The paper used for the Nesquik All Natural packaging is sourced from sustainable forests, certified by the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC), and is designed to ensure the product's quality during transport and storage. Furthermore, Nesquik has committed to making 100% of its packaging recyclable by 2025, with efforts already underway, such as the fully recyclable Nesquik tubs and tins and the nearly fully recyclable ready-to-drink cartons, which are 95% recyclable except for the plastic straw sleeve. These initiatives are part of Nesquik's dedication to improving the sustainability of its packaging and moving towards more environmentally friendly solutions.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nesquik, through its parent company NestlÃ©, sources cocoa responsibly under the NestlÃ© Cocoa Plan. This plan is part of NestlÃ©'s efforts to ensure responsible sourcing across its supply chain, which indirectly contributes to better practices in the areas where cocoa is grown. While the focus of the NestlÃ© Cocoa Plan is not directly on animal welfare, responsible sourcing practices can contribute to better overall environmental and social outcomes in cocoa-producing regions.

Microsoft

 97 68

Environmental protection

Microsoft is actively working towards a more sustainable future with a focus on environmental protection. The company has committed to being carbon negative by 2030 and aims to remove all of its historical emissions since its founding in 1975 by 2050. To achieve this, Microsoft is investing in carbon removal, acquiring 1.4 million tons of carbon removal in fiscal year 2022 and recycling it into marketable products. Additionally, Microsoft is adopting a circular strategy for materials management, diverting over 12,000 metric tons of waste from landfills and incinerators in fiscal year 2022. The company is also working towards being water positive across its direct operations by 2030 and has reached nearly one million people with clean water and sanitation solutions by the end of calendar year 2022. Microsoft has protected more land than it uses, with 12,270 acres protected in Belize, surpassing the 11,206 acres of land that it uses. Furthermore, Microsoft is leveraging technology to accelerate environmental sustainability through its Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability, which offers a suite of tools for managing environmental sustainability performance. The company also supports global sustainability through initiatives like the Climate Innovation Fund, investing in cutting-edge climate technologies and solutions.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • By 2030, Microsoft will be carbon negative.
    • By 2030, Microsoft aims to be water positive across its direct operations.
    • By 2030, Microsoft will achieve zero waste across its direct waste footprint.
    • By 2025, Microsoft will protect more land than it uses.

Foot Locker

 97 58

Environmental protection

Foot Locker, Inc. has announced its ambition to achieve net zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 2050 or sooner. This commitment is in alignment with climate scientists' recommendations to transition toward a net zero state and avoid the worst impacts of climate change. The company has committed to setting a science-based target in line with the criteria established by the Science Based Target initiative (SBTi). Foot Locker, Inc. plans to report its progress against certain metrics regarding its GHG emissions annually in its Impact Report. This report is aligned with the reporting disclosure guidance of the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB) industry standards and the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) recommendations. The company's efforts to power a more sustainable future are part of its broader environmental, social, and governance (ESG) journey, which also includes expanding its calculations and disclosures to include additional relevant Scope 3 emissions categories.

sources: 1, 2

T.J. Maxx

 97 62

Environmental protection

T.J. Maxx, through its parent company TJX, has embarked on a comprehensive environmental sustainability program aimed at reducing the environmental impacts of its operations and certain products and packaging. The company's environmental strategy is focused on three main areas: climate and energy, waste management, and responsible sourcing. TJX has set ambitious goals as part of its commitment to environmental sustainability. These include achieving net zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in its operations by 2040, sourcing 100% renewable energy for its operations by 2030, diverting 85% of its operational waste from landfill by 2027, and ensuring that 100% of the packaging for products developed in-house by its product design team is reusable, recyclable, or made from sustainable materials by 2030. In fiscal year 2023, TJX made significant progress towards these goals, including a 29% absolute reduction in global GHG emissions from its own operations since fiscal year 2017, sourcing 27% of its electricity from renewable sources, and diverting 74% of its global operational waste from landfill. These efforts are part of TJX's broader strategy to expand and accelerate its environmental goals, which were announced in April 2022. The company has also increased its sustainability staffing and expertise in the U.S., Canada, and Europe to support these initiatives.

sources: 1

Kohl's

 97 64

Environmental protection

Kohl's has made significant strides in environmental sustainability, focusing on climate action, waste and recycling, and sustainable sourcing. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its environmental impact, aligning its efforts with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) and the Paris Agreement. Kohl's has achieved a 49% reduction in combined scope 1 and scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions from its owned operations against a 2014 baseline, aiming for a 50% reduction by 2025. Additionally, it has reduced energy consumption by 30% at its facilities compared to a 2008 baseline. The company has expanded its renewable energy platforms, with 163 solar locations and plans to increase electric vehicle (EV) charging stations to 200 locations by the end of 2023. Kohl's is also committed to diverting 85% of its U.S. operational waste from landfills annually and has labeled 100% of its owned branded packaging with the How2RecycleÂ® label. In sustainable sourcing, Kohl's aims for 100% responsibly sourced cotton and 50% of polyester styles to contain recycled materials in its proprietary brands by 2025. The company has joined the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and the U.S. Department of Energyâs Better Climate Challenge, committing to net zero emissions by 2050 and sharing its carbon reduction progress and strategies.

sources: 1, 2

Chase

 97 50

Environmental protection

JPMorgan Chase is actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at environmental protection and promoting a sustainable future. The company is focusing on aligning key sectors of its financing portfolio with net zero emissions by 2050, utilizing its Carbon CompassSM methodology to set portfolio-level net zero aligned targets to reduce the carbon intensity of its in-scope sector portfolios over time. JPMorgan Chase has set net zero aligned targets for eight sectors, including Oil & Gas, Electric Power, Auto Manufacturing, Iron & Steel, Cement, Aviation, Shipping, and Aluminum. The company aims to facilitate more than $2.5 trillion to address climate change and contribute to sustainable development, with $1 trillion dedicated to green initiatives over 10 years, from 2021 through the end of 2030. Operational sustainability is also a focus, with targets set for carbon neutrality across operations, sourcing renewable energy for 100% of global power needs, diverting 100% of e-waste from landfills, purchasing 100% of paper from certified sources, and transitioning owned fleet vehicles to electric vehicles by 2025. JPMorgan Chase has also signed long-term agreements to purchase high-quality, durable carbon dioxide removal (CDR) to match every ton of its unabated direct operational emissions with durable carbon removal by 2030.

sources: 1, 2

Motorola

 97 60

Environmental protection

Motorola is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives aimed at minimizing the environmental impacts of its operations and products throughout their lifecycle. The company focuses on energy efficiency and sourcing energy from clean, renewable sources such as wind power to reduce its carbon footprint. Motorola Mobility has also implemented a Green Building strategy worldwide to leverage significant opportunities to reduce environmental impact through its buildings. In product design, Motorola follows principles such as using environmentally preferred materials, increasing the use of recycled materials, improving energy efficiency, reducing packaging, and enhancing the recyclability of its products. Additionally, Motorola Mobility's Global Packaging team collaborates with carrier partners to reduce the weight and volume of retail packaging, expand the use of recycled materials, and adhere to the CTIA Green Packaging guidelines. This includes the use of FSCÂ® certified paper, water-based adhesives, 100 percent recycled content pulp packaging parts, soy/vegetable-based inks, zero VOC UV inks, and initiatives to increase packaging density per pallet. Motorola is also committed to reducing potentially hazardous substances in its products and finding environmentally sound alternatives while maintaining performance and quality. The company participates in the CTIA Green Working group and requires its recycling suppliers to abide by its Supplier Code of Conduct, emphasizing life cycle assessment, recycling, and reuse in product manufacturing 1.

Dell

 97 68

Environmental protection

Dell is actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at environmental protection and sustainability. The company has committed to reaching net zero greenhouse gas emissions across scopes 1, 2, and 3 by 2050. To achieve this ambitious goal, Dell has outlined several key drivers, including reducing scopes 1 and 2 GHG emissions by 50% by 2030, sourcing 75% of electricity from renewable sources across all Dell Technologies facilities by 2030 (and 100% by 2040), reducing absolute scope 3 GHG emissions from purchased goods and services by 45% by 2030, and reducing absolute scope 3 GHG emissions associated with the use of sold products by 30% by 2030. Additionally, Dell has incorporated 343.3 million pounds of sustainable materials in its products and packaging in FY23 and has recovered 2.8 billion pounds of used electronics since 2007. The company's circular design approach, exemplified by the Concept Luna prototype, aims to reduce waste and emissions, reuse materials, and achieve next-level innovation. Dell also focuses on energy efficiency in its products and services, constantly innovating to bring customers greater efficiency and reduce the carbon footprint of its data centers.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dell Technologies promotes a safe, healthy workplace where people can thrive, not only within its own operations but also across its supply chain. The company insists on ethical practices, respect, and dignity for everyone involved in creating its products. This commitment extends to the responsible operation of Dell's factories and those of its suppliers, ensuring better outcomes for workers involved in the manufacturing process.

sources: 1

    • Reduce absolute scope 3 GHG emissions from purchased goods and services by 45% by 2030
    • Reduce absolute scope 3 GHG emissions associated with the use of sold products by 30% by 2030
    • For every metric ton of product a customer buys, one metric ton will be reused or recycled by 2030
    • Ensure 100% of packaging is made from recycled or renewable material, or utilizes reused packaging by 2030
    • More than half of product content will be made from recycled, renewable, or reduced carbon emissions material by 2030
