    • Making products in facilities using clean, renewable energy
    • Sending zero manufacturing waste to landfill
    • Incorporating recycled plastics into packaging
    • Partnering to create recycling solutions for 100% of packaging

Betty Crocker

 96 75

Environmental protection

Betty Crocker, as a part of General Mills, is involved in various environmental protection efforts, particularly focusing on reducing food waste. General Mills has established a Food Waste Action Team aimed at tackling food waste, which is a significant environmental and economic issue. This initiative is part of their broader goals related to food security and climate change. The company is committed to cutting food waste in its operations by half by 2030 and achieving zero waste to landfill at all owned production facilities by 2025. These efforts are multifaceted, including monitoring processes to keep food out of the waste stream, reducing food waste in offices, and investing in technology to facilitate food rescue programs. Additionally, General Mills supports education initiatives like Save the Food and #tastenotwaste to help consumers reduce food waste at home. Through these actions, General Mills is working towards minimizing its environmental impact and promoting sustainability.

sources: 1

  • Commitments
    • Cut the food waste in our operations by half by 2030
    • Achieve zero waste to landfill at all owned production facilities by 2025

NestlÃ© Toll House

 96 74

Environmental protection

NestlÃ© Toll House, under the broader initiatives of NestlÃ©, is actively working towards a more sustainable future with a focus on environmental protection. The company has committed to achieving net zero emissions by 2050, highlighting a significant stride towards reducing its carbon footprint. A key aspect of this commitment is the emphasis on renewable energy, with all NestlÃ© facilities in the U.S. set to use 100% renewable electricity by 2025. This move not only reduces reliance on fossil fuels but also contributes to the global effort against climate change.

In addition to energy initiatives, NestlÃ© is also focusing on waste reduction and recycling. The majority of its packaging is now recyclable or designed to be, which is part of a broader effort to advance recycling infrastructure and make it easier for consumers to recycle. This commitment extends to the sourcing of ingredients, where the company is partnering with 500,000 farmers globally to accelerate the shift to regenerative agriculture. This approach not only aims to reduce emissions but also to enhance biodiversity and soil health, contributing to the overall sustainability of the farming practices involved in producing ingredients for NestlÃ© Toll House products.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

NestlÃ©'s sustainability efforts extend to ensuring the welfare of workers across its supply chain. Through the NestlÃ© Cocoa Plan, the company is actively working to improve the lives of cocoa farmers, a key supplier group for NestlÃ© Toll House products. This plan includes initiatives aimed at increasing farm productivity, thereby potentially raising farmer incomes, and providing support in areas such as child education and agroforestry. The income accelerator program, part of the NestlÃ© Cocoa Plan, is designed to help cocoa-farming households move towards a living income by providing support across four areas: cocoa farm productivity, child education, agroforestry, and additional incomes, underpinned by a cash incentive.

Furthermore, NestlÃ© is committed to tackling child labor risks in its cocoa supply chain through its Child Labor Monitoring and Remediation System (CLMRS). This system helps identify children at risk, raise awareness, and provide remediation, which includes building and refurbishing schools, providing school kits, and helping obtain birth certificates. These efforts are part of a broader strategy to ensure the welfare of workers and their communities, demonstrating NestlÃ©'s commitment to a responsible and sustainable supply chain.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Rainforest Alliance Certified
  • Commitments
    • Achieving net zero emissions by 2050
    • Using 100% renewable electricity across all U.S. facilities by 2025
    • Sourcing 100% of cocoa through the NestlÃ© Cocoa Plan by 2025

Capital One

 96 57

Environmental protection

Capital One is actively engaged in various initiatives to enhance its environmental sustainability and address the challenges posed by climate change. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, with a commitment to reduce Scope 1 Direct Emissions and Scope 3 Emissions (categories 1-14) by 50 percent by 2030, using 2019 as the baseline year. Additionally, Capital One aims to purchase 100 percent renewable electricity and increase location-aligned procurement in the markets where it operates. The company is also focused on reducing water consumption at its facilities by 20 percent by 2025 (from a 2019 baseline) and ensuring that 95 percent of the paper purchased for operations is certified by the Forest Stewardship Council or contains 30 percent post-consumer waste recycled content each year. Capital One is pursuing LEED certification for all new office construction and comprehensive renovations, targeting LEED Silver or higher. Furthermore, the company has set a goal to reduce landfill waste generated at its campus locations by 50 percent by 2025 (from a 2019 baseline). Capital One supports green infrastructure through a $500,000 grant to the Greater New Orleans Foundation for training in green infrastructure and invests in environmental sustainability through Trove, a company that extends the life of merchandise. It also backs renewable energy projects, including providing tax equity for the largest solar project in Idaho, and partners with companies like REI to support shared values and provide enhanced rewards for co-op members.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • U.S. Green Building Councilâs Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED)
  • Commitments
    • Reduce Scope 1 Direct Emissions and Scope 3 Emissions (categories 1-14) by 50 percent by 2030 (from a baseline year of 2019)
    • Purchase 100 percent renewable electricity while increasing location-aligned procurement
    • Reduce water use at facilities by 20 percent by 2025 (from a baseline year of 2019)
    • Ensure 95 percent of paper purchased for operations is certified by the Forest Stewardship Council or contains 30 percent post-consumer waste recycled content each year
    • Target LEED Silver or higher for all new office construction and comprehensive renovations
    • Reduce landfill waste generated at campus locations by 50 percent by 2025 (from a baseline of 2019)

Petco

 96 63

Environmental protection

Petco has taken significant steps towards environmental protection, focusing on sustainability as a core aspect of its mission to improve the lives of pets, pet parents, and its partners. The company has established a set of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) pillars, with one of the key pillars dedicated to preserving the health of our planet. This commitment is reflected in their actions, such as eliminating over 6 million single-use plastic polybags within their owned brand supply chain. Furthermore, Petco actively engages with key stakeholders, including suppliers and nongovernmental organizations (NGOs), to build a collective understanding of ESG risks and opportunities. This engagement is part of their broader strategy to identify and mitigate internal and external risks to their business, including environmental risks. Petco's governance structure includes a VP of Sustainability who oversees program development and engages subject matter experts responsible for the management of key focus areas, including environmental sustainability. The company also leverages a dashboard of key performance indicators (KPIs) to track its performance, success, and impact across the business, which currently measures energy, emissions, waste, and water data. This approach demonstrates Petco's commitment to environmental protection and sustainability.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Petco has implemented several initiatives to ensure the welfare of its workers, referred to as partners. The company has provided financial assistance to nearly 2,000 partners since the launch of the program in 2020, demonstrating a commitment to supporting its workforce during challenging times. Additionally, Petco adheres to a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, which provides guidance to partners on ethical behavior and details the process for reporting any ethics violations. This is complemented by a Harassment, Discrimination, and Workplace Conduct Policy, ensuring a safe and respectful working environment. Petco's Supplier Code of Conduct sets out expectations for suppliers in areas including human rights and discrimination, further extending its commitment to ethical conduct and worker welfare throughout its supply chain. The company also offers multiple ways for partners to report and escalate concerns, including an anonymous whistleblower hotline, ensuring that workers have a voice and that their concerns are addressed.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Petco's commitment to animal welfare is evident in its responsible sourcing live animal certification processes, which ensure the humane treatment of all life sold in its Petco Pet Care Centers. This approach is part of the company's broader commitment to serving pet parents and communities with integrity, as outlined in its Code of Business Conduct and Ethics. By requiring all suppliers to agree to its Supplier Code of Conduct, Petco sets out its expectations in areas including animal welfare, further demonstrating its dedication to the ethical treatment of animals. This commitment to animal welfare is a core aspect of Petco's mission to improve the lives of pets and pet parents.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

Kleenex

 96 79

Environmental protection

Kleenex has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and reduce its carbon footprint. The company has achieved a 60% reduction in carbon emissions since 2015, demonstrating a significant commitment to reducing its environmental impact. Kleenex products are made with 100% responsibly sourced fibers, ensuring the conservation of forests for future generations. In 2011, Kleenex became the first U.S. tissue maker to be certified by the Forest Stewardship CouncilÂ® (FSCÂ®) for consumer tissue products, highlighting its dedication to preventing deforestation and promoting responsible forest management. Additionally, Kleenex carton boxes are made with 100% recycled paperboard, further emphasizing the brand's efforts in waste minimization and recycling.

sources: 1, 2

Johnson & Johnson

 96 62

Environmental protection

Johnson & Johnson is actively engaged in efforts to protect the environment, recognizing the interconnection between environmental health and the health of people. The company has been building on over two decades of climate action, with current goals that are among their most ambitious, aiming to reach net zero carbon emissions. This commitment is part of a broader environmental sustainability strategy that aligns with their environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals. These goals focus on improving access and affordability, creating healthier communities, and ensuring a healthy mind, body, and environment are within reach for everyone, everywhere. Johnson & Johnson's approach to environmental sustainability is guided by their Credo, which emphasizes their commitment to maintaining good order of the property they use, protecting the environment, and conserving natural resources. Additionally, the company has committed $800 million through 2030 to make its products more sustainable for a healthier planet, including aiming for 100% recyclable, reusable, or compostable plastic packaging and certified/post-consumer recycled paper- and pulp-based packaging. This is part of their Healthy Lives Mission, demonstrating a significant investment in environmental sustainability.

Energizer

 96 75

Environmental protection

Energizer is actively working on reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives focused on product sustainability, packaging, and climate and energy. The company has integrated sustainability assessments into its New Product Development Process across all categories, aiming for 100% of new products to undergo this assessment by 2025. In terms of packaging, Energizer has surpassed its goal of achieving 30% recycled content by 2030, already reaching over 32% post-consumer recycled content globally. This achievement is part of their ongoing commitment to increase the use of recycled materials in their packaging. Additionally, Energizer has set a target to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions by 30% by 2030 in its direct operations (Scope 1 and Scope 2). As of the last reporting, the company has successfully decreased emissions by more than 11,000 metric tons of carbon dioxide equivalent (MTCO2e), marking a reduction of over 9% from the previous year. These efforts are part of Energizer's broader 2030 ESG roadmap, demonstrating their commitment to environmental stewardship.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Energizer emphasizes the importance of creating a positive impact on local communities and providing safer work environments for its employees. The company engages in various partnerships, colleague-led grassroots programs, and volunteer efforts to contribute positively to the regions where its offices are located. This approach reflects Energizer's commitment to societal well-being and is an integral part of their sustainability strategy, aiming to achieve harmony with their surroundings and support the overall financial health of the company.

sources: 1

Dawn

 96 80

Environmental protection

Dawn, a brand under Procter & Gamble, has implemented several initiatives aimed at environmental protection and sustainability. The brand has focused on reducing water usage, recycling, and sustainable manufacturing practices. Specifically, Dawn aims to enable a 25% reduction in in-home water usage related to handwashing dishes in North America. In terms of recycling, Dawn Dish liquid uses up to 35% PCR (post-consumer recycled) content in clear bottles, with a goal to use widely recyclable or reusable packaging by 2025. Additionally, Procter & Gamble has made significant strides in sustainable manufacturing by converting to 100% renewable energy at its manufacturing sites and reducing water usage in manufacturing by 35%. These efforts demonstrate Dawn's commitment to minimizing its environmental footprint and promoting sustainability in its operations.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Dawn has been actively involved in wildlife conservation for over 40 years, focusing on the protection and care of aquatic wildlife. The brand has helped clean more than 150,000 marine birds and mammals in North America, demonstrating a strong commitment to animal welfare. Dawn has donated thousands of bottles to International Bird Rescue & The Marine Mammal Center, contributing to the rescue and rehabilitation of affected wildlife. Furthermore, Dawn has invested a total of $4.5 million with environmental advocacy partners since 2006. The brand's ambition includes protecting and caring for one million birds and marine mammals through direct rescue and rehabilitation efforts, as well as advocacy and work in habitats to keep wildlife safe and in the wild. Dawn's initiatives in animal welfare are a testament to its dedication to creating a cleaner world for wildlife.

sources: 1

Ziploc

 96 81

Environmental protection

Ziploc has taken steps towards environmental sustainability by focusing on the production of reusable and recyclable products. Their commitment to reducing environmental impact is evident in their product design, which includes bags made without BPA or Phthalates, emphasizing consumer health and environmental safety. The brand encourages the reuse of their products and has made efforts to ensure that their bags are recyclable. Specifically, Ziploc bags are recyclable in some areas, and their EndurablesÂ® bags can be recycled through TerraCycleÂ®, a specialized recycling program. Additionally, Ziploc has introduced compostable sandwich bags, which are commercially compostable and designed to reduce landfill waste. These compostable bags are BNQ and BPI certified, indicating they meet specific environmental standards. However, it's important to note that these compostable bags are not suitable for backyard composting and are intended for commercial composting facilities. This initiative represents a significant step towards sustainability by offering an alternative to traditional plastic bags and contributing to a more sustainable planet.

Corona

 96 53

Environmental protection

Corona has taken significant steps to protect the environment, focusing on reducing its plastic footprint. The brand has achieved a net-zero plastic footprint, meaning it recovers and recycles as much or more plastic than it uses globally. This initiative prevents plastic from polluting natural paradises. Corona has removed plastic rings from all its exported cans and eliminated plastic from its pressure-sensitive labels, reducing its footprint by 50,000 pounds. Additionally, the brand has been active in cleaning up beaches, with Corona X Parley cleaning up 44,026,625 square meters of beach since 2017. Corona also invests in recycling programs, such as a significant investment in Mexico Recicla, a recycling facility in Mexico, to recover and recycle plastic before it reaches oceans and waterways. Furthermore, Corona has launched the Plastic Free Challenge, an accelerator program aimed at finding solutions for environmental and social challenges, emphasizing the brand's commitment to reimagining a sustainable future.

sources: 1, 2

Campbell's

 96 73

Environmental protection

Campbell Soup Company is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on combating climate change, promoting sustainable water supplies, eliminating waste, and improving circularity in packaging. The company has set a science-based target (SBT) to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, which has been approved by the Science Based Targets initiative. Campbell is also committed to sustainable agriculture, managing 122,000 acres of sustainably cultivated wheat in various states. Additionally, the company has redesigned its V8 bottles, saving 2.5 million pounds of plastic each year. These initiatives demonstrate Campbell's commitment to building a more resilient and sustainable food system that improves the planet.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Campbell Soup Company is dedicated to ensuring the welfare of its workers through various initiatives. The company focuses on building a winning team and culture, prioritizing inclusion and diversity, and caring for its people. Campbell aims to create an inclusive, high-performing culture where employees can be real and feel safe, valued, and supported to do their best work. Additionally, Campbell has been recognized for its efforts in employee safety, benefits, and executive and board diversity. The company's commitment to its employees is evident in its efforts to provide opportunities for them to thrive and in the recognition it has received for its workplace practices.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Campbell Soup Company is committed to promoting animal welfare as part of its sustainability efforts. The company has pledged that 100% of its eggs will be cage-free by the end of 2025. This commitment reflects Campbell's dedication to ensuring the health and welfare of animals used in its products. By transitioning to cage-free eggs, Campbell is taking a significant step towards more humane animal treatment practices.

sources: 1

    • Saving 2.5 million pounds of plastic each year from redesigning V8 bottles.

Gucci

 96 49

Environmental protection

Gucci has embarked on a comprehensive sustainability strategy, focusing on reducing its environmental impact and fostering a more sustainable business model. As part of its 10-year "Culture of Purpose" sustainability strategy announced in 2015, Gucci aims to reduce its total environmental footprint by 40% and decrease its greenhouse gas emissions by 50% by 2025, using a 2015 baseline. This includes a commitment to reducing an additional 40% of its scope 3 emissions from purchased goods and services. Gucci has also pledged to achieve 100% traceability for its raw materials and align fully with its parent company Keringâs Standards for Raw Materials and Manufacturing Processes by 2025. Furthermore, the company has committed to using 100% renewable energy by the end of 2022 and is actively developing new eco-friendly sourcing solutions, raw materials, and processes through disruptive innovation. To track its progress, Gucci utilizes Environmental Profit and Loss (EP&L) accounting, a tool pioneered by Kering, to understand and share its environmental impacts transparently. Gucci's environmental initiatives also include increasing the use of low-impact alternative and sustainable materials in its collections, developing sustainable sourcing and innovative on-the-ground programs, implementing energy-saving methods, optimizing manufacturing efficiencies, reducing waste, scaling up circular approaches, and supporting the conservation and restoration of vital ecosystems worldwide. Additionally, Gucci has joined the Fashion Pact, committing to shared goals with its peers in climate, biodiversity, and oceans.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Gucci's sustainability strategy encompasses significant efforts to ensure worker welfare. The company is committed to promoting diversity and gender parity, supporting the continuation of craftsmanship traditions, offering sustainable and caring working environments for its teams, and contributing to positive social impacts across its entire supply chain. Gucci's initiatives in this area include responsible and innovative management of the supply chain, for which it has been recognized with awards, and campaigns to support girls and women's empowerment. The company also focuses on diversity and inclusion, holding membership with Parks, an organization dedicated to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Gucci has made significant strides in animal welfare by joining the Fur Free Alliance and eliminating animal fur from all its collections starting with the Spring Summer 2018 season. This move marks a milestone for the luxury fashion industry and demonstrates Gucci's commitment to more humane and sustainable practices.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Reducing total environmental footprint by 40% by 2025 (from a 2015 baseline)
    • Decreasing greenhouse gas emissions by 50% by 2025 (from a 2015 baseline)
    • Achieving 100% traceability for raw materials by 2025
    • Using 100% renewable energy by the end of 2022

Head & Shoulders

 96 65

Environmental protection

Head & Shoulders is actively working to reduce its environmental impact through various initiatives focused on packaging, water usage, and manufacturing processes. The brand has committed to making 100% of its packaging recyclable or reusable by 2030. This includes efforts to improve packaging by incorporating recycled content and making all Head & Shoulders HDPE bottles recyclable. By the end of a specified year, HDPE bottles sold in Western Europe are expected to contain up to 25% recycled plastic. Additionally, Head & Shoulders has created the world's first recyclable shampoo bottle made from beach plastic, contributing to the cleanup of over 200 beaches in Europe with the help of over 1000 volunteers and 100 NGOs, an effort recognized by the United Nations with the UN Momentum for Change Award.

In terms of water conservation, Head & Shoulders aims to provide 1 billion people with access to water-efficient products and has already reached 700 million. The brand is also working towards reducing water usage in its manufacturing facilities by 20% per unit of production, focusing on water-stressed regions. Furthermore, Head & Shoulders has achieved significant reductions in water consumption, cutting its usage by 58% and setting a goal for an additional 20% reduction.

The brand is also addressing its manufacturing impact by sending zero waste to landfill in its manufacturing process, with 95% of its manufacturing sites being Zero Manufacturing Waste to Landfill (ZMWTL) and diverting more than 5 million tons of waste from landfills. These efforts are part of Head & Shoulders' broader commitment to reducing its footprint and striving for circular solutions.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

    • Nothing found

    • Send zero waste to landfill in manufacturing process

Gap

 96 58

Environmental protection

Gap Inc. has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on water conservation, sustainable materials, and waste reduction. The company's Washwell program aims to reduce water usage in denim production by at least 20%, with a goal of applying these techniques to 100% of eligible denim and woven bottoms by 2025. Gap Inc. also commits to sourcing 100% of its cotton from more sustainable sources by 2030, including options like regenerative, organic, and recycled cotton. Additionally, the company aims to use 100% recycled polyester by the same year. Gap Inc. has established a partnership with thredUp to promote clothing recycling, contributing to the recirculation of 65,000 pounds of clothing. The company has set ambitious climate goals, including sourcing 100% renewable electricity for its owned and operated facilities and reducing supply chain greenhouse gas emissions by 30% from its 2017 baseline by 2030. Furthermore, Gap Inc. has committed to achieving net-zero emissions across its value chain by 2050.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Gap Inc. has made significant efforts to ensure worker welfare through various programs and initiatives. The company's Personal Advancement & Career Enhancement (P.A.C.E.) program is designed to empower female garment workers by providing them with career and life-skill education. Since its launch, P.A.C.E. has reached over 1.2 million women and girls. Gap Inc. also aims for 100% of its strategic factories to invest in women's empowerment through participation in P.A.C.E. or Reimagining Industry to Support Equality (Rise) by 2025. Additionally, the company is working towards having all workers employed in its strategic factories have their voices heard through representative workplace committees by the same year. Gap Inc. has also committed to achieving gender parity at the supervisor level in its strategic factories by 2025 and ensuring that all its factories have prevention and response management systems and trainings in place to address gender-based violence.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Gap Inc. has established an animal welfare policy that prohibits the use of fur, angora, and mohair, as well as practices including live plucking and mulesing. This policy reflects the company's commitment to the humane treatment of animals used in the production of its products.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • 100% of eligible denim and woven bottoms made using Washwell techniques by 2025
    • Empower 5 million people touched by the apparel industry to improve their access to clean water and sanitation by 2030
    • Use 100% more sustainable cotton by 2030
    • Use 100% recycled polyester by 2030
    • Source 100% renewable electricity for owned and operated facilities by 2030
    • Reduce supply chain greenhouse gas emissions by 30% from 2017 baseline by 2030
    • Achieve net-zero emissions across value chain by 2050

Barbie

 96 54

Environmental protection

Barbie has taken significant steps towards environmental sustainability, particularly through its "The Future of Pink is Green" initiative launched in 2021. This initiative aims for all Barbie products and packaging to be made from 100% recycled, recyclable, or bio-based plastic materials. Additionally, Barbie has introduced a range of products under the "Barbie Loves the Ocean" line, which includes dolls and playsets made from recycled plastics. These products are part of Barbie's commitment to reducing plastic waste and promoting environmental awareness among its consumers. The recycled plastics used in these products are sourced within 50 kilometers of waterways in areas that lack formal waste collection systems, although it's noted that certain parts like the doll head, shoes, and some accessories are excluded from this recycled content.

sources: 1

  • Commitments

Lowe's

 96 72

Environmental protection

Lowe's has outlined a comprehensive sustainability strategy that encompasses various environmental protection efforts. The company is committed to responsible sourcing, offering safer and more eco-friendly products, and reducing its carbon footprint. Lowe's aims to align its goals and initiatives with global standards, such as the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UN SDGs), and has committed to contributing to environmental protection through enforced responsible sourcing policies. They are actively working to expand their eco-friendly product offerings, striving for innovative products with increased sustainability features to help customers reduce the environmental impact of their projects. Additionally, Lowe's has set specific product sustainability goals, including responsibly sourcing 100% of their wood products by 2025 and ensuring that 100% of their strategic suppliers have sustainability goals in place by the same year. In 2022, 59% of their wood products were responsibly sourced, and 86% of their strategic suppliers had sustainability goals. Lowe's also reports its carbon emissions (Scope 1 and 2) annually and is working towards implementing strategies for emissions reduction.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Lowe's emphasizes the importance of maintaining a diverse, healthy, engaged, and skilled workforce as part of its sustainability strategy. The company supports its U.S. communities through initiatives focused on safe, affordable housing and skilled trades education, aiming to foster an inclusive culture through leadership, support, education, and engagement. Lowe's commitment to building a culture where associates feel safe, valued, and equipped with the knowledge, skills, and tools they need to grow and serve customers highlights its dedication to worker welfare. Additionally, Lowe's encourages associates to volunteer and support community development projects, further demonstrating its commitment to the well-being of its employees and the broader community.

sources: 1, 3

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • By 2025, 100% of our wood products will be responsibly sourced
    • By 2025, 100% of our strategic suppliers will have sustainability goals

Adobe

 96 65

Environmental protection

Adobe is actively engaged in various sustainability initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact and promoting sustainability through its products, operations, and partnerships. The company's commitment to environmental protection is evident in its product innovations, which enable customers to operate more efficiently and reduce their environmental impacts. Innovations such as cloud-based software delivery, paperless workflows, and virtual collaboration contribute to reducing physical waste and emissions from transportation and shipping. Adobe's operational sustainability efforts include building LEED-certified offices, setting a 100% renewable energy goal, establishing Science-based Targets, and achieving significant reductions in Scope 1, Scope 2, and business travel emissions ahead of its 2025 targets. The company has also accelerated its goal to achieve 100% renewable electricity from 2035 to 2025 and opened Founders Tower, an all-electric building powered by 100% renewable energy. Additionally, Adobe is committed to partnering with suppliers, customers, industry peers, and organizations to drive policy change and sustainability practices aligned with the goals of the Paris Agreement.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

  • Certifications
    • LEED-certified offices
  • Commitments
    • 100% renewable electricity by 2025
    • 55% supplier spend to those with SBTs (Scope 3) by 2025
    • 35% reduction in Scope 1 & 2 emissions by 2025
    • 30% reduction in business travel emissions (Scope 3) by 2025
    • 90% global waste diversion rate annually
    • 25% reduction in global water usage per full-time employee by 2025
    • 80% of Adobe buildings, by square footage, certified to LEED or other green building standards
    • Net zero by 2050

Hidden Valley Ranch

 96 67

Environmental protection

Hidden Valley Ranch, under the umbrella of Vail Resorts, has made significant commitments to environmental sustainability. In 2017, Vail Resorts announced ambitious goals to achieve a zero net emissions, zero waste to landfill, and zero operating impact on forests and habitat by 2030. To reduce emissions, the company is committed to reducing electricity and natural gas use by an additional 15% on top of the 19% already achieved. This involves investing $25 million in energy-saving projects such as low-energy snowmaking equipment and more efficient grooming practices. Vail Resorts also plans to purchase 100% renewable energy to match its total electrical energy use and invest in carbon offset programs like tree planting. Efforts to minimize waste include improving recycling and composting programs, engaging with vendors to reduce packaging, and increasing awareness among employees and guests. To protect forests and habitats, the company aims to minimize or eliminate the impact of future resort development and plant or restore an acre of forest for every acre displaced by operations. These initiatives are part of Vail Resorts' broader "Epic Promise for a Zero Footprint."

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Vail Resorts, the parent company of Hidden Valley Ranch, demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through various programs. The EpicPromise Foundation supports employees and their dependents in times of need with emergency financial assistance and educational grants. In 2016, the Foundation provided $546,214 to 299 employees. Additionally, the EpicVolunteers program offers employees 40 hours of paid time off for volunteer projects, allowing them to engage in enriching experiences worldwide. The company also organizes an annual company-wide volunteer week, further emphasizing its commitment to community engagement and employee welfare.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Zero Net Emissions by 2030
    • Zero Waste to Landfill by 2030
    • Zero Operating Impact on Forests and Habitat by 2030

Listerine

 96 70

Environmental protection

Listerine is actively working on reducing its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. The company has focused on responsible packaging by using clear PET bottles made from the most recycled plastic material in the world, which are recyclable in most markets. They emphasize the importance of recycling caps by keeping them on the bottles to prevent them from ending up in the environment. Listerine has set ambitious goals for its packaging, aiming for 100% recyclable bottles and caps by 2021, transitioning away from opaque plastic bottles, ensuring labels wash away without residue during recycling, and moving to colorless caps to improve recycling quality. Additionally, they plan to introduce bottles made with post-consumer recycled plastic (PCR) starting in 2022 and aim for all paper and pulp packaging to be certified responsibly sourced or made from post-consumer recycled material by 2025.

In terms of ingredient selection, Listerine prioritizes eco-friendly and non-toxic choices. The brand ensures that no animal-derived ingredients are used in its products. Its COOL MINT Mouthwash, for example, is 99% naturally derived, showcasing their commitment to using ingredients that are gentle on aquatic life and ecosystems, as assessed by the Global Aquatic Ingredient Assessmentâ¢ (GAIA) tool.

Listerine is also focused on resource conservation, implementing innovative solutions to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, increase energy and water efficiency, and conserve environmental resources. The concentration of the COOL MINT mouthwash flavor oil is an example of this effort, aimed at reducing emissions associated with the transportation of raw materials. Furthermore, Listerine is part of Johnson & Johnson's mission to source 100% of its operations' electricity from renewable sources, with 30% already being produced or procured from renewable energy sources. Johnson & Johnson has achieved a 32% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, surpassing its 2020 goal of a 20% reduction.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Listerine has made a clear commitment to not using any animal-derived ingredients in its products. This decision reflects the company's stance on promoting non-toxic and environmentally friendly ingredients that do not harm aquatic life or ecosystems. By setting a high bar for ingredient selection, Listerine ensures that its products are not only beneficial for human oral health but also considerate of animal welfare.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • 100% recyclable bottles & caps by 2021
    • Launching bottles with post-consumer plastic (PCR) in 2022
    • 100% certified responsibly sourced or post-consumer recycled paper and pulp packaging by 2025
    • Source 100% of electricity from renewable sources for operations

NBC

 96 58

Environmental protection

NBCUniversal is actively working towards environmental sustainability across its global operations, with a significant commitment to becoming carbon neutral by 2035 for Scope 1 and 2 emissions. This ambitious goal underscores the company's dedication to reducing its environmental impact and fostering a sustainable future. In pursuit of this objective, NBCUniversal has implemented a Sustainable Production Program aimed at educating and equipping its film and television productions with the necessary tools to minimize their environmental footprint. This initiative spans various aspects of production, from script development to set construction and on-screen behaviors, emphasizing the importance of sustainability in both behind-the-scenes operations and storytelling.

The company's theme parks, including Universal Orlando Resort and Universal Studios Hollywood, have also embraced sustainability through initiatives focused on waste reduction and recycling, water conservation, and energy efficiency. Similarly, NBCUniversal's facilities are undergoing improvements to enhance energy and water efficiency, integrate waste reduction and recycling programs, and incorporate innovative design elements that contribute to a smaller environmental footprint. These comprehensive efforts demonstrate NBCUniversal's commitment to environmental stewardship and its role in promoting sustainable practices within the entertainment industry.

sources: 1, 2

The LEGO Store

 96 70

Environmental protection

The LEGO Group is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and contribute to a sustainable future. They are focused on transitioning to sustainable materials for their core products, aiming to achieve this significant milestone in the near future. In addition to product materials, LEGO is committed to making all its packaging more sustainable by the end of 2025, reflecting their dedication to reducing environmental impact across all aspects of their operations. The company has also launched LEGOÂ® Replay, a program designed to support a circular economy by allowing consumers to donate LEGO bricks to children in need, thereby extending the lifecycle of their products.

To address climate change, LEGO is investing in energy efficiency and the installation of renewable energy sources across its stores, offices, and factories. This effort is part of their broader strategy to reduce CO2 emissions. Furthermore, LEGO has set an ambitious target to achieve Zero Waste to Landfill by 2025, ensuring that no waste from their facilities ends up in landfill sites. They have also partnered with the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) to reduce carbon emissions in their manufacturing and supply chain operations and to promote global action on climate change. These initiatives underscore LEGO's commitment to not just minimizing their environmental impact but also having a positive influence on the planet.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

The LEGO Group places a high value on the welfare of its employees, partners, and suppliers. They strive to create inclusive, safe, and motivating workplaces. This commitment is evident in their policies and practices, including offering parental leave and promoting diversity and inclusion within the company. LEGO adheres to Responsible Business Principles, ensuring ethical conduct and fair treatment in all aspects of their operations. Additionally, the company is dedicated to promoting family-friendly workplaces, recognizing the importance of supporting employees in balancing their professional and personal lives. These efforts reflect LEGO's broader sustainability goals, which prioritize people alongside environmental protection and community engagement.

sources: 1

Nothing found

  • Commitments
    • Making all core LEGO products from sustainable materials
    • Making all packaging more sustainable by the end of 2025
    • Achieving Zero Waste to Landfill by 2025

Western Union

 96 51

Environmental protection

Western Union has acknowledged the importance of addressing climate change and its impacts on their business operations. As part of their evolving Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) strategy, the company has taken steps to assess both their own impact on climate change and the risks and opportunities it presents for their business. This includes measuring their greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions for the year 2022. Such actions indicate a commitment to improving their environmental impact through informed decision-making and targeted efforts to address climate-related challenges. However, specific initiatives or commitments towards carbon reduction, renewable energy usage, waste minimization, or designing environmentally friendly products were not detailed in the provided context.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Western Union has demonstrated a strong commitment to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture within its workforce. In 2022, the company reported that nearly 92 percent of their candidate slates and 84 percent of interview panels globally were diverse. They have also maintained gender pay equity globally and racial/ethnicity pay equity in the U.S. for the third consecutive year. Additionally, Western Union has engaged in marketing job opportunities through partnerships and campaigns with Historically Black Colleges and Universities in the U.S. and online platforms such as DiversityInc and the Minority Corporate Counsel Association. They also piloted a sponsorship program aimed at identifying high-performing women and connecting them with mentors to help maximize their potential and growth. These efforts reflect Western Union's dedication to creating an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the customers they serve.

sources: 1, 2

Arby's

 96 62

Environmental protection

Arby's, as part of the Inspire Brands family, is involved in several initiatives aimed at environmental protection, particularly through sustainable food sourcing and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The company has made strides in removing artificial colors from many products across its brands and is actively evaluating the feasibility of their replacement in other products. Additionally, Arby's offers a variety of menu options that include smaller serving-sized items and sandwiches featuring vegetables on artisan bread, contributing to a more sustainable food offering. Dunkin', another Inspire brand, has launched the Dunkin Drive-To Sustainability Program, committing to 100% Responsibly Sourced Coffee by 2025. This program focuses on verification, partnerships, and improvement, including donations to Rainforest Alliance and One Tree Planted, supporting sustainable coffee and tea projects worldwide. These efforts collectively aim to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability within the food industry.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Arby's, under the umbrella of Inspire Brands, is committed to the humane treatment of animals within its supply chain. The company does not own, raise, process, or transport livestock but requires its suppliers to follow applicable FDA guidelines related to antibiotic use. This includes the judicious use of antibiotics under the supervision of a veterinarian to prevent or treat illness in animals. Arby's has made significant progress in animal welfare, including meeting its commitment to transition to cage-free eggs in 2020. Additionally, Arby's, Buffalo Wild Wings, and Sonic's fish sandwiches are made with wild-caught Alaskan Pollock that is sustainably sourced based on the Marine Stewardship Council Certified benchmark. Dunkin' sources chicken menu items from chickens raised without antibiotics from conception to consumption, and Sonic is making progress in sourcing cage-free eggs. These efforts demonstrate Arby's commitment to animal welfare and sustainable food sourcing practices.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Dunkin' is committing to 100% Responsibly Sourced Coffee by 2025.

GEICO

 96 48

Environmental protection

GEICO has taken steps to contribute to environmental protection through its partnership with auto body repair shops and the implementation of an environmental and safety training program. This initiative requires selected auto body repair shops in the GEICO Auto Repair XpressÂ® program to have at least one person at each facility complete an online training program focused on safety and pollution prevention. The training, provided by S/P2Â®, covers topics specific to auto body repair, aiming to meet annual OSHA and EPA guidelines. This effort not only ensures that repair facilities are safer for customers, employees, and the environment but also promotes the safe handling of materials like paint, antifreeze, and other shop chemicals. GEICO's commitment to environmental safety was recognized in January 2015 when S/P2 awarded the company for its dedication to promoting safety and pollution prevention training within the automotive repair and insurance industries. This award highlights GEICO's role in setting a standard for excellence that contributes to safer facilities and environmental protection.

Hanes

 96 72

Environmental protection

HanesBrands has made significant strides in environmental sustainability, as outlined in their 2021 Sustainability Summary Report. The company has achieved an 11% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions, with a commitment to set science-based emissions reduction targets for 2030. Additionally, HanesBrands has made considerable progress in renewable energy usage, with 48% of its electricity coming from renewable sources. The company also boasts a high rate of waste diversion, with 92% of its waste being diverted from landfills. These efforts are part of HanesBrands' broader commitment to sustainability, which includes goals around reducing greenhouse gas emissions and moving toward 100% sustainably sourced cotton.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

HanesBrands has demonstrated a strong commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives and programs. The company has impacted 1.4 million lives through its philanthropic initiatives and associate and community programs. Additionally, HanesBrands has donated 9.4 million items of essential clothing to 80 organizations, further showcasing its commitment to supporting communities and individuals in need. The company also highlights its commitment to diversity and inclusion, with 49% of U.S. leaders at the senior manager level and above being women. These efforts are part of HanesBrands' broader commitment to building a more sustainable business and investing in the company's associates.

sources: 1

Jack Daniel's

 96 62

Environmental protection

Jack Daniel's has implemented a range of sustainability initiatives focusing on environmental protection. The company has established a zero-waste policy in its distillery operations, ensuring that 99% of the materials used are either reused or recycled. This includes upcycling sugar maple charcoal, a by-product of their whiskey production process, into smoking pellets for barbecues, converting excess shrink wrap into decking material, reusing grain and yeast distilling by-products as cattle feed, and repurposing used barrels for furniture making and other alcohol manufacturers. Additionally, Jack Daniel's has taken significant steps in water conservation by conserving hundreds of acres of land to protect its natural water source, Cave Spring Hollow, and saving approximately 8 million gallons of water annually through the use of a reverse osmosis system. The company is also actively involved in protecting white oak and sugar maple trees, essential for their whiskey production, through partnerships with the DendriFundâs White Oak Initiative and the University of Tennessee's Tree Improvement Program. These efforts are part of Jack Daniel's broader commitment to environmental stewardship and sustainable production practices.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Zero-waste distillery

Petsmart

Environmental protection

PetSmart is committed to being a responsible steward of the planet, focusing on operating ethically and responsibly with an emphasis on environmental sustainability. They aim to mitigate their impact on the environment, although specific initiatives or programs in carbon reduction, waste minimization, renewable energy usage, or environmentally friendly product designs are not detailed. PetSmart's commitment includes adherence to regulatory compliance and efforts to safeguard human and animal rights across their supply chain, which indirectly contributes to their environmental stewardship. Their Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) strategy is informed by international frameworks such as the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals and the Global Reporting Initiative, indicating a structured approach to improving their environmental impact over time.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

PetSmart invests in programs that support the health, safety, and quality of life of their over 50,000 associates. They focus on building a diverse and inclusive workforce, celebrating a strong culture of belonging, and investing in the advancement of their associates and communities. This commitment to worker welfare is part of their broader CSR strategy, which aims to empower people and communities by improving the experience and quality of life for their employees. The company's efforts to create a supportive and inclusive work environment are a testament to their dedication to the welfare of their workers.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

PetSmart places a high priority on the welfare of animals in their care and in their communities. Through the clinical expertise of their staff veterinarians, investments in training and education, and the provision of best-in-class products and services, PetSmart is committed to ensuring the health and happiness of pets. Additionally, their support of PetSmart Charities underscores their commitment to animal welfare. This comprehensive approach demonstrates PetSmart's dedication to living up to their brand promise of doing Anything for Pets.

Pampers

 96 62

Environmental protection

Pampers is actively working towards improving its environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and minimizing waste. The company has taken steps to support sustainable forest practices and ensure that all wood pulp in its diapers is third-party certified by globally recognized certification systems. Pampers' factories have achieved zero manufacturing waste to landfill, and the brand is committed to making its diaper packaging recyclable where facilities exist. Additionally, Pampers is working towards using 50% sustainable and/or bio-based, recycled, and renewable materials in its nappies and wipes, and aims to reduce virgin-petroleum-based plastics in its packaging by 50%. The company has also committed to ensuring that all baby care manufacturing facilities purchase 100% renewable electricity. These efforts are part of Pampers' broader commitment to contribute towards its company's target to reduce emissions across operations by 50% and across the supply chain by 40% as part of its Net Zero GHG emissions by 2040 ambition.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

    • Reduce virgin-petroleum-based plastics in packaging by 50%
    • Purchase 100% renewable electricity for all baby care manufacturing facilities

Panera Bread

 96 62

Environmental protection

Panera Bread has committed to a significant environmental protection strategy, focusing on reducing its carbon footprint and transitioning to more sustainable practices. The company has set a bold aspiration to become Climate Positive by 2050, aiming to remove more carbon than it emits. This commitment is part of addressing the fact that food systems produce over 30% of global carbon emissions. Panera is actively working to reduce its carbon emissions from facilities and supply chains by the end of 2025. Initiatives include offering more Cool Food Meals, shifting to circular packaging, and moving to renewable electricity for its cafes. Panera also promotes the use of sustainable packaging, considering the material's lifecycle and its ability to be reused, composted, or recycled. Additionally, the company encourages customers to bring their own clean reusable drinkware to participating cafes to reduce waste. These efforts are part of Panera's broader strategy to mitigate its environmental impact and contribute to a healthier planet.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Panera Bread has taken significant steps to ensure the welfare of animals used in its products. The company has moved to using chicken, turkey, sausage, and ham that are raised without antibiotics, contributing to better animal care standards and public health. In 2016, Panera committed to better welfare standards for broiler chickens, working with animal welfare experts, growers, suppliers, and other market participants to identify cost-effective solutions. This includes transitioning to new broiler breeds recognized for higher welfare outcomes, providing birds with more space, improved environments (including better litter, lighting, and enrichment), and ensuring birds are rendered unconscious using multi-step controlled atmospheric stunning. Additionally, by June 2021, Panera completed its transition to sourcing 100% of its primary egg supply from cage-free sources, with a goal to reach 100% cage-free eggs across all products by the end of 2025.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to becoming Climate Positive by 2050
    • Reducing carbon emissions from facilities and supply chains by the end of 2025
    • Transitioning to 100% circular packaging
    • Using renewable electricity for at least 50% of company-owned operations by 2025
    • Increasing the percentage of Cool Food Meals to 60% of entrÃ©es by 2025

Environmental protection

Paramount has initiated several efforts to protect the environment, focusing on sustainable production and operations. The company introduced Peak Sustainability, a comprehensive climate action strategy for Paramount UK, which includes seven key climate action pledges aimed at addressing environmental impacts across various priorities. This initiative is part of a broader vision to develop and achieve company-wide, internal climate-related benchmarks and scale Paramountâs climate strategy globally. Paramount's commitment to environmental protection is also evident in its alignment with relevant United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), such as Climate Action.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Paramount is dedicated to ensuring the welfare of its workers by fostering a culture of meritocracy and inclusivity. The company aims to reflect, celebrate, and elevate the diversity of the communities in which it operates and the audiences it serves. Paramount boasts a Board that is representative of diverse communities, with seven directors self-identifying as women, two as LGBTQ+, two as African American, and one as Hispanic or Latinx. This diversity is part of Paramount's broader commitment to building a welcoming environment where all employees have the opportunities and resources to thrive.

Nature Valley

 95 68

Environmental protection

Nature Valley has initiated several efforts to protect the environment, focusing on recyclable packaging and supporting regenerative agriculture practices. They have committed to making their Crunchy bar wrappers store drop-off recyclable as a first step towards their goal of having all their packaging fully recyclable by 2025. This initiative is part of a broader commitment to a more recyclable future, including a partnership with Down to Earth with Zac Efron to raise awareness about Store Drop-Off recycling. Additionally, Nature Valley is financially supporting farmers to adopt regenerative agriculture practices, particularly those supplying oats, to preserve and protect the land. This support extends to eight oat farmers currently on their journey towards regenerative agriculture, emphasizing the company's belief in the importance of sustainable land management.

The brand is part of MondelÄz International's broader mission to lead the future of snacking with a focus on sustainability. This includes specific goals related to environmental sustainability, such as reducing the environmental impact of their products. Triscuit's parent company, MondelÄz International, has set ESG 2025 goals, which include commitments to environmental sustainability. Additionally, Triscuit has launched a new food transparency program that allows consumers to trace the journey of the white-winter wheat used in some of their crackers. This initiative is part of the company's efforts to enhance supply chain transparency and demonstrates an enhanced commitment to ESG, including the environmental aspect of sourcing ingredients sustainably.

Elmer's

 95 76

Environmental protection

Elmer's has taken significant steps towards environmental protection and sustainability. The company has partnered with How2Recycle, a standardized labeling system that clearly communicates recycling instructions to the public. This initiative aims to include consumer-friendly labels on future packaging to facilitate recycling. Elmer's also emphasizes the recyclability of its slime-related containers, providing specific instructions for recycling glue bottles, Gue jars, and Magical Liquid bottles. Beyond recycling, Elmer's has committed to sustainable manufacturing practices. The company's Foam Board Sustainability Commitment includes using a 100% ozone-friendly foaming agent, a formaldehyde-free process, and integrating recycled content. Additionally, Elmer's efforts to reduce electricity consumption by reusing Foam Board byproducts as a fuel source highlight its commitment to environmental protection. The Statesville, N.C., plant has implemented several initiatives to reduce energy consumption, reuse materials, and recycle, significantly reducing non-recyclable solid waste and keeping over 700,000 pounds of material waste from landfills in 2010 alone.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Elmer's demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through its Social Compliance Program. This program ensures that suppliers outside of the United States and Canada who manufacture, assemble, or package finished products for Elmer's comply with local legal requirements. These requirements cover a range of issues, including wages, benefits, working hours, child labor, forced labor, factory security, and health and safety. Elmer's commitment to operating with the highest standards of business ethics extends to its expectation that vendors maintain these same standards, ensuring a fair and safe working environment for all involved in the production of its products.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • How2Recycle

  • Commitments

    • Foam Board Sustainability Commitment
    • Reduction of electricity consumption by reusing Foam Board byproducts as a fuel source
    • Reduction of non-recyclable solid waste loads by 10 percent or more on average at the Statesville, N.C., plant

Goodyear

 95 66

Environmental protection

Goodyear is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives. The company has committed to introducing a 100% sustainable-material tire by 2030 and has made significant progress with the development of a demonstration tire made of 90% sustainable materials. This tire features 17 different sustainable ingredients, including bio-methane, carbon dioxide, end-of-life tire pyrolysis oil feedstocks, plant-based oil, soybean oil, rice husk ash silica, and bio-renewable pine tree resins. Additionally, Goodyear has increased its utilization of renewable electricity to 34% across its global manufacturing operations, up from 3% in 2019. The company also focuses on improving fuel efficiency, achieving a 32.9% reduction in rolling resistance and a 9.4% reduction in tire weight in its global consumer tire portfolio, from a 2005 baseline. These efforts are part of Goodyear's broader sustainability strategy, which is integrated into all levels of the company and aims to reduce its impact on the environment while creating value for stakeholders.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Goodyear is committed to creating a safe, diverse, and healthy workplace for its associates. The company's Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) saw a 6% growth in associate membership in 2022, indicating an active effort to engage employees in its culture. A notable milestone was the 100th anniversary of the Akron-based Goodyear Womenâs Network (GWN) in 2022, highlighting the company's long-standing commitment to supporting women in the workplace. These initiatives are part of Goodyear's broader strategy to provide a supportive and inclusive environment for all its employees, which is integral to its corporate responsibility framework.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) Standards
  • Commitments
    • Introducing a 100% sustainable-material tire by 2030
    • Increasing the utilization of renewable electricity across global manufacturing operations

Swiffer

 95 72

Environmental protection

Swiffer, as part of the P&G family, is contributing to environmental sustainability through a partnership with TerraCycle. This collaboration offers a free recycling program for items that cannot be recycled curbside, encouraging consumers to recycle Swiffer products and packaging that would otherwise end up in landfills. This initiative not only helps keep the environment clean but also rewards consumers for their recycling efforts, promoting a more sustainable approach to product disposal.

sources: 1, 2

Band-Aid

 95 80

Environmental protection

Band-Aid is actively working to minimize its environmental footprint and is investigating new ways to further reduce it. The company has made strides in packaging sustainability, with most of its adhesive bandages' cardboard cartons being fully recyclable. These cartons contain a minimum of 30% post-consumer-use cardboard. Band-Aid also includes a How2RecycleÂ® label on its bandage packages to assist consumers in properly disposing of them. The brand is working towards making all of its packaging fully recyclable, including sterile bandage wrappers. Additionally, Band-Aid is focused on re-evaluating its manufacturing processes to improve efficiencies, minimize waste, and lower water or energy consumption. The company is also making efforts to ensure that the plastic bottles and packaging used in its antiseptic washes are fully recyclable and utilize post-consumer material to support zero-waste initiatives.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Band-Aid, through its partnerships and community support initiatives, indirectly contributes to worker welfare. The company partners with organizations like Feeding AmericaÂ® and CAREÂ® to address basic needs and support thriving communities. Additionally, Band-Aid is proud to partner with the National Black Nursing Association and The Foundation of the National Student Nurses Association to support Black nurses by offering scholarships and highlighting their stories. This initiative aims to foster equity and showcase the presence of Black healthcare workers in the healthcare system. While these efforts are more community-focused than directly related to Band-Aid's own workers, they demonstrate a commitment to supporting healthcare professionals and addressing inequities.

sources: 1

Nothing found

    • Continual re-evaluation of manufacturing processes to minimize waste and lower water or energy consumption
    • Efforts to make plastic bottles and packaging for antiseptic washes fully recyclable and use post-consumer material

HP

 95 69

Apple Watch

 95 54

Environmental protection

Apple has made significant strides in environmental protection, particularly with its Apple Watch lineup, which has been announced as the company's first-ever carbon-neutral products. This achievement is part of Apple's broader commitment to make all its products carbon neutral by 2030. The company has implemented several strategies to reduce the carbon footprint of its products, including using 100% clean electricity for manufacturing and product use, incorporating 30% recycled or renewable material by weight, and reducing reliance on air transportation for shipping. These efforts have led to a dramatic reduction in product emissions, with over 75% reduction for each carbon-neutral Apple Watch. Additionally, Apple has introduced innovations such as ending the use of leather across all product lines, introducing entirely fiber-based packaging for the new Apple Watch lineup, and expanding the use of recycled materials in its products. The company also supports large-scale solar and wind projects to power its data centers and offices with renewable electricity and has committed to matching 100% of customers' expected electricity use for charging the carbon-neutral Apple Watch models with renewable energy projects.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Apple has taken a significant step in promoting animal welfare by ending the use of leather across all its product lines. This decision aligns with the company's environmental goals and reduces its impact on animal life. In place of leather, Apple has introduced FineWoven, a new textile made from 68% post-consumer recycled content, which is used in iPhone MagSafe cases and wallets as well as the Magnetic Link and Modern Buckle Apple Watch bands. This move not only supports animal welfare but also contributes to Apple's commitment to using recycled and renewable materials.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • SCS Global Services certification for carbon-neutral Apple Watch models
  • Commitments
    • Commitment to make all Apple products carbon neutral by 2030
    • Commitment to use 100% clean electricity for manufacturing and product use
    • Commitment to incorporate 30% recycled or renewable material by weight
    • Commitment to reduce reliance on air transportation for shipping
    • Commitment to match 100% of customers' expected electricity use for charging carbon-neutral Apple Watch models with renewable energy projects
    • Commitment to eliminate plastic from all packaging by 2025

Ritz

 95 78

Environmental protection

The Ritz-Carlton, The Ritz London, and Ritz Paris have all implemented various sustainability initiatives focusing on environmental protection. The Ritz-Carlton has initiated Community Footprints programs, encouraging guests to participate in activities like farm tours, beach clean-ups, and seasonal sea oat plantings to protect shorelines. The Ritz London has committed to reducing its energy use by 3% annually and sources its food from local, sustainable, and organic suppliers. It also promotes the use of electric and hybrid vehicles for hotel transfers and has implemented waste reduction and recycling programs. Ritz Paris has been certified by the Global Sustainable Tourism Council and focuses on reducing energy needs through 100% LED lighting and rainwater recovery. It also emphasizes waste reduction, sustainable mobility, and responsible purchasing practices.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

The Ritz-Carlton, The Ritz London, and Ritz Paris have all taken steps to ensure worker welfare. The Ritz-Carlton's Community Footprints program involves employees in volunteer efforts to support local communities. The Ritz London prioritizes the well-being of its teams by contributing to the renovation of local heritage sites and organizing training sessions on the history of the Place VendÃ´me and the Ritz Paris. Ritz Paris is committed to the well-being of its teams through health protection awareness, high-quality training courses, and career management support. It also engages in positive collaborations with underprivileged communities through volunteer work and donations.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • Zero waste to landfill (The Ritz London)

Xbox

 95 57

Environmental protection

Xbox, a division of Microsoft, is actively working to reduce its environmental impact as part of Microsoft's broader goal to be carbon negative, water positive, and zero waste by 2030. Xbox is innovating in hardware and software design to optimize for renewable energy usage and minimize carbon emissions. This includes making Xbox consoles carbon aware, where game, app, and OS updates are scheduled at times when the local energy grid is using more renewable energy sources, thus reducing dependency on fossil fuels and CO2 emissions. Xbox has also introduced energy-saving settings for its consoles, such as the Shutdown (energy saving) power option, which significantly reduces power consumption when the console is off. Additionally, Xbox is exploring ways to use less new plastic and aims for all Microsoft product packaging to be 100% recyclable by 2030, with a commitment to eliminate single-use plastics in product packaging by 2025. The company has already made strides by converting Xbox gift cards from plastic to paperboard, reducing over 500,000 kg of plastic annually. Furthermore, Xbox offers refurbished consoles as a lower waste alternative to buying new, contributing to the circularity of its products.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Be carbon negative, water positive, and zero waste by 2030
    • Eliminate single-use plastics in product packaging by 2025
    • All Microsoft product packaging to be 100% recyclable by 2030

J. C. Penney

 95 58

Environmental protection

JCPenney is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability. The company has developed a five-year roadmap aiming to use preferred sustainable fibers in all of its private label apparel and home products by 2026. These preferred fibers include more sustainably sourced cotton, recycled polyester, Tencel, and EcoVero. JCPenney's commitment to sustainable cotton is evident through its inclusion of BCI, Organic Cotton, and recycled cotton in its preferred fiber portfolio. The company is a proud member of the Better Cotton Initiative (BCI), which focuses on producing more sustainable crops and reducing harmful chemicals. Additionally, JCPenney has partnered with Unifi, utilizing their recycled polyester fiber, REPREVE, in their products, which has led to the recycling of more than 18 million bottles. The company's involvement in the Ellen MacArthur Foundationâs Jeans Redesign program showcases its commitment to addressing waste and pollution in the fashion industry by adhering to guidelines that promote durability, material health, recyclability, and traceability.

In terms of sustainable manufacturing, JCPenney encourages factories and mills within its supply chain to obtain OEKO-TEXÂ® certification to ensure fabrics are free of harmful chemicals. The company is also working towards implementing new chemical standards in the manufacturing process, guided by the Zero Discharge of Hazardous Chemicals (ZDHC) Manufacturing Restricted Substances List (MRSL). JCPenney's efforts in energy conservation have been recognized with the 2022 ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year award, marking the 16th consecutive year of receiving this accolade. The company has successfully reduced its greenhouse gas emissions by 29,042,555 pounds of CO2 between 2020 and 2021 through audits and energy performance management at its facilities worldwide. Additionally, JCPenney engages in innovative recycling programs, such as working with RWS to prevent over 35 million hangers from ending up in landfills annually.

sources: 1

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

    • OEKO-TEXÂ®
    • ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year
  • Commitments
    • Use preferred sustainable fibers in 100% of private label apparel and home products by 2026

Buffalo Wild Wings

 95 52

Environmental protection

Buffalo Wild Wings, as part of Inspire Brands, is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts focusing on energy and water usage reduction, waste management, and sustainable packaging. The company has made significant strides in reducing its environmental footprint through initiatives such as shifting to reusable dishware for dine-in, which eliminated 700 million pieces of single-use packaging annually. Additionally, Buffalo Wild Wings has focused on serving beverages from reusable steel kegs instead of single-use cans and bottles, reducing greenhouse gas emissions by approximately six million kg of CO2e and preventing over 15 million pounds of single-use containers from entering landfills each year. The brand has also implemented an LED retrofit on kitchen lighting in all company-owned sports bars, saving more than 5.2 million kilowatt hours of energy and $520,000 annually. Furthermore, an energy management system initiative is expected to result in a 5% average reduction in gas and electric use year-over-year. These efforts are part of a broader commitment by Inspire Brands to enhance environmental stewardship across its restaurant portfolio.

Hamburger Helper

 95 53

Environmental protection

Hamburger Helper has taken a significant step towards environmental sustainability by modifying the packaging of its product. By slightly straightening the noodles within their boxes, Hamburger Helper has been able to lay the product flatter, reducing the amount of air in each box. This adjustment has led to a reduction in the size of the boxes, saving nearly 900,000 pounds of paper fiber annually. This change not only results in a decrease in the use of packaging materials but also contributes to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 11 percent. This is equivalent to removing 500 trucks from the road. Additionally, the more compact packaging allows for a 20 percent increase in the number of products that can be stocked on shelves, enhancing efficiency and reducing waste throughout the supply chain. These efforts demonstrate Hamburger Helper's commitment to driving innovation in packaging and reducing environmental impact.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

LG

 95 71

Environmental protection

LG Electronics is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainability. The company is committed to achieving carbon neutrality and ensuring all operations use 100% renewable energy by 2030. This commitment extends to redesigning processes to cut carbon emissions and rethinking product lifecycles to minimize waste. LG is also focused on introducing clean technology to foster sustainability. Their efforts include developing innovative technologies that reduce carbon emissions, conserve resources, and make living more sustainable. Additionally, LG is working on water-saving technologies in their products, such as washing machines and dishwashers, which are designed to reduce water usage without compromising performance. They are also exploring groundbreaking technology to wash clothes using pure CO2, eliminating the need for water. Furthermore, LG is committed to using sustainable materials, with several of their products containing parts made from recycled plastic resin and certified post-consumer recycled content.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

LG Electronics is dedicated to creating a decent workplace that ensures a healthy and safe environment for its employees. The company is committed to upholding human rights, fostering diversity, and creating a supportive work environment. LG aims to create a sense of belonging, enabling individuals to reach their full potential. This commitment is part of LG's broader efforts to ensure worker welfare, focusing on exceptional experiences and human-centered innovation to bring smiles to people's faces.

sources: 1
