Hefty

 95 75

Environmental protection

HeftyÂ® is actively engaged in several initiatives aimed at environmental protection and sustainability. The company is committed to producing recycled and compostable products, rethinking production processes, and creating circular economies through community programs. A significant effort in this direction is the use of recyclable packaging across the entire HeftyÂ® trash bags portfolio, alongside a reduction in packaging size to decrease the use of paperboard material and CO2 emissions. HeftyÂ® offers products designed to create less waste, such as HeftyÂ® Ultra Strongâ¢ trash bags made with 50% recovered materials, HeftyÂ® Compostables Trash Bags for commercial composting, and tableware products made with up to 96% plant-based materials.

The Hefty ReNewâ¢ Program is another cornerstone of their environmental efforts, focusing on the collection and conversion of hard-to-recycle plastics into valuable resources. This program has successfully diverted 2,500 tons of hard-to-recycle plastics from landfills and is accessible to 1.3 million households for curbside recycling. The program's impact is further underscored by independent life cycle assessments conducted in 2020 and 2022, which highlight its contributions to reducing landfill waste, decreasing dependence on fossil fuels, and improving recycling facility efficiency.

HeftyÂ® also emphasizes the importance of adhering to all environmental regulations and has set a goal to achieve zero waste certification by 2025 through the reduction of raw material and energy consumption, recycling or reducing scrap, and optimizing shipping efficiencies.

sources: 1, 2

Tesla

 95 46

Environmental protection

Tesla is deeply committed to contributing to a sustainable energy economy, with a focus on accelerating the world's transition to sustainability. This commitment is evident in their Master Plan Part 3, which outlines key areas to advance the shift to sustainability, including the dramatic growth in the annual deployment of solar and wind energy as well as the production of batteries. Tesla's products, particularly their electric vehicles (EVs), are designed to lower emissions significantly compared to gas-powered vehicles. The Model Y All-Wheel Drive, for example, is highlighted as the most efficient electric SUV built to date, achieving 4.0 EPA miles per kWh. In 2022, Tesla produced and delivered over 1.3 million EVs globally, emphasizing the importance of scale in achieving sustainable transportation.

Tesla also focuses on sustainable design in their manufacturing processes. Their factories are built to limit waste, water usage, and energy consumption. Notably, Gigafactory Texas features highly efficient, low emissivity windows and a significant installation of solar panels, with 32,400 kW installed across their factories by the end of 2022. Additionally, Tesla has implemented AI control to enhance energy efficiency in their factories. The company aims to achieve industry-leading low water usage per vehicle, even accounting for in-house cell manufacturing. Tesla's approach to greenhouse gas reporting is based on real-world mileage data from over four million cars, allowing for more accurate estimation of greenhouse gas savings.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Krispy Kreme

 95 69

Environmental protection

Krispy Kreme has initiated several measures to protect the environment, focusing on waste reduction, responsible sourcing, energy and emissions, and overall carbon footprint management. The company has achieved 100% diversion of food waste from landfill, with waste doughnuts being converted to animal feed and the rest for energy regeneration. They have also partnered with Too Good To Go to ensure leftover doughnuts are enjoyed by people, and have managed to divert 100% of waste from their manufacturing sites from landfill in partnership with Veolia. Krispy Kreme has set a target to reduce food waste in their retail shops by 50% in 2023.

In terms of plastic reduction, Krispy Kreme has removed 31.8 tonnes of plastic from their business since 2019, switched to paper straws and cups, and removed plastic windows from their packaging, contributing to a significant reduction in plastic use. The company has committed to having a minimum of 80% recyclable packaging by 2025.

Krispy Kreme sources 100% free-range eggs in the UK and Ireland, uses Rainforest Alliance Certified coffee, and ensures their palm oil supports sustainable production and a deforestation-free supply chain. The company has also made strides in energy savings, achieving a 6% reduction through voltage optimisation and a 3% reduction across all manufacturing hubs in 2021, with plans to double this in 2022. Krispy Kreme UK has been certified as carbon neutral across its UK & Ireland operations for 2022 by Sustainable Advantage and is working on a roadmap to net zero, although a specific target date has not been set.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Krispy Kreme has demonstrated a commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives aimed at promoting diversity, inclusion, and community engagement. The company has focused on increasing diversity and promoting a sense of belonging among its employees, achieving a 73% "belonging" score in its 2022 Krispy Kremer engagement survey. The survey validated key strengths regarding acceptance and equal opportunity among team members and corporate employees. Krispy Kreme has established a global goal to achieve gender parity by the end of 2025. Additionally, the company's team members have participated in thousands of Acts of Joy, volunteering, and participating in local community events across the globe. Krispy Kreme's fundraising initiatives have also helped community groups raise $40 million globally and supported more than 83,000 events in the U.S. alone in 2022.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Krispy Kreme has made a commitment to using 100% cage-free eggs by 2025. As of 2022, the company reached 45% of this target and expects to achieve 75% by 2024, with full completion in 2025. This initiative is part of Krispy Kreme's broader effort to reduce animal protein use and find ways to accelerate consumption reduction. In the UK and Ireland, Krispy Kreme has already transitioned to using 100% free-range eggs since 2019, further demonstrating their commitment to animal welfare.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Rainforest Alliance Certified (Coffee)
    • Sustainable Advantage certified Krispy Kreme UK as carbon neutral for 2022

  • Commitments

    • Achieve 100% cage-free eggs by 2025
    • Reduce food waste in retail shops by 50% in 2023
    • Achieve 80% recyclable or compostable packaging by 2025
    • Establish a roadmap to net zero (Date not set)

Barnes & Noble

Delta Air Lines

 95 55

Environmental protection

Delta Air Lines has committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, recognizing the aviation industry's significant challenge in decarbonizing. To reach this ambitious goal, Delta is focusing on revolutionizing its fleet, investing in sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), and creating operational improvements. The airline aims to replace 10% of its jet fuel refined from fossil fuel with SAF by the end of 2030. In 2022, Delta took delivery of 69 aircraft that were 25% more fuel-efficient per seat mile than the aircraft retired since 2019. Additionally, Delta has made efforts to reduce single-use plastics onboard, including introducing bedding made from 100% recycled plastic bottles, reusable and biodegradable service ware, and premium canned wine, aiming to reduce onboard single-use plastic consumption by about 4.9 million pounds per year. Delta's commitment to sustainability also extends to its ground service vehicles, with a significant portion of its ground support equipment at hubs in Salt Lake City and Boston nearly entirely powered by electricity. This move is part of Delta's broader aspiration for a 100% net-zero ground operation globally.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050
    • Aiming to replace 10% of jet fuel with sustainable aviation fuel by the end of 2030
    • Reducing onboard single-use plastic consumption by about 4.9 million pounds per year

Hostess CupCake

 95 68

Environmental protection

Hostess Brands has demonstrated a commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental footprint. The company has made significant progress in reducing water usage by 25% over the last two years on a per metric ton of product produced basis. Additionally, Hostess Brands has decreased its energy use by 14% and its greenhouse gas emissions by 19% over the past two years, also on a per metric ton of product produced basis. These achievements are part of the company's broader efforts to conserve resources and minimize its impact on the environment. In 2021, Hostess Brands began developing its first-ever Climate Action Plan to identify further steps to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, energy, and water usage, with plans to finalize this strategy over the next two years. The company has also conducted a detailed review of its packaging to identify opportunities to reduce its carbon footprint and has made strides in using recycled packaging materials year over year. A notable project is the conversion of an idled factory in Arkadelphia, Arkansas, into a state-of-the-art bakery with a sustainability-first approach. This facility is expected to become Hostess Brands' most sustainable facility to date, showcasing the company's commitment to environmentally conscious capital expenditure decisions.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Hostess Brands places a high priority on worker welfare, as evidenced by its initiatives focused on Workplace Health & Safety and Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (DEI&B). The company has implemented employee training practices that have resulted in significantly lower injury and safety incident rates compared to industry averages. Hostess Brands has also introduced several employee and culture-enhancing programs designed to attract, develop, and retain a high-quality workforce. These include "thank you" bonuses for frontline bakery and distribution center employees, roundtable employee discussions to encourage open and transparent dialogue, and an emphasis on DEI&B programs. These efforts have been recognized with Hostess Brands' first-ever inclusion by Forbes as a 2021 Top 500 Place to Work for Mid-sized Companies and a 2021 Top Workplace for Military Veterans.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Finalizing a Climate Action Plan over the next two years to further reduce greenhouse gas emissions, energy, and water usage.

Intel

 95 68

Environmental protection

Intel is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and address climate change. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its environmental footprint, including achieving net-zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions for scopes 1 and 2 by 2040, and net-positive water use and zero waste to landfills by 2030. Intel aims to increase the energy efficiency of its client and server microprocessors tenfold by 2030 and has committed to achieving net-zero upstream Scope 3 GHG emissions by 2050. In 2022, Intel made significant progress towards these goals, utilizing 93% renewable electricity globally, saving 9.6 billion gallons of water, and upcycling 67% of its manufacturing waste. The company is also focused on sustainable semiconductor manufacturing, improving energy efficiency across its product portfolio, and collaborating with partners to accelerate the fight against climate change. Intel's efforts include participating in water restoration projects, achieving 100% renewable electricity use across its global operations, and implementing circular economy strategies for its manufacturing waste streams.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Nothing found

Polo Ralph Lauren

 95 55

Environmental protection

Polo Ralph Lauren is actively working towards environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint, minimizing waste, and conserving natural resources. The company has set a Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) approved goal to reduce absolute Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 30% by 2030 from a FY20 base year and aims to achieve net zero by 2040. In its efforts to use renewable energy, Polo Ralph Lauren is working towards powering its owned and operated offices, distribution centers, and stores with 100% renewable electricity by 2025. The company has also committed to a 20% reduction in total water use across its operations and value chain by 2025 compared to a FY20 baseline and has already decreased its total water use by 25% from the baseline. Additionally, Polo Ralph Lauren aims to achieve 100% recyclable, reusable, or sustainably sourced packaging materials by 2025 and has successfully achieved zero waste to landfill across its distribution centers. The company is also working on eliminating the use of hazardous chemicals in its supply chain by 2025 and is developing a biodiversity strategy aligned with the Science Based Targets for Nature by 2024.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Polo Ralph Lauren is committed to championing better lives for its workers and those within its supply chain. The company has achieved its goal of ensuring that at least 20% of its Global Leadership Team is comprised of underrepresented racial and ethnic groups. It has maintained gender parity with equal representation in leadership positions at the VP level and above. Polo Ralph Lauren has significantly increased company employee volunteer hours by 500% compared to a FY22 baseline. The company aims to make empowerment and life skills programs available to 250,000 workers across its supply chain by 2030 and has already reached 98,000 workers. Additionally, Polo Ralph Lauren has achieved a 27% increase in women in factory leadership across four target countries and has rolled out its Wage Management Strategy to all of its strategic and key suppliers to address fair and timely compensation for factory workers.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Cradle to Cradle (C2C) CertifiedÂ® Gold for Luxury Cashmere Sweater

    • Reduce absolute Scope 1, 2, and 3 GHG emissions by 30% by 2030 (SBTi-approved)
    • Achieve net zero by 2040
    • Power owned and operated offices, distribution centers, and stores with 100% renewable electricity by 2025
    • Achieve at least a 20% reduction in total water use across operations and value chain by 2025

    • Roll out Wage Management Strategy to all strategic and key suppliers by FY23

OxiClean

 95 73

Environmental protection

OxiClean is actively contributing to environmental protection through its product design and manufacturing processes. The company highlights the use of 100% renewable electricity in the manufacturing of its OxiCleanâ¢ Versatile Stain Remover. This product is also noted for its simple five-ingredient formula, which aims to reduce the introduction of chemicals into homes. By promoting the extension of the life of various items such as clothing and furniture, OxiClean encourages a reduction in waste and energy consumption associated with producing new items. Their efforts extend to providing solutions that help consumers maintain their belongings for longer periods, thereby contributing to a decrease in landfill waste. This approach not only emphasizes the importance of sustainability in product usage but also in the lifecycle of consumer goods, aligning with broader environmental protection goals.

Ralph Lauren

 95 55

Environmental protection

Ralph Lauren is actively working towards reducing its environmental footprint through various initiatives aimed at protecting the environment. The company has set a target to reduce absolute Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 30% by 2030, a goal that has been approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi). As of the fiscal year 2023, Ralph Lauren has already decreased its absolute emissions by 29% from its fiscal year 2020 baseline. Additionally, the company has committed to achieving net zero emissions by 2040 and has submitted this target for SBTi approval against its new Net Zero Standard. Ralph Lauren is also focusing on renewable energy, aiming to power its owned and operated offices, distribution centers, and stores with 100% renewable electricity by 2025. In terms of water conservation, the company has surpassed its goal by reducing total water use across its operations and value chain by 25% from its fiscal year 2020 baseline, against a target of at least a 20% reduction by 2025. Furthermore, Ralph Lauren has achieved its goal of zero waste to landfill across its distribution centers and is working towards eliminating the use of hazardous chemicals in its supply chain by 2025. The company is also developing a biodiversity strategy aligned with the Science Based Targets for Nature, set to be completed by 2024.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Ralph Lauren is committed to championing better lives for its workers, both within its workforce and throughout its supply chain. The company has successfully ensured that at least 20% of its Global Leadership Team is comprised of underrepresented racial and ethnic groups. It has also maintained gender parity in leadership positions at the VP level and above, with 50% of these roles held by women. Ralph Lauren has significantly increased company employee volunteer hours by 500% compared to a fiscal year 2022 baseline. Additionally, the company aims to make empowerment and life skills programs available to 250,000 workers across its supply chain by 2030, having already reached 98,000 workers to date. Ralph Lauren has achieved a 27% increase in women in factory leadership across four target countries, surpassing its goal of a 25% increase by 2025. The company has also rolled out its Wage Management Strategy to all of its strategic and key suppliers to address fair and timely compensation for factory workers, with all strategic and key suppliers expected to have the capabilities and systems in place to deliver fair and timely compensation by 2030.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Cradle to Cradle (C2C) CertifiedÂ® Gold for the Luxury Cashmere Sweater

  • Commitments

    • Reduce absolute Scope 1, 2, and 3 GHG emissions by 30% by 2030 (SBTi-approved)
    • Achieve net zero by 2040
    • Power owned and operated offices, distribution centers, and stores with 100% renewable electricity by 2025
    • Achieve at least a 20% reduction in total water use across operations and value chain by 2025
    • Achieve 100% recyclable, reusable, or sustainably sourced packaging materials by 2025
    • Achieve zero waste to landfill across distribution centers by 2023
    • Eliminate the use of hazardous chemicals in the supply chain by 2025
    • Develop a biodiversity strategy and set goals aligned with the Science Based Targets for Nature by 2024
    • Make empowerment and life skills programs available to 250,000 workers across the supply chain by 2030
    • Increase women in factory leadership by 25% by 2025
    • Roll out Wage Management Strategy to all strategic and key suppliers by FY23

PUMA

 95 60

Environmental protection

PUMA is actively working towards reducing its environmental footprint through various initiatives focused on the sustainability of materials and processes involved in product manufacturing. The company has set ambitious targets for sourcing materials from sustainable sources. By 2021, over 99% of PUMA's cotton and nearly all of its polyester in apparel and leather in footwear originated from sustainable sources. PUMA aims to source 100% of its cotton, polyester, leather, down feathers, paper, and cardboard from more sustainable sources by 2025. The company is a member of the Leather Working Group, aiming to improve the leather manufacturing industry by promoting environmental priorities and best practices. For its cotton, PUMA partners with the Better Cotton Initiative to improve cotton farming globally, with a commitment to sourcing 100% of its cotton as 'more sustainable cotton' by 2025. In terms of polyester, PUMA has committed to scaling up the usage of recycled polyester to 75% by 2025, with 43% achieved in 2021. This initiative helps to avoid waste and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Additionally, all paper bags used in PUMA stores and product hangtags are FSC certified, and PUMA shoe boxes use over 95% recycled paper content, supporting responsibly managed forests. All PUMA products using down feathers are made with 100% RDS-certified down, ensuring animal welfare throughout their lifetime.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

PUMA places a strong emphasis on human rights and worker welfare within its supply chain. The company has been conducting regular audits at its suppliers for over 20 years, with its auditing program accredited by the Fair Labor Association since 2007. This demonstrates PUMA's commitment to ensuring fair working conditions and respecting human rights across all players in its supply chain. The company's approach to sustainability integrates respect for human rights as a core principle, addressing high-risk areas and working towards improving the lives of workers involved in the production of its products.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

PUMA ensures the welfare of animals used in its products, particularly through its commitment to using 100% RDS-certified down feathers since 2020. The Responsible Down Standard (RDS) certification guarantees that the down in PUMA products does not come from birds that have been live-plucked or force-fed, and that their welfare has been protected throughout their lives. This commitment reflects PUMA's dedication to minimizing animal suffering and promoting health and welfare standards in its product lines.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Leather Working Group
    • Better Cotton Initiative
    • bluesignÂ®
    • STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEXÂ®
    • Forest Stewardship Council (FSC)
    • Responsible Down Standard (RDS)
  • Commitments
    • Source 100% sustainable cotton, polyester, leather, down feathers, paper, and cardboard by 2025
    • Scale up the usage of recycled polyester to 75% by 2025

Popeyes Chicken & Biscuits

 95 60

Environmental protection

PopeyesÂ® has announced several initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental footprint. The company is committed to removing all EPS foam cups globally and replacing them with paper cups. Additionally, PopeyesÂ® is working towards ensuring all approved fiber-based packaging comes from certified or recycled sources globally by the end of 2021. In terms of sustainable sourcing, PopeyesÂ® now sources palm oil that is RSPO Mass Balance certified or covered by RSPO certification and credits for its entire menu globally. This is in line with the brand's Palm Oil Sourcing Policy, which aims to contribute to the production of certified sustainable palm oil and support deforestation-free supply chains.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

PopeyesÂ® has made commitments towards animal welfare by pledging to eliminate antibiotics important to human medicine from their chicken supply chain in the US and Canada by the end of 2021. This policy supports the brand's approach to responsible antibiotic use in food animals. Additionally, PopeyesÂ® has committed to using 100% cage-free eggs, including whole eggs, liquid eggs, egg products, and egg ingredients in all corporate-run and franchisee-operated restaurants in Canada by the end of 2025.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • RSPO Mass Balance certified (for palm oil sourcing)
  • Commitments
    • Removing artificial colors, flavors, and preservatives from fried chicken menu items in Canada by the end of 2023.
    • Eliminating antibiotics important to human medicine from their chicken supply chain in the US and Canada by the end of 2021.
    • Using 100% cage-free eggs in all corporate-run and franchisee-operated restaurants in Canada by the end of 2025.
    • Removing all EPS foam cups globally and replacing them with paper cups.
    • Implementing requirements for all approved fiber-based packaging to come from certified or recycled sources globally by the end of 2021.

Big Lots

 95 62

Environmental protection

Big Lots has taken several steps to protect the environment, focusing on its corporate headquarters. The headquarters is LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certified, indicating it meets high standards for being environmentally friendly and energy-efficient. Additionally, the company offers free charging for fuel-efficient vehicles and has designated prime parking spots for them. Inside the building, "smart" restroom fixtures have been installed to reduce water usage, and recycling stations for paper, plastic, and glass are available. The HVAC systems and insulation are optimized for energy efficiency. Furthermore, Big Lots has established a Green Team, which consists of associates across the business committed to reducing the company's environmental impact. This team promotes events, activities, and educational opportunities focused on sustainable practices and reduction initiatives.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Big Lots emphasizes the importance of treating its associates as part of a family dedicated to serving everyone like family. This approach suggests a focus on creating a supportive and inclusive workplace environment. However, specific programs or initiatives related to worker welfare, such as living wage programs or community building activities, are not detailed in the provided context.

sources: 1

Bed Bath and Beyond

 95 57

Environmental protection

Bed Bath & Beyond has launched a comprehensive environmental, social, and governance (ESG) strategy, with significant commitments towards environmental protection. The company aims to become Net Zero by 2040, focusing on improving its environmental performance across its value chain. This includes deploying AI-based tools to monitor and manage its carbon footprint, setting milestones for operations, sourcing, and products, and reducing water and energy consumption. Additionally, Bed Bath & Beyond is committed to making sustainable products more accessible to customers, reducing the use of virgin plastics, and leading responsible sourcing practices. This initiative is part of their broader strategy to build a better home for the next generation through sustainability improvements.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Bed Bath & Beyond is committed to creating an equitable and inclusive work environment, aiming to become a top 10 retail employer by 2030. The company plans to introduce an industry-leading paid parental leave policy and invest in an associate relief fund to support employees during unexpected challenges. Furthermore, Bed Bath & Beyond has set diversity, equity, and inclusion goals to achieve at least 50% women representation and at least 25% racial and/or ethnic diversity at all levels by 2030. The company is also focusing on expanding learning and development opportunities and introducing innovative upskilling programs for its workforce.

sources: 1

Dick's

 95 61

Environmental protection

DICK'S Sporting Goods is actively working to reduce its environmental footprint through various initiatives aimed at sustainability and responsible stewardship of the planet. The company has set a goal to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions for its operations by 30% by 2030, using a 2016 baseline. Additionally, DICK'S has committed to eliminating single-use, point-of-sale plastic bags in all its stores by the end of 2025. This commitment extends beyond just the elimination of plastic bags to addressing the company's entire value chain, with some stores offering new point-of-sale bag options in accordance with local policies. DICK'S also partners with SidelineSwap to promote the reuse of sports gear, thereby keeping it out of landfills, and encourages recycling by allowing customers to return plastic shopping bags to their stores for recycling. These efforts reflect DICK'S commitment to protecting the environment and promoting sustainable consumption.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

DICK'S Sporting Goods has established clear goals to ensure the welfare of its workers, focusing on creating an inclusive, equitable, diverse, and safe workplace. The company has achieved its target of having 50% BIPOC and/or women for entry-level hires in technology by 2025 and maintains a median gender pay ratio of 100%. Furthermore, DICK'S is working towards increasing BIPOC representation in leadership roles by 30% and enhancing the overall representation of women in store leadership by 40% by 2025. These efforts underscore DICK'S commitment to fostering a workplace environment where all teammates can thrive.

sources: 1

Universal Studios

 95 66

Environmental protection

Universal Studios, as part of Comcast NBCUniversal, is committed to becoming carbon neutral by 2035. Their environmental sustainability efforts are focused on clean energy and energy efficiency, recycling and waste reduction, and water conservation. Universal Orlando Resort has installed a 250-kW floating solar system and is exploring additional on-site solar options across its Orlando and Los Angeles theme parks. Universal Studios Hollywood is transitioning to electric trams, aiming to convert all 21 trams by 2025. Energy efficiency is achieved through the use of LED lighting, high-efficiency HVAC systems, and reflective roofing materials to minimize solar heat load. Waste reduction efforts include food waste collection for energy generation and recycling of materials like metal, glass, batteries, plastic, and paper. Water conservation measures include the use of reclaimed water for irrigation, irrigation control sensors, and waterless urinals, significantly reducing potable water usage. Additionally, Universalâs Volcano Bay implements water conservation programs to purify and reuse water daily. The "Green is Universal" initiative underscores NBCUniversal's commitment to integrating environmental sustainability into its operations, including on the Universal Studios Lot, through practices like EV charging, food donation, LED set lighting, sustainable production practices, and a zero-waste recycling program.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to carbon neutrality by 2035

General Mills

 95 69

Environmental protection

General Mills is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives focusing on sustainable and responsible sourcing, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, water stewardship, and regenerative agriculture. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) footprint across its value chain by 30% by 2030 and aims to reach net-zero GHG emission levels by 2050. In terms of water stewardship, General Mills is committed to increasing efficiency and conservation from watershed to production. The company is also dedicated to advancing regenerative agriculture on 1 million acres of farmland by 2030, emphasizing practices that regenerate the earth's resources. Additionally, General Mills is working towards designing 100% recyclable or reusable packaging by 2030 to minimize the environmental impact of its packaging. These efforts are part of General Mills' broader commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship, reflecting its dedication to protecting the planet and its resources for future generations.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

General Mills has adopted the U.S. Dairy Stewardship Commitment, which includes a focus on animal care as part of its broader social responsibility pledge. This commitment ensures that all the fluid milk sourced in the U.S. for Yoplait comes from co-ops whose member farms operate in accordance with the standards of the National Milk Producers Federation animal care program, Farmers Assuring Responsible Management (FARM). This initiative reflects General Mills' commitment to ensuring the welfare of workers and animals within its supply chain, demonstrating its dedication to responsible and ethical sourcing practices.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

General Mills is committed to animal welfare through its adoption of the U.S. Dairy Stewardship Commitment and its focus on sourcing ingredients responsibly. The company ensures that the fluid milk sourced in the U.S. for Yoplait comes from co-ops whose member farms adhere to the National Milk Producers Federation animal care program, Farmers Assuring Responsible Management (FARM). This commitment to animal welfare is part of General Mills' broader sustainability efforts, which include responsible sourcing of ingredients such as palm oil and cocoa, with an emphasis on eliminating deforestation and supporting smallholder farmer livelihoods.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • PEFC/FSC certified virgin materials (for fiber packaging)
  • Commitments
    • Reduce GHG footprint across the value chain by 30% by 2030
    • Reach net-zero GHG emission levels by 2050
    • Advance regenerative agriculture on 1 million acres of farmland by 2030
    • Design 100% recyclable or reusable packaging by 2030

Pfizer

 95 53

Environmental protection

Pfizer is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on climate impact mitigation, conservation of resources, and waste reduction. The company has committed to ambitious targets aligned with a 1.5Â°C pathway to drive down greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions throughout its value chain. Pfizer aims to achieve the Net-Zero Standard by 2040, with interim goals of reducing company emissions by 46% by 2030 and 95% by 2040 compared to a 2019 baseline. Additionally, Pfizer plans to reduce value chain emissions by 90% by 2040, with near-term targets for suppliers and logistics to set their own science-based GHG reduction targets. In 2020, Pfizer launched a $1.25 billion Sustainability Bond to support environmental projects and a $1 billion bond in 2021 to help fund Covid-19 vaccine expenses. The company is also focused on reducing the environmental impact of its medicines through the product life cycle, including GHG emissions, water scarcity, and the elimination of substances of environmental concern. Pfizer has implemented over 1,500 sustainability projects globally since 2012, resulting in significant environmental performance improvements and savings. The company continues to work on waste minimization, water stewardship, smarter packaging, green processes, and addressing pharmaceuticals in the environment.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • Reduce company (Scope 1 & 2) emissions by 46% by 2030 compared to a 2019 baseline
    • Reduce value chain emission by 90% by 2040
    • By 2025, aim for 64 percent of purchased goods and services suppliers by spend to set their own science-based GHG reduction targets
    • Reduce emissions for upstream logistics by 10 percent and business travel by 25 percent from a 2019 baseline

Tabasco

 95 63

Environmental protection

Tabasco has implemented several initiatives to reduce its environmental impact, focusing on water usage, recycling, and sourcing. Since 2010, the company has successfully reduced its water usage rate by 11% through improved maintenance practices and more efficient wash down procedures. In terms of recycling, Tabasco has achieved an 88% increase in its recycling rate compared to 2010, aiming to reuse or recycle any production waste. Notably, its white oak barrels are reused for up to fifty years as part of the pepper mash aging process. Additionally, Tabasco prioritizes sourcing materials as close to Avery Island as possible, mostly within a 10-hour delivery circle, to lower fuel and freight costs and reduce environmental impact. sources: 1

Worker welfare

Tabasco supports its farmers by providing multi-year contracts that guarantee a price per pound and estimated quantities. The company supplies seed, grown on Avery Island, at no cost and coordinates agronomist support to provide technical assistance in the fields. This approach ensures a stable income and support for farmers, contributing to their welfare. sources: 1

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

Honey Bunches of Oats

 95 63

Environmental protection

Honey Bunches of Oats, a product of Post Consumer Brands, is involved in several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment through responsible sourcing of its key ingredients. The company has committed to sourcing the majority of its ingredients, including wheat and rice, from the U.S. and Canada, focusing on sustainable farming practices. For wheat, a primary ingredient in Honey Bunches of Oats, Post is working with suppliers who are exploring regenerative agriculture practices. These practices are designed to reduce carbon emissions both in the field and from wheat processing facilities by pulling carbon from the air and storing it in the soil. Additionally, Post sources rice from suppliers committed to water conservation and environmental preservation, achieving a 52% reduction in water usage and a 41% decrease in greenhouse gas emissions over the last 35 years. Post has also committed to a "no deforestation" policy within its supply chain for key commodities, including cocoa, to prevent environmental degradation.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Post Consumer Brands has outlined a Supplier Code of Conduct that prohibits discrimination, harassment, forced labor, and child labor within its supply chain. This code is part of the company's broader efforts to ensure the welfare of workers involved in the production of its cereals, including Honey Bunches of Oats. By partnering with suppliers who have sustainable cocoa sourcing programs, Post aims to address social issues such as ending child and forced labor in cocoa production. These initiatives reflect the company's commitment to responsible sourcing and the welfare of workers across its supply chain.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committed to responsibly sourcing from trusted suppliers aligned with the Global Food Safety Initiative.
    • Partnered with the Sustainability Consortium to evaluate supply chain and increase transparency.
    • Committed to a "no deforestation" policy within its supply chain for key commodities.
    • Wheat suppliers are exploring regenerative agriculture practices.
    • Largest rice suppliers have decreased water usage by 52% and greenhouse gas emissions by 41%.

Tommy Hilfiger

 95 57

Environmental protection

Tommy Hilfiger is actively working towards becoming a more sustainable brand by focusing on circular economy principles and reducing its environmental footprint. The brand has made significant strides in sourcing sustainable materials, with 97% of the cotton used globally in 2022 being sustainably sourced. Additionally, Tommy Hilfiger has achieved 78% renewable energy coverage across its global retail operations through the purchase of certified renewable energy credits and onsite solar adoption. The company is also committed to waste reduction, having diverted 110,792 pounds of textile from landfills since 2020 through circular business models that involve taking back, repairing, reselling, recycling, or transforming pre-loved or damaged products into new items. Furthermore, Tommy Hilfiger has set a goal to ensure 100% of the cotton it uses is more sustainable by 2025, as part of its broader mission to build a future of fashion that wastes nothing.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Tommy Hilfiger is committed to fostering an inclusive and equitable workplace. The brand has made notable progress in gender parity, with women holding 45% of Vice President and above positions across PVH, the parent company of Tommy Hilfiger, as of 2022. The company continues to work towards achieving full gender parity. Additionally, Tommy Hilfiger has launched collaborations with diverse voices to promote creativity, gender, and size inclusion, such as the TOMMYXRICHARDQUINN capsule and collaborations with change-makers like Indya Moore, Romeo Hunte, and Patta. The brand also focuses on making fashion accessible to people with disabilities through its Tommy Hilfiger Adaptive line, which is sold across various regions and has been expanded to new product categories.

sources: 1, 2

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

T-Mobile

 95 52

Environmental protection

T-Mobile is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives aimed at sustainability and carbon reduction. The company has committed to reaching net-zero emissions by 2040 and has already made significant strides towards this goal. As of 2022, T-Mobile sources 100% of its purchased electricity from renewable energy, contributing to a 20% reduction in total Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions since 2020. This achievement is part of their broader strategy to improve energy efficiency and invest in product circularity. Additionally, T-Mobile has managed to reuse, resell, or recycle 11.7 million customer devices, further emphasizing its commitment to reducing waste and promoting sustainability. The company's efforts have been recognized with an A- grade on the 2022 CDP Climate Change assessment. T-Mobile is also a participant in several environmental initiatives, including The Climate Pledge, RE100, the EPA Green Power Partnership, GeSI, and The Nature Conservancy, to accelerate and scale corporate climate action and promote the use of green energy.

sources: 1, 2

    • ISO 14001:2015

Duracell

 95 75

Environmental protection

Duracell has implemented several initiatives to reduce its environmental impact, focusing on production, packaging, and product innovation. All Duracell plants in Europe operate using 100% green energy, and the central location of their EU plant minimizes transport distances, contributing to lower emissions. Since 2014, the Aarschot Plant has achieved a 78% reduction in carbon emissions, a 24% reduction in water consumption, and a 44% reduction in gas consumption. In terms of packaging, Duracell is on a mission to become 100% plastic-free, excluding the BabySecure Double Blister Pack designed for child safety. Currently, 88% of all Duracell packaging in Western Europe is plastic-free, with strong plans in place to achieve a plastic-free goal by 2024. All cardboard packaging is made from recycled material and is fully recyclable, proudly displaying the Nordic Ecolabel. Duracell's product innovation, particularly with the Duracell Optimum, aims to minimize waste by offering batteries with up to 30% extra life since the early 2000s and up to 69% lower environmental impact according to a 2021 Life Cycle Assessment. Duracell also promotes recycling initiatives globally, including the 'Big Battery Hunt' in the UK and the 'Batterie Challenge' in Germany, to encourage battery recycling and educate on the importance of proper disposal.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

    • Nordic Ecolabel

  • Commitments

    • 100% plastic-free packaging by 2024 (excluding BabySecure Double Blister Pack for child safety)
    • Continuously improving battery performance to minimize waste and environmental impact

Huggies

 95 60

Environmental protection

Huggies has initiated several environmental protection efforts focusing on sustainability and reducing their environmental impact. The company is committed to making decisions that support the earth and take steps toward sustainability. Huggies has made progress towards creating a net-positive impact for the planet. All Huggies baby wipes are made with more than 70% plant-based materials, and all Huggies paper-based packaging is curbside recyclable. Their diapers' plastic packaging is recyclable at store drop-off locations in the U.S. Huggies Special Delivery Diapers are produced using 100% renewable electricity, and the brand has reduced greenhouse gases (GHG) by 61% from 2015-2021 in their U.S. manufacturing process. These diapers are also made with responsibly sourced materials, including Forest Stewardship CouncilÂ® (FSCÂ®) certified pulp. Kimberly-Clark, Huggies' parent company, has committed to having 75% of the materials in their products be biodegradable, recoverable, or recyclable by 2030. They are also committed to a 50% reduction in new, fossil fuel-based plastics by 2030 and ensuring all packaging is 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable by 2025.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Huggies has launched and partnered with several programs and non-profits to support babies' health and wellness, which indirectly impacts worker welfare by supporting the communities they live in. The brand helped found the National Diaper Bank Network in 2011, contributing over 200 million diapers to support children across the country. Huggies is a primary sponsor for Hand to HoldÂ®, a national nonprofit providing emotional support, education, and community to NICU parents, ensuring a healthy beginning for babies. Additionally, Huggies partners with the Association of Womenâs Health, Obstetric and Neonatal Nurses (AWHONN) to further womenâs and newbornsâ health research, education, and advocacy. This partnership includes advocating for equity and respectful care of pregnant women of color and supporting federal legislation addressing maternal and infant mortality.

sources: 1

Special K

 95 64

Environmental protection

Special K, as part of the Kellogg Company, is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts. The company has made significant strides in improving the sustainability of its packaging, with 97 percent of its timber-based packaging coming from either recycled or certified-sustainable content. In 2018, 65 percent of these materials were from recycled content, while the remainder came from verified sustainable sources. Kellogg Company has also committed to making all of its packaging reusable, recyclable, or compostable by the end of 2025. This commitment has already led to a reduction of 191 tonnes of packaging per year across several Kelloggâs Cereals brands, including Special K, Bran Flakes, and Frosties, in Europe. This reduction includes 142 tonnes of carton board, 35 tonnes of case weight, 10.7 tonnes of plastic liner, and 2 tonnes of plastic wrap. Additionally, these efforts have resulted in the use of 6,281 fewer pallets and 1,667 fewer trucks annually.

Furthermore, Kelloggâs has set ambitious targets for reducing energy use, greenhouse gas emissions, water use, and waste, while making its packaging resource-efficient. The company has committed to sourcing 100% renewable or âgreenâ electricity by 2050, supporting UN Sustainable Development Goal #13 to combat climate change. Kelloggâs European manufacturing facilities have seen a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by almost 13% since 2015, with specific facilities achieving significant reductions in energy use, greenhouse gas emissions, and water use. The company is also utilizing low carbon energy sources such as solar, wind, hydro, and cogeneration heat and power in its facilities to achieve its goal of 100% renewable energy by 2050.

sources: 1, 2

Six Flags

 95 59

Environmental protection

Six Flags is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on energy management, water conservation, and waste reduction. The company has made significant strides in adopting solar power, with installations at Six Flags Magic Mountain, Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, and Six Flags Great Adventure, contributing to a combined 42.37 megawatts of solar power systems. These efforts allow Six Flags Magic Mountain to offset 100% of its energy usage with solar power. Additionally, Six Flags has implemented water conservation measures by converting all restroom fixtures to contactless options and replacing paper towels with air dryers. In terms of waste management, Six Flags has established a closed-loop recycling program for used oil and solvents, partnered with Coca Cola for plastic and aluminum recycling, and transitioned to compostable dining products to reduce landfill waste. The company is also working with third-party experts to measure its carbon footprint and develop further waste, water, and energy reduction targets and initiatives.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Six Flags is committed to ensuring the welfare of its workers through various initiatives. The company emphasizes diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) by creating a Diversity & Inclusion council, developing a transparent hiring and promotion process, and conducting annual salary and wage analyses to ensure no significant disparity by race or gender. Six Flags also prioritizes worker safety with a best-in-class safety and security program, including ongoing training for critical situations such as active shooter drills and emergency disaster preparedness. Additionally, Six Flags supports the physical and mental health of its employees by maintaining health insurance benefits during the COVID-19 pandemic, offering a range of health insurance options, and providing an Employee Assistance Program for counseling services. The company also focuses on employee engagement and training & development, with annual compliance training on various subjects and a talent development program that includes partnerships with educational institutions for tuition discounts.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Six Flags actively supports the health and well-being of animals in its care at the Wild Safari at Six Flags Great Adventure and Six Flags Discovery Kingdom. The company abides by high standards of care, meeting or exceeding all industry standards related to animal welfare. Six Flags is a member of the Zoological Association of America (ZAA) and the Alliance of Marine Mammal Parks & Aquariums (AMMPA), and it complies with USDA inspection requirements. Six Flags Discovery Kingdom is also "Humane Certified" by American Humane. The company has established Animal Welfare Committees to continuously monitor and improve animal care. Six Flags is committed to the ethical treatment of animals through supply-chain and food-sourcing management, having successfully converted all egg products used in its operations to cage-free varieties and working towards converting egg-based ingredients to cage-free.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • "Humane Certified" by American Humane
  • Commitments
    • Target to convert 100% of the eggs in the supply-chain to "cage-free" varieties within 10 years (achieved ahead of schedule for whole eggs and substitutes, working on egg-based ingredients)

Whirlpool

 95 71

Environmental protection

Whirlpool Corporation has been proactive in its efforts to protect the environment, with a significant focus on reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across its operations. Since 2003, Whirlpool has been committed to reducing emissions, aiming to achieve Net Zero emissions in its plants and operations by 2030. This ambitious goal encompasses all large manufacturing sites and distribution centers worldwide, targeting both direct (Scope 1) and power-related (Scope 2) emissions. To reduce GHG emissions, Whirlpool has implemented several strategies, including energy use reduction through World Class Manufacturing efficiency projects and facility retrofits, expanding the use of renewable energy to neutralize Scope 2 emissions, electrifying or substituting fossil fuels with alternatives like hydrogen or bio-gas, and investing in carbon offset credits to balance unavoidable emissions. In 2023, Whirlpool reported a significant reduction in total GHG emissions, demonstrating progress towards their Net Zero goal. Additionally, the company has made strides in resource management, with investments in wind and solar energy projects to cover 100% of its U.S. sites' electrical consumption with renewable energy. Whirlpool also focuses on water recirculation and has achieved Zero Waste to Landfill (ZWtL) status, further contributing to its environmental sustainability efforts.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Zero Waste to Landfill Gold or Platinum levels
  • Commitments
    • Net Zero emissions in plants and operations by 2030
    • 100% renewable energy for electricity consumption
    • 97% diversion from landfill (above ZWtL Gold status level)

Chevrolet

 95 59

Environmental protection

General Motors (GM), the parent company of Chevrolet, is actively working towards environmental sustainability with a focus on achieving carbon neutrality in its global products and operations by 2040. GM has made significant strides in reducing emissions and promoting renewable energy. The company has secured agreements to power 100% of its U.S. sites with renewable energy by 2025, a goal achieved 25 years ahead of its initial target. This commitment is part of GM's broader strategy to reduce its environmental footprint and transition towards a more sustainable future. Additionally, GM has opened its first Ultium Cells battery cell plant in Ohio, with more plants scheduled to open in Tennessee in 2023 and Michigan in 2024, emphasizing its shift towards electric vehicles (EVs) and sustainable energy sources. GM's efforts also include joining the First Movers Coalition, committing to low-carbon steel, aluminum, concrete, and cement, which further demonstrates its dedication to reducing emissions and supporting a net-zero transition. These initiatives are part of GM's broader strategy to innovate and lead in the transition to a sustainable, all-electric future.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

General Motors has demonstrated a commitment to social responsibility by providing $60 million in grants to more than 400 U.S.-based nonprofits. These grants are aimed at creating inclusive solutions to social issues, including education, road safety, community enrichment, and climate initiatives. This initiative reflects GM's broader aspiration to make the company the most inclusive in the world, focusing on diversity, equity, inclusion, and the protection of human rights. By fostering supplier relationships and supporting communities, GM is working towards a more equitable and inclusive future for all stakeholders.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • ENERGY STAR Sustained Excellence Award
  • Commitments
    • Achieve carbon neutrality in global products and operations by 2040
    • Power 100% of U.S. sites with renewable energy by 2025
    • Divert more than 90% of total operational waste from landfills, incinerators, and energy recovery facilities by 2022

Irish Spring

 95 59

Nothing found

Air Wick

 95 63

Environmental protection

Air Wick has taken significant steps towards sustainability, particularly with its Botanica by Air Wick range. This range is a testament to their commitment to reducing their environmental footprint through the use of more natural, responsibly sourced ingredients and sustainable packaging. Air Wick collaborates with fragrance house suppliers to responsibly source natural fragrances, ensuring that all suppliers conform to RB's ingredients policy. This policy includes stipulations against the use of dyes, animal testing on final products, and mandates responsibly sourced natural ingredients. Additionally, Air Wick supports sustainable farming practices globally, which benefits both nature and the farming community.

The company has also focused on the recyclability of its products. Air Wick has redesigned its packaging with sustainability and recyclability in mind, ensuring that all products are recyclable. They provide clear instructions on packaging to guide consumers on how to responsibly dispose of products. For example, electrical components are directed to Waste and Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) recycling centers, while glass products can be recycled through regular glass recycling channels.

Moreover, Air Wick has committed to using recycled materials in its products. The Botanica range features packaging with significant percentages of post-consumer recycled (PCR) materials, such as 65% PCR in cardboard boxes and up to 99% PCR in PET bottles. The company has also reduced the amount of plastic used in packaging and increased the use of PCR materials, adhering to safety and quality requirements.

In addition to these efforts, Air Wick's cardboard packaging and reeds are Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) certified, ensuring they meet the highest environmental and social standards and are sourced from well-managed forests. The Botanica candles are made with Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) Certified palm wax, replacing traditional paraffin wax content and supporting sustainable palm oil production. Lastly, Air Wick has introduced plant-based solvents in its products to reduce the use of traditional solvents, furthering its commitment to environmental protection.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Air Wick has made a clear commitment to animal welfare by ensuring that there is no animal testing on the final products of its Botanica range. This stance is part of their broader sustainability and ethical sourcing efforts, demonstrating a commitment to not only environmental sustainability but also ethical considerations in product development.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Forest Stewardship Council (FSC)
    • Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO)
  • Commitments
    • Commitment to plant 1 billion square feet of wildflower habitat in the Northern Great Plains over the next 3 years.
    • Pledge to restore 20 million square feet of wildflower habitats in the UK as part of a three-year plan, running from 2021-2023.

Progressive

 95 50

Environmental protection

Progressive is actively working to reduce its environmental footprint and operate more efficiently, aligning with its core values and enhancing resilience. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its dependence on natural resources and minimize its environmental impact. Progressive's Real Estate and Corporate Services team leads efforts to manage buildings, equipment, and fleet in an environmentally responsible manner. The company has committed to achieving carbon neutrality for Scope 1 and 2 emissions by the end of 2025, setting a path towards net-zero emissions in the following decade. To reach this goal, Progressive is investing in renewable energy sources, exploring fuel-efficient vehicle alternatives, and focusing on efficiency and conservation opportunities within its commercial real estate portfolio. Notably, Progressive completed construction on a 1.8-megawatt solar array at a main campus location, which went live in January 2023, and entered a renewable energy agreement with a wind farm in Pennsylvania to significantly reduce its electricity-related carbon emissions. The company has also made strides in reducing its carbon emissions per million policies in force (PIFs), surpassing its goal of a 68% reduction compared to 2008 levels by 2021. Additionally, Progressive is committed to responsible waste management, with recycling programs in place and efforts to reduce waste sent to landfills. For Earth Day 2022, Progressive partnered with a local organization to promote responsible resource consumption and recycling.

sources: 1

  • Commitments

    • Setting a path towards net-zero emissions in the following decade

Corona Light

 95 45

Environmental protection

Corona Light, as part of its sustainability efforts, has taken significant steps towards reducing its environmental impact, particularly in terms of plastic usage. The brand has achieved a net-zero plastic footprint, meaning it recovers and recycles as much or more plastic than it uses globally. This initiative prevents plastic from polluting natural paradises. To accomplish this, Corona has partnered with South Pole, a climate solutions provider, to measure the plastic used in its products and distribution and to calculate the impact of its mitigation activities. One of these activities includes a major investment in Mexico Recicla, a recycling facility in Mexico, allowing Corona to recover more plastic than it uses. Additionally, the brand has removed plastic rings from all of its exported cans and eliminated plastic from its pressure-sensitive labels, reducing its footprint by 50,000 pounds. Since 2017, in collaboration with Corona X Parley, the brand has cleaned up 44,026,625 square meters of beach. Corona also invests in recycling programs in Mexico to recover and recycle plastic before it reaches oceans and waterways. Furthermore, the brand has launched the Plastic Free Challenge, an accelerator program aimed at finding solutions for pressing environmental and social challenges.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Achieved a net-zero plastic footprint
    • Removed plastic rings from all exported cans
    • Eliminated plastic from pressure-sensitive labels, reducing footprint by 50,000 pounds
    • Cleaned up 44,026,625 square meters of beach since 2017 in collaboration with Corona X Parley
    • Invests in recycling programs to recover and recycle plastic before it reaches oceans and waterways
    • Launched the Plastic Free Challenge, an accelerator program for environmental and social solutions

Heinz Mustard

 95 68

Environmental protection

Heinz is actively engaged in various sustainability initiatives aimed at environmental protection. The company has set a goal to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050 and is on track to have 100% of Heinz Ketchup tomatoes sustainably sourced by 2025. Heinz's approach to sustainability includes practices such as ensuring that their tomato fields are located close to their facilities to reduce carbon footprint, composting leftover vines and leaves from harvesting back into the soil, and upcycling leftover skins and seeds into pet food or livestock feed. Additionally, Heinz is involved in agricultural development projects worldwide to teach conservation farming practices. The company is also future-proofing its tomatoes by testing new sustainable practices and creating new tomato varieties at its research farm. In terms of packaging, Heinz is innovating to make all packaging 100% recyclable, reusable, or compostable and aims to reduce landfill intensity by 20% by 2025. They have an ambitious goal to create a fully circular Heinz Tomato Ketchup bottle by 2025 in Europe. Water conservation is another key focus, with Heinz developing smarter systems to protect, conserve, and optimize water use, aiming to reduce water use intensity by 15% across manufacturing facilities and by 20% in high-risk watershed areas by 2025. The company is also working towards reducing overall energy use by 15% and procuring the majority of its electricity from renewable resources by 2025. Lastly, Heinz is committed to waste reduction, having already diverted 90% of its solid waste to recycling or byproducts usage.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

John Deere

 95 67

Environmental protection

John Deere is actively working on environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing emissions, enhancing energy efficiency, and promoting sustainable agriculture. The company has achieved a 15% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from a fiscal year 2021 baseline. It has also launched four electric turf and compact utility products, along with two hybrid-electric turf and compact utility products, and revealed two hybrid-electric (E-Drive) X-Tier Loaders. These efforts are part of John Deere's broader strategy to develop sustainable products, including participating in pilot programs for renewable diesel production and launching an ethanol-burning 9-liter engine concept. Additionally, John Deere has implemented projects to reduce nearly 1,200 metric tons of CO2e annually and has engaged 65% of its key suppliers by spend in measuring and publicly reporting certain categories of their emissions. These actions demonstrate John Deere's commitment to environmental stewardship and its efforts to minimize its environmental footprint.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

John Deere is committed to enhancing worker welfare through a multiyear people-focused strategy that includes upskilling, apprenticeship programs, leadership accelerator programs, and development events. The company has introduced a DEI Global Advisory Board to drive impact and accountability and held an Employee Resource Group (ERG) Leadership summit. Additionally, John Deere has introduced innovative new employee safety programs. These initiatives are part of John Deere's broader efforts to build a global talent pipeline and ensure a diverse and inclusive workforce. The company's commitment to worker welfare is further demonstrated by its support of STEM education for youth in communities, with nearly four million hours dedicated to this cause.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

    • Launch of electric and hybrid-electric products
    • Implementation of projects to reduce nearly 1,200 metric tons of CO2e annually
    • Engagement of 65% of key suppliers by spend in measuring and publicly reporting certain emissions categories

Philips

 95 65

Environmental protection

Philips is actively working to minimize its impact on the environment through various initiatives aimed at climate action, transitioning to a circular economy, implementing EcoDesign in their products, and collaborating with suppliers to reduce their environmental footprint. The company has set ambitious goals to mitigate climate change and promote responsible use of energy and materials, aligning its efforts with UN Sustainable Development Goals 12 and 13. Philips is committed to reducing CO2 emissions across its value chain, maximizing the lifetime value of its products while minimizing the use of new materials, and eliminating waste through innovative service models, smart digital solutions, and product take-back, refurbishment, and recycling programs. EcoDesign principles are embedded in Philips' innovation processes, addressing product development aspects including recyclability and chemicals management. Additionally, Philips aims to reduce the environmental footprint of its supply chain in line with a 1.5 Â°C global warming scenario and publishes an Environmental Profit & Loss account annually to highlight environmental hotspots and drive innovation towards reducing impact. The company also plans to embed circular practices at its sites and achieve zero used materials sent to landfill by 2025.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Philips aims to deliver social impact by improving people's health and well-being, offering the best place to work, and engaging with suppliers and communities where it operates. The company is dedicated to conducting its business in an environmentally and socially responsible manner, focusing on developing meaningful technology that optimizes healthcare delivery and meets society's needs. Philips invests in its employees, ensuring their well-being at work, and implements practices that assure business integrity and accountability. However, specific programs or initiatives related to living wage, community building activities, fair trade certification, or women's rights programs were not detailed in the provided context.

sources: 1, 3

McCormick

 95 77

Environmental protection

McCormick is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on sustainable sourcing, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, sustainable packaging, and water use reduction. The company has committed to achieving Net Zero by 2050 and has set science-based targets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in line with limiting climate warming to 1.5Â°C by 2030. These efforts include a 42% absolute reduction in greenhouse gas emissions (Scope 1 & 2) from their facilities and a 42% absolute reduction in greenhouse gas emissions (including packaging) (Scope 3) by 2030. Additionally, McCormick aims for a 25% reduction in water use from their facilities and 85% recycling and recovery of solid waste from their facilities by 2030. They also plan to ensure 100% of their plastic packaging can be reused, recycled, or repurposed by 2030. McCormick's commitment to sustainable agriculture and value chain engagement is part of their strategy to achieve these environmental goals.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

McCormick is dedicated to ensuring the welfare of its workers through various initiatives and goals set for 2025. The company aims to have women in 50% of leadership positions globally and ethnically diverse talent (EDT) in 30% of leadership positions in the U.S. They are also working towards having 95% of MySuccess connected exempt employees globally with active development goals in the HR system. Additionally, McCormick seeks a 50% increase in the number of McCormick Science Institute citations in professional literature and ensures that 100% of employees have access to health & wellbeing programs. Furthermore, 90% of their sales are expected to come from products that enable health, nutrition, or natural consumer choices, highlighting their commitment to both employee welfare and consumer health.

sources: 1, 2

Neutrogena

 94 65

Environmental protection

Neutrogena has taken several steps to protect the environment and promote sustainability in its operations and products. The company has launched its Responsible Palm Oil Sourcing Criteria and is working with leading suppliers, representing nearly 85% of its palm oil derivatives supply, to implement these criteria. Neutrogena aims to fully implement its sourcing criteria by the end of 2020. Additionally, Neutrogena encourages recycling through its Care To RecycleÂ® initiative, providing ideas for DIY projects using leftover product containers and guidance on recycling beauty products. The company also focuses on reducing waste and using sustainable materials through its EARTHWARDSÂ® Approach, with a goal for EARTHWARDSÂ®-recognized products to reflect 20 percent of Johnson & Johnson revenue by 2020. Furthermore, Neutrogena assesses the environmental impact of its products on aquatic ecosystems through the Global Aquatic Ingredient Assessment (GAIA), ensuring that ingredients are gentle on the environment after use.

Coors Light

 94 41

Environmental protection

Coors Light, under the umbrella of Molson Coors, has made significant strides in environmental sustainability, focusing on packaging, water usage, and climate impact. The company has committed to ensuring that by 2025, all consumer-facing packaging will be 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable, with all plastic packaging comprising at least 30% recycled content. A notable initiative is the replacement of plastic rings with 100% recyclable six-pack rings across Molson Coorsâ North American brands, positioning Coors Light as the largest beer brand in North America to undertake such an initiative. This move is expected to eliminate 1.7 million pounds of plastic from the environment annually, with 400,000 pounds from Coors Light packaging alone.

In terms of water conservation, Coors Light aims to grow barley with 10% less water and brew beer with 22% less water by 2025 compared to 2016 levels. Additionally, the company is working to boost water availability in stressed watersheds and restore 3.5 billion gallons of water. Coors Light is also committed to reducing CO2 emissions by 50% in direct operations and 20% across the value chain by 2025 relative to 2016 levels.

The company has also opened a pop-up plastic-free concept store made from 100% sustainable materials, including brewery scraps, to celebrate its commitment to a plastic-free future. This initiative underscores Coors Light's broader environmental goals and its vision for a world free from single-use plastic.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

    • Nothing found

    • Replace all plastic rings with 100% recyclable six-pack rings across Molson Coorsâ North American brands by 2025

    • Brew beer with 22% less water by 2025 compared to 2016 levels

GMC

 94 55

Environmental protection

General Motors (GM) is actively working towards an environmentally sustainable future with a focus on reducing carbon emissions and advancing renewable energy usage. The company has set a bold goal to make its global products and operations carbon neutral by 2040. This includes plans to eliminate tailpipe emissions from new US light-duty vehicles by 2035. GM has also secured sufficient renewable energy to power 100% of its U.S. sites by 2025, with a global target set for 2035. These efforts are part of GM's broader strategy to transition to a zero-emissions, all-electric future, aligning with science-based climate actions. The company's commitment to environmental sustainability is further demonstrated by its receipt of the ENERGY STAR Sustained Excellence Award for the 11th consecutive year, highlighting its ongoing efforts to reduce energy consumption and environmental impact.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

General Motors has demonstrated a commitment to social responsibility, particularly in terms of worker welfare and community support. The company has provided $60M in grants to more than 400 U.S.-based nonprofits aimed at creating inclusive solutions to social issues. This philanthropic effort indicates GM's dedication to supporting communities and addressing social challenges, which indirectly contributes to worker welfare by fostering a more inclusive and supportive society. Additionally, GM's aspiration to be the most inclusive company in the world, as stated in their sustainability report, suggests a focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion within their workforce, although specific programs or initiatives directly related to worker welfare were not detailed in the provided context.

Budweiser

 94 43

Environmental protection

Budweiser, under its parent company Anheuser-Busch, has committed to a series of ambitious environmental sustainability goals aimed at reducing its environmental impact and promoting a more sustainable future. The company focuses on four key areas across its supply chain: sustainable agriculture, water stewardship, renewable electricity and carbon reduction, and circular packaging. By 2025, Anheuser-Busch aims to ensure that 100% of its direct farmers are highly skilled, connected, and financially empowered. In terms of water stewardship, the company is committed to engaging all its facilities in water efficiency efforts and improving water availability and quality in high-stress communities. Anheuser-Busch has also achieved its goal of brewing its products with 100% renewable electricity and aims to source all its purchased electricity from renewable sources by 2025. Additionally, the company is working towards reducing CO2 emissions across its value chain by 25% and ensuring that all its packaging is made from majority recycled content or is returnable by the same year. Beyond these goals, Anheuser-Busch has set a global ambition to achieve net-zero emissions by 2040, demonstrating its commitment to environmental sustainability and the health of the planet.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts

 94 57

Environmental protection

Walt Disney Parks and Resorts is actively engaged in various environmental sustainability efforts aimed at reducing emissions, conserving water, minimizing waste, and sourcing lower impact products. The company has embarked on the development of new solar facilities to increase its renewable energy consumption to nearly 40% of its annual total power use. Water conservation measures and the use of reclaimed water are in place to reduce potable water consumption. Efforts to reduce waste include eliminating single-use plastic straws and stirrers globally, resulting in a significant reduction of waste, and sending organic waste to composting facilities. Disney has also redesigned its Core Classic dolls to feature 100% recyclable, sustainably sourced paper packaging. The company is committed to building sustainably, with new projects designed to minimize waste, water, and energy use. Additionally, Disney invests in nature-based climate solutions to reduce the impact of climate change. The company has set ambitious 2030 environmental goals, including achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions, sourcing sustainable seafood, and achieving zero waste to landfill for its wholly owned and operated parks, resorts, and cruise line.

Holiday Inn Express

 94 59

Environmental protection

Holiday Inn Express & Suites Morgan Hill is actively engaged in environmental protection through various sustainability initiatives. The hotel has partnered with Clean the World to recycle soaps and bottled amenities from guest rooms, distributing them to children and families globally to prevent the spread of diseases. Their commitment to a cleaner world is further demonstrated by their use of organic carpet cleaning methods, biodegradable breakfast wares, green-friendly cleaning supplies, and energy-efficient practices. These include digitally controlled thermostats in guest rooms, common area and staff lighting on timers, recycling programs for bottles, cans, newspapers, and cardboard, as well as energy-efficient CFL lighting. The hotel also promotes a linen and towel reuse program, has recycling bins in rooms and at the Breakfast Bar, and practices electronic sales kits and registration cards to minimize paper use. Additionally, the IHG Green Engage system is utilized across all IHG hotels, including Holiday Inn Express & Suites, to measure and manage their environmental impact. This system offers over 200 'Green Solutions' to help hotels reduce their energy, water, and waste, aiming for up to 25% reduction in energy use for hotels achieving Level 3 certification or above.

sources: 1, 2, 3
