Marriott

 94 65

Environmental protection

Marriott International has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives and goals aimed at reducing its environmental impact. The company has committed to setting a science-based target to reach net-zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by no later than 2050. This commitment is part of Marriott's broader sustainability and social impact platform, Serve 360: Doing Good in Every Direction, which aligns with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Additionally, Marriott aims to locally source 50 percent of produce by 2025 and has achieved LEED Gold Core and Shell Certification for its new global corporate headquarters, which includes energy-efficient features and electric vehicle charging stations. The company also supports sustainable meeting practices, such as reducing food waste, using compostable packaging for boxed lunches, and providing water stations to minimize single-use plastics. These efforts are part of Marriott's 2025 Sustainability and Social Impact Goals, which also include cutting food waste in half, having 100 percent of the portfolio sustainably certified, responsibly sourcing 95 percent of its top 10 priority categories, and reducing overall waste to landfill by 45 percent.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Marriott International is actively working to ensure worker welfare through various initiatives focused on employment and underemployment issues, diversity, and inclusion. The company has announced an accelerated goal to achieve global gender parity in executive positions by 2023, two years ahead of the original goal, and established a new goal to achieve 25 percent people of color in executive positions in the U.S. by 2025. Marriott has also established the Marriott-Sorenson Center for Hospitality Leadership with The J. Willard and Alice S. Marriott Foundation and Howard University to build a pipeline of diverse talent in the hospitality industry. Furthermore, Marriott has launched the next iteration of its human trafficking awareness training, aiming to train 100% of on-property associates to recognize and respond to potential situations of human trafficking by 2025. The company's commitment to worker welfare is also evident in its support for associates and their families affected by the war in Ukraine, providing over $3 million in hotel-level financial and in-kind support.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • LEED Gold Core and Shell Certification

  • Commitments

    • Commitment to set a science-based target and reach net-zero GHG emissions by no later than 2050
    • Goal to achieve global gender parity in executive positions by 2023
    • Goal to achieve 25 percent people of color in executive positions in the U.S. by 2025
    • 2025 goal to train 100% of on-property associates on human trafficking awareness
    • Aim to locally source 50 percent of produce by 2025
    • Goal to have 100 percent of the portfolio sustainably certified by 2025
    • Goal to responsibly source 95 percent of top 10 priority categories by 2025

I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!

 94 44

Environmental protection

I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! has taken steps towards environmental sustainability by sourcing sustainable palm oil. They are a proud member of the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) and commit to buying 100% physically sustainable and traceable palm and palm kernel oil. This effort is part of their broader commitment to reduce the environmental impact of their products by ensuring the ingredients they use are sourced responsibly. Additionally, all of their plastic tubs, lids, and spray bottles are recyclable, encouraging consumers to participate in recycling programs to minimize waste.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! offers a Vegan Spread that is Certified Plant-Based by the Plant Based Food Association. This certification ensures that the product contains no animal or animal-derived ingredients, catering to consumers who prioritize animal welfare in their dietary choices. The Vegan Spread is also dairy-free, providing an alternative for those who avoid dairy products for ethical or health reasons.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Certified Plant-Based by the Plant Based Food Association
    • Kosher certification for all products
  • Commitments
    • Commitment to sourcing 100% physically sustainable and traceable palm and palm kernel oil

Red Robin

 94 58

Environmental protection

Red Robin has implemented several initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact. The company has focused on becoming better stewards of the planet through strategies that include recycling programs at their home office and the installation of energy-efficient LED lighting in their company-owned restaurants. Additionally, Red Robin emphasizes the importance of sourcing high-quality ingredients for their Gourmet Burgers and food, ensuring that their meat and produce suppliers adhere to the highest industry standards for humane farming. This approach not only prioritizes the quality of the food served but also the environmental and ethical implications of their sourcing practices. Furthermore, Red Robin has built relationships with suppliers who share their commitment to protecting the environment and its people, asking them to contribute to these efforts as well.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Red Robin demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare and community support through various programs and initiatives. The company engages in grassroots fundraising for organizations such as the Red Robin Foundation, American Cancer Society, and Denver Kids, thereby supporting the communities around them. Additionally, Red Robin fosters an inclusive and supportive work environment by offering a Womenâs Excellence program designed to support and inspire all team members. The company also partners with the Womenâs Foodservice Forum to advance and support female leaders within the organization. Moreover, Red Robin has created focus groups on social and economic inequality to promote empathy and growth among its employees, further emphasizing its dedication to creating a welcoming and supportive atmosphere for everyone.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Red Robin is committed to animal welfare through its sourcing practices. The company ensures that the meat and produce supplied to them are obtained using the highest industry standards for humane farming. This commitment is part of Red Robin's broader environmental stewardship efforts, which include prioritizing high-quality ingredients that customers love while also considering the ethical implications of their sourcing decisions. By focusing on humane farming practices, Red Robin aims to promote the health and welfare of animals used in their products.

Liberty Mutual

 94 49

Environmental protection

Liberty Mutual has demonstrated a commitment to environmental protection through significant investments in renewable energy and a strategic shift towards more sustainable energy sources. The company has invested over $1.25 billion in renewable energy projects, including wind, solar, and hydropower, as well as sustainable forestry initiatives globally. This investment reflects a broader commitment to reducing reliance on fossil fuels, with Liberty Mutual reducing its future investment commitments to fossil fuels by more than 50 percent. Additionally, the company is investing in solar projects in the U.S. that, once completed, are expected to significantly reduce annual CO2 emissions, equivalent to approximately 400 million gallons of gasoline. The Liberty Mutual Climate Transition Center further underscores the company's dedication to addressing climate change by advancing the understanding of climate-related risks and promoting resilience through research, data, and cross-industry partnerships.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Liberty Mutual is actively engaged in initiatives that promote worker welfare and community support. The company has made significant philanthropic contributions, including a $5 million grant aimed at reducing youth homelessness in the greater Boston area. Liberty Mutual's commitment to diversity and inclusion is evident in its efforts to create an inclusive workplace and its recognition on various lists, including PEOPLE magazineâs â50 Companies That Care,â Fortune magazineâs âBest Workplaces for Diversity,â and Forbes magazineâs âBest Employers for Women.â The company also emphasizes the importance of insurance as a social good, underscoring its belief in the positive societal impact of its services. Furthermore, Liberty Mutual has invested in making public spaces more accessible to people with disabilities, exemplified by the openings of Liberty Playground in Plano, Texas, and Thomas M. Menino Park in Boston, Massachusetts.

Land O'Lakes

 94 72

Environmental protection

Land O'Lakes has demonstrated a commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and enhancing sustainability. The company has launched a transformational carbon program, with Truterra's inaugural carbon offset program sequestering nearly 200,000 metric tons of carbon and returning nearly $4 million to farmers. This initiative is part of a broader effort to engage in carbon offsetting, with more programs planned for the future. Additionally, Land O'Lakes has introduced the Dairy 2025 Commitment, aimed at helping its 1,600 member-owners reduce their environmental footprint. Since the program's launch, nearly 70% of the company's milk supply has completed the initial assessment, marking a significant step towards environmental sustainability. Furthermore, Land O'Lakes has set ambitious environmental goals, including reaching net zero emissions by 2050 across Scopes 1, 2, and 3, using 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable consumer packaging by 2030, and reducing waste to landfill by 50% by 2030. These efforts underscore the company's dedication to driving impact for communities and the planet for a better tomorrow.

Chipotle Mexican Grill

 94 57

Environmental protection

Chipotle Mexican Grill has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and reduce its carbon footprint. In 2022, the company achieved a 13% reduction in its direct greenhouse gas emissions, demonstrating a commitment to lowering its environmental impact. Additionally, Chipotle sources 40% of its electricity from renewable sources, further contributing to its sustainability efforts. The company has also established a food donation program called the "Harvest Program," in which 100% of its new restaurant openings participated, showcasing its dedication to minimizing food waste. Furthermore, Chipotle has set up and maintained a composting program in 32% of its restaurants and achieved a 49% landfill diversion rate, indicating a significant effort towards waste reduction. The company has also reduced approximately 65,000 MWh of energy through its energy management systems, highlighting its commitment to energy efficiency. Chipotle has set ambitious environmental goals, including a 50% reduction in Scope 1, 2, & 3 greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and a 5% reduction in waste to landfill by 2025, based on a 2020 waste baseline. These initiatives and commitments reflect Chipotle's ongoing efforts to cultivate a better world through environmental protection.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Chipotle Mexican Grill places a strong emphasis on worker welfare, as evidenced by its numerous initiatives and achievements in this area. In 2022, the company promoted over 22,000 of its employees internally, demonstrating its commitment to career development and growth opportunities for its workforce. Additionally, Chipotle donated over 282,000 meals to those in need within its communities, showcasing its dedication to giving back and supporting the well-being of both its employees and the wider community. The company also awarded $37 million in bonuses and $14 million in tuition assistance to more than 4,800 employees, further highlighting its investment in its employees' futures. Furthermore, Chipotle raised $4.3 million through its Round Up for Real Change program and maintained an average hourly wage of $16, indicating its commitment to fair compensation. Chipotle's efforts to launch Emerging Leader and Mentoring programs, as well as its partnership with Guild to provide debt-free degrees and relevant certificates, underscore its dedication to developing and supporting its employees. These initiatives reflect Chipotle's people-first approach and its purpose of cultivating a better world by investing in its employees' welfare and future.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Chipotle Mexican Grill is committed to promoting animal welfare through its sourcing practices and certifications. In 2022, the company purchased 232 million pounds of animal welfare-certified pork, chicken, and beef, ensuring that the animals were treated humanely from birth to slaughter. Chipotle also achieved its goal of sourcing 100% American Humane certified chicken in the United States, demonstrating its commitment to high animal welfare standards. The company's Food with Integrity (FWI) commitment requires suppliers to follow a Supplier Code of Conduct, which includes provisions for responsibly raised meats. This means that all animals must be treated humanely, fed a vegetarian diet, and never given added hormones or sub-therapeutic antibiotics. Additionally, 100% of the milk in Chipotle's sour cream, cheese, and queso comes from cows that have never been treated with rBGH (Recombinant Bovine Growth Hormone). These practices and certifications reflect Chipotle's dedication to animal welfare and its commitment to sourcing ingredients that are produced in a responsible and ethical manner.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • American Humane certification for chicken

  • Commitments

    • 50% reduction in Scope 1, 2, & 3 greenhouse gas emissions by 2030
    • Identify key biodiversity hotspots throughout operation by 2025
    • 5% reduction in waste to landfill by 2025

Land O Lakes (butter)

 94 67

Environmental protection

Land O'Lakes, Inc. has made significant strides in environmental protection through its Dairy 2025 commitments and various sustainability initiatives. The company has launched a large-scale measurement project aimed at collecting on-farm sustainability data from over 1,600 farms across the United States. This project is notable for being the largest of its kind in the U.S. dairy industry, aiming to gather more than 250 data points per farm. The collected data focuses on key environmental aspects such as fuel, electricity, and water usage, nutrient application, crop rotation, and manure management. This initiative is part of Land O'Lakes' broader effort to measure and improve the sustainability footprint of its member-owners' farms, thereby supporting the company's and its customers' sustainability goals. Additionally, Land O'Lakes has partnered with Bel Brands and The Hershey Company on projects that promote sustainable agricultural practices, such as the increased use of cover crops, and implement best management practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve water quality in various regions, including the Chesapeake Bay.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • U.S. Dairy Stewardship Commitment
    • National Dairy Farmers Assuring Responsible Management (FARM) program
  • Commitments
    • Complete an on-farm sustainability assessment on all member dairy farms by 2025
    • Collect on-farm sustainability data across more than 1,600 farms to support environmental footprint reduction efforts

Hard Rock Cafe

 94 58

Environmental protection

Hard Rock International and Seminole Gaming are actively engaged in environmental sustainability efforts aimed at waste, energy, and water management. They have implemented efficiency technologies across 83% of their properties, including auto-sensors, reduced flow faucets, two-flow toilets, and efficient laundry machines. Their waste management practices have seen significant improvements, with 83% of properties tracking or weighing waste, 33% tracking diverted waste, and 83% repurposing amenities and soap. Additionally, 67% of properties separate food waste, and 50% donate to charitable organizations to combat food waste. In partnership with the World Wildlife Fund (WWF), Hard Rock and Seminole Gaming participate in Earth Hour annually, turning off lights to raise awareness for climate change, with 114 properties participating and saving over 603,000 KW to date. They have also contributed to the Clean the World Foundation by sending 350,000 bars of unused soap and participating in the Hospitality Recycling program, diverting 13,660 pounds of plastic waste. Their efforts extend to designing casino-hotel properties to meet or exceed energy codes and expanding energy-efficient technologies. A digital Practice Library has been developed to share best practices globally, including short case studies on various initiatives to promote sustainability efforts collaboratively.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Hard Rock International and Seminole Gaming have established a comprehensive approach to worker welfare, focusing on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), and supporting team members across various demographics. They have invested $26 million annually in purchases from Minority Business Enterprise, Women Business Enterprise, Veteran Business Enterprise, and Disabled Business Enterprise to support indigenous-owned and local disadvantaged businesses. The Seminole & Hard Rock Women in Leadership program aims to increase women's representation in leadership roles, with women in director and vice president roles exceeding the industry standard. A Tribal Career Development Program is available for Seminole Tribal Members to build business skills and leadership capabilities. Additionally, 11 Team Member Resource Groups (TMRGs) foster a sense of belonging and inclusion, covering a wide range of interests and identities. Hard Rock and Seminole Gaming have been recognized by Forbes in various categories, including The Best Employers for New Grads, The Best Employers for Women, The Best Employers for Diversity, and more, highlighting their commitment to being an employer of choice for diverse talent.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Disney Store

 94 53

Environmental protection

The Walt Disney Company has implemented a comprehensive strategy to enhance environmental sustainability across its operations. This includes significant efforts in emissions reduction, water conservation, waste reduction, and the development of lower impact products. Disney has committed to increasing its renewable energy consumption to nearly 40% of its annual total power use at Walt Disney World Resort through the development of new solar facilities. The company has also focused on water conservation by utilizing reclaimed water and implementing sophisticated irrigation systems at Disneyland Resort. In terms of waste reduction, Disney has eliminated single-use plastic straws and stirrers globally, diverting over 175 million straws and 13 million stirrers annually from landfills. Additionally, Disney has redesigned its Core Classic dolls to feature 100% recyclable, plastic-free packaging. The company is also committed to building sustainably, establishing rigorous internal Sustainable Design Standards aligned with its 2030 goals. Disney's commitment to environmental stewardship is further demonstrated through its investments in nature-based climate solutions, which contribute to habitat preservation and climate change mitigation. The company has set ambitious 2030 environmental goals, including achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions, implementing localized watershed stewardship strategies, achieving zero waste to landfill for its parks, resorts, and cruise line, and sourcing lower impact products.

Sprint

 94 46

Environmental protection

Sprint has made significant strides in environmental protection by committing to source 100% renewable electricity across all its operations, including retail stores, offices, call centers, and network sites by 2025. This initiative is part of Sprint's broader commitment to become 100% carbon neutral by the same year. To achieve this, Sprint is focusing on reducing its overall energy consumption and investing in alternative energy sources to offset carbon emissions. Notable projects include the implementation of energy efficiency measures such as intelligent systems at its headquarters, which have reduced energy consumption by 6%, and intelligent thermostats in retail locations, leading to a 10-14% reduction in energy consumption. Additionally, Sprint has entered into two 12-year virtual power purchase agreements (VPPAs) with Duke Energy Renewables and an aggregation agreement with Apple, eBay, and Samsung for renewable energy from Apex Clean Energy's White Mesa Wind Project, which will offset 30% of Sprint's CO2 emissions by 2021. The company is also exploring further investments in renewable and alternative energy, including converting electric accounts in parts of Virginia to clean solar power.

sources: 1

Nothing found

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

    • Divert 50% of operational waste from landfills by 2025
    • Reuse or recycle 100% of electronic waste
    • Become 100% carbon neutral by 2025

Purell

 94 67

Environmental protection

GOJO Industries, the maker of Purell, has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental sustainability through various initiatives and goals. They have focused on reducing chemicals of concern in their products by 20% by 2030 and ensuring that at least 75% of their global sales come from third-party certified products by the same year. Their efforts also include reducing enterprise solid waste intensity by 50% and virgin plastic intensity in primary packaging by 30% by 2030. Additionally, they aim to ensure 100% of their primary packaging is recyclable, reusable, or industrially compostable by 2030. GOJO has committed to setting a 1.5Â° C aligned short-term and net-zero Science-Based Target approved by SBTi by 2024, sourcing 100% corrugated board as recycled or certified by SFI or FSC, and sourcing 100% of palm-derived ingredients as RSPO Mass Balance certified by 2030. They have also been recognized for their environmental leadership, including powering their facilities and sourcing materials responsibly, focusing on recyclable design, and achieving Cradle to Cradle CertifiedÂ® Gold status for many of their formulations.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

GOJO Industries has set ambitious goals to enhance worker welfare by 2025 and 2030. These include ensuring diversity (gender and ethnicity) of GOJO hiring and promotion is consistent with community diversity and the customers they serve. They aim to exceed 75% sentiment on GOJO engagement survey questions related to opportunities for growth/advancement and feeling of belonging, and exceed a 75% internal placement rate for all filled leadership roles at GOJO by 2025. By 2030, they strive to maintain these achievements and further enhance team member well-being, including achieving an OSHA recordable incident rate below 1.0. These goals reflect GOJO's commitment to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace that promotes team member growth, development, and well-being.

sources: 1, 2

Rice Krispies Treats

 94 63

Environmental protection

Rice Krispies Treats, through its parent company Kellogg Company, is actively working to reduce the environmental impact of rice production, which is known to be responsible for up to 12% of global methane emissions. The company has launched Kelloggâs Ingrainedâ¢, a $2 million, five-year initiative in collaboration with Walmart, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the Lower Mississippi River Basin. This program focuses on rewarding rice farmers for reducing their greenhouse gas emissions and provides them with training in irrigation management, nutrient management, and soil health. These efforts are designed to help farmers adopt more environmentally friendly practices. Additionally, this initiative supports woman-owned businesses in Northeast Louisiana, including Kennedy Rice Mill, which is transitioning to climate-positive practices. This approach not only addresses environmental sustainability but also supports social sustainability by empowering women in agriculture.

Kodak

 94 68

Environmental protection

Kodak is actively engaged in environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing waste, conserving energy and water, and minimizing harmful emissions across its global operations. The company has made significant strides in waste management, achieving a 99% diversion rate of waste from landfill and incineration in 2022, excluding waste-to-energy diversion. This accomplishment aligns with Kodak's goal to approach zero waste at its sites worldwide by 2025. Additionally, Kodak has successfully reduced its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 54% in 2022 compared to the baseline year of 2016, surpassing its target of a 25% reduction by 2025. The company is also focused on reducing water consumption and has identified discrepancies in previously reported data, indicating ongoing efforts to accurately measure and improve water usage. Furthermore, Kodak aims to triple the quantity of spent solvents recovered from external sources by 2025, with a 51% increase already achieved in 2022 compared to 2016. These initiatives demonstrate Kodak's commitment to creating environmentally sustainable products and operating in an environmentally responsible manner.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Kodak has set a goal to achieve a 25% reduction in Occupational Injury Rate (OIR) by 2025, a milestone that was met in 2022. The company is now focused on sustaining this performance, indicating a commitment to ensuring the safety and well-being of its employees. Additionally, Kodak maintains a 100% score on the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and continues to be recognized as one of the "Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality." This achievement reflects Kodak's dedication to fostering an inclusive and equitable work environment for all employees.

sources: 2

Skechers

 94 66

Environmental protection

Skechers is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on reducing its environmental impact through sustainable practices and partnerships. The company has launched the "Our Planet Matters" collection, which features products made with recycled materials, demonstrating its commitment to sustainability. Skechers has also partnered with The Nature Conservancy, pledging a minimum of $800,000 to support the organization's efforts in land and water conservation, reforestation, and protecting biodiversity. Additionally, Skechers is working on making its corporate offices more sustainable by aiming for LEED Gold certification for its new buildings, incorporating features like natural lighting, high-performance glass, and Forest Stewardship certified wood. The company's distribution centers in North America, Europe, and China have achieved LEED Gold certification and BREEAM Very Good Rating, respectively, showcasing efforts in green building, renewable energy, and waste and water use reduction. Skechers also emphasizes sustainable shipping and packaging, with 100% of its factories' master cartons and outbound shipping cartons being recyclable, and 99% of its footwear packaging meeting the FSC standard for responsible sources.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Skechers demonstrates a strong commitment to worker welfare through various policies and practices aimed at ensuring ethical and responsible conduct across its supply chain. The company adheres to the California Transparency in Supply Chains Act and the UK Modern Slavery Act, requiring compliance with local labor laws and international labor standards. Skechers has updated its Supplier Code of Conduct to include more stringent provisions on labor management and has implemented a whistleblower program to address potential violations. The company conducts both scheduled and unscheduled audits to ensure compliance with its standards on slavery and human trafficking. Additionally, Skechers provides training for its employees and management on issues related to forced labor and human trafficking. The company is also a member of The Mekong Club, an organization focused on eradicating human trafficking, further highlighting its dedication to promoting human rights and worker welfare.

sources: 1

    • Aiming for LEED Gold certification for new corporate office buildings

Discover

 94 53

Environmental protection

Discover is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. The company has set specific environmental sustainability goals, including reducing its Scope 1 and Scope 2 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 50% from the 2017 baseline by 2030. Additionally, Discover is committed to conducting assessments and building out a roadmap with additional goals, including resource conservation, by the end of 2023. The Environmental Working Group leads these efforts, focusing on reducing the company's footprint across energy and emissions, supply chain, sustainable products and services, and resiliency planning.

Discover has already achieved a 29% reduction in total Scope 1 and 2 emissions from its 2017 baseline through energy-saving measures such as lighting upgrades, end-of-life equipment replacements, building automation improvements, and evaluating electrification to reduce the use of fossil fuels. The company also explores onsite solar and offsite renewable energy investments, like a Virtual Power Purchase Agreement, to further reduce its carbon footprint.

In terms of building sustainability, Discover has achieved Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certification for 8% of its total U.S. square footage and is evaluating all existing buildings for potential LEED Operations and Maintenance Certification. The company has introduced low-wattage LED lighting to reduce energy consumption and has earned the WELL Health-Safety rating for 9 of its U.S. offices, emphasizing the importance of safe and sustainable buildings.

Discover is also committed to waste management, achieving a 42% diversion rate by recycling 216 tons of material across all its U.S. offices in 2022. The company supports sustainable transportation options for its employees, including Car and Vanpooling, a Commuter Benefits Plan, Shuttle services, and Electric Vehicle Chargers at its headquarters. Water conservation efforts have led to a decrease in freshwater consumption by over 32 million gallons since 2017, through measures like low-flow fixtures and xeriscaping.

sources: 1

    • WELL Health-Safety rating
  • Commitments
    • Reduce Scope 1 and Scope 2 GHG emissions by 50% from the 2017 baseline by 2030

A&E is dedicated to investing in innovative technologies to minimize the environmental impact of its operations and products. This commitment is further evidenced by the development of PFAS-Free thread products and the attainment of Gold Level Cradle to Cradle Certifiedâ¢ Material Health Certificates for its new sustainable thread products, showcasing the company's efforts in creating environmentally friendly products.

General Electric

 94 63

Environmental protection

General Electric (GE) is actively engaged in efforts to address climate change and environmental stewardship. The company's technology contributes to approximately 30% of the world's electricity generation, positioning GE as a key player in the global energy sector. GE is committed to decarbonizing the energy sector while simultaneously working to increase access to sustainable, reliable, and affordable electricity. This commitment is particularly significant considering the nearly 775 million people worldwide who currently lack access to electricity. GE's approach to environmental protection includes a focus on reducing the carbon footprint of energy generation and promoting the use of renewable energy sources.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

GE places a strong emphasis on the welfare of its employees, suppliers' workers, and the communities affected by its operations. The company has recently published the GE Human Rights Report, which offers detailed insights into its human rights program. This program encompasses a wide range of governance documents and due diligence processes aimed at protecting the rights and well-being of workers within GE, its suppliers, and the broader communities impacted by GE's business activities. Additionally, GE is dedicated to ensuring the safety of all individuals working for or on behalf of the company, with the ultimate goal of ensuring that everyone returns home safely at the end of the day.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committed to decarbonizing the energy sector while increasing access to sustainable, reliable, and affordable electricity

TGI Friday's

 94 57

Environmental protection

TGI Fridays has implemented several initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact. The company has developed a comprehensive strategy to drive carbon emission reductions, improve waste management, and limit the use of plastics. Key initiatives include the development of checklists for opening and closing restaurants to ensure energy efficiency, promoting a Green Mission to increase team awareness of environmental initiatives, and using data to monitor and improve energy usage behavior across restaurants. These efforts led to a 12% reduction in electricity use in 2022, saving 704 tonnes of carbon dioxide emissions. Additionally, TGI Fridays has achieved a significant milestone in waste management, with no waste sent to landfill in 2022 through their third-party waste manager, Circom. 60% of the waste managed was recycled, and the remaining 40% was used in energy recovery processes. The company is also trialing technologically advanced waste units and working with a plastics-free kitchen equipment supplier to reduce plastic use. All used cooking oil across the Group is recycled, further saving 784,450kg of carbon dioxide emissions in 2022.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

TGI Fridays is committed to ensuring the welfare of its approximately 4,500 employees in the UK. The company engages with its employees through various channels, including employee forums, learning and development opportunities, career development programs, employee surveys, annual performance and development reviews, and appraisal processes. Additionally, TGI Fridays hosts social and team-building events to foster a positive work environment. The company conducts an annual employee engagement survey to measure employee satisfaction and engagement. TGI Fridays aims to provide its employees with a rewarding culture and work environment, competitive remuneration and benefits package, and opportunities for learning and career development.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

TGI Fridays has made commitments towards improving animal welfare within its supply chain. The company has pledged to source only chicken breeds approved by the Global Animal Partnership (GAP) for higher welfare outcomes, ensure chickens are given improved space allocations and an enriched environment as per GAP standards, and source chickens processed through a more humane, multi-step, controlled-atmosphere system. TGI Fridays ensures supplier compliance through third-party auditing. Additionally, the company sources 100% cage-free eggs in the U.S. and has developed policies for key commodities like fish, requiring suppliers to demonstrate certification by internationally recognized bodies such as the Marine Stewardship Council. This approach ensures sustainable sourcing and addresses the social and environmental impacts of sourcing practices.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Global Animal Partnership (GAP)
    • American Humane certified
    • Marine Stewardship Council
    • Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil
  • Commitments
    • 100% sourcing of cage-free eggs in the U.S. as of 2019
    • Reduction of electricity use by 12% in 2022, saving 704 tonnes of CO2 emissions
    • No waste sent to landfill in 2022 through third-party waste management

Canon

 94 73

Environmental protection

Canon has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on reducing environmental impact throughout the product life cycle, contributing to a carbon-free future, and promoting a circular economy. The company is actively working towards climate change mitigation, resource efficiency, and the elimination of hazardous substances to prevent pollution. Canon also emphasizes biodiversity and harmonizing with nature through its activities. Notably, Canon has received recognition for its climate change efforts, including the highest A score from CDP and approval of its GHG emission reduction targets by the Science Based Targets initiative. Additionally, Canon has been selected as one of the Asia-Pacific Climate Leaders 2023.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Canon is committed to ensuring worker welfare through various initiatives. The company respects human rights and focuses on the hiring and treatment of human resources, diversity and inclusion, occupational safety and health management, human resource development, and personal growth. Canon also engages in sociocultural support activities and emphasizes supply chain management to ensure fair practices throughout its operations.

sources: 1, 2

Dunkin'

 94 65

Environmental protection

Dunkin' has launched the Dunkinâ Drive-To Sustainability Program, aiming for 100% responsibly sourced coffee by 2025. This initiative is structured around three pillars: Verification, Partnerships, and Improvement. Dunkin' has partnered with Enveritas, a non-profit organization, to ensure the application of solutions for ending poverty among smallholder coffee growers and to audit their U.S. coffee supply chain for policy compliance. The company has supported environmental efforts such as the planting of 450,000 trees in Honduras and Guatemala in partnership with One Tree Planted, and has contributed to boosting coffee sustainability through agricultural science as a leading sponsor of World Coffee Research. Dunkin' is also a participant in The Sustainable Coffee Challenge, aiming to make coffee the world's first sustainable agricultural product, and has made significant donations to support coffee sustainability, including a $200,000 donation to One Tree Planted for tree planting in Honduras and Guatemala. Additionally, Dunkin' has committed $110,000 to become a premier-level sponsor of The Sustainable Coffee Challenge in 2021.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dunkin' has undertaken several initiatives to improve the livelihoods of coffee farmers and producers. Through the Farmworker Training Project in partnership with the Louis Dreyfus Company, Dunkin' has trained farmers and farmworkers in Honduras to enhance sustainability practices. The company has also supported providing coffee suppliers in Guatemala and Colombia with access to Equal Originsâ Virtual Learning Journey to empower women in coffee. Additionally, Dunkin' has allocated funds to support disaster relief efforts in Nicaragua and Honduras following Hurricanes Eta and Iota, including donations to Seeds for Progress Foundation and World Vision to assist coffee-growing communities. Furthermore, Dunkin' is providing its coffee suppliers in Guatemala and Colombia with The Partnership for Gender Equityâs Virtual Learning Journey, aiming to advance gender equity among producer organizations.

sources: 1, 2

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

Dish Network

 94 38

Environmental protection

DISH Network has taken significant steps to reduce its environmental impact through various initiatives. The company has launched a campaign to encourage customers to switch from paper billing to electronic billing, which has led to the planting of over 13,000 trees in the Sierra National Forest. This effort not only reduces paper waste but also contributes to reforestation efforts. Additionally, DISH has implemented a comprehensive equipment refurbishment program, refurbishing over 5 million receivers, broadband hardware, and accessories annually. This program helps to reduce waste by reusing materials whenever possible. Technicians are also equipped with reusable packaging materials and digital forms to minimize environmental impact further.

In an effort to reduce its carbon footprint, DISH has integrated 200 ROUSH CleanTech propane autogas-fueled Ford E-250 cargo vans into its fleet. These vehicles are expected to lower carbon dioxide emissions by 12.5 million pounds over their lifetime compared to gas-powered counterparts. The choice of propane autogas was influenced by its cost savings, national availability, on-site fueling benefits, and the fact that it emits fewer greenhouse gases and smog-producing hydrocarbons than conventionally fueled vehicles. DISH's commitment to environmental stewardship is further recognized by its membership in the Colorado Environmental Leadership Program, which honors companies that go beyond state and federal regulations to improve their environmental performance.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

DISH Network is committed to the welfare of its workers, providing an environment where employees can realize their full potential. The company offers various programs to support career development, including the Leadership Education and Development (LEAD) program, which provided over 25,000 hours of training in 2019 alone. These programs are designed to help team members excel in their current roles and prepare for future opportunities through promotions, challenging work assignments, and exposure to new technologies.

DISH also emphasizes diversity and inclusion within its workforce. The company supports employee-led diversity networks and interest groups through its platform, COLLECTIVE. These groups, including the African American Network, Out at DISH, DISH Womenâs Network, Adelante, Empowered Parents Network, and the Veterans Resource Group, empower employees to learn about different backgrounds and support one another in professional and personal growth. This initiative reflects DISH's belief in the value of diverse perspectives and its commitment to creating an inclusive workplace.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Colorado Environmental Leadership Program
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Kroger

 94 61

Environmental protection

Kroger is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts, focusing on climate impact and resource conservation. The company supports the transition to a lower-carbon economy through energy management best practices and investments in green energy, having achieved a 15% reduction in greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions towards its 2030 goal. Additionally, Kroger is committed to aligning its Scope 1 & 2 targets with a 1.5Â°C scenario and setting a new Scope 3 target. In terms of resource conservation, Kroger implements waste and food waste diversion programs aiming for zero-waste goals, manages water use responsibly, and engages partners to achieve more sustainable packaging. The company offers customers affordable options for natural, organic, Fair Trade Certified, and plant-based products, further emphasizing its commitment to environmental sustainability.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Kroger demonstrates a strong commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives aimed at ensuring the health, safety, and well-being of its associates and customers. The company focuses on food safety, affordability, nutrition, and protecting health and safety. Since 2017, Kroger has directed 3 billion meals to communities, recovered more than 582 million pounds of surplus fresh food, and directed $1.3 billion in charitable giving to help end hunger. Kroger fosters a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion through responsible employment practices, recruiting, education, leadership training, career advancement, and partnerships with organizations working to advance equity and justice. The company also offers competitive benefits, healthcare, and leadership opportunities to grow and build rewarding careers for its associates.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Kroger is committed to promoting animal welfare across its supply chain. The company has established an animal welfare policy and provides updates on its progress. Notably, Kroger has partnered with Simple TruthÂ® & Kipster Farms for eggs, emphasizing laying hen welfare. This partnership reflects Kroger's efforts to build more sustainable, higher-welfare food production systems and ensure the humane treatment of animals used in its products.

sources: 1

Firestone

 93 59

Environmental protection

Firestone, as part of the Bridgestone group, is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and minimizing the impact of its operations on the environment. The company's eco-development objectives are centered around respect for nature, sustainable use of natural resources, and reduction of CO2 emissions. Firestone is committed to encouraging biodiversity through a sustainable purchasing policy and designing products that minimize the use of natural resources by incorporating greater technological innovation. The manufacturing process of Firestone products undergoes strict testing to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, a practice that extends throughout the lifespan of their tyres. By 2030, Firestone aims to decouple its economic growth from its environmental impact, developing more efficient technologies and commercial models to optimize resource use. The company also focuses on long-term environmental solutions, including increasing energy self-sufficiency in its factories, reducing raw material and water consumption, recycling resources efficiently, developing renewable resources, and turning waste recycling into value creation. These efforts are part of Firestone's vision to surpass government environmental objectives by 2050.

Sunchips

 93 65

Environmental protection

SunChips, under the Frito-Lay brand, has integrated sustainability into its core business strategy, focusing on environmental protection through several key initiatives. The brand has made significant strides in reducing its environmental impact by purchasing renewable energy credits to offset its energy needs. Additionally, SunChips has harnessed solar power at its Modesto plant, further emphasizing its commitment to renewable energy sources. In a notable move towards sustainable packaging, SunChips introduced a fully compostable chip bag in 2010, marking a significant step in reducing the environmental impact of its packaging. Beyond its direct operations, SunChips has supported broader sustainability initiatives, such as contributing to the rebuilding of Greenburg, Kansas, into a model of green living following a devastating tornado. These efforts collectively showcase SunChips' dedication to environmental protection and sustainable practices.

Amazon Alexa

 93 51

Environmental protection

Amazon Alexa is actively engaged in environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing the carbon footprint of its devices. The company measures carbon emissions throughout the lifecycle of its devices, from production through customer use to disposal, with the goal of making each generation of Amazon devices more carbon-efficient than the last. Amazon has committed to investing in renewable energy, specifically wind and solar farms, to match the energy use of Echo, Fire TV, and Ring devices worldwide by 2025. As of the end of 2022, Amazon contracted enough renewable energy capacity to equal the expected energy use of these devices in 2025, with some farms already operational and others under construction. Additionally, Amazon has introduced Low Power Mode in over 60% of devices in customers' homes by the end of 2022 to further reduce energy consumption. The company also focuses on using recycled materials in its devices, with products launched in 2022 incorporating up to 75% recycled plastic, up to 100% recycled yarn, up to 100% recycled aluminum, and up to 90% recycled magnesium, depending on the product. Amazon has set an ambitious goal to make its device packaging 100% recyclable by 2023 and is working to source 100% of the wood fiber in its packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources.

sources: 1

Nothing found

    • Make Amazon device packaging 100% recyclable by 2023
    • Source 100% of the wood fiber in our packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources

Gain

 93 59

Environmental protection

The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN) has taken significant steps towards environmental protection through the launch of its Environment Strategy in 2021, aiming to become a 'green nutrition NGO'. This strategy is a comprehensive approach to reducing the environmental impact of GAIN's programs while advocating for a transformation of the food system to benefit both people and the planet. Recognizing the intrinsic link between food systems and environmental impacts, GAIN is addressing these issues across its programs, partnerships, and advocacy work. Efforts include rolling out Environmental Guidelines for project managers to assess and mitigate the environmental impact of programs, developing partnerships with environmentally focused organizations like the World Wild Fund for Nature (WWF) and the Food and Land Use Coalition (FOLU), and increasing the environmental sustainability of GAIN's own offices. These initiatives aim to find solutions that benefit both human nutrition and the environment, highlighting GAIN's commitment to addressing the interconnected challenges of climate change and nutrition.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

GAIN's efforts in ensuring worker welfare are evident in its focus on decent work and economic growth, as part of its alignment with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The organization supports policies that promote productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity, and innovation, which are crucial for strong food systems. Specifically, GAIN's Marketplace for Nutritious Foods program focuses on supporting small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the nutritious food value chain to develop profitable business models and sustainably bring nutritious and safe foods to market. Additionally, the Workforce Nutrition program aims to improve nutrition for garment and tea workers, demonstrating GAIN's commitment to enhancing worker welfare through nutrition and economic empowerment.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to becoming a 'green nutrition NGO'

IKEA

 93 60

Environmental protection

IKEA is actively working towards environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint, increasing the use of renewable energy, and ensuring sustainable material sourcing. The company has committed to becoming climate positive by 2030, aiming to reduce more greenhouse gas emissions than the IKEA value chain emits while growing the business. This commitment includes not relying on carbon offsetting and contributing to limiting the global temperature increase to 1.5Â°C by the end of the century. In FY22, IKEA reduced the climate footprint of its value chain by 12% compared to the baseline year FY16. Additionally, IKEA has achieved 100% renewable electricity for all IKEA-operated factories, packaging, and distribution units globally. The company is also focusing on regenerating resources, with the ambition to only use responsibly sourced renewable or recycled materials in its offerings. Approximately 15% of IKEA's total wood use in FY22 was recycled, with a goal of at least one-third of recycled wood by FY30.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

IKEA is committed to creating a positive social impact for everyone across its value chain, with a focus on fair and equal treatment. The company is working towards supporting decent work by rolling out new IKEA code of conduct requirements for digital platform workers to IKEA suppliers and service providers. This initiative is part of IKEA's broader ambition to contribute to a fair and equal society by respecting and promoting human rights across the value chain and contributing to resilient societies.

sources: 3

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Forest Stewardship CouncilÂ®-certified (FSCÂ®)
  • Commitments
    • Becoming climate positive by 2030 without relying on carbon offsetting
    • Using only renewable or recycled materials by 2030
    • Reducing the climate footprint of the IKEA value chain by 12% compared to baseline year FY16
    • Achieving 100% renewable electricity for all IKEA-operated factories, packaging, and distribution units globally
    • Aiming for at least one-third of recycled wood by FY30
    • Inspiring and enabling more than 1 billion people to live a better everyday life within the boundaries of the planet by 2030
    • 50% of main meals offered in IKEA restaurants to be plant-based by FY25

Chevron

 93 47

Environmental protection

Chevron is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and transition towards a lower carbon future. The company is working to lower the carbon intensity of its operations and has become the second largest producer of renewable diesel and biodiesel in the United States through its acquisition of Renewable Energy Group, Inc. Chevron's environmental strategy includes responsible water use and a focus on biodiversity, particularly in ecologically sensitive areas. In the Permian Basin, Chevron collaborates with Aris Water Solutions to recycle produced water efficiently, with 99% of water demands for well completions in 2022 met using brackish or recycled water. Additionally, Chevron is creating a global geospatial database to screen operating sites and potential new projects for biodiversity impacts and benefits.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Chevron places a strong emphasis on empowering its workforce and fostering a culture of inclusion and belonging. The company's U.S.-based Humankind program allows employees, retirees, and contractors to support their communities. In 2022, Chevron's Humankind program facilitated donations exceeding $34 million to U.S. nonprofit organizations, supported over 1,200 charitable organizations through volunteering, and logged more than 88,700 volunteer hours in the United States. These efforts reflect Chevron's commitment to building a diverse workforce and giving back to communities.

  • Commitments

Nintendo Wii

 93 57

Environmental protection

Nintendo of America has taken significant steps towards environmental protection through its sustainability efforts. In 2020, the company established the Sustainability Committee, which is composed of members from various departments. This committee's primary goal is to explore new ways to advance Nintendo's sustainability efforts. One of the major achievements of this committee has been the reduction of CO2 emissions from operations. Since its establishment, Nintendo of America has transitioned to using 100-percent renewable energy for its offices and suburban shipping facility. Additionally, the company participates in a carbon-balance program, which contributes to local reforestation projects. These projects aim to offset CO2 emissions generated by natural gas usage in areas such as the company's cafeterias.

Furthermore, Nintendo of America has implemented a post-sales recycling program, known as the Take Back Program, which is available to consumers in the U.S. and Canada. This program allows consumers to recycle any of their electronics, not just Nintendo products. Nintendo provides postage and instructions for sending video game products to them for R2-certified recycling. The company also offers fully recyclable packaging upon request. In 2022, this program successfully received over 3,800 items for recycling, preventing more than 1 metric ton of materials from ending up in landfills.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Responsible Recycling (R2)
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Suave

 93 59

Environmental protection

Suave demonstrates a commitment to environmental stewardship through its manufacturing and packaging processes. The company aims to minimize waste and promote sustainable practices, although specific initiatives or targets are not detailed. Suave also conducts EcoDesign Reviews as part of its product development process, assessing the environmental impact and compliance with sustainability targets to ensure their products align with environmental considerations.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Suave invests in the growth, development, and wellbeing of its employees by providing necessary training, resources, and support. The company emphasizes the importance of diversity and inclusivity, particularly championing women in decision-making roles. This approach underlines Suave's belief in the power of diversity and the unique perspectives, talents, and insights that women bring to the workplace.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Suave is certified Cruelty-Free by PETA, indicating that the company does not conduct animal testing on any of its products anywhere in the world. This certification is part of Suave's broader commitment to ethical practices and compassion towards animals. Over 40 years ago, Suave's parent company, Unilever, began developing and using non-animal methods to assess product safety, a practice that continues to be a core aspect of Suave's product development process.

Trader Joe's

 93 64

Environmental protection

Trader Joe's has made significant strides in environmental protection, focusing on resource management, waste diversion, and packaging improvements. The company has successfully composted and recycled over 670 million pounds of materials, including organic material, cardboard, plastic wrap, plastic buckets, and damaged pallets. Remarkably, approximately 99.5% of all Trader Joeâs products were either sold to customers, donated to food recovery partners, or composted, with only 0.5% not being diverted. This is a notable achievement compared to the USDA report that 10% of food in America is lost at the retail level. Trader Joe's is committed to further reducing this percentage and eliminating food waste from their stores.

In 2020, Trader Joe's made significant improvements to the packaging of over 150 products by eliminating excess components, increasing the use of recycled and sustainably sourced materials, and removing non-sustainable materials. Notably, the company removed over 2 million pounds of plastic packaging from its products. Examples of these improvements include replacing the black plastic tray for deli meats with a paper-based tray, switching from plastic clamshells to cardboard boxes for cherry tomatoes, and replacing multi-layer foil envelopes with home compostable clear film for tea packaging. Trader Joe's employs a five-point sustainability framework to guide these improvements, focusing on reducing and removing packaging, sourcing renewable and recycled materials, choosing recyclable packaging, avoiding harmful substances, and educating customers on proper disposal and recycling practices.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Smucker's

 93 74

Environmental protection

Smucker's is actively engaged in several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment and promoting sustainability. The company has committed to reducing its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, with specific targets set for both its operations and its value chain. By 2030, Smucker's aims to reduce absolute scope 1 and scope 2 GHG emissions by 28% and scope 3 GHG emissions by 22% per unit of sold product, all from a 2019 base year. These goals align with the Science-Based Targets Initiative (SBTi) protocol, demonstrating Smucker's commitment to contributing to the goals of the Paris Agreement through science-based targets. Additionally, Smucker's is working towards achieving TRUE certification at all of its sites by 2030, which will formalize its waste reduction activities and ensure a consistent approach to minimizing nonhazardous solid waste and maximizing resource efficiency. The company has also set goals to reduce energy intensity by 5% and water intensity by 5% at company-owned facilities by 2025, compared to a 2019 base year. In terms of packaging sustainability, Smucker's has introduced goals to support recycling, source sustainably, and optimize design, aiming for 100% recyclable, compostable, or reusable packaging materials by 2025. These efforts are part of a broader strategy to innovate processes, work with suppliers, and engage industry peers to enact change and reduce environmental impact.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • TRUE certification (goal by 2030)
  • Commitments
    • Reduce absolute scope 1 and scope 2 GHG emissions 28% by 2030 from a 2019 base year
    • Reduce scope 3 GHG emissions 22% per unit of sold product by 2030 from a 2019 base year
    • Achieve TRUE certification at 100% of sites by 2030
    • Reduce energy intensity at company-owned facilities by 5% by 2025 vs. 2019 base year
    • Reduce water intensity at company-owned facilities by 5% by 2025 vs. 2019 base year
    • Strive for 100% recyclable, compostable or reusable packaging materials by 2025
    • Make How2RecycleÂ® information available for all packaging by 2025
    • Ensure 100% of fiber-based packaging is from recycled and/or certified sources by 2025
    • Strive to use 30% post-consumer recycled or renewable resource materials in plastic packaging by 2030

Breyers

 93 70

Environmental protection

Breyers is actively engaged in environmental protection through its commitment to sustainably sourcing vanilla and other ingredients. The company's efforts are focused on supporting sustainable vanilla harvesting, which is crucial given vanilla's significant social, environmental, and economic impact in the regions where it is produced. Breyers sources its vanilla directly from smallholders, ensuring a fair income for farmers and reducing environmental impact. This initiative is part of the Vanilla For Change program, a partnership with Symrise and Unilever, aiming to improve the livelihood of vanilla farmers in Madagascar, where a significant portion of the world's vanilla is produced. The program has positively impacted over 40,000 people in 76 villages. Additionally, Breyers pays a premium for Rainforest Alliance Certified vanilla, supporting practices that do not contribute to deforestation. The company's commitment extends to ensuring all the fruit and vanilla used in its products are 100% sustainably sourced, with the exception of raspberries. This approach helps mitigate the economic effects of climate change on farming communities and supports a better future for people and the planet.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Breyers, through its Vanilla For Change initiative, is significantly contributing to worker welfare, particularly for vanilla farmers in Madagascar. The program, in partnership with Symrise and Unilever, aims to improve the livelihoods of natural vanilla farmers by sourcing vanilla directly from smallholders. This direct sourcing approach helps lift vanilla suppliers and their families out of poverty by paying a fair price for higher quality vanilla, ensuring a fair income for farmers. Additionally, the partnership with Save The Children has led to the establishment of village-level savings and loan associations, encouraged cooperatives, and created youth groups throughout Madagascar. These efforts go beyond farming to improve the overall well-being of the communities involved.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Rainforest Alliance Certified
  • Commitments
    • 100% sustainably sourced vanilla and fruit (except raspberries)

Miller

 93 46

Environmental protection

Miller, under its parent company Illinois Tool Works, has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives. They have partnered with We Energies in the "Energy for Tomorrow Program" aiming to increase renewable energy to 39% of We Energiesâ power mix by 2030, thereby reducing reliance on nonrenewable sources. Miller has also invested in LED lighting across its facilities, resulting in a significant reduction of annual electricity consumption by 286,722 kilowatt hours, equivalent to saving 323,995 pounds of coal, 22,937 gallons of petroleum, or 2,130,344 cubic feet of natural gas. Furthermore, Miller developed an oil recovery system that captures and reuses oil in its operations, saving 11,000 gallons annually. This initiative is part of their broader effort to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions intensity, achieving a 37% reduction through 2021 compared to 2017 levels, through decreased energy consumption and increased use of renewable energy sources.

sources: 1

    • Saving 11,000 gallons annually through an oil recovery system
    • Achieving a 37% GHG emissions intensity reduction through 2021 compared to 2017 levels

BBC America

 93 57

Environmental protection

BBC America, as part of the BBC Group, is actively engaged in various initiatives to minimize its environmental impact and promote sustainability both on and off the screen. The company is committed to reducing the environmental impact of its programs through the implementation of sustainable production practices. This includes the use of the BAFTA albert Consortium's carbon calculator and certification system, which is mandatory for all TV commissions from January 2022. The albert certification recognizes productions that adopt greener working practices, and BBC America's productions, such as "Winterwatch," have made significant strides in this area by using green hydrogen and intelligent hybrid generator systems to power broadcasts, significantly reducing carbon emissions.

Furthermore, BBC America is involved in portraying sustainability on-screen to reflect societal shifts towards more sustainable living and to educate audiences about climate change and the transition to Net Zero. This is evident in programming that incorporates themes of sustainability, such as the eco-friendly surf center featured in a special episode of "DIY SOS" and the comprehensive environmental content offered through the "Our Planet Now" initiative.

BBC America also supports the BBC Group's Net Zero strategy, which includes Science Based Targets (SBTs) for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, transitioning to a fully electric vehicle fleet by 2030, and achieving Zero Waste to Landfill. The company is part of the Carbon Disclosure Project's supply chain solution and is developing a greenhouse gas emissions reporting platform in collaboration with Microsoft.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

BBC America, through its co-productions like "Planet Earth III" with the BBC Studios Natural History Unit, supports understanding of climate change and the importance of biodiversity. While direct initiatives focused on animal welfare in the production process are not explicitly mentioned, the content of these programs plays a significant role in raising awareness about the natural world and the need to protect it. The portrayal of wildlife and natural habitats in these productions can contribute to a broader understanding and appreciation of animal welfare and conservation efforts.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • albert certification

  • Commitments

    • Transitioning to a fully electric vehicle fleet by 2030
    • Achieving Zero Waste to Landfill
    • Reducing greenhouse gas emissions to Net Zero (Science Based Targets)

Smirnoff

 93 55

Environmental protection

Smirnoff has embarked on a mission to develop more sustainable packaging and systems by 2030, focusing on improving the circularity of glass bottles. In partnership with the Don't Trash Glass (DTG) campaign, Smirnoff is working to collect used glass for processing into new bottles for future products. This initiative, in collaboration with the Glass Packaging Institute and GlassKing Recovery & Recycling, aims to gather used and discarded glass bottles from over 300 Chicago bars, restaurants, and local businesses. The collected glass will be processed by Smirnoff's glass partners and then transported to the Smirnoff packaging plant in Plainfield, Illinois. This effort is part of Smirnoff's broader commitment to reimagining packaging and becoming sustainable by design, aligning with Diageo's ten-year action plan, Society 2030: Spirit of Progress.

sources: 1

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to developing more sustainable packaging and systems by 2030

Black & Decker

 93 71

Environmental protection

Black & Decker, as part of Stanley Black & Decker, is actively working towards environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing their operational environmental footprint. This includes efforts in decarbonization, sustainable water use, and achieving zero waste to landfill. They have committed to a 42% reduction in absolute Scope 1 and Scope 2 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 2030 from a 2022 baseline. Additionally, they aim for 100% zero waste to landfill for their global manufacturing and distribution sites by 2040. Transitioning operations to renewable energy is a key strategy in reducing their total electrical load and carbon intensity, demonstrating their commitment to minimizing climate risk and finding climate opportunities. Their actions align with the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals, emphasizing their role in accelerating actions needed for a sustainable future.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Black & Decker, under its parent company Stanley Black & Decker, emphasizes worker welfare through its ECOSMARTâ¢ initiative. This initiative focuses on embedding environmental and safety accountability into the company culture, aiming to create a paradigm shift in attracting, developing, and retaining talent. The company has seen a significant drop in recordable injuries since the introduction of its Safety Always approach in 2014, highlighting safety as a core value. Furthermore, they are committed to ensuring the highest standard of human rights is respected and promoted throughout their supply chain, demonstrating their dedication to the welfare of their workers and those within their operational sphere.

sources: 2

    • CDP Climate Disclosure Leadership Index

    • 42% reduction in absolute Scope 1 and Scope 2 GHG emissions by 2030 from a 2022 baseline
    • 100% zero waste to landfill for global manufacturing and distribution sites by 2040

Planters Trail Mix

 93 64

Environmental protection

Planters, under its parent company Hormel Foods, has taken significant steps towards sustainability, particularly in its packaging. The brand introduced a new peanut-shaped packaging for its dry-roasted peanuts, which uses 8% less plastic than the previous standard 16-ounce bottles. This initiative is expected to save over 200 tons of plastic annually. This effort is part of Hormel Foods' broader "20 By 30 Challenge," aimed at reducing the negative environmental impacts of its brands' packaging, nonrenewable energy use, greenhouse gas emissions, water use, and solid waste. In the previous year, Hormel Foods' sustainability initiatives in packaging alone saved more than 727,000 pounds of waste. Additionally, Planters has collaborated with Applegate Naturals to launch the Do Good Dog hot dog, made with beef raised on verified regenerative U.S. grasslands, which supports reversing the impact of meat production on the climate by rebuilding soil biodiversity and organic matter.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Through its collaboration with Applegate Naturals on the Do Good Dog hot dog, Planters indirectly supports animal welfare by promoting beef raised on verified regenerative U.S. grasslands. This approach to meat production not only aims to mitigate climate impact but also implies a commitment to more sustainable and potentially more humane animal farming practices by focusing on soil health and ecosystem support.

sources: 1

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

Abercrombie & Fitch

 93 47

Environmental protection

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) has demonstrated a commitment to environmental sustainability through various initiatives and goals. The company aligns its sustainability goals with the UNâs Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), focusing on challenges such as climate change and environmental degradation. A&F Co. has made significant strides in reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, water usage, and waste across its operations and supply chain. Notably, the company achieved a 25% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2021 compared to a 2019 baseline, with a target to reduce these emissions by 47% by 2030. In terms of water conservation, A&F Co. successfully reduced water usage in denim production by 30% since fiscal year 2020, utilizing Jeanologia Environmental Impact Measuring (EIM) software. The company also focuses on sourcing sustainable materials, achieving 100% sourcing of down from Responsible Down Standard (RDS) certified sources since fiscal year 2020 and aiming to source 25% of its cotton supply through Better Cotton by 2025. Additionally, A&F Co. has implemented the g2 revolution hazardous waste recycling program in 43% of its US stores as of fiscal year 2022.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is committed to ensuring global human and labor rights, focusing on creating safe and responsible facilities for its workers. The company emphasizes honesty, respect, and the dignity and rights of all people in its business conduct. A&F Co. collaborates with suppliers to promote worker safety, fair social and labor conditions, gender equality, and well-being. The company has achieved its goal of training 25,000 workers on human trafficking prevention between fiscal years 2019 and 2022. Furthermore, A&F Co. aims to provide access to well-being and empowerment programs for 50,000 workers by 2027, having trained 3,134 workers through such programs between fiscal years 2019 and early 2021.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. has taken steps to ensure the ethical sourcing of animal-derived materials. The company achieved its goal of sourcing 100% of its down from Responsible Down Standard (RDS) certified sources since fiscal year 2020. Additionally, A&F Co. is working towards sourcing 100% of its virgin wool according to the Responsible Wool Standard (RWS) by 2025. These efforts demonstrate the company's commitment to animal welfare and the responsible sourcing of animal-derived materials.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Responsible Down Standard (RDS)
    • Responsible Wool Standard (RWS) (in progress)
  • Commitments
    • Reduce Scope 1 & 2 Emissions by 47% by 2030
    • Source 25% Better Cotton by 2025
    • Source 25% recycled polyester fabric by 2025
    • Source 100% Responsible Wool Standard (RWS) Wool by 2025
    • Source 50% Canopy Supported Innovative Viscose by 2025
    • Reduce water in denim production by 30% by 2022 (achieved)
    • Train 25,000 supply chain workers on human trafficking prevention by 2022 (achieved)
    • Provide supply chain workers access to well-being and empowerment programs: 50,000 workers by 2027
    • Global Home Office Waste Reduction: 50% by 2025 (achieved)

Farmers Insurance

 93 49

Environmental protection

Farmers Insurance is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainability. The company has committed to transitioning all sedan and SUV fleet vehicles to hybrid and electric models by the end of 2026. Additionally, Farmers has achieved a significant reduction in internal paper use, cutting it by over 80% since 2015, through initiatives like paperless billing and reducing internal print communications. In 2019, the company also removed polystyrene and plastic from its operations wherever biodegradable alternatives were practical. Furthermore, Farmers Insurance Exchange has become the first U.S.-based insurer to sign onto the United Nations Environment Programme Finance Initiative's Principles for Sustainable Insurance. This international framework aims to address environmental, social, and governance risks and opportunities within the global insurance industry. Through this commitment, Farmers joins over 200 organizations worldwide in publicly committing to these principles since their introduction in 2012.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Farmers Insurance demonstrates a strong commitment to worker welfare through various programs and initiatives. The company has established the Farmers Family Fund, which has provided more than $4 million in grants to support employees experiencing unexpected financial hardships since its launch in 2012. Additionally, Farmers emphasizes diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging as foundational elements of its organizational culture. The company supports a vibrant network of Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that are led by employees and open to all, aiming to support employees in bringing their whole selves to work.

sources: 1
