Panasonic

 93 72

Environmental protection

Panasonic has established a comprehensive approach to environmental protection, focusing on achieving carbon neutrality and promoting a circular economy. The company's Environment Vision 2050, set in 2017, aligns with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris Agreement, aiming to create and utilize energy more efficiently than it is consumed. Through the GREEN IMPACT initiative, Panasonic pledges to reduce its business operations' CO2 emissions (Scope 1 and Scope 2) to net-zero by 2030 and work on reducing Scope 3 emissions by designing energy-efficient products. The company has partnered with Redwood Materials to create a local, circular supply chain for batteries, emphasizing the importance of a closed-loop battery recycling and remanufacturing process. This collaboration aims to reduce costs and CO2 emissions by minimizing the need for global shipping of components for processing. Panasonic has also achieved net-zero emissions at several manufacturing sites by reducing energy consumption, utilizing on-site renewable energy sources, and purchasing renewable energy credits. In 2022, Panasonic joined the Clean Energy Buyers Association (CEBA) to promote renewable energy development in the U.S. and committed to reaching net-zero for Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2030. The company's environmental efforts have been recognized by the CDP's 2022 Climate Change A List for its transparency and action on climate change.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Panasonic is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) as part of its sustainability initiatives, aiming to create greater value and contribute to society by embracing and respecting the individuality of each person within the organization. The company has established a DEI policy that focuses on creating an inclusive work environment, supporting diverse work styles and work-life balance, and promoting gender equity. Panasonic also supports employees with disabilities, employs workers post-retirement, and acknowledges the importance of LGBTQ inclusion. These efforts are part of Panasonic's broader commitment to employee well-being and social contribution through corporate citizenship activities.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year Sustained Excellence award (2022)
    • EPEAT bronze rating on select Toughbook SKUs
  • Commitments
    • Reduce CO2 emissions of business operations (Scope 1 and Scope 2) to net-zero by 2030
    • Reduce Scope 3 emissions by designing and building more energy-efficient products
    • Achieve a 90 percent carbon-free U.S. electricity system by 2030 in partnership with CEBA

Amazon Video

 93 62

Environmental protection

Amazon is actively working towards environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainability. The company has committed to reaching net-zero carbon emissions by 2040, a goal that encompasses a broad range of activities from renewable energy projects to innovative packaging solutions. A significant part of Amazon's strategy involves transitioning to 100% renewable energy for its operations, with the company on track to achieve this target by 2025, five years ahead of its original 2030 goal. This effort is supported by investments in renewable energy sources, which accounted for 90% of Amazon's electricity consumption in 2022.

In addition to its focus on renewable energy, Amazon is innovating in the area of packaging to reduce waste and increase recyclability. The company has committed to making Amazon device packaging 100% recyclable by 2023. Furthermore, Amazon is engaging in water stewardship initiatives, aiming to make AWS water positive by 2030, thereby contributing more water to communities than it consumes. These efforts are part of Amazon's broader commitment to protecting natural resources and driving climate solutions, which also include conservation and restoration initiatives to protect the natural world.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Amazon is advancing human rights and ensuring worker welfare through its commitment to human rights principles and supply chain management. While specific programs or initiatives directly related to worker welfare within Amazon Video's operations are not detailed, Amazon's broader commitment to human rights suggests a focus on creating better conditions for workers across its operations. This includes efforts to ensure fair treatment, safety, and well-being of employees in its supply chain. However, more specific information on living wage programs, community building activities, or other direct worker welfare initiatives within Amazon Video was not provided in the provided context.

Wrangler

 93 63

Environmental protection

Wrangler has implemented several initiatives to reduce its environmental impact, focusing on water and energy conservation, and the use of preferred materials. The brand has introduced IndigoodÂ®, a platform that significantly reduces water usage in fabric construction by at least 90% compared to conventional processes, through innovative technologies like foam-dyeing. Additionally, Wrangler's Earthwashâ¢ process aims to create authentic washes with lower environmental impacts, using less energy, water, and cleaner chemistry. The company has set ambitious goals, including powering all owned and operated facilities with renewable energy by 2025, saving 10 billion liters of water by 2025 since the start of its water-saving initiatives in 2008, and sourcing 100% preferred materials, including cotton by 2025 and synthetics by 2030. Wrangler is also committed to using 100% Preferred Chemistry by 2023, which reduces the use of chemicals that may negatively impact the environment or worker safety.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Wrangler has committed to working only with factories that support worker well-being or community development programs by 2030. This commitment reflects the brand's dedication to ensuring the welfare of the workers involved in the manufacturing of its products. Although specific programs or initiatives are not detailed in the provided context, this goal indicates a broader strategy to improve working conditions and support community development within its supply chain.

The company is actively working on reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives and is also engaged in biodiversity conservation efforts.

Cadbury Egg

 93 61

Environmental protection

Cadbury is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. A significant focus has been placed on sustainable packaging as part of MondelÄz's 'Pack Light and Pack Rightâ strategy. In March 2021, Cadbury removed plastic windows from all its chocolate shell eggs and transitioned to 100% sustainably sourced cardboard, eliminating 108 tonnes of cardboard from the market. Additionally, the company reduced the amount of plastic used in its large sharing bags by 15% and introduced packaging with 30% recycled plastic for two of its sharing bar brands, impacting over 28 million sharing bars. In Australia and New Zealand, Cadbury has made substantial changes to its Easter packaging, moving Cadbury Hollow Hunting Egg plastic crates to cardboard cartons and redesigning Easter Gift Boxes to save over 331,000 kg of plastic and cardboard packaging. These efforts are part of Cadbury's commitment to zero net waste packaging and making its packaging better for people and the planet through less packaging, better packaging materials, and investments in improved recycling systems.

Purina

 93 59

Environmental protection

Purina is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on climate change, packaging sustainability, and water conservation. As part of NestlÃ©'s global Net Zero commitment, Purina aims to achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and reach Net Zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. This commitment involves assessing their impact and identifying opportunities within their business practices and through partnerships to drive greenhouse gas reductions. In terms of packaging, nearly 90% of Purina's plastic packaging is currently designed for recycling. By 2025, they aim to increase this to 95%, while continuing to research and test new solutions for the remainder of their packaging. Additionally, Purina is working to reduce water consumption in its factories by treating and using water responsibly, demonstrating a commitment to conserving this vital resource.

Purina also partners with organizations that promote sustainable practices, such as Ducks Unlimited, with whom they have worked to restore wetlands and support waterfowl habitats. Through the Rice Stewardship Partnership with Ducks Unlimited and U.S. Rice, they contribute to creating wetlands that provide migrating waterfowl with rest and nourishment. Furthermore, Purina's partnership with Truterra aids on-farm conservation by supporting sustainable practices on farmlands where key ingredients for their pet foods are grown. These efforts are part of Purina's broader commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship.

sources: 1, 2

Hardee's

 93 54

Environmental protection

Hardee's demonstrates a commitment to environmental protection through its innovative indoor farming practices, which significantly reduce the consumption of resources compared to traditional farming methods. By adopting an indoor ecosystem, Hardee's has managed to consume 95% less water and use 97% less fertilizer, while also preserving natural areas by requiring 99% less land. This approach not only minimizes the impact on the surrounding environment but also ensures that nothing harmful is left behind. Additionally, Hardee's facility is powered by renewable energy sourced from solar generation, further reducing its carbon footprint and enhancing the stability of its crops. The company also emphasizes water conservation by irrigating with water from its own well, then collecting and reprocessing it, achieving a 95% reduction in water usage. Furthermore, Hardee's innovative farming practices ensure a 99% take rate of fertilizer to plants, preventing the leaching of harmful chemicals into groundwater. The company's packaging is part of the Sustainable Forest Initiative (SFI), showcasing its commitment to sustainable packaging solutions. Hardee's also actively contributes to ending food insecurity by donating fresh, organic produce to over 20,000 local families in Florida in 2020 alone, highlighting its dedication to giving back to the community and preserving the environment for future generations.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Sustainable Forest Initiative (SFI)
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Hampton Inn

 93 60

Environmental protection

Hilton, the parent company of Hampton Inn, is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through its "Travel with Purpose" Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) strategy. This initiative aims to drive responsible travel and tourism globally, with a specific focus on reducing the consumption of natural resources. Hilton is committed to climate action and destination stewardship, working towards a net-zero future for the company and the broader travel and tourism industry. Efforts to reduce Watts, Water, and Waste at their hotels are central to their environmental strategy. This approach demonstrates Hilton's commitment to operating and growing sustainably, paving the way for a more environmentally responsible hospitality sector. 1

Worker welfare

Hilton's "Travel with Purpose" strategy also encompasses a strong focus on social impact, particularly in fostering opportunities for people both within the company and in the broader communities where it operates. This includes a commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) and the protection of human rights. Hilton aims to create positive social impacts through its Careers, Communities, and Conduct programs, which are designed to support team members and contribute to the welfare of communities around the world. This holistic approach to social responsibility reflects Hilton's dedication to enhancing the lives of its employees and those in the surrounding communities. 1

Aflac

 93 50

Environmental protection

Aflac has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainability. The company has significantly reduced its Scope 1 and 2 market-based greenhouse gas emissions by more than 95% from 2007 to 2021, surpassing its goal of a 75% reduction from a 2007 base year nine years ahead of its 2030 schedule. This achievement underscores Aflac's dedication to mitigating climate change and conserving natural resources. Additionally, Aflac is focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions to help ensure the long-term value of the companyâs operations and investments while preserving the environment. The company's environmental stewardship is further highlighted by its commitment to sustainable and DEI investments, with $741 million allocated in 2022. Aflac's sustainability bond, issued in March 2021, has been fully allocated towards projects that provide environmental or social benefits, aligning with the Sustainable Development Goals adopted by all United Nations Member States in 2015. These efforts reflect Aflac's dedication to being a good steward of the environment and its proactive approach to addressing climate change.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Aflac has integrated worker welfare into its corporate culture and daily operations, emphasizing the importance of being a good corporate citizen and supporting its employees and communities. The company's social commitment is evident in its efforts to provide opportunities for a diverse workforce and distribution channels, fostering an inclusive culture in both Japan and the U.S. Aflac's contributions exceeding $165 million in support of the Aflac Cancer and Blood Disorders Center of Children's Healthcare of Atlanta highlight its dedication to helping families facing childhood cancer. Additionally, Aflac's support for 149,000 pediatric patients and their families staying at the Aflac Parents House in Japan during treatments demonstrates the company's commitment to the well-being of its employees and the communities it serves. These initiatives reflect Aflac's belief in balancing purpose and profit while ensuring the welfare of its workers and contributing positively to society.

sources: 1, 2

J.P. Morgan

 93 43

Environmental protection

J.P. Morgan is actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at environmental protection and promoting a sustainable future. The company is focusing on advancing the transition to a low-carbon economy by supporting clients and financing opportunities that accelerate this shift. They are committed to minimizing the environmental impact of their operations, including efforts in their corporate buildings, retail bank branches, and data centers. J.P. Morgan has set ambitious targets aligned with achieving net zero emissions by 2050 across key sectors of their financing portfolio, utilizing their Carbon CompassSM methodology for setting portfolio-level net zero aligned targets. They aim to facilitate more than $2.5 trillion to address climate change and contribute to sustainable development, with $1 trillion dedicated to green initiatives over a decade, from 2021 through the end of 2030. Operational sustainability targets include achieving carbon neutrality across their operations and maintaining this status through various measures, including the use of renewable energy for 100% of their global power needs and diverting 100% of e-waste from landfills. They have also committed to reducing their Scope 1 and Scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions by 40% by 2030 compared to a 2017 baseline.

Their efforts extend to energy conservation, with a focus on increasing renewable energy generation in North America, lowering energy consumption, and identifying alternative, renewable energy sources for their manufacturing operations. Additionally, Cottonelle products are Forest Stewardship CouncilÂ® (FSCÂ®) Certified, indicating that the forests are managed responsibly to prevent deforestation.

Capital One Bank

 92 48

Environmental protection

Capital One is actively engaged in various initiatives to enhance its environmental sustainability and address climate change. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, with a commitment to reduce Scope 1 Direct Emissions and Scope 3 Emissions (categories 1-14) by 50 percent by 2030, using 2019 as the baseline year. Additionally, Capital One aims to purchase 100 percent renewable electricity and increase location-aligned procurement in the markets where it operates. The company is also focused on reducing water consumption at its facilities by 20 percent by 2025 (from a 2019 baseline) and ensuring that 95 percent of the paper purchased for operations is certified by the Forest Stewardship Council or contains 30 percent post-consumer waste recycled content each year. Capital One is pursuing the U.S. Green Building Councilâs Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certification for all new office construction and comprehensive renovations, targeting LEED Silver or higher. Furthermore, the company has set a goal to reduce landfill waste generated at its campus locations by 50 percent by 2025 (from a 2019 baseline). Capital One supports green infrastructure through a $500,000 grant to the Greater New Orleans Foundation for training in green infrastructure and invests in environmental sustainability through ventures like Trove, which extends the life of merchandise. The bank also backs renewable energy projects, including providing tax equity for the largest solar project in Idaho, and partners with companies like REI to support shared values and provide enhanced rewards for co-op members.

sources: 1, 2

RayBan

 92 62

Environmental protection

Ray-Ban has taken significant steps towards sustainability, particularly in the production of their eyewear. They have introduced a range of bio-based eyewear, utilizing materials such as bio-acetate, bio-based nylon, and bio-based rubber. Bio-acetate frames are notable for being biodegradable, thanks to a new kind of plasticizer mixed with cellulose acetate, which helps in reducing environmental impact. The bio-based nylon used in their frames consists of at least 57% bio-based content, substituting fossil-based materials with renewable sources like castor oil. For children's designs, bio-based rubber elements are incorporated, containing at least 28% biological content from renewable sources such as corn. This makes the products more sustainable without compromising their style. Additionally, Ray-Ban's commitment to sustainability extends to their lenses and packaging. The bio-based nylon lenses are composed of at least 40% biological content from renewable sources, although this technology has not yet been applied to polarized lenses. The company's packaging is made from 100% recycled paper, further emphasizing their efforts to minimize environmental impact. Ray-Ban also practices responsible shipping, partnering with logistics providers to reduce emissions during the delivery process.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Nothing found

BlueCross BlueShield

 92 56

Environmental protection

Blue Cross Blue Shield (BCBS) companies are actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and address the climate crisis, recognizing the intrinsic link between the health of our planet and the health of our communities. BCBS of Massachusetts (BCBSMA) has launched a comprehensive corporate sustainability strategy named Green@Blue, aiming to reduce environmental impact, promote environmental justice, and provide stakeholders with information on how the environment affects health. Key goals under this strategy include achieving carbon neutrality and zero waste by 2030. Initiatives to reach these goals include supporting community solar farms, which have significantly increased solar-generated power in Massachusetts and reduced carbon emissions, and sponsoring Bluebikes to promote public bike sharing as a sustainable transportation option. Additionally, BCBS companies share best practices and innovations in sustainability, such as moving data centers to colocation facilities for increased energy efficiency, implementing comprehensive recycling and composting programs, and encouraging healthy commuting options to reduce pollution and improve public health.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Blue Cross Blue Shield Association (BCBSA) demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through its supplier diversity program, which aims to broaden the supplier base with diverse businesses, reflecting the organization's vision for social responsibility. This program promotes opportunities for minority-owned, woman-owned, veteran-owned, and other traditionally underrepresented businesses, integrating supplier diversity with BCBSA's overarching Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) strategy. By fostering a diverse supply chain, BCBSA not only supports underrepresented communities but also enhances its competitive advantage and impacts the communities it serves positively.

sources: 1

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Carbon neutral by 2030
    • Zero waste by 2030

Guinness

 92 53

Environmental protection

Guinness is actively engaging in environmental protection through its Regenerative Agriculture Pilot, aiming to support the transition towards regenerative agriculture among Irish barley farmers. This initiative focuses on adopting nature-based solutions to produce low carbon barley and improve natural resources like biodiversity and water. The pilot, one of the most ambitious on the island of Ireland, involves working with farmers to define effective regenerative practices tailored to Irish barley production. Key outcomes include improvements in soil health and carbon sequestration, enhanced biodiversity, reduced synthetic fertilizer use, enhanced water quality, and improved farm profitability and farmer livelihoods. The pilot also employs a digital management system for monitoring and coordinating field operations, such as soil testing and yield monitoring. Additionally, Guinness has committed to sourcing 100% of its electricity from renewable generation since September 2020, as part of its broader sustainability efforts aligned with Diageoâs Society 2030: Spirit of Progress plan, which includes achieving net zero carbon emissions across its direct operations and a 50% reduction in scope 3 emissions by 2030.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Guinness demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare and community support through various initiatives. The company champions inclusion and diversity across its business, partnering with organizations like Learning for Life, St. Michael's House, and Junior Achievement to support local communities and artists. These partnerships aim to shape a tolerant society and provide support to various community initiatives, including Little Flower Penny Dinners. This approach reflects Guinness's broader commitment to creating a positive impact on its people, communities, customers, suppliers, and the planet.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • ISO14001 Environmental Management System Certification
    • Green Tourism Gold Award
  • Commitments
    • Achieve net zero carbon emissions across its direct operations by 2030
    • 50% reduction in scope 3 emissions by 2030
    • Zero waste to landfill at the Guinness Storehouse

Acura

 92 52

Environmental protection

Acura is actively engaged in environmental protection through its Acura Environmental Leadership Program, which encourages dealers across the United States to voluntarily reduce their environmental impact. This initiative outlines a comprehensive set of environmental best practices for auto dealerships, aiming for significant reductions in total energy use. Dealerships can achieve different levels of recognition (Silver, Gold, and Platinum) based on their achievements in energy reduction. Acura's commitment extends to designing vehicles with aerodynamic designs that enhance fuel efficiency and lower emissions, positioning their manufacturing operations as leaders in the efficient use of natural resources. The company's overarching goal is to contribute to carbon neutrality for all products and corporate activities by 2050, demonstrating a broad and ongoing commitment to environmental stewardship.

ESPN

 92 51

Environmental Sustainability

ESPN is actively engaged in reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives aimed at minimizing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainability. The company has implemented measures to create an environmentally friendly workplace, including compliance with LEED standards for new constructions and renovations, the installation of solar panels, and upgrades to lighting fixtures. These efforts are complemented by modifications to air conditioning and heating operations, as well as the installation of motion sensors to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. ESPN also collaborates with its Bristol campus food vendor to recover and donate prepared food from cafeteria locations to local food pantries. In addition to its workplace initiatives, ESPN is committed to reducing the environmental impact of its events, such as College GameDay, ESPYS, espnW Summit, and X Games. This is achieved through waste minimization, the use of renewable resources, environmentally conscious products, and pollution prevention strategies.

Tupperware

 92 71

Environmental protection

Tupperware is actively engaged in environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing waste and minimizing environmental impact. The company has committed to significantly reduce its impact on waste by ensuring waste reduction at every step of the product lifecycle, from design and manufacturing to distribution, consumption, recycling, and recovery. Tupperware has introduced ECO+ material, made from circular polymers derived from mixed single-use plastic waste, as part of its commitment to using sustainably sourced materials. The company has also set ambitious goals, including achieving a 90% absolute reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 2030 at its owned manufacturing facilities and ensuring that by 2025, all Tupperware products will be delivered in compostable or biodegradable packaging. Additionally, Tupperware aims to enhance its return process so that by 2025, 90% of returned products are recycled and repurposed, and has established revised circularity targets, including the elimination of non-recyclable, non-compostable, non-biodegradable, non-reusable plastic packaging for Tupperware products by 2030.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Tupperware's commitment to worker welfare is evident through its adaptation to the COVID-19 pandemic, where the company's independent global sales force successfully adopted digital tools for virtual parties, enabling direct connection with consumers. This shift not only maintained business continuity but also supported the sales force in their entrepreneurial journey. Furthermore, Tupperware has achieved significant representation of women in leadership, with women holding 60% of the companyâs executive and management roles. The company's global corporate giving amounted to $4.24 million in 2020, representing 3.8% of annual net income, demonstrating Tupperware's commitment to supporting its workers and communities.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • 90% absolute reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 2030
    • All Tupperware products to be delivered in compostable or biodegradable packaging by 2025
    • 90% of returned products to be recycled and repurposed by 2025
    • 95% elimination of non-recyclable, non-compostable, non-biodegradable, non-reusable plastic packaging for Tupperware products by 2030

Dial

 92 62

Environmental protection

Dial has implemented several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment and promoting sustainability. Through its partnership with Plastic Bank, Dial is actively involved in preventing plastic waste from entering the oceans. This collaboration enables the collection of plastic waste, which is then transformed into Social PlasticÂ® and used in Dial's refill bottles. Dial's commitment to this cause is projected to prevent over 35 million plastic bottles from entering the ocean in 2023 alone. Additionally, the use of 100% Social PlasticÂ® for Dial Hand Soap refill bottles (excluding the cap) is expected to save over 6.5 million pounds of carbon emissions in 2023 by utilizing post-consumer recycled (PCR) plastic. This effort not only reduces carbon emissions but also promotes the circular economy by reintegrating recycled materials back into the product lifecycle.

Dial has also launched a partnership with TerraCycle to address the recycling of packaging components that are not accepted through traditional curbside recycling programs. This initiative encourages consumers to participate in recycling efforts, further contributing to Dial's environmental sustainability goals. Moreover, Dial's introduction of Concentrated Refills represents an innovative approach to reducing single-use plastic waste. These refills use 95% less plastic compared to traditional soap bottles and are packaged in 100% paper-based materials, with the packets being recyclable through TerraCycle. This initiative is part of Dial's broader commitment to sustainability and reducing its environmental footprint.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dial's sustainability efforts extend to supporting worker welfare, particularly through its partnership with Solidaridad. This collaboration focuses on enabling farmers and workers to earn a living income and produce in harmony with nature. Dial has committed to a three-year grant for a project in Colombia, which aims to provide technical support, training, and financing to help farmers increase their production of RSPO (Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil) certified palm oil. This initiative not only supports environmental sustainability but also ensures the social welfare of farmers by improving their livelihoods and making sustainable farming practices more accessible.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Dial is certified by Leaping Bunny, indicating that its products are cruelty-free and not tested on animals. This certification reflects Dial's commitment to animal welfare and its dedication to producing personal care products that do not contribute to animal suffering.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Leaping Bunny

  • Commitments

    • Preventing over 35 million plastic bottles from entering the ocean in 2023
    • Saving over 6.5 million pounds of carbon emissions in 2023 by using 100% PCR for its refill bottles

Coors

 92 44

Environmental protection

Coors, under its parent company Molson Coors, has made significant strides in environmental sustainability, focusing on packaging, water usage, and climate change. The company has committed to ensuring that by 2025, all consumer-facing packaging will be 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable, with all plastic packaging comprising at least 30% recycled content. A notable initiative is the replacement of plastic rings with 100% recyclable six-pack packaging across Molson Coorsâ North American brands, positioning Coors Light as the largest beer brand in North America to undertake such an initiative. This move is expected to eliminate 1.7 million pounds of plastic from the environment annually, with 400,000 pounds from Coors Light packaging alone.

In terms of water conservation, Coors aims to grow barley with 10% less water and brew beer with 22% less water by 2025 compared to 2016 levels. Additionally, the company is working to boost water availability in stressed watersheds and restore 3.5 billion gallons of water. Coors has also set ambitious goals to reduce CO2 emissions by 50% in direct operations and 20% across its value chain by 2025, relative to 2016 levels.

The company has demonstrated a long-standing commitment to sustainability, highlighted by the introduction of the recyclable aluminum can in 1959 and the nationwide recycling program, Cash for Cans, in the early 1970s. Coors has achieved zero waste to landfill status in all its major Coors Light breweries, with over 99.5% of waste being reused, recycled, or turned into energy. Since 2016, Coors has reduced its carbon footprint in the US by nearly 30%, saving more than 1.6 million metric tons of CO2e, and conserved 1.3 billion gallons of water.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Ensure consumer-facing packaging is 100% reusable, recyclable, or compostable by 2025
    • All plastic packaging to be made from at least 30% recycled content by 2025
    • Replace all plastic rings with 100% recyclable six-pack packaging by 2025
    • Grow Coors barley with 10% less water by 2025
    • Brew beer with 22% less water by 2025
    • Restore 3.5 billion gallons of water by 2025
    • Cut CO2 emissions by 50% in direct operations and 20% across the value chain by 2025

Johnson's Baby

 92 62

Environmental protection

Johnson's Baby has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and reduce its carbon footprint. The company has made changes to its packaging to improve recyclability and reduce waste. In 2020, Johnson's Baby transitioned from pumps to caps on all liquid cleansing products below 500ml in the US, with plans to expand this change globally, significantly reducing the number of pumps reaching landfills each year. Additionally, in 2021, the company revamped its Baby Gift Sets in the US to minimize packaging material and improve recyclability, using at least 75% recycled content. Johnson's Baby is also expanding its assortment of refillable packaging in several key markets to enable bottle reuse and reduce the use of virgin plastic. The company has incorporated recyclability messages onto its bottles and aims to maximize recyclability by converting to fully transparent PET bottles and recyclable pumps by 2025. By 2030, Johnson's Baby aspires to use 100% recycled plastic in its bottles. Furthermore, the company has developed the Global Aquatic Ingredient Assessmentâ¢ (GAIA) process to better understand and manage the impact certain ingredients may have on waterways. This process helps guide decisions on ingredient selection, reformulation, and stewardship policies, with over 1,000 ingredients scored to date. The GAIA process is designed to select ingredients that more easily break down and biodegrade, thereby reducing the environmental impact on waterways. sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health, the parent company of Johnson's Baby, does not conduct animal testing in the research or development of its cosmetic products. The company believes that its cosmetic products can be validated as safe and effective without compromising animal welfare. However, it acknowledges that some countries still require animal testing data to meet their regulatory requirements. Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health is investing in advancing non-animal testing methods and supports efforts to eliminate the testing of cosmetic products or ingredients on animals globally. The company's commitment to non-animal testing methods dates back 30 years, with its scientists being among the first to replace animal eye irritancy testing. This was incorporated into the JOHNSON'SÂ® NO MORE TEARSÂ® claim substantiation. Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health has also been instrumental in developing industry principles to inform legislative bans on cosmetic animal testing globally and continues to collaborate with legislators, NGOs, and industry peers to support efforts to ban cosmetic animal testing worldwide. sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Maximizing recyclability by converting to fully transparent PET bottles and recyclable pumps by 2025
    • Expanding refillable packaging to the US
    • Aspiring to use 100% recycled plastic in bottles by 2030

Hilton

 92 61

Environmental protection

Hilton is actively engaged in environmental protection and sustainability efforts, focusing on climate action and destination stewardship with the goal of achieving a net-zero future. The company has implemented the LightStay system since 2009 to measure, report, and improve its environmental impact across its global portfolio. Hilton has set science-based targets to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in alignment with the Paris Agreement, making it the first major hotel company to do so. These efforts are part of Hilton's broader commitment to reduce its environmental footprint through programs focused on energy efficiency (Watts), water stewardship (Water), and waste reduction (Waste). Notably, the Hotel Marcel New Haven, part of the Tapestry Collection by Hilton, opened in 2022 as the first net-zero carbon emissions hotel in the U.S. Hilton aims to reduce its Scope 1 and 2 carbon intensity by 61% by 2030, decrease water use intensity by 50% by 2030 while implementing 20 community water projects, and cut its waste by 50% by 2030, promoting recycling, composting, and other waste diversion methods.

sources: 1

  • Commitments

    • Decrease water use intensity by 50% by 2030
    • Implement 20 community water projects by 2030
    • Reduce waste by 50% by 2030

CoverGirl

 92 50

Environmental protection

CoverGirl has taken significant steps towards environmental sustainability, particularly in its packaging initiatives. The brand announced a major reduction in plastic use within its iconic Clean Pressed Powder Collection, achieving a 35% reduction in plastic per compact. This initiative is part of CoverGirl's broader commitment to responsible beauty and making clean beauty accessible and affordable. The brand has also launched products with sustainability in mind, such as the Lash Blast Clean Mascara, which features packaging made from 80% recycled paper from well-managed forests. These efforts reflect CoverGirl's dedication to continuously evolve its products to meet the highest standards of clean beauty without sacrificing quality, aligning with the conscious beauty consumer's values.

sources: 1

Nothing found

Animal welfare

CoverGirl is committed to animal welfare, as evidenced by its Leaping Bunny approval by Cruelty Free International. This certification is a gold standard for cosmetics, personal care, and household product brands committed to eliminating animal testing from their supply chains. CoverGirl underwent a rigorous independent audit of its global supply chain to ensure all products and ingredients comply with the strict criteria set by Cruelty Free International. This certification covers all CoverGirl cosmetic products, demonstrating the brand's commitment to cruelty-free beauty standards worldwide.

American Eagle Outfitters

 92 54

Environmental protection

American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on sustainable materials and reducing water and carbon footprints. The company's "REAL Good" badge identifies products made from sustainable raw materials like recycled fibers or those manufactured using sustainable techniques, such as water reduction and recycling in factories that align with AEO's Water Leadership Program. AEO's commitment to environmental sustainability extends to its use of Better Cotton, recycled cotton, polyester, and nylon, organic cotton, and sustainably sourced man-made cellulosics. The company also employs solution dying and natural dyes to reduce water usage and dependency on synthetic chemicals. In 2016, AEO joined the Sustainable Apparel Coalition, utilizing the Higg Index to measure the environmental impacts of factory operations. AEO has set comprehensive sustainability goals, including becoming carbon neutral by 2030, focusing on water and energy reduction, and using more sustainable raw materials. These efforts are part of AEO's broader strategy to accelerate sustainability improvements across its operations.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

AEO is committed to enhancing worker well-being, environmental responsibility, and supplier ownership through its factory monitoring programs and key initiatives. The company partners with over 300 factories in more than 20 countries, focusing on developing trusted relationships with suppliers to ensure responsible apparel manufacturing. AEO's comprehensive Supplier Code of Conduct is based on internationally accepted standards, including the International Labor Organization's core conventions and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. This code is used collaboratively with factory partners to meet AEO's requirements, emphasizing the company's commitment to responsible sourcing and creating products that align with its values and purpose.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

    • Sustainable Apparel Coalition member
  • Commitments
    • Carbon neutral by 2030
    • Water reduction focus
    • Energy reduction focus
    • Use of more sustainable raw materials

Dockers

 92 57

Environmental protection

Dockers is actively engaged in environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing water usage and incorporating recycled materials into their products. The brand has developed Water<LessÂ®, a suite of water-saving techniques that significantly reduce the amount of water required in the dyeing and finishing processes of their clothing. This innovative approach has enabled Dockers to save over 3 billion liters of water. Additionally, Dockers has partnered with Waves For Water, an organization focused on providing clean water to communities affected by water scarcity, demonstrating a commitment to addressing global water issues beyond their production processes.

Dockers also emphasizes the use of recycled materials in their products. They incorporate RepreveÂ® fibers, made from recycled plastic bottles, into their fabrics. This not only reduces waste but also lessens the environmental impact of their products. Furthermore, Dockers utilizes sustainable fibers such as TENCELâ¢ Lyocell, derived from sustainably sourced natural wood, and LENZINGâ¢ ECOVEROâ¢ viscose, which has a smaller carbon footprint compared to generic viscose. These efforts highlight Dockers' commitment to innovation and style while being responsible stewards of the environment.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dockers demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives and partnerships. The brand is involved with the Stonewall Community Foundation, investing in the LGBTQ+ community and supporting small, grassroots nonprofits. This partnership reflects Dockers' commitment to social justice and equality. Additionally, Dockers encourages its employees to engage in community service, offering paid time off for volunteering and matching employee donations to organizations year-round. This approach fosters a culture of giving back and supports the well-being of communities where Dockers operates.

Moreover, Dockers is part of the Levi Strauss & Co. Worker Well-being (WWB) initiative, which aims to improve the health and well-being of workers in their supply chain. This initiative is based on the premise that worker satisfaction and engagement lead to better business performance. Over the past decade, Dockers has launched well-being programs across its global supply chain, reaching over 200,000 workers, the majority of whom are women. These efforts underscore Dockers' commitment to advancing worker welfare both within and outside their organization.

Heineken

 92 51

Environmental protection

Heineken has made significant strides in environmental protection, particularly in carbon emissions reduction and water stewardship. The company has achieved an 18% reduction in absolute carbon emissions in scopes 1 and 2 since 2018, aligning with its goal to become net-zero by 2030 in its own production and by 2040 across its full value chain. Additionally, Heineken has initiated water balancing projects in 26 of its 31 sites located in water-stressed areas, with 29% of these sites now fully balanced. This demonstrates Heineken's commitment to not only reducing its carbon footprint but also to responsible water use in its operations.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Heineken is actively working to ensure the welfare of its workers through various initiatives. The company has assessed 100% of its operating companies for equal pay for equal work, with actions in place to close any identified gaps by 2023. Furthermore, Heineken is committed to ensuring that all its employees worldwide earn at least a fair wage by 2023. So far, 99.96% of its operating companies are compliant with this goal. A fair wage, as defined by Heineken, often exceeds the minimum wage and covers basic needs for the employee and their family, including food, housing, education, healthcare, transportation, discretionary income, and savings.

sources: 1

    • Increase the percentage of women in senior management positions to at least 30% by 2025 and 40% by 2030
    • Ensure all employees worldwide earn at least a fair wage by 2023

IBM

IBM's commitment to environmental leadership is evident in its efforts to reduce negative environmental impacts through the application of science, technology, and innovation. The company's approach includes the use of hybrid cloud and AI technologies to address environmental issues and support communities in adapting to climate change and building resilience. Additionally, IBM's consulting services are designed to help clients integrate sustainability into their operations, emphasizing the importance of responsible computing and green IT strategies. These efforts are part of IBM's broader strategy to embed sustainability solutions into an organization's operations and culture, demonstrating a commitment to advancing the quadruple bottom line of being responsible, equitable, and viable.

Claritin

 92 58

Environmental protection

Claritin has initiated the DiversiTree Project in partnership with the Arbor Day Foundation, focusing on planting female trees to help reduce pollen levels in the environment. This effort is based on the understanding that female trees do not produce pollen and can help balance the pollen levels by receiving pollen released by male trees. The project began with the establishment of the first female forest in Forest Hill Park, Richmond, Virginia, one of the cities worst affected by allergies in 2022. The initiative aims to restore botanical balance by reducing pollen levels through the strategic planting of female trees, such as Juniper, Red Maple, Aspen, and Gingko. This environmental effort not only addresses the issue of rising pollen levels, which are expected to double by 2040, but also contributes to the broader goal of creating healthier outdoor spaces for the community.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Planting female trees to help reduce pollen levels and restore botanical balance, starting with the first female forest in Forest Hill Park, Richmond Virginia.

Land Rover

 92 55

Environmental protection

Land Rover is actively working to reduce its environmental impact through various initiatives. The company has committed to offsetting 100% of its manufacturing assembly emissions by investing in carbon finance projects globally, such as supporting the distribution of LifeStraw water filters in Kenya. Land Rover is also focused on sustainable manufacturing, aiming to maximize efficiency and minimize waste across its operations. This includes significant reductions in water usage, energy consumption, and waste to landfill. Additionally, Land Rover is working on reducing emissions by modifying factory processes and logistics, and investing in new products, facilities, research, and development. The company has made strides in using more sustainable materials, such as natural rubber, recycled aluminum, and plastics, and is committed to lightweighting its vehicles to improve fuel efficiency.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Land Rover has demonstrated a commitment to social responsibility by supporting local and global communities through various projects. The company's 2020 Global Corporate Social Responsibility programme focuses on humanitarian & health, education, design, technology & talent, and environment & conservation projects. Land Rover also runs an award-winning apprenticeship programme that attracts young people to start careers in automotive design, engineering, and technology, offering them the opportunity to earn while they learn and potentially secure job opportunities globally.

Nokia aims to be a leader in energy efficiency in silicon, software, and systems, and is working on improving product circularity by introducing more recycled content into new products and expanding circular product offerings to customers. In 2023, Nokia achieved its renewable energy target of 75% across its facilities and reduced the average power consumption of its mMimo 5G base station by 50%. Additionally, Nokia has engaged in partnerships and initiatives to support biodiversity and geodiversity, including a co-funded tenure-track professorship at the University of JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤ and participation in the UN Global Compact Finland SBTN working group.

Whole Foods Market

 92 57

Environmental protection

Whole Foods Market has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on waste reduction and responsible sourcing. The company has successfully kept more than 72 percent of waste produced at its stores and facilities out of landfills. This achievement is supported by maintaining recycling programs at nearly 96 percent of its stores and implementing organic diversion programs, such as composting, at nearly 450 of its stores in 2022. Additionally, Whole Foods Market is committed to reducing its carbon footprint and consciously sourcing products. In 2022, the company onboarded more than 2,300 new organic products, bringing the total to over 37,000 active organic products available across its stores. These efforts are part of Whole Foods Market's broader sustainability strategy, which includes combatting food waste and consciously sourcing products to minimize environmental impact.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Whole Foods Market has demonstrated a strong commitment to supporting its team members' growth and wellbeing. In 2022, the company graduated more than 1,360 team members from career development programs and celebrated over 10,200 team member promotions. These initiatives are part of Whole Foods Market's efforts to provide meaningful career advancement opportunities for its employees. Additionally, the company's Local Producer Loan Program awarded nearly $1.7 million to local suppliers last year, and its Local and Emerging Accelerator Program (LEAP) inducted nine new participants. These programs not only support the professional development of Whole Foods Market's team members but also contribute to the growth and success of local suppliers and emerging businesses.

Bacardi

 92 53

Environmental protection

Bacardi has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on sustainable sourcing, ocean conservation, cleaner energy, water management, and biodiversity. The company sources 100% of its sugarcane sustainably for its Caribbean rum production. In partnership with Beneath the Waves, Bacardi is actively involved in ocean conservation efforts, particularly in protecting blue carbon seagrass spaces and preserving shark populations. The company has made significant strides in energy efficiency, with 95% of steam from distillation reused to create cleaner energy, and generating its own biogas to power 60% of its distillery's energy needs. Additionally, Bacardi's distillery and bottle sites are certified by the Wildlife Habitat Council, demonstrating their commitment to biodiversity. The company also repurposes its barrels as Bomba drums in Puerto Rico, contributing to community sustainability efforts.

sources: 1, 2

Bloomingdale's

 92 45

Environmental protection

Bloomingdale's is actively working towards a more sustainable future through various initiatives. They offer a range of sustainable fashions and eco-friendly products that are independently certified as responsibly produced. These products include items made or packaged using certified recycled, repurposed, organic, or responsibly sourced materials to reduce environmental impact. Bloomingdale's also focuses on products designed for less waste, such as refillable, reusable, and Cradle to Cradle certified items. Additionally, they provide products made safer or cruelty-free, avoiding hazardous chemicals or animal cruelty and testing. Their efforts extend to responsibly produced goods, ensuring safe labor practices and responsible management of natural resources. Bloomingdale's sustainability efforts are highlighted in their Sustainable & Mindful Shop, which features products across various categories, including fashion, handbags, shoes, kids, jewelry & accessories, and home items, all aimed at reducing carbon footprint and eliminating single-use plastic products contributing to ocean-bound plastic.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Animal welfare

Bloomingdale's commitment to sustainability includes offering products that are made safer or cruelty-free. This includes items created without using hazardous chemicals or animal cruelty and testing. They feature certifications such as the Responsible Down Standard (RDS), Responsible Wool Standard (RWS), Leaping Bunny, Certified Vegan, GreenGuardâ¢, and OEKO-TEXÂ® STANDARD 100, which promote the health and welfare of animals used in their products or services and/or minimize animal suffering.

Procter & Gamble

 92 62

Environmental protection

Procter & Gamble (P&G) has set ambitious environmental sustainability goals under its Ambition 2030 initiative, focusing on climate, waste, water, and nature. The company aims to achieve net zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across its operations and supply chain by 2040. This includes the entire lifecycle emissions of its products and packaging, from raw material to retailer. P&G is also committed to designing all its consumer packaging to be recyclable or reusable by 2030 and is working on new recycling solutions and using alternative materials to keep plastic out of nature. In terms of water sustainability, P&G has set goals to restore more water than is consumed at its manufacturing sites in 18 water-stressed areas around the world by 2030. Additionally, the company is focused on the long-term health of natural ecosystems, ensuring responsible sourcing of key commodities like wood pulp, palm oil, and paper packaging, and investing in nature-based solutions to impact more than 1.5 million acres of land.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Nothing found

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Achieve net zero greenhouse gas emissions across operations and supply chain by 2040
    • Design all consumer packaging to be recyclable or reusable by 2030
    • Restore more water than is consumed at manufacturing sites in 18 water-stressed areas by 2030

Michelob Ultra

Maybelline

 92 57

Environmental protection

Maybelline has launched the "Conscious Together" program, focusing on creating a more responsible business model with a significant emphasis on environmental protection. The program includes initiatives like "Conscious Packaging," where Maybelline has committed to using recycled materials in their products. Since 2018, they have replaced 600 tons of virgin plastic with recycled plastic. By 2030, Maybelline aims for all its plastic packaging to be made from 100% recycled plastic, with 3.5% of all packaging already meeting this goal in 2022.

In terms of "Conscious Production," Maybelline is transitioning its manufacturing sites to use 100% renewable energy. This shift includes implementing energy efficiency measures such as LED lighting, high-efficiency compressors, LEED certification, and the use of renewable energy sources like solar panels and biomass. The goal is for all owned manufacturing sites to be powered by renewable energy by 2025, with 50% already achieving this in 2022.

The "Conscious Formula" initiative aims to make Maybelline's products less impactful on the planet. By 2030, 95% of Maybelline's ingredients will be bio-based, derived from abundant minerals, or produced through circular processes. As of 2022, 32% of ingredients meet these criteria.

Maybelline is also addressing the challenge of cosmetic waste through its "Conscious Disposal" efforts. The company is investing in the development of makeup recycling technologies and expanding takeback programs globally. In 2022, they collected 50 tons of empty product across seven countries.

Additionally, Maybelline has partnered with The Recycling Partnership to launch the Small Town Access Fund, aiming to improve recycling access for communities with populations under 50,000. This initiative is expected to impact over 49 thousand households by reducing contamination in recycling bins and capturing more than 3,500 tons of recyclables.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • By 2030, all Maybelline New York plastic packaging will be made from 100% recycled plastic
    • By 2025, all owned manufacturing sites producing Maybelline New York products will use 100% renewable energy
    • By 2030, 95% of Maybelline ingredients will be bio-based, derived from abundant minerals or circular processes

DiGiorno

 92 63

Environmental protection

DiGiorno is actively engaging in environmental protection through its support for regenerative agriculture practices. The company is providing both financial and technical resources to assist wheat farmers in adopting these practices, which are designed to conserve and restore farmland and its ecosystem. Regenerative agriculture practices include planting cover crops, reducing or eliminating tillage, and minimizing the use of pesticides. These methods aim to enhance soil quality, reduce water usage, and increase biodiversity. DiGiorno's efforts are focused on over 100,000 acres of land, nearly double the amount required to grow the wheat used in their pizzas. The ultimate goal of these initiatives is to protect and restore soil, water, and biodiversity, thereby helping to reduce the impacts of climate change.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Working to protect and restore soil, water, and biodiversity
    • Help reduce the impacts of climate change

Baby Ruth

Tampax

 92 50

Environmental protection

Tampax is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through several initiatives focused on sustainable sourcing, waste reduction, and energy use. The company emphasizes the responsible sourcing of materials, particularly cotton, which is a primary component of their tampons. Tampax uses ingredients like responsibly grown cotton and ensures the traceability of the organic cotton used in their Tampax Pure products through blockchain technology. This allows consumers to trace the cotton from the field to the finished product. Tampax has committed to using 30% sustainable materials in their products and verifies their material sources with third-party certifications such as the Forest Stewardship Council, Global Organic Textile Standard, and has received the OEKO-TEX seal, ensuring that every component of the tampon has been tested for harmful substances.

In terms of waste reduction, Tampax has made significant strides in minimizing manufacturing waste sent to landfills. Since 2009, as part of P&G Fem Care brands, Tampax has avoided sending more than 340,000 tons of manufacturing waste to landfills. The company also utilizes recycled material for their cartons and ensures that nearly all of their packaging is recyclable, contingent on the existence of local recycling programs. Additionally, Tampax and its suppliers are committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 30% in the next five years. The brand also supports the use of renewable electricity, either directly powering their sites with renewable sources or matching their energy use with renewable electricity credits. Tampax continues to explore ways to innovate with less environmental impact across their products, packaging, and supply chain.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Forest Stewardship Council
    • Global Organic Textile Standard
    • OEKO-TEX seal
  • Commitments
    • Using 30% sustainable materials in products
    • Reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 30% in the next 5 years

Nerds

 92 59

Environmental protection

NerdRabbit has taken significant steps to protect the environment through various initiatives aimed at reducing their carbon footprint and supporting climate-positive projects. They have partnered with Green Places to assess, reduce, and offset greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions generated from their business operations. This partnership has led to NerdRabbit being certified as carbon neutral, indicating that for all the carbon emissions they have not yet eliminated, they invest in high-quality carbon-negative projects to offset their footprint. They conduct annual carbon assessments to identify their total annual emissions, both direct and indirect, enabling them to take action to operate more sustainably. Additionally, NerdRabbit supports several climate-positive projects around the world, including refrigerant reclamation through Hudson Technologies, the Paradigm cookstoves project providing services in Africa's poorest markets, and the Pacajai REDD+ rainforest project in Brazil aimed at preventing deforestation. These efforts showcase NerdRabbit's commitment to environmental protection and their active role in tackling climate change.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • Carbon neutral certified
  • Commitments
    • Planting a tree for every qualified job seeker or company that signs up for Nerdly, with a goal of planting 10,000 trees

Mary Kay

 92 40

Environmental protection

Mary Kay has implemented several initiatives under its "Pink Doing Green" program to enhance its environmental sustainability. The company has achieved LEED certification for new building projects, demonstrating a commitment to environmentally responsible construction and operation. Mary Kay has also focused on reducing operational waste sent to landfills and has planted over a million trees to support carbon reduction efforts. Additionally, the company has improved water efficiency in its manufacturing facilities. These actions reflect Mary Kay's broader commitment to sustainability, which includes reducing the negative environmental impacts of its products and packaging, and responsibly using water and ethically sourced resources.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Mary Kay has made significant strides in ensuring worker welfare through various initiatives. The company has garnered 13 employer/great place to work awards and was ranked #8 on the list of "The Companies Employees Donât Want to Leave," according to Resume.io. Mary Kay has also released gender diversity data, revealing that its executive team is 54% female, managers and above are 59% female, and 62% of the total workforce is female. In 2021, Mary Kay scored 75% in employee engagement, which is 10% over the global average for employee engagement. These efforts are part of Mary Kay's broader commitment to business excellence, which includes making ethical decisions, being transparent about business practices, and taking accountability for its conduct as a global corporate citizen.

sources: 1, 2

La-Z-Boy

 92 68

Environmental protection

La-Z-Boy is actively engaged in various initiatives to minimize its environmental impact and promote sustainability. The company has integrated environmentally friendly and sustainable practices across its operations, focusing on waste reduction, recycling, energy efficiency, and resource conservation. La-Z-Boy has adopted the Enhancing Furnitureâs Environmental Culture (EFEC) management program at its North American manufacturing facilities, aiming to reduce its environmental footprint. This program includes training for employees on environmental management and the development of eco-plans for energy, water, and waste reduction.

The company's commitment to environmental protection is also evident in its use of renewable energy sources. For instance, its Severn, Maryland store sources approximately 70% of its energy needs from rooftop solar panels. Additionally, La-Z-Boy's World Headquarters and Dayton, Tennessee Innovation Center have achieved LEED Silver Certification, reflecting their energy-efficient design and operation.

La-Z-Boy monitors greenhouse gas emissions at its U.S. facilities and has implemented a biomass system at its Dayton facility, which uses wood offal to heat and cool the facility. The company's water conservation efforts have led to a 28% reduction in water usage by its branded manufacturing operations compared to Fiscal 2016. La-Z-Boy also prioritizes the sourcing of domestic plantation wood and compliance with the Lacey Act for imported woods to minimize deforestation.

In terms of waste management, La-Z-Boy has eliminated approximately 12.6 million pounds of landfill waste compared to Fiscal 2007, with eight of its facilities achieving zero waste to landfill status. The company recycles or reuses 96% of its non-hazardous waste.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • EFEC registration and implementation of the EFEC environmental management program at manufacturing facilities

Palmolive

 92 62

Environmental protection

Colgate-Palmolive has made significant strides in environmental protection as part of its 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy. The company has committed to eliminating one-third of its new (virgin) plastics and ensuring all of its plastic packaging is recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2025. Additionally, it aims to achieve Net Zero water usage at its manufacturing sites in water-stressed areas by 2025 and across all sites by 2030. Colgate-Palmolive is also accelerating its action on climate change with a target to achieve Net Zero carbon emissions across its value chain by 2040 and to use 100% renewable electricity for its global operations by 2030. The company has reduced absolute greenhouse gas emissions by approximately 37.5% from 2002-2020 and its water use per ton of production by 52%. Furthermore, 21 of its manufacturing facilities have achieved TRUE Zero Waste certification, and it operates 19 facilities with 27 LEED certifications globally. These efforts underscore Colgate-Palmolive's commitment to driving sustainable sourcing and operating high-efficiency, low-impact, zero waste facilities.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Colgate-Palmolive's 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy includes initiatives aimed at enhancing worker welfare. The company seeks to inspire its employees to make a difference by valuing their contributions and sharing in the success created together. This approach is designed to motivate and enable employees to reach their full potential and perform at their best every day. Additionally, Colgate-Palmolive is committed to creating a more inclusive world by ensuring all employees feel they belong and are supported to achieve their potential. The company is driving representation across all organizational levels with a focused effort to achieve parity with labor force availability.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Colgate-Palmolive's commitment to animal welfare is evident in its goal to foster lifelong relationships between pets and people. Through the Hill's Food, Shelter & Love program, the company aims to find adoption homes for 15 million shelter pets. This initiative supports global shelter partners with resources and premium nutrition, demonstrating Colgate-Palmolive's dedication to improving the lives of animals.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • TRUE Zero Waste certification
    • LEED certification
  • Commitments
    • Eliminate one-third of new (virgin) plastics by 2025
    • Make all plastic packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2025
    • Achieve Net Zero water at manufacturing sites in water-stressed areas by 2025 and across all sites by 2030
    • Achieve Net Zero carbon emissions across the value chain by 2040
    • Use 100% renewable electricity for global operations by 2030
    • Find adoption homes for 15 million shelter pets through the Hill's Food, Shelter & Love program

SiriusXM

 92 49

Environmental protection

SiriusXM is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts aimed at minimizing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainability. The company is committed to protecting natural resources, establishing clean business practices, and evaluating actions to minimize or eliminate adverse environmental impacts from its operations. SiriusXM's environmental commitments include minimizing negative environmental impacts, integrating sound environmental practices into its business operations, reducing emissions, increasing energy efficiency, using renewable energy, reducing waste, conserving resources, recycling materials, and raising environmental awareness among its employees. Additionally, SiriusXM has established a Supplier Code of Conduct that sets expectations for suppliers to comply with environmental laws, reduce their carbon footprint, and develop environmentally friendly technologies. The company is also exploring opportunities to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions, including sourcing renewable energy. Efforts to improve the environmental impact of its operations include using VI efficiency rated AC power supplies, reducing packaging size, and ensuring proper recycling of customer radios and electronic waste. SiriusXM complies with various environmental regulations and standards, such as ROHS, REACH, and the Toxic Substances Control Act, and participates in the Illinois EPA e-Waste law to prevent electronic waste from reaching landfills.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

SiriusXM is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where diversity is valued, respected, supported, and celebrated. The company focuses on recruiting, retaining, developing, and advancing a diverse and talented workforce, with an emphasis on increasing women and minority representation at all levels of the organization. SiriusXM engages in sponsorships of professional conferences focused on diverse talent to recruit in diverse communities. The company's efforts to create an engaging environment for its employees are part of its broader commitment to social responsibility, which includes being a platform for diverse perspectives and facilitating dialogue on various issues. SiriusXM's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) is central to its corporate culture and informs its decision-making and actions.

sources: 1, 2

Under Armour

 92 62

Environmental protection

Under Armour is actively working to reduce the environmental impact of its products and operations. The company's sustainability strategy focuses on embracing material innovations to enable less waste and more durability, aiming for circular systems by 2030. Under Armour is committed to using only recycled polyester in its apparel and accessories by 2030, with a goal of reaching at least 35% by 2025. Additionally, the company aims to make the uppers in its highest volume footwear series with at least 50% recycled or bio-based materials by 2030. Under Armour has also set a goal to reduce single-use plastic brand product packaging by 75%, with a 50% reduction target by 2023. In terms of fiber shedding, Under Armour aims for 75% of its fabrics to be made of low-shed materials by 2030. The company is working towards eliminating 100% of fluorine durable water repellents (DWR) in its products by 2025 and is exploring biocide-free anti-odor technology to replace metal-based antimicrobial finishes. Under Armour's dye innovations focus on using fewer chemicals and less water while achieving better colors, including the use of solution-dyed fabric for environmental benefits. The company has also set ambitious goals to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) footprint and source renewable energy to reach net zero emissions by 2050, with an interim goal of reducing absolute scope 1, 2, and 3 GHG emissions by 30% by 2030. Under Armour is advancing low-impact manufacturing and greener chemistry to support healthier people and nature, aiming to scale innovative water-saving materials and technologies to at least 25% of its purchased materials by 2025.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Under Armour is championing its teammates and communities through various initiatives aimed at supporting diversity, equity, and inclusion, community impact, and worker well-being. The company has achieved 42% female representation in director and above positions and continues to advance diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Under Armour has impacted an estimated 152,000 youth through community engagement programs to increase access to sports globally. Additionally, the company has launched pilot programs to offer additional protection and support to workers in its supply chain, adopting a diversified audit approach and conducting regular factory assessments at 94% of Tier 1 suppliers. These efforts demonstrate Under Armour's commitment to ensuring the welfare of its workers and contributing positively to the communities it operates in.

sources: 1, 3

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • By 2030, use only recycled polyester in apparel and accessories, reaching at least 35% by 2025.
    • By 2030, the uppers in our highest volume footwear series will be made with at least 50% recycled or bio-based materials.
    • By 2025, reduce single-use plastic brand product packaging by 75%, 50% by 2023.
    • By 2030, 75% of fabric will be made of low-shed materials.
    • By 2030, reduce absolute scope 1, 2, and 3 GHG emissions by 30%, with net zero emissions by 2050.
    • By 2030, increase renewable electricity in owned and operated facilities to 100%, with an interim goal of 80% by 2025.
    • By 2025, scale innovative water-saving materials and technologies to at least 25% of our purchased materials and achieve 20% water savings at strategic mills and Tier 1 suppliers with wet processes.
    • By 2025, eliminate 100% of biocides and fluorine DWR in our products.
    • By 2025, reduce solvent use to cut the volatile organic compounds (VOC) impact of our footwear by 30%.
    • By 2030, reduce the environmental impact of our materials (measured by MSI score) by 50%.
    • By 2025, 100% of cotton will come from low-impact sources, with 100% traceably sourced by 2022.
