Jack in the Box

 92 51

Environmental protection

Jack in the Box is actively working towards enhancing its environmental sustainability, particularly in the areas of packaging and energy management. The company has set a goal to reduce the amount of virgin plastic in its packaging by 20% below 2020 levels by 2030. As of June 2023, approximately 8% of its packaging was comprised of virgin plastic, maintaining the same percentage as in June 2020. Additionally, the majority of its fiber packaging material, approximately 85.3%, is now produced from recycled or certified sustainable sources. The company is also transitioning towards 100% PFAs-free packaging systemwide in 2023. Furthermore, Jack in the Box's San Diego corporate office is generating significant solar electricity, contributing to the community grid, and has implemented energy-efficient practices such as transitioning to LED lighting and installing electric vehicle charging stations. These efforts underscore the company's commitment to reducing its environmental footprint and contributing to a greener future.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Jack in the Box is committed to supporting its employees through competitive wages, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for growth and development. The company offers industry-aligned compensation and innovative features like JACKâs DailyPay. Its benefits package includes health insurance, wellness initiatives, pet insurance, a generous leave policy, and a Tuition Reimbursement Program. Jack in the Box places a high priority on safety, upheld by its rigorous Injury and Illness Prevention Program, ensuring a healthy and secure workplace for all employees. Additionally, the company is enhancing diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEI&B) with specialized training for People Managers, promoting inclusivity at cultural events, and conducting comprehensive demographic analysis. These efforts demonstrate Jack in the Box's commitment to fostering an environment where employees can thrive and succeed.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Jack in the Box is making strides in animal welfare through its sourcing practices. The company ensures that approximately 84% of its eggs are sourced from cage-free environments, reflecting its commitment to improved animal welfare standards. Additionally, Jack in the Box is working towards enhancing animal welfare in its pork supply chain. These efforts are part of the company's broader commitment to ethical sourcing and strict adherence to Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) standards, ensuring the health and welfare of animals used in their products.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Reduce the amount of virgin plastic in packaging 20% below 2020 levels by 2030
    • Transition to 100% PFAs-free packaging systemwide in 2023

Fiat

 92 49

Environmental protection

Fiat, under its parent company Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA), has made significant strides in environmental protection and sustainability. The company has focused on reducing its environmental footprint across its manufacturing plants worldwide. Since 2010, FCA has achieved a 27% reduction in CO2 emissions, a 38% reduction in water usage, and a 62% reduction in waste generated. Notably, FCA operates three carbon-neutral plants in Brazil and has 63 plants worldwide that send zero waste to landfill. Additionally, the company boasts a 99% recycling water index at its plants globally. Fiat's commitment to sustainable mobility is evident in its investment of 3.5 billion euros in research and development in 2018, with a significant focus on autonomous driving, vehicle connectivity, and electrification. By 2022, Fiat plans to offer 30 nameplates with electrified propulsion systems, including battery electric, plug-in hybrid electric, full hybrid, and mild hybrid options. This commitment was showcased at the 2019 Geneva International Auto Show with the presentation of electrified versions of JeepÂ® Renegade and Compass, as well as the Alfa RomeoÂ® Tonale and FiatÂ® Concept Centoventi concept cars. Fiat's dedication to environmental protection is further highlighted by its transition to a fully electrified product range from July 2022, ensuring all its vehicles will have some form of electrification, aligning with the company's vision of sustainable mobility for all.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Fiat, through its parent company FCA, demonstrates a strong commitment to worker welfare and community engagement. The company emphasizes the importance of positively impacting its stakeholders, including approximately 192,000 employees, dealers, suppliers, and customers. FCA's approach to worker welfare includes providing 1.7 million hours of training to its employees, fostering a diverse and inclusive working environment, and being the only automaker listed on the Thomson Reuters Diversity and Inclusion Index. Additionally, FCA has been recognized as one of the Top 50 U.S. Companies for Hispanic Women by Latina Style magazine. The company's commitment extends to community involvement, with employees volunteering over 174,000 hours and the company committing 24 million euros to benefit local communities, including 8 million euros dedicated to education with a focus on STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math). These efforts reflect FCA's dedication to improving the livelihoods of its employees and fostering vitality among communities.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Achieve a fully electrified product range from July 2022
    • Launch a new vehicle every year starting in 2023, each with an electric motor, to achieve a fully electric lineup by 2027

Best Western

 92 55

Environmental protection

Best Western Hotels Italy and Malta are actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at promoting environmental sustainability within their operations. These efforts include enhancing energy efficiency, reducing the use of single-use plastics, monitoring and limiting CO2 emissions, and improving accessibility and inclusivity. A significant part of their environmental strategy is the "Stay for the Planet" program, which adheres to standards set by the Global Sustainable Tourism Council (GSTC). This program focuses on reducing the environmental impact of the hotel industry through the promotion of sustainable practices and the implementation of a system to monitor and improve the environmental and social performance of participating hotels. The sustainability rating, developed by LifeGate's scientific committee, evaluates hotels on energy consumption, water usage, waste management, procurement practices, and behaviors towards sustainability, assigning a score from 1 to 5 leaves based on their performance. This initiative is a cornerstone of Best Western's commitment to responsible hospitality and is detailed in their first ESG Report, highlighting their efforts to build positive relationships with stakeholders and reduce the impact of their activities on the environment.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

The "Stay for the Planet" program by Best Western Hotels Italy and Malta also includes a focus on "People," which is dedicated to implementing best practices in hotels related to staff development, accessibility, and inclusivity. This initiative indicates a commitment to ensuring the welfare of their workers by fostering an environment that supports their growth and accommodates diverse needs. By integrating these practices into their sustainability efforts, Best Western demonstrates an understanding of the importance of worker welfare in achieving a responsible hospitality model.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Global Sustainable Tourism Council (GSTC)
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Jawbreakers

 92 50

Environmental protection

Jawbreakers has outlined a sustainability strategy that includes a focus on minimizing their environmental impact. They have taken steps to ensure that their products are designed and built to last, moving away from the fast-fashion model and aiming for longevity in the wardrobe. Their commitment to environmental sustainability is further demonstrated by their practice of repurposing fabric offcuts to ensure nothing is wasted and manufacturing in small quantities to avoid excess stock. Additionally, Jawbreakers has a policy against using real leather, fur, feathers, or buttons made from any part of an animal, which not only supports animal welfare but also reduces their environmental footprint by avoiding materials that are typically resource-intensive to produce.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Jawbreakers places a strong emphasis on ethical trading and the welfare of workers both within their own operations and across their supply chain. They have made a clear commitment to combating modern slavery and human trafficking by ensuring that their supply chains are free from such practices. This is achieved through regular in-person visits to suppliers to inspect working conditions and ensure compliance with their standards. In the UK, warehouse staff are paid above the London living wage, and the company avoids setting unreasonable production targets or performance goals. Furthermore, all clothing is designed in-house and produced within a known supply chain, allowing for greater transparency and control over the working conditions and practices of those involved in the production of their garments.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Jawbreakers has made a clear commitment to animal welfare as part of their sustainability strategy. They pledge never to use real leather, fur, feathers, or buttons made from any part of an animal in their products. This policy not only supports animal welfare by avoiding materials that involve animal suffering but also aligns with their environmental goals by choosing more sustainable material alternatives. By taking these steps, Jawbreakers demonstrates a commitment to minimizing animal suffering and promoting the health of animals indirectly involved in their products.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Commitment to never use real leather, fur, feather, or buttons made from any part of an animal.
    • Commitment to ensuring no modern slavery or human trafficking in their supply chains or any part of their business.

Aldi

 92 66

Environmental protection

Aldi is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives, focusing on sustainable packaging, waste and recovery, deforestation, and the sourcing of products like fish, seafood, coffee, cocoa, and cotton. The company is dedicated to reducing its environmental impact by minimizing packaging and increasing recyclability. Aldi is also committed to responsibly sourcing wood, paper products, and other resources to support sustainable forest management. Furthermore, Aldi works with farmers to promote socially and environmentally sustainable practices within its supply chain and incorporates responsibly sourced cotton in all relevant textile products. The company has established an Animal Welfare Policy to ensure the well-being of animals in its supply chain and supports the pollinator population, particularly honeybees, by considering the views of various stakeholders. Aldi's commitment to environmental protection is evident in its efforts to reduce operational waste, improve packaging recyclability, and responsibly source many of its branded items.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Aldi is committed to ensuring safe and fair workplace practices throughout its supply chain. The company's dedication to worker welfare is part of its broader corporate sustainability efforts, which prioritize customer and employee safety, health, and well-being. Aldi's approach to sustainability includes incorporating sustainable business practices that not only benefit the environment but also support the welfare of its workers. By focusing on sustainable production and offering high-quality products at affordable prices, Aldi demonstrates its commitment to protecting the planet and ensuring the well-being of its employees and customers alike.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Aldi has established an Animal Welfare Policy to ensure the well-being of animals within its supply chain. The company is committed to the responsible sourcing of products and works with farmers to promote socially and environmentally sustainable practices, including those related to animal welfare. Aldi's efforts to support the well-being of animals are part of its broader environmental protection initiatives, which also include sustainable packaging, waste reduction, and the responsible sourcing of wood, paper products, and other resources.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Aldi has committed to becoming the first major U.S. retailer to eliminate plastic shopping bags from all its stores, aiming to prevent nearly 4,400 tons (nearly nine million pounds) of plastic from circulation each year. This initiative is part of Aldi's broader efforts to make sustainability affordable for its customers and reduce its environmental impact.

sources: 1

Champion

 92 62

Environmental protection

Champion is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment. The company has partnered with Treedom to plant its 5th forest, named the ECO FUTURE FOREST, which is part of their commitment to their most sustainable collection yet, the ECO FUTURE COLLECTION. This partnership, which began in 2020, has led to the planting of over 6000 trees. Champion is also focused on reducing its environmental impact through energy-saving solutions and the use of renewable resources. They are working on finding less impactful logistics solutions to reduce CO2 emissions and support offsetting projects for any residual emissions. Additionally, Champion has implemented an Energy Policy for its stores and offices to raise awareness and save energy wherever possible.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Champion is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and supporting worker welfare through various initiatives. The company has partnerships with All Inclusive Sport and CSV Emilia Reggio, which are responsible for involving children with disabilities in sporting activities. This initiative is part of Champion's effort to build a culture of inclusion. Furthermore, Champion encourages sustainable habits and lifestyles among its employees by providing them with personalized bottles by 24 bottles, aiming to reduce the waste of plastic bottles. The company also promotes sustainable mobility for its employees to help fight climate change and reduce air pollution.

Kraft Barbecue Sauce

 92 56

Environmental protection

Kraft Heinz, the company behind Kraft Barbecue Sauce, has set ambitious environmental stewardship goals as part of its sustainability efforts. They are committed to achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050, with an interim goal of halving emissions by 2030. To reduce energy consumption, Kraft Heinz aims to lower energy use intensity by 15% across its manufacturing facilities by 2025. Additionally, the company is working towards sourcing the majority of its electricity from renewable sources by the same year. Water conservation is also a priority, with goals to reduce water use intensity by 20% in high-risk watershed areas and by 15% across all manufacturing facilities by 2025. Waste reduction efforts include a target to decrease waste to landfill intensity by 20% across manufacturing facilities by 2025. Kraft Heinz is also focusing on sustainable packaging, aiming to make 100% of its packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2025. They have already achieved creating a fully circular Heinz tomato ketchup bottle in Europe and have set a new goal to reduce the use of virgin plastic globally by 20% by 2030.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Kraft Heinz is actively working to ensure worker welfare through various initiatives and goals. The company is striving to improve product health and nutrition, which indirectly benefits workers by promoting healthier food options. They have set a goal to achieve 85% compliance with Kraft Heinz Global Nutrition Targets by 2025. Additionally, Kraft Heinz is committed to reducing total sugar and sodium in its products, including BBQ Sauce, which contributes to the overall health and wellness of consumers and employees alike. The company aims to fill 50% of its global management positions with women and have 30% of its salaried U.S. employee population identify as people of color by 2025, promoting diversity and inclusion within the workplace. Furthermore, Kraft Heinz is dedicated to providing 1.5 billion meals to people in need by 2025, demonstrating a commitment to community support and alleviating global hunger.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Kraft Heinz has made significant commitments to animal welfare in its sourcing practices. The company aims to source 100% of its eggs globally from cage-free or better hens by 2025, with a definition of "cage-free or better" that includes cage-free, free-range, pasture-raised, or similar natural or open housing settings. In Europe, Kraft Heinz has already achieved its goal of sourcing 100% of eggs from free-range hens by 2020. Additionally, the company is working to improve broiler chicken welfare in the U.S. by 2024 and align with the European chicken commitment by 2026. These efforts demonstrate Kraft Heinz's commitment to promoting the health and welfare of animals used in their products.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2050, halving same by 2030.
    • Reduce energy use intensity by 15% across our manufacturing facilities by 2025.
    • Procure majority of electricity from renewable sources by 2025.
    • Reduce water use intensity by 20% in high-risk watershed areas by 2025.
    • Reduce water use intensity by 15% across our manufacturing facilities by 2025.
    • Reduce waste to landfill intensity by 20% across our manufacturing facilities by 2025.
    • Make 100% recyclable, reusable or compostable packaging by 2025.
    • Create a fully circular Heinz tomato ketchup bottle in Europe by 2022.
    • Reduce our use of virgin plastic globally by 20% by 2030.
    • Source 100% of eggs globally from cage-free or better hens by 2025.
    • Source 100% of eggs in Europe from free-range hens by 2020.
    • Improve broiler chicken welfare in the U.S. by 2024 and European chicken commitment by 2026.

TNT

 92 58

Environmental protection

TNT has made environmental protection a priority within its operations, focusing on energy and carbon efficiency. The company's commitment to mitigating its environmental impact is structured around three main areas: improving CO2 efficiency and air quality in operations, providing CO2 information to customers to help them reduce emissions, and encouraging awareness and training among employees and subcontractors in environmental management. TNT's environmental policies and management framework adhere to the international ISO 14001 standard, requiring all operating units to achieve and maintain external certification to this standard, in addition to complying with national and local regulatory standards. The company employs an environmental management system to plan, implement, monitor, manage, and improve the environmental impact of its activities. This includes incorporating environmental requirements into capital expenditure and procurement review processes, managing the environmental impact of its fleet and infrastructure, and setting guidelines for subcontractors and suppliers to meet TNT's environmental requirements. In 2014, TNT reported total CO2e emissions of 2,915 ktonnes, a slight increase from the previous year.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

TNT is committed to ensuring the health and safety of its employees and subcontractors, which is a key component of its corporate responsibility strategy. The company is working to strengthen its safety culture by addressing the attitudes, beliefs, perceptions, and values of employees and subcontractors regarding safety. TNT promotes a safety culture where management shows leadership and commitment to safety, and all employees take responsibility for their own health and safety as well as that of others. The company's health and safety policies and management framework are based on the international OHSAS 18001 standard, with all operating units required to achieve and maintain external certification to this standard, alongside compliance with national and local regulatory standards. TNT identifies and assesses health and safety risks associated with operational activities, managing and controlling these risks to acceptable levels through effective risk controls within operational processes. Additionally, TNT employs a 'safe vehicle, safe driver, safe journey' approach to mitigate road safety risks, aiming for continuous improvement in vehicle, driver, and journey safety, including subcontractor management. The company has set a target to reduce lost time accidents (LTAs) to 2.0 per 100 FTE by 2015, from 2.69 in 2014.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • ISO 14001
    • OHSAS 18001
  • Commitments
    • Reduce lost time accidents (LTAs) to 2.0 per 100 FTE by 2015

GE

 92 68

Environmental protection

GE is actively engaged in various initiatives to protect the environment and address climate change. The company has committed to achieving carbon neutrality by 2030 for its Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions. This ambitious goal is particularly significant given GE's industrial nature and extensive global supply chain. The strategy to reach carbon neutrality involves driving absolute reductions in direct emissions and energy use through operational investments, smart power sourcing, and waste elimination. GE's approach includes site-specific sustainability assessments to identify energy reduction opportunities and the implementation of lean decarbonization practices to enhance operational efficiencies and reduce emissions. Additionally, GE Renewable Energy has secured Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) in India and Europe to supply its operations with renewable electricity, further reducing its carbon footprint.

GE Renewable Energy is also focused on safety and environmental stewardship through its Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) programs. The company introduced 'Vision Safe,' a new EHS philosophy, to ensure the safety of all employees, contractors, customers, and visitors at its sites. This philosophy is built around three key pillars and includes programs for continuous improvement and the development of a fully intelligent Data & Analytics system.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

GE is committed to fostering an inclusive culture where everyone feels empowered to do their best work. The company values the unique identity, background, and experiences of its employees and aims to create an environment where everyone feels accepted, respected, and that they belong. GE's commitment to diversity and inclusion is evident in its efforts to build diverse teams and perspectives, which the company believes are essential for building a world that works for everyone. In 2022, GE published its Diversity Annual Report as part of its Sustainability Report to transparently share diversity data and hold itself accountable for continuous improvement. Additionally, GE supports diversity in community engagement through programs like Next Engineers, further demonstrating its commitment to worker welfare and inclusion.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Carbon neutrality by 2030 for GEâs Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions

Fitbit

 91 55

Environmental protection

Fitbit is actively working towards a sustainable future by focusing on rethinking consumption, value chain responsibility, and adopting a lower-impact production process. In terms of rethinking consumption, Fitbit is making efforts to reduce waste and reuse resources. This includes incorporating recycled and responsibly sourced materials into their products, eliminating single-use plastics, and improving product reparability and recyclability. For value chain responsibility, Fitbit is committed to building a fully traceable value chain and only working with suppliers who are committed to fair labor practices. This also involves collaborating with industry stakeholders to contribute to broader solutions. In their production process, Fitbit aims to reduce their environmental footprint by using safer chemistry, reducing fresh water usage, and transitioning to renewable energy sources while also cutting down on energy consumption overall. Additionally, Fitbit encourages customers to recycle their old devices through their recycling program, further emphasizing their commitment to minimizing waste.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Fitbit takes social and environmental considerations into account within its value chain. This includes a commitment to only working with suppliers who adhere to fair labor practices. By focusing on building a fully traceable value chain, Fitbit aims to ensure transparency and responsibility in its production and supply processes. This approach indicates a broader commitment to social responsibility, including the welfare of workers involved in the creation and distribution of Fitbit products.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Incorporating recycled and responsibly sourced materials
    • Eliminating single-use plastics
    • Improving product reparability and recyclability
    • Building a fully traceable value chain
    • Working only with suppliers committed to fair labor practices
    • Using safer chemistry
    • Using less fresh water
    • Switching to renewable energy sources and reducing energy consumption

Sealy

 91 61

Environmental protection

Sealy has undertaken several initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability. The company has committed to achieving zero landfill waste by the end of 2022 and aims to become carbon neutral by 2040. Additionally, Sealy has announced a commitment to sourcing 100% renewable energy electricity for its U.S. and European manufacturing operations. The foams used in Sealy mattresses are CertiPUR-US certified, ensuring they are made without toxins. Sealy has also been recognized for its sustainable initiatives, being named a 2020 Hospitality Industry Leader in the MindClick Sustainability Assessment Program and earning maximum credit in six categories including raw materials and end of life. The Sealy Naturals collection is an eco-friendly mattress line made with responsibly-sourced materials such as 100% natural latex, ethically-harvested wool, and covers made from a blend of soft hemp and organic cotton. The mattresses are designed using a hybrid innerspring and latex design, employing environmentally-friendly construction techniques like hand-tufting to reduce glue usage by 65%, thereby minimizing chemical emissions.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • GREENGUARD Gold
  • Commitments

    • Carbon neutral by 2040
    • Sourcing 100% renewable energy electricity for U.S. and European manufacturing operations by 2020

Bass Pro Shops

 91 58

Environmental protection

Bass Pro Shops demonstrates a strong commitment to environmental protection through various conservation efforts and sustainable practices. The company has partnered with over 250 leading conservation organizations to restore millions of acres of habitat across North America, significantly increasing wildlife populations for hundreds of native species. This includes protecting vital waterfowl breeding grounds in the Prairie Pothole Region, conserving millions of acres of turkey habitat, and supporting the growth of bass populations through citizen science efforts. Additionally, Bass Pro Shops has taken significant steps in sustainable golf course management. All five of Big Cedar Lodge's premier golf courses have been designated as Audubon International Signature Sanctuary locations, meeting the highest standard of conservation-minded course design and sustainable operation. This certification process involves rigorous evaluations, including environmental audits and the implementation of a Natural Resource Management Plan (NRMP) that addresses various environmental concerns such as wildlife conservation, water quality monitoring, integrated pest management, and waste reduction. The resort uses organic fertilization methods and a special water recirculation system to reduce chemical run-off, showcasing a commitment to minimizing environmental impact.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • Audubon International Signature Sanctuary status for all five golf courses at Big Cedar Lodge
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Hallmark Channel

 91 52

Environmental protection

Hallmark has a longstanding commitment to sustainability, formalized as early as 1943 with its first paper recycling program. The company has set science-based targets to lower its greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, emphasizing the reduction of environmental impacts across its operations, products, and supply chain. Hallmark's sustainability efforts include sourcing paper sustainably, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, and minimizing water consumption and waste to landfill. Notably, Hallmark UK has innovated by recycling coffee cups into greeting cards in partnership with James Cropper and a process called "CupCyclingÂ®". Hallmark has also joined sustainability organizations like How2Recycle and the Sustainable Packaging Coalition to enhance the recyclability and sustainability of its products and packaging. Crayola, a Hallmark brand, has transitioned to sustainable packaging for its Giant Coloring Pages, eliminating significant amounts of plastic waste annually. Additionally, Crayola celebrated the 10th anniversary of its 20-acre solar farm, achieving its goal of using 100% renewable energy for the production of its crayons, markers, paints, and modeling compounds.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • Sustainable Packaging Coalition

    • Use How2Recycle labeling on all U.S. packaging by 2025

Enterprise

 91 55

Environmental protection

Enterprise has initiated several programs aimed at environmental conservation and addressing global challenges. Through the Enterprise Urban Initiative, the company supports community growth after natural disasters by planting trees. This initiative is part of a broader commitment, the 50 Million Tree pledge, in collaboration with the Arbor Day Foundation and the US Forest Service, to plant 1 million trees annually for 50 years. Additionally, Enterprise has partnered with The Nature Conservancy in the Routes and Roots program to tackle critical conservation challenges worldwide. These efforts are complemented by a $1 million donation to the American Red Cross Annual Disaster Giving Program, supporting disaster relief services, and a significant commitment through the Fill Your Tank program, where Enterprise is donating over $115 million over 10 years to combat food insecurity globally.

sources: 1

Toshiba

 91 57

Environmental protection

Toshiba has taken significant steps to protect the environment and combat climate change. The company has revised its Environmental Future Vision 2050, focusing on achieving carbon neutrality throughout its value chain. This includes investments in energy-saving and renewable energy equipment, as well as creating products and services that contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Toshiba aims for a 70% reduction in GHG emissions by 2030, emphasizing collaborations with suppliers to lower emissions from purchased products and services. Additionally, Toshiba is committed to promoting businesses that support climate change adaptation measures, such as stabilizing energy supply and enhancing resilience. These efforts are part of Toshiba's broader strategy to contribute to solving social issues, including those outlined in the SDGs, through technological advancements and business activities.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Toshiba has re-identified material issues that include ensuring employee health and safety, promoting sustainable procurement, and strengthening R&D to stimulate innovation. The company aims to encourage every group employee to feel pride and fulfillment in their work, harnessing creativity and technology in collaboration with business partners to realize rich value. This includes securing, retaining, and training human resources, promoting respect for human rights, and ensuring employee health and safety. Toshiba's commitment to these areas is part of its broader vision for respect of human rights, nurturing people and technology, and giving back to society.

sources: 1

Centrum

Jiffy Lube

 91 47

Environmental protection

Jiffy Lube is actively involved in environmental protection through its vehicle maintenance services and oil recycling programs. The company emphasizes the importance of vehicle maintenance in reducing environmental impact. Properly maintained vehicles, including clean filters and lubricants, properly inflated tires, and correct engine tuning, contribute to better fuel efficiency and lower emissions. Jiffy Lube offers services such as setting the right tire pressures, servicing and replacing air and oil filters, and ensuring the engine and drivetrain components are well-lubricated to minimize fuel-robbing friction. Additionally, Jiffy Lube plays a significant role in oil recycling. Some Jiffy Lube locations serve as designated oil recycling collection centers, collecting used motor oil from changes performed at their locations and from individuals who change their oil themselves. This used oil is then sent to an oil-recycling center where it is re-refined and used to make heating oil, asphalt, and other petroleum-based products, significantly reducing waste and environmental impact. The company highlights the importance of recycling motor oil, noting that improper disposal of motor oil can release a substantial amount of oil into the environment, whereas recycling just two gallons of used oil can generate enough electricity to run the average household for almost 24 hours.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Mobil 1

Kindle

 91 59

Environmental protection

Kindle, as part of Amazon's broader sustainability efforts, is designed with environmental protection in mind. The company focuses on reducing the carbon footprint of its devices throughout their lifecycle, from production to disposal. Amazon aims for each generation of devices, including Kindle, to be more carbon-efficient than the last. This includes incorporating recycled materials into the devices and committing to renewable energy sources to offset the energy use of its devices. Specifically, Amazon has committed to investing in wind and solar farm capacity equal to the energy use of its Echo, Fire TV, and Ring devices worldwide by 2025. While Kindle is not explicitly mentioned in this commitment, it is part of Amazon's broader device portfolio, which is moving towards sustainability. The company has also set ambitious goals for its device packaging, aiming to make it 100% recyclable by 2023 and sourcing all wood fiber in the packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources. Additionally, Amazon has joined ChemFORWARD as a co-design partner to advance safer chemistry in its products, including Kindle.

sources: 1

Nothing found

    • Make Amazon device packaging 100% recyclable by 2023
    • Source 100% of the wood fiber in our packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources

Gold Bond

 91 62

Environmental protection

Gold Bond is actively engaged in several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment and promoting sustainability. The company has made significant progress in reformulating its products by nearly completing the removal of parabens, phthalates, and dyes, which aligns with its commitment to healthier products and a reduced environmental impact. In terms of packaging, Gold Bond is taking steps to improve sustainability through partnerships with How To Recycle and Terracycle, facilitating easier recycling for consumers and reducing waste. Starting in 2024, the company plans to introduce packaging made from post-consumer recycled plastic and is transitioning to using FSC/SFI certified materials to help protect the world's forests.

Gold Bond's manufacturing processes also reflect its environmental commitments. The company's facilities in Chattanooga, Tennessee, are working towards carbon neutrality and have implemented a Water Efficiency Management Plan to reduce water consumption. Efforts to reduce landfill waste and increase recycling rates are part of its waste management strategy. Additionally, Gold Bond supports biodiversity through partnerships with Lookout Mountain Conservancy and Plan Bee, sponsoring honeybee hives, and organizing volunteer events to support local conservation efforts.

sources: 1

Mars Bar

 91 60

Environmental protection

Mars is actively working to reduce its environmental impact, particularly through its efforts to make the Mars Bar carbon neutral in the UK, Ireland, and Canada by 2023. This initiative is part of Mars's broader commitment to achieve net zero greenhouse gas emissions across its full value chain by 2050. To reduce its carbon footprint, Mars has already cut emissions from its direct operations in the UK by 67% since 2015, partly by sourcing 100% renewable electricity for its Mars Bar production. Additionally, Mars is implementing a new logistics program to remove a million miles from the roads by next year, aiming for more sustainable delivery methods. The company is also addressing emissions in its agricultural supply chains by combating deforestation, improving land use, and transforming raw material sourcing practices, particularly for cocoa and dairy. These efforts are expected to reduce the Mars Bar's carbon footprint by over 20% in the specified regions by 2023. Mars plans to offset any remaining emissions with high-quality carbon removal credits, focusing on reforestation and land restoration projects. The company is committed to transparency in this process, adhering to the PAS 2060 standard for carbon neutrality.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Mars is dedicated to improving the lives of people within its value chain, emphasizing human rights and opportunities. The company's efforts are focused on areas where it has the most influence and can make a significant impact, such as in its supply chains for cocoa, palm oil, and other raw materials. Mars is working to ensure that the millions of people who contribute to its success, including its associates, customers, and communities where it operates, can thrive. This includes respecting human rights throughout its value chain and implementing programs with key partners to support individuals' rights and livelihoods. Mars's commitment extends to supporting the Living Income Differential (LID) fee to ensure fair compensation for smallholder cocoa farmers, demonstrating its dedication to enhancing the welfare of workers and communities involved in its supply chain.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Mars bars sold in the UK, Ireland, and Canada to be certified carbon neutral by 2023
    • Achieve net zero greenhouse gas emissions across the full value chain by 2050

YouTube TV

 91 54

Environmental protection

YouTube TV, as part of Google's broader sustainability efforts, is indirectly involved in advancing environmental protection through Google's commitment to sustainability. Google has set ambitious goals to pursue net-zero emissions across its operations and value chain by 2030. This includes operating on 24/7 carbon-free energy, such as solar and wind, in its data centers and office campuses. Google aims to achieve this through purchasing carbon-free energy, accelerating new and improved technologies, and transforming the energy system through partnerships and advocacy. Additionally, Google plans to enable 5 GW of new carbon-free energy through investments in key manufacturing regions by 2030, aiming to drive grid decarbonization and enable greater access to carbon-free energy, particularly in markets where clean energy procurement mechanisms are underdeveloped. These initiatives are part of Google's broader strategy to operate its business sustainably and contribute to system-level change in energy consumption and production.

sources: 1

Nothing found

Lincoln

 91 59

Environmental protection

Lincoln Electric has implemented several initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact, focusing on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, energy usage, recycling, landfill avoidance, and water usage. The company has set ambitious goals for 2025, including a 10% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions, with an 18.9% reduction already achieved by 2022 compared to 2018. Energy intensity, measured as total energy consumption per total labor hours worked, is targeted for a 16% reduction, with a 1% reduction achieved by 2022. Lincoln Electric is also working towards an 80% recycling rate, having reached 75.9% in 2022, and aims for a 97% landfill avoidance rate, with 95.2% achieved in the same year. Additionally, the company has successfully reduced its water usage by 25% from 2018 to 2022, surpassing its goal of a 14% reduction. These efforts demonstrate Lincoln Electric's commitment to environmental sustainability and its proactive approach to minimizing its ecological footprint.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • 52% Reduction in Total Recordable Case Rate (TRCR) by 2025
    • 10% Reduction in Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions by 2025
    • 16% Reduction in energy intensity by 2025
    • 80% Recycling rate by 2025
    • 97% Landfill avoidance rate by 2025
    • 14% Reduction in water usage by 2025

Lee

 91 60

Environmental protection

Lee is actively engaging in several initiatives to protect the environment, focusing on renewable energy, sustainable materials, and water conservation. By 2025, Lee commits to powering all owned and operated facilities with 100% renewable energy. They are also working towards utilizing more than 50% sustainable synthetics and sourcing 100% sustainably-grown or recycled cotton. A significant effort in water conservation is evident through their Indigoodâ¢ Denim, which eliminates water from the denim dyeing process, and their achievement of saving over one billion liters of water in the manufacturing process. Additionally, Lee is part of the MacArthur Foundationâs Jeans Redesign, aiming to minimize waste and ensure the recyclability and durability of jeans. Their advancements in virtual design technology have also reduced the number of physical prototypes needed, saving significant amounts of water and reducing carbon emissions.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Lee demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives aimed at supporting communities and ensuring the well-being of workers. The company encourages employee volunteerism, with hundreds of hours spent annually on community service worldwide. In a notable partnership with AgTech company AppHarvest, Lee supplies apparel to workers in a high-tech greenhouse, supporting job creation in Appalachia, an area affected by the coal industry's decline. Furthermore, Lee has established Terms of Engagement and Global Compliance Principles to protect the health, safety, and well-being of workers involved in growing materials and crafting products, expecting all partners and suppliers to adhere to these standards.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

While Lee's material footprint includes very few animal-derived materials, the company is committed to the ethical treatment of animals. In cases where animal-derived materials are used, Lee promotes and pursues the development and use of commercial substitutes to minimize the use of such materials. This approach reflects their commitment to treating animals with care and respect.

sources: 1

    • Cradle to Cradle Certifiedâ¢

    • Power 100 percent of all owned and operated facilities with renewable energy by 2025.
    • Utilize more than 50 percent sustainable synthetics by 2025.
    • Source 100 percent sustainably-grown or recycled cotton by 2025.
    • Increase Indigoodâ¢ dyed products every year.

Smirnoff Ice

 91 43

Environmental protection

Smirnoff has announced its commitment to developing more sustainable packaging and systems by 2030, focusing on improving the circularity of its products and reducing waste. In a significant move towards this goal, Smirnoff has partnered with the Don't Trash Glass (DTG) campaign, alongside the Glass Packaging Institute and GlassKing Recovery & Recycling, to collect used glass for recycling into new bottles. This initiative, starting in Chicago, involves collaborating with over 300 local bars, restaurants, and businesses to increase the amount of recycled glass available. The collected glass will be processed and transported to Smirnoff's packaging plant in Plainfield, Illinois, to be reused for Smirnoff products, demonstrating a commitment to a more circular economy and reducing environmental impact. This effort is part of Diageo's broader sustainability strategy, Society 2030: Spirit of Progress, aiming to reimagine packaging and become sustainable by design.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to developing more sustainable packaging and systems by 2030

Dove Chocolate Candy Bar

 91 67

Environmental protection

Dove Chocolate is actively working towards a deforestation-free supply chain for the cocoa it sources, with a commitment to achieve this goal by 2025. In 2020, Dove Chocolate, through its suppliers, distributed nearly 3.5 million cocoa seedlings to farmers in West Africa. This initiative is part of their broader effort to increase shade and biodiversity in cocoa farming areas, which also saw the distribution of approximately 1.2 million non-cocoa trees. These efforts are aimed at helping cocoa farmers work more efficiently and responsibly, growing more cocoa on less land to preserve forests and increase farmers' incomes. Dove Chocolate's Dark products, including Dove Dark Chocolate, Dove Dark Almond Promises, and Dove Dark Peanut Butter Promises, are sourced from Rainforest Alliance Certified farms. This certification ensures that the cocoa is grown in a way that is better for the environment and the farming communities. Dove Chocolate uses farm mapping to prevent sourcing cocoa from forest lands, National Parks and Reserves, and Classified Forests, contributing to their ambition of a deforestation-free cocoa supply chain.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dove Chocolate, in partnership with CARE, has been working since 2016 to empower women in its cocoa-supply chain through the Village Savings and Loans model. This initiative aims to support women's empowerment in cocoa-growing communities. On International Womenâs Day in 2019, Dove Chocolate and CARE laid the first stone on a new marketplace for women-led businesses in the village of Gueyo, CÃ´te dâIvoire. This marketplace, which houses 150 businesses primarily run by women, provides modern facilities that protect the vendors and their products from the elements, thereby improving their working conditions and livelihoods. This effort is part of Dove Chocolate's broader mission to improve lives in cocoa-growing communities by ensuring human rights are respected, the environment is protected, and cocoa farmers have the opportunity to thrive.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Rainforest Alliance Certified (for Dove Dark Chocolate, Dove Dark Almond Promises, Dove Dark Peanut Butter Promises)
  • Commitments
    • Achieving a deforestation-free supply chain by 2025

Quality Inn

 91 49

Nothing found

PayDay

 91 60

Environmental protection

PayDay is actively engaged in various sustainability initiatives aimed at reducing its environmental impact. The company emphasizes the importance of integrating social and environmental concerns into all its processes and products. PayDay has taken significant steps to minimize its carbon footprint, particularly through its product offerings. The company utilizes recycled materials such as recycled polyester, made from beverage bottles or collected ocean plastic, which significantly reduces energy usage and CO2 emissions. Additionally, PayDay employs eco-friendly, plant-based inks for printing, which are non-toxic and easily degradable. The use of recycled metal and recycled cardboard in its products and packaging further exemplifies PayDay's commitment to environmental sustainability. Organic cotton is preferred over conventionally grown cotton for apparel, reducing the use of chemical pesticides and fertilizers, as well as the water requirement for cultivation. The company also focuses on minimizing plastic waste in packaging by using recycled or FSC certified paper and avoiding plastic or using recycled plastic where possible. Shipping practices have been optimized to reduce carbon emissions, with the use of recycled grass paper packaging and paper tape with natural glue, making the entire package recyclable. PayDay's offices operate mostly paperless and utilize renewable energy sources. The company has also offset its carbon emissions through partnerships with ClimatePartner and supports the international marine conservation project Plastic Bank.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

PayDay is committed to upholding social standards within its operations and supply chain. The company collaborates with organizations that contribute significantly to sustainability and adhere to social standards. PayDay's partnership with the Fair Wear Foundation highlights its dedication to ensuring safe and dignified working conditions and decent wages in the apparel industry. Additionally, the company works with STANLEY/STELLA, a certified supplier of sustainable and vegan textiles, which operates with an ethical, humane, and ecological business philosophy. These partnerships reflect PayDay's commitment to promoting labor-social standards worldwide and ensuring respect for the environment, people, and animals in the production of its merchandise.

sources: 1

MSNBC

Mayo Clinic

 91 68

Environmental protection

Mayo Clinic has implemented a comprehensive approach to environmental stewardship, focusing on conserving energy, reducing greenhouse gas emissions, sourcing sustainable equipment and supplies, offering nourishing and healthy foods, reducing waste, building for sustainability, and using water wisely. The clinic has committed to reducing its greenhouse gas emissions by 50% and reducing energy use intensity by 20% by 2032 as part of the Better Climate Challenge. Efforts to conserve energy include improving building equipment functionality, using sustainable design in new facilities, scheduling air handlers off during unoccupied times, replacing fluorescent lighting with LED lights, sealing air ducts, and installing heat recovery systems. Mayo Clinic also explores transitioning to sustainable energy sources, with several sites generating energy from onsite solar panel installations, receiving energy from community solar and wind gardens, or utilizing geothermal technology. In terms of sourcing, Mayo Clinic prioritizes environmentally preferred qualities in its supplies and equipment, including minimizing hazardous substances, using recycled materials, and selecting energy-efficient equipment. The clinic is a founding member of Greenhealth Exchange, aiming to accelerate the adoption of sustainable products in healthcare. Mayo Clinic's food services focus on healthy and sustainable choices, including using Energy Star appliances, recycling, reducing food waste, and donating reserve food to local organizations. The clinic is committed to reducing waste, with over 31% of its overall waste stream currently recycled, and operates its own Recycling Center. Sustainable building design is prioritized, following a Sustainable Building Policy and Guide that includes recommendations from green building certification programs. Mayo Clinic campuses feature outdoor green spaces and healing gardens, support for bicycle commuters, and expanding electric vehicle charging stations. Water conservation efforts include diverting water for irrigation, reducing production water, capturing water runoff in raingardens, and offering pharmaceutical collection services to prevent water contamination.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

    • Greening the Operating Room Recognition Award
    • Green Business designation from the Eau Claire Chamber of Commerce
  • Commitments
    • Reducing greenhouse gas emissions (scopes 1, 2) by 50% by 2032
    • Reducing energy use intensity by 20% by 2032

Dots

 91 51

Environmental protection

Dots is actively engaged in various environmental protection initiatives, focusing on tangible impacts such as plastic cleanup, tree planting, marine protection, land conservation for wildlife, coral reef restoration, and the protection of sea turtles and nature reserves. They have successfully planted over 700,446 trees across more than 40 countries, emphasizing the restoration of vital ecosystems. In their mission to clean the oceans, Dots has removed 652,148 pounds of ocean plastic, working closely with river and coastal communities. The company has also acquired 263,590 square feet of land for nature reserves, contributing to biodiversity and climate regulation. Furthermore, Dots has been instrumental in saving 583,665 sea turtles by protecting essential nesting beaches and removing plastic waste. Their efforts extend to protecting 6,832,788 acres of wildlife habitat and 11,567,000 square meters of marine area, focusing on sustainable fishing, tourism, and conservation efforts. These initiatives are part of Dots' broader commitment to generating environmental impact where it's most needed, in partnership with vetted organizations globally.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Dots' initiatives significantly contribute to animal welfare, particularly through their efforts in saving sea turtles and protecting wildlife habitats. By safeguarding essential nesting beaches and removing plastic waste, Dots helps ensure the survival of sea turtle hatchlings. Their work in protecting vast areas of wildlife habitat also supports the welfare of countless species by preserving biodiversity hotspots, which are crucial for the survival of unique and irreplaceable species. These actions demonstrate Dots' commitment to minimizing animal suffering and promoting the health of animals within their ecosystems.

Revlon

 91 51

Environmental protection

Revlon has taken a significant step towards environmental protection by launching the first mass cosmetic product, PhotoReady Prime Plus Perfecting + Smoothing Primer, that meets the Environmental Working Groupâs (EWG) industry-leading clean beauty standards. This initiative marks Revlon as the first global brand to offer an EWG VERIFIEDâ¢ cosmetic product at mass retailers, thereby making affordable clean beauty accessible to a broader audience. The EWG VERIFIEDâ¢ mark is awarded to products that meet robust ingredient and transparency requirements, including obtaining a "green" Skin Deep score, which indicates that the ingredients are of the lowest hazard and supported by robust scientific data. This move by Revlon demonstrates a commitment to not only consumer health but also to environmental stewardship by ensuring their products adhere to stringent safety and environmental standards.

Additionally, Wayfair has implemented renewable energy and carbon-reduction strategies, such as investing in renewable energy credits for its most energy-intensive sites. The company also donates thousands of pieces of furniture each year to local nonprofits, reducing waste and supporting communities. Wayfair's Shop Sustainably feature allows customers to discover products that meet global environmental and social certifications, further emphasizing its commitment to environmental protection.

Dr. Scholl's shoes

 91 60

Environmental protection

Dr. Scholl's Shoes demonstrates a commitment to environmental protection through several initiatives. The company has set a goal that by 2025, 100% of its strategic factories will participate in ongoing waste reduction programs. This is a significant step towards minimizing the environmental impact of their manufacturing processes. Additionally, Dr. Scholl's Shoes has partnered with Trees for the Future, pledging to plant a tree for the purchase of select shoe styles. This initiative not only aims to offset CO2 manufacturing emissions but also supports communities worldwide in planting trees for a better life. As of now, 237,522 trees have been planted, contributing to the restoration of farmlands and the prevention of local deforestation. Furthermore, the company utilizes eco-conscious materials in their footwear, including topcloth and linings made from recycled bottles, foam made from invasive algae biomass, and chrome-free leathers sourced through Leather Working Group-audited factories. These efforts reflect Dr. Scholl's Shoes' dedication to reducing its environmental footprint and promoting sustainable practices.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Dr. Scholl's Shoes is actively working to ensure the welfare of workers involved in the production of their footwear. The company has committed that by 2025, 100% of its strategic factories will comply with its fair wage programs and social working standards. This commitment indicates a strong dedication to providing fair compensation and maintaining high social standards within their supply chain. By focusing on fair wages and social standards, Dr. Scholl's Shoes aims to improve the quality of life for workers and contribute positively to the communities where their products are made.

Chiquita

 91 72

Environmental protection

Chiquita has been actively engaged in environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting sustainable agriculture. The company has implemented farm rejuvenation and reengineering practices as part of its "Farmersâ Code," which is an integral component of the "Behind the Blue Sticker" strategic vision. These practices are designed to improve efficiency, increase yield, and reduce environmental impact while maintaining the quality of Chiquita bananas. As part of these efforts, 59% of Chiquita farms have been rejuvenated, leading to higher yields and reduced waste. The company has also introduced "cover crops" to assist in soil erosion control and reduce herbicide use by 36%. Furthermore, Chiquita has launched the "30by30" sustainability program with the goal of reducing carbon emissions across its operations by 30% by the end of 2030. This program includes measures such as moving to greener electricity using solar panels and wind turbines, switching to biofuels or electric vehicles, and reducing nitrogen emissions from fertilizers. Chiquita is the first global fruit company to be recognized by the Science Based Target Initiative (SBTi) for its commitment to reducing emissions in line with the Paris Agreement.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Chiquita has demonstrated a commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives aimed at protecting children's rights and enhancing the well-being of its employees. In late 2017, the company conducted the industryâs first Child Rights Impact Assessments in Costa Rica and Panama, using the UNICEF-developed methodology. The assessments identified a culture of non-discrimination and strong protection of pregnancy rights, with child rights well protected on the companyâs farms. Chiquita has also identified opportunities for improvement and implemented remediation plans to enhance children's rights, particularly regarding accessible transport to education facilities. Additionally, the company has made significant progress toward its goal of helping 20,000 school children and supporting 100 schools. Chiquita's efforts in worker welfare are further supported by its adherence to the SA8000 labor rights standard, which ensures compliance with the ILO Core Conventions, prohibits forced and child labor, and mandates freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Global G.A.P.
    • SA8000
    • Rainforest Alliance
  • Commitments
    • Reduce carbon emissions by 30% by the end of 2030 ("30by30" sustainability program)
    • Develop a Science Based plan for supply chain partners by 2025

Greyhound

 91 49

Environmental protection

Greyhound has implemented several measures to reduce its environmental impact and promote sustainable travel. The company highlights that traveling by bus has the lowest carbon footprint compared to other modes of transport, excluding walking and biking. Specifically, choosing Greyhound over personal vehicles can reduce carbon dioxide emissions by approximately 79%, and opting for bus travel instead of flying can cut emissions by 84%. Greyhound's fleet includes modern vehicles designed with emissions-reducing components. These buses meet the latest EPA standards for carbon monoxide and hydrocarbon emissions and utilize clean-burning low-sulfur, Bio, or Renewable diesel fuel. Since 2008, all buses have been equipped with diesel particulate filters, and since 2014, new buses feature DEF (Diesel Exhaust Fluid) after-treatment systems to further reduce emissions. Additionally, Greyhound has implemented idle management systems to conserve fuel and minimize emissions when buses are not moving. The company also focuses on eco-friendly practices in its stations, such as switching to LED lighting, employing environmentally-friendly landscaping that requires minimal watering, and recycling cooking oil used in food services. These efforts collectively contribute to Greyhound's commitment to environmental protection and sustainable travel.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

General Motors

 91 53

Environmental protection

General Motors (GM) is actively working towards a more sustainable future with a focus on environmental protection and carbon neutrality. The company has set ambitious goals to become carbon neutral in its global products and operations by 2040. A significant step towards this goal is the commitment to eliminate tailpipe emissions from new US light-duty vehicles by 2035. GM has also made strides in renewable energy, securing enough to power 100% of its U.S. sites by 2025, with plans to extend this globally by 2035. These efforts are part of GM's broader vision for a zero-emissions, all-electric future, aligning with science-based climate actions. The company has been recognized for its sustainability efforts, receiving the ENERGY STAR Sustained Excellence Award for the 11th consecutive year and the Sustainability Leadership Award from the Business Intelligence Group. Additionally, GM has made significant investments in electric vehicle (EV) technology and infrastructure, including securing all EV battery raw materials for 1 million units of North American capacity by 2025 and opening its first Ultium Cells battery cell plant in Ohio, with more plants opening in Tennessee and Michigan in the coming years.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

General Motors has demonstrated a commitment to social issues and worker welfare through various initiatives. The company has provided $60 million in grants to more than 400 U.S.-based nonprofits aimed at creating inclusive solutions to social issues. This philanthropic effort is part of GM's broader aspiration to make the company the most inclusive in the world. GM's focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion, along with its efforts to protect human rights and foster strong supplier relationships, underscores its commitment to improving worker welfare and building communities.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • ENERGY STAR Sustained Excellence Award
  • Commitments
    • Carbon neutral in global products and operations by 2040
    • Eliminate tailpipe emissions from new US light-duty vehicles by 2035
    • Power 100% of U.S. sites with renewable energy by 2025 and globally by 2035

Southwest

 91 51

Environmental protection

Southwest Airlines has committed to achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050 through a strategy named Nonstop to Net Zero, focusing on carbon, circularity, and collaboration. The airline is modernizing its fleet with more fuel-efficient aircraft and securing sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) to reduce its carbon footprint. It has set goals to electrify 50% of eligible ground support equipment by 2030, save 50 million incremental gallons of jet fuel by 2025, and reduce single-use plastics in inflight service by 50% by weight by 2025, with an aim to eliminate them where feasible by 2030. Additionally, Southwest has signed a 20-year agreement to purchase up to 680 million gallons of neat SAF from USA BioEnergy, LLC, which could produce the equivalent of 2.59 billion gallons of net zero fuel over the term. The airline is also working on improving recycling and collaborating with suppliers on sustainability, including utilizing EcoVadis to assess the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) performance of its supply chain.

sources: 1, 2

    • Achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2050
    • Reducing carbon emissions intensity by 50% by 2035 with an interim target of 25% reduction by 2030

    • Reducing energy utilization index at the Company's Dallas corporate headquarters by 50% by 2035

Amazon Fire TV

 91 52

Environmental protection

Amazon Fire TV is part of Amazon's broader commitment to sustainability, particularly in reducing the environmental impact of its devices. The company has taken significant steps to ensure that its devices, including Fire TV, are designed with carbon reduction in mind. This includes the use of recycled materials in the manufacturing process and efforts to make device packaging fully recyclable. Amazon has committed to making the packaging of its devices 100% recyclable by 2023 and aims to source all wood fiber in its packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources. Additionally, Amazon has invested in renewable energy projects, with a commitment to match the energy use of Echo, Fire TV, and Ring devices worldwide with renewable energy by 2025. This includes investments in wind and solar farm capacity, some of which are already operational, with others expected to begin operating between 2023 and 2024. The company also emphasizes energy efficiency in its devices, with over 60% of devices in customers' homes featuring a Low Power Mode by the end of 2022. This mode is part of Amazon's effort to address the electricity used by its devices through renewable energy development, starting with Echo devices.

sources: 1, 2

    • Source 100% of the wood fiber in our packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources

Bentley

 91 59

Environmental protection

Bentley Motors is actively engaged in various initiatives to reduce its environmental impact and promote sustainability. The company's "Beyond100" strategy is a comprehensive plan aimed at transforming Bentley into a leading maker of luxury electric cars by 2030. This includes achieving carbon-neutral status for its factory in Crewe and investing in a 'Bentley Dream Factory' to become climate neutral end-to-end. Bentley has already made significant strides in sustainable car manufacturing, with its Crewe site certified carbon neutral to PAS 2060 by the Carbon Trust in 2019. The company has installed over 30,000 solar panels, allowing up to 40% of the factoryâs electricity needs to be met with solar power. Additionally, Bentley has adopted hydrotreated vegetable oil (HVO) fuel for in-house logistics vehicles, significantly reducing CO2 emissions, nitrous oxide, and particulates compared to conventional fuel. The company has also implemented water recycling measures in its paint shop, leading to a 55.9% reduction in water usage per vehicle over the past ten years. Bentley's commitment to biodiversity is evident in its installation of a green wall and the establishment of bee hives on the factory site, contributing to local ecosystem health.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Bentley Motors has become a fully approved corporate member of the Leather Working Group, aiming to ensure that all of its leather is sourced from suppliers and tanneries that have completed the Leather Working Group audit process. The company is working towards each of its suppliers achieving the Leather Working Groupâs gold standard award through continuous improvement, demonstrating Bentley's commitment to responsible sourcing and environmental performance in the leather industry.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • PAS 2060 Carbon Neutral Certification
    • ISO 40001 Environmental Management Standard
    • ISO 50001 Energy Management Standard
    • Leather Working Group Corporate Member

  • Commitments

    • Becoming the leading maker of luxury electric cars by 2030
    • Achieving climate neutrality end-to-end by 2030
    • Launching a new electric model each year from 2025
    • Becoming plastic neutral by the end of 2025
    • Aiming for a 75% total production environmental impact reduction against 2010 by 2025

Aveeno

 91 63

Environmental protection

Aveeno is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on ethical farming and sourcing, responsible packaging, and sustainable product formulations. The company sources its oats from family-owned farms using eco-friendly practices such as crop rotation and pesticide-free fields, which help preserve soil quality and reduce water usage. Aveeno's packaging initiatives include using over 70% recyclable materials in North America and incorporating post-consumer recycled plastic into new packaging. By 2025, Aveeno aims to achieve 100% recyclable, reusable, or compostable packaging and use 100% renewable electricity for its manufacturing sites. Additionally, Aveeno employs a patented system, the Global Aquatic Ingredient Assessmentâ¢ tool, to develop non-toxic and biodegradable products that minimize impact on aquatic life and ecosystems.

sources: 1, 2

Layâs Kettle Cooked

 91 61

Environmental protection

Lay's Kettle Cooked, as a part of Frito-Lay and PepsiCo, is involved in several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment. The company has made significant strides in sustainable agriculture, ensuring that all its corn and potatoes are 100% sustainably sourced. This commitment extends to their water conservation efforts, where they have managed to save 31 million gallons of water by reducing water use intensity by 4.8% year over year. Frito-Lay has also focused on reducing its environmental impact through its fleet by working towards converting it to 100% natural gas sourced from renewable resources. This effort is equivalent to eliminating 7.7 million gallons of gasoline and 6.7 million gallons of diesel, akin to removing 14,000 cars from the road. Additionally, the company has achieved 100% LED lighting in its manufacturing facilities, further reducing its carbon footprint. In terms of packaging, Frito-Lay has reduced its packaging plastic by more than 7.8 million lbs since 2019 and has implemented a practice of reusing cardboard up to 5 times, saving 2 million trees annually.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Frito-Lay, including its Lay's Kettle Cooked brand, has demonstrated a commitment to investing in communities and supporting worker welfare indirectly through its community engagement and support initiatives. The company's employees have volunteered nearly 4,000 hours to support their local communities. Furthermore, Frito-Lay has supported over 420,000 youth through school meal programming and provided over 108 million meals to underserved communities. These efforts reflect the company's broader commitment to fostering a positive impact on the communities where its workers live and work, although specific programs directly targeting worker welfare within the company are not detailed in the provided context.

sources: 1

O'Reilly Auto Parts

 91 59

Environmental protection

O'Reilly Auto Parts is actively engaged in various sustainability efforts aimed at protecting the environment. The company has committed to reaching net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, aligning with the 2015 Paris Agreement's 1.5Â°C emission-reduction goals. To achieve this, O'Reilly has set specific targets for reducing emissions across different scopes. For Scope 1 & 2 emissions, the goal is to reduce emissions by 10% per store by 2026, 50% by 2035, and 90% in alignment with the Paris Agreementâs 1.5Â° goal, all measured against a 2021 baseline. For Scope 3 emissions, the aim is to ensure that 50% of supplier spend by 2026 and 90% by 2035 will be with companies also on a journey to net-zero GHG emissions.

O'Reilly has implemented several operational sustainability and energy conservation measures. These include converting all corporate, store, and distribution center lighting to LED, utilizing light motion sensors, Low-E glass, and higher-efficiency heating and air conditioning units. The company also recycles used auto parts and fluids, diverting millions of pounds of used auto parts and gallons of automotive fluids from landfills each year. Additionally, O'Reilly has made significant investments in renewable energy, including over $560 million in solar and wind farms, generating substantial amounts of clean energy.

sources: 1

    • Ensure that 50% of supplier spend by 2026 and 90% by 2035 will be with companies on a journey to net-zero GHG emissions
