Columbia

 87 62

Environmental protection

Columbia University has launched an ambitious sustainability initiative, Plan 2030, aiming for net zero emissions by 2050. This plan is grounded in climate science and aligns with the Science Based Target initiative (SBTi) and the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) to establish measurable targets. Efforts include a significant reduction in greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, with a 45% decrease since the baseline year of 2006. The university is expanding electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure, with two new EV ports added and a ten-year plan for further expansion. A commitment to net zero emissions by 2050 or sooner has been made, alongside the introduction of electrification studies to guide the university's pathway to electrification. Columbia's newest biomedical research building will be a 100% electric laboratory, marking one of the first net zero buildings of its kind in New York City. Additionally, the university has committed to 100% renewable electricity through the purchase of carbon offsets and plans to reduce water system energy consumption by upgrading to energy-efficient equipment. A screening level inventory for Scope 3 emissions, which constitute about 75% of the university's total emissions, has been completed. These actions demonstrate Columbia's commitment to environmental protection and sustainability.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Net Zero Emissions by 2050

Courtyard by Marriott

 87 58

Environmental protection

Courtyard by Marriott, as part of Marriott International, is actively engaged in reducing its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. The company is focused on sustainably managing its energy and water use, reducing waste and carbon emissions, and increasing the use of renewable energy. Marriott employs innovative technologies to plan, implement, track, and communicate its responsible operations to mitigate climate-related risks. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce its environmental footprint by 15% to 50% across its portfolio by 2025, from a 2016 baseline, in areas such as water intensity, carbon intensity, waste to landfill, and food waste. Additionally, Marriott aims to achieve a minimum of 30% renewable electricity use. As of 2022, Marriott has made progress towards these goals, including a 24.6% reduction in carbon intensity and the implementation of a residential bath amenity program expected to prevent about 500 million tiny, single-use toiletry bottles annually from going to landfills. Over 1,200 hotels in the U.S. and Canada are utilizing My Digital Office, a cloud-based document management solution, to eliminate paper use for hotel reporting processes, saving more than 8,000 trees in 2022 alone.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Courtyard by Marriott, under Marriott International's umbrella, is committed to sourcing 100% of its eggs from cage-free sources throughout its global operations by the end of 2025. This commitment is part of Marriott's broader responsible sourcing goals, which aim to reduce the negative environmental and social impact of its business activities. By focusing on sustainable, responsible, and local sourcing, Marriott is taking steps to ensure the welfare of animals used in its supply chain.

sources: 1

  • Certifications
    • LEED
    • BREEAM
    • Estidama
  • Commitments
    • Reduce environmental footprint by 15% to 50% across the portfolio by 2025 (from a 2016 baseline)
    • Achieve a minimum of 30% renewable electricity use
    • 100% of hotels to be certified to a recognized sustainability standard by 2025
    • 650 hotels to pursue LEED certification or equivalent by 2025
    • Source 100% cage-free eggs by the end of 2025

Timberland

Environmental protection

Timberland has set a bold environmental vision for 2030, aiming for its products and processes to have a net positive impact on nature. This vision is part of VF Corporation's Made for Change sustainability strategy. Timberland's approach focuses on circularity and regeneration, with specific goals including designing 100% of its products for circularity and sourcing 100% of its natural materials from regenerative agriculture. The company has a history of environmental stewardship, highlighted by the launch of the EarthkeepersÂ® boot in 2007, which was made using recycled, organic, and renewable materials. Additionally, Timberland met its goal of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 50% in 2015 and has planted 10 million trees, committing to plant 50 million more by 2025. The brand's efforts extend to establishing regenerative sources for materials like leather, rubber, cotton, and sugar cane, aiming for products that contribute more to the environment than they take.

Herbal Essences

 87 53

Environmental protection

Herbal Essences is actively working to reduce its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. The brand is focused on responsible packaging, aiming to make 90% of its major packaging platforms recyclable or reusable by 2025. This effort is supported by the use of How2Recycleâ¢ labels to encourage bathroom recycling and a partnership with TerraCycleÂ® for a national recycling program in the U.S. In terms of sourcing, Herbal Essences is committed to verifying the sustainable sourcing of its priority plant-based ingredients through credible external partners. The brand emphasizes the importance of sourcing and producing ingredients in a manner that respects human rights, conserves natural resources, and protects natural ecosystems. Additionally, Herbal Essences is dedicated to responsible manufacturing, with a commitment to use 100% renewable electricity and achieve Zero Manufacturing Waste to Landfill across all P&G Beauty manufacturing sites. The brand has set ambitious goals for 2030, including a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and a 35% increase in water efficiency. Herbal Essences also participates in global efforts to protect biodiversity and replant nature, partnering with organizations like the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, and The Nature Conservancy to seed bank endangered plant species and replant native plant species. The brand's commitment to environmental protection is further demonstrated by its use of real, certified botanicals and recycled plastic in its product packaging.

sources: 1, 2

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Herbal Essences is committed to animal welfare, as evidenced by its certification by PETA. The brand ensures that none of its products, including its sulfate-free shampoos and paraben-free conditioners, are tested on animals. This commitment to kindness and sustainability reflects Herbal Essences' dedication to protecting both animals and the planet.

Samsonite is actively working towards becoming the most sustainable lifestyle bag and travel luggage company in the world. Their environmental efforts are guided by their sustainability strategy, 'Our Responsible Journey,' which aims to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from their operations and value chain. Additionally, they are committed to minimizing their impact on the environment. This includes applying circular economy principles to continuously innovate and create more sustainable products. Samsonite's dedication to environmental sustainability is evident in their efforts to design products that are built to last, thereby reducing waste and promoting a more sustainable consumption model.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Samsonite is committed to providing a culture of inclusion and engagement for its employees. They offer professional development opportunities for all employees, ensuring that their workforce is well-equipped and motivated. This approach not only benefits the employees by fostering a supportive and growth-oriented work environment but also contributes to the overall success and sustainability of the company. By focusing on the welfare of their workers, Samsonite demonstrates a commitment to the people aspect of their sustainability strategy, 'Our Responsible Journey.'

AXE

 87 46

Environmental protection

AXE is actively working towards environmental sustainability by focusing on packaging improvements and setting ambitious goals for the future. The brand has made significant strides in making its packaging more sustainable. For instance, AXE's body sprays are infinitely recyclable, allowing the materials they are made from to be reused repeatedly. Additionally, their stick packs are currently 50% recyclable, with a commitment to increase this percentage. Moreover, AXE's body wash and haircare bottles are manufactured from 100% recycled plastic. These efforts are part of AXE's broader commitment to environmental sustainability, which includes tackling climate change, protecting forests, and encouraging consumers to recycle more and use less energy through the adoption of more sustainable products. By 2025, AXE aims for all of its packaging to be recyclable or to include recycled materials, demonstrating a clear commitment to reducing its environmental footprint and supporting a more sustainable future.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

AXE has achieved PETA approval and has joined PETAâs Beauty Without Bunnies program, signifying that its products and ingredients are not tested on animals anywhere in the world. This accreditation is a testament to AXE's commitment to non-animal testing methods and aligns with the preferences of Generation Z consumers, a significant portion of whom prioritize cruelty-free products. The brand has pledged not to commission any animal tests on ingredients or finished products, ensuring that consumers can choose AXE products with the confidence that they are not contributing to animal testing. This move is part of a broader effort by Unilever, AXE's parent company, to promote non-animal testing and support regulatory change towards more humane and scientifically advanced alternatives.

sources: 3

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • PETA Approved
  • Commitments
    • All packaging to be recyclable or include recycled materials by 2025

Orkin

 87 47

Environmental protection

Orkin has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and reduce its ecological footprint. The company employs Integrated Pest Management (IPM) programs that aim for effective pest control with minimal impact on non-target organisms and the environment. These programs are designed to achieve acceptable levels of pest control while reducing the reliance on chemical treatments. Orkin's commitment to environmental responsibility is further demonstrated through its membership in the National Pest Management Associationâs Quality Pro program, which upholds high ethical and operational standards in pest control.

Orkin has taken steps to reduce its emissions footprint by using GPS and route consolidation software, which optimizes travel efficiency between customer locations. This approach, coupled with a service frequency that is less frequent than the industry standard, significantly reduces mileage and fuel emissions. The company also focuses on energy efficiency and resource conservation in its operations, including the use of electronic payroll systems to reduce paper use and encouraging public transportation among employees. Orkin's Environmental Stewardship Group monitors and maintains the company's environmental practices.

Additionally, Orkin uses environmentally responsible products that are scientifically tested and registered by the Environmental Protection Agency. The company's training programs ensure that these products are applied effectively and safely, further minimizing environmental impact. Orkin is also EcoWise-certified in parts of California, indicating its compliance with specific environmental standards in pest management.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • EcoWise-certified (in parts of California)
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Vans

 87 56

Environmental protection

Vans is actively working towards environmental sustainability through its VR3 collection, which emphasizes the use of Renewable, Regenerative, and Recycled materials in its products. To qualify for the VR3 checkerboard globe logo, products must incorporate at least 30% of these materials. The VR3Cushâ¢ midsole and footbed, for instance, are made with at least 25% biobased EVA foam derived partially from plants. Similarly, the VR3 Waffleâ¢ outsole contains at least 25% natural rubber, sourced with the intention of reducing environmental impacts. Vans also focuses on the use of textile materials in its apparel and accessories, ensuring they contain at least 40% of Renewable, Regenerative, and/or Recycled materials, excluding trims. This initiative is supported by internal teams and third-party certifications or Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) data, with VF Responsible Sourcing teams verifying material choices against applicable standards and policies.

Vans has set ambitious goals for the future, committing to making 100% of its top four CO2 impact materials (Cotton, Polyester, Rubber, and Leather) Regenerative, Renewable, or Recycled by 2030. Additionally, the company aims to achieve 100% recycled content for key product packaging by 2025 and eliminate plastic packaging waste by 2030. Vans is also working towards creating and scaling circular products by 2030, which includes designing products for disassembly, reuse, and recycling, establishing recycling, resell, or donation pathways for all materials, and creating new products from recycled materials.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • 100% of top 4 CO2 impact materials will be Regenerative, Renewable, or Recycled by 2030
    • 100% Recycled content for key product packaging by 2025 & zero plastic packaging waste by 2030
    • Create and scale circular product by 2030

Baileys

 87 54

Environmental protection

Baileys has undertaken significant efforts to protect the environment, focusing on carbon reduction, water usage minimization, and sustainable packaging. Since 2008, Baileys operations have been powered by 100% renewable electricity. The company is committed to achieving net-zero in its direct operations by 2030 and aims to reduce carbon emissions by 50% across its value chain. This commitment aligns with the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) for the 1.5Â°C pathway. Baileys has already achieved a 29% reduction in water consumption at its production sites and has set a goal to reduce water usage by 20% across all operations by 2030. Additionally, Baileys has been operating with zero waste to landfill in its direct operations since 2014 and is working towards making 100% of its packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2030. These initiatives are part of the broader Diageo Society 2030 Spirit of Progress Plan.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Baileys demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through its long-standing partnerships with over 385 Irish family farms, many of which have been family-run for generations. The company is a proud partner of TirlÃ¡n, a farmer-owned co-operative, which empowers farmers with more control over their businesses. Together with TirlÃ¡n, Baileys has co-founded the Sustainable Farming Academy, offering a Diploma in Environment, Sustainability, and Climate to Glanbia farmers. This initiative aims to equip future generations with the knowledge and skills to advance sustainable farming practices further. The academy supports farmers in implementing regenerative agriculture practices to restore soil and increase biodiversity, including the early achievement of planting 100,000 native Irish trees and hedgerows.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Baileys places a high priority on the welfare of the cows that produce the cream for its Irish Cream liqueur. The company ensures that its supplier farms adhere to the highest standards of animal welfare, environmental protection, and food safety through Irelandâs National Sustainable Dairy Assurance Scheme. This scheme requires farms to be audited every 18 months. Baileys' supplier farms operate a grass-based farming system, allowing cows to graze on lush green fields for more than 200 days a year. Stress levels and udder health of the cows are monitored to ensure low stress and good health, contributing to the quality of the cream produced. Additionally, Baileys and its partner farmers employ practices such as playing music to cows during milking to help them relax, a testament to the care and attention given to animal welfare.

sources: 1, 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Achieving net-zero in direct operations by 2030
    • Reducing carbon emissions by 50% across the value chain by 2030
    • Reducing water usage across all operations by 20% by 2030
    • Making 100% of packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2030

Zest

 86 53

Environmental protection

Zest demonstrates a strong commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainable practices. The company's efforts are particularly focused on facilitating the transition to electric vehicles (EVs) as a means to achieve net zero emissions. Recognizing the critical role of EVs in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, Zest is dedicated to delivering the infrastructure necessary for a widespread shift from petrol and diesel vehicles to electric alternatives. This commitment is rooted in the understanding that transport is the highest emitting sector in the UK, responsible for 22% of greenhouse gas emissions. By supporting the full transition to EVs, Zest contributes significantly to the UK's net zero targets and the global effort to limit temperature rise to 1.5 degrees.

In addition to promoting EV adoption, Zest operates sustainably by implementing hybrid working models and prioritizing carbon efficiency within its operations. The company has successfully limited its annual carbon footprint to just 22.47 tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent (tCO2e). Furthermore, Zest has partnered with Carbon Neutral Britain to offset its carbon footprint, achieving certification as a carbon-neutral business. The offsetting portfolio includes supporting forest creation in the UK and investing in wind farm, hydro power, and reforestation projects in developing countries. These projects not only contribute to environmental conservation but also offer social and economic benefits to the communities involved.

Zest also emphasizes the use of renewable low carbon energy, running on 100% renewable sources. This approach aligns with the broader trend of decarbonizing energy sources in the UK, ensuring that EV charging contributes to a reduction in carbon emissions.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Carbon Neutral Certification
  • Commitments
    • Achieve 100% renewable low carbon energy by 2025

Sephora

 86 47

Environmental protection

Sephora has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability. The company powers all its stores, distribution centers, and headquarters with 100% renewable energy and has been recognized as an EPA Green Power Partner for seven years. Energy management systems have been incorporated into all US and Canada stores to enhance energy efficiency. Sephora is on track to reduce the carbon footprint of its stores, headquarters, and distribution centers by 50% by 2026, employing energy-saving solutions like efficient lighting. The company has achieved 100% renewable energy usage in several countries, including France, Italy, Portugal, Spain, and the United States. Sephora also focuses on reducing waste, having diverted more than 1.6 million pounds of waste from landfills in 2021. The company has launched the Beauty (Re)Purposed program in partnership with Pact Collective, aiming to reduce hard-to-recycle packaging waste by collecting empty beauty packaging in over 600 stores across the U.S. and Canada. This initiative is part of Sephora's broader effort to promote product circularity and reduce environmental impact.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Sephora's sustainability efforts include a commitment to responsible sourcing, which indirectly impacts animal welfare. The company screens potential suppliers for their ethical, social, and environmental performance, including animal welfare standards, before choosing to work with them. Additionally, Sephora's Clean + Planet Positive program highlights products that are cruelty-free, using only sustainably harvested palm oil and mica, which suggests a consideration for animal welfare in their product selection. However, specific animal welfare certifications or programs were not mentioned.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • EPA Green Power Partner
  • Commitments
    • Reduce the carbon footprint of stores, headquarters, and distribution centers by 50% by 2026
    • Power all stores, distribution centers, and headquarters with 100% renewable energy
    • Divert more than 1.6 million pounds of waste from landfills (achieved in 2021)
    • Expand the Beauty (Re)Purposed program to reduce hard-to-recycle packaging waste

Hennessy

 86 48

Environmental protection

Hennessy has been proactive in its environmental sustainability efforts for over two decades, establishing a comprehensive plan that respects the environment. As a pioneer in the environmental field within the Wines and Spirits sector, Hennessy achieved ISO 14001 certification in 1998, recognizing its responsible actions across eleven sites and twelve facilities for environmental protection. The company's commitment extends throughout its entire lifecycle, with a particular focus on farming practices. Hennessy collaborates with a community of 1,600 winegrowers, covering approximately 32,000 hectares of vines, to ensure sustainable practices are implemented.

Hennessy has made several significant commitments to environmental sustainability. These include supporting suppliers to achieve zero herbicide use by 2028 and ensuring all partners comply with sustainable viticulture certifications by 2025. The company has also launched a research project to combat grapevine trunk diseases and has invested in an autonomous robot, Ted from NaÃ¯o, to explore alternatives to chemical weed control. Additionally, Hennessy promotes biodiversity through fallow land, with 21 hectares of its vineyard dedicated to alternative crops, including fallow flowers and preserved meadows. The company is also funding research on adapting grape varieties to drought conditions to mitigate the effects of global warming.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Hennessy places a strong emphasis on worker welfare, recognizing its employees as the heart and soul of the Maison. The company employs over 1,000 individuals and fosters a culture of social responsibility, openness, and exchange. Hennessy supports gender equality and diversity in the workplace and is committed to encouraging employee growth and advancement. This commitment to its people is a testament to Hennessy's dedication to maintaining a supportive and inclusive work environment.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

    • ISO 22000
    • ISO 45001

    • Sustainable Viticulture Cognac
  • Commitments
    • Achieve zero herbicide use by 2028
    • Ensure all partners comply with sustainable viticulture certifications by 2025

Scotts

 86 56

Environmental protection

ScottsMiracle-Gro is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts, focusing on water conservation, reducing plastic usage, and fostering environmental innovation. The company has made significant strides in improving water quality across the U.S. by reformulating products to reduce environmental impact, such as removing phosphorus from lawn maintenance products in 2013 to decrease harmful algae blooms. Additionally, ScottsMiracle-Gro has developed products tailored to specific regional needs, like the ScottsÂ® Turf BuilderÂ® Long Island Lawn Food, and has enhanced its fertilizers in Florida to contain 65 percent slow-release nitrogen to minimize runoff. The company's patented EdgeguardÂ® technology is designed to keep fertilizer on lawns and out of waterways.

ScottsMiracle-Gro is also committed to reducing its environmental footprint through packaging and operational innovations. It aims to reduce the amount of plastic material used in packaging by 3 percent and triple the amount of recycled content in plastic packaging by 2025. The company is the nation's largest recycler of green waste, diverting 5 billion pounds from landfills annually into high-value compost. Furthermore, ScottsMiracle-Gro is working on reducing landfill waste, having diverted more than 23,000 tons in 2020, and is exploring new recycling methods for tackling plastic bag waste. The company has also committed to converting 20 percent of its sales fleet to hybrid vehicles by 2025 to reduce emissions.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

ScottsMiracle-Gro is dedicated to fostering a healthy and inclusive workplace culture. The company has set goals to create a best-in-class associate experience, ensuring that each associate feels welcome, engaged, and that their talents are utilized effectively. ScottsMiracle-Gro is developing platforms to track sentiment and engagement among associates and is committed to maintaining high levels of engagement through action plans. Additionally, the company aims to cultivate an inclusive work environment where differences are acknowledged and leveraged to drive business forward. ScottsMiracle-Gro also focuses on associate health and wellness by providing holistic programs aimed at enhancing health, happiness, and longevity. The company is investing in talent growth to align people plans with business strategies, including identifying critical roles, defining success criteria, assessing talent, and providing learning opportunities for leaders.

sources: 1

Virgin Mobile

 86 37

Environmental protection

Virgin Mobile Middle East and Africa (MEA) has taken significant steps towards environmental protection by achieving net-zero carbon emissions across all its operations in 2021. This milestone was reached through a partnership with the Dubai Carbon Centre of Excellence, which involved gathering and assessing data to calculate the group-wide total emissions and implementing sustainable processes for the reduction of overall emissions. Virgin Mobile MEA has eliminated over 50 tonnes of single-use plastic by removing it from its SIM packs and recharge cards. Additionally, the company has reduced the size of its SIM cards and switched to recycled paper for SIM card packaging, achieving 100% single-use plastic-free operations in Oman and Saudi Arabia. Sustainable practices have also been introduced in its offices, focusing on business travel, reduce and reuse policies, energy efficiency, and sustainability awareness and education. To offset its emissions annually and reach net-zero carbon emissions, Virgin Mobile MEA has invested in nature-based solutions. The company plans to plant thousands of trees in school locations through Carbon Footprint Ltd to support local wildlife habitats and educate children on the importance of natural ecosystems. Furthermore, Virgin Mobile MEA enables customers to offset their carbon footprint with any purchases made through the Virgin Mobile app, as part of its mission to achieve a carbon-negative footprint.

sources: 1, 2

Tidy Cats

 86 49

Environmental protection

Tidy Cats is actively working towards enhancing its sustainability practices with a focus on reducing environmental impact through various initiatives. The brand has set ambitious goals for 2025, which include achieving 100% recyclable or recycle-ready packaging, utilizing 100% renewable electricity in its factories, and incorporating 100% recycled plastic in its jugs. Additionally, Tidy Cats aims to use 50% post-consumer recycled plastic in its pails. To further its commitment to sustainability, Tidy Cats has introduced responsible packaging solutions, such as specially-designed pail refill bags that reduce plastic waste and encourage the reuse of pails. The brand also emphasizes land reclamation, ensuring that the land used is returned to its natural state, which includes transforming it into wildlife areas and lakes. These efforts are part of Tidy Cats' broader mission to create a cleaner environment for pets and their owners to enjoy for years to come.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Tidy Cats has launched the Naturally Strong litter, which is packaged in 50% post-consumer recycled plastic jugs and boxes made from Sustainable Forestry Initiative certified materials. Additionally, the brand has expanded its eco-friendly clumping litter line, Purina Yesterday's News, which is made from recycled newspaper, wood shavings from timber mills, and cardboard recycled from other NestlÃ© facilities. This initiative not only supports recycling efforts but also contributes to reducing the environmental impact associated with pet care products. Over 20,000 tons of paper and cardboard are recycled into Purina Yesterday's News each year, demonstrating Tidy Cats' commitment to sustainability and indirectly promoting animal welfare by ensuring a cleaner environment.

sources: 2

MetLife

 86 43

Environmental protection

MetLife is actively engaged in environmental stewardship, focusing on reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives. The company has implemented energy efficiency, water conservation, waste reduction, and other environmental practices across its global operations. Recognizing the urgent risk posed by climate change, MetLife is committed to playing a part in identifying solutions and building resilience. This commitment is further demonstrated through its Net Zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions ambition for its global operations and General Account investment portfolio by 2050 or sooner. The company tracks emissions in accordance with the GHG Protocol and is dedicated to identifying and measuring relevant climate data as methodologies and standards evolve. MetLife's environmental priorities include biodiversity, climate risk, deforestation, employee training & environmental engagement, environmental health & safety (EHS), green transportation, GHG emissions, green offices, green investments, renewable energy, supply chain sustainability, sustainable travel, waste management, and water management. The company also engages in reforestation efforts and promotes supply chain sustainability.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

MetLife demonstrates a strong commitment to worker welfare through various initiatives aimed at creating a great workplace and nurturing a trusting, inclusive culture. The company focuses on global diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), talent and skill development, holistic well-being, compensation, and attracting and retaining talent. MetLife's broad set of 2030 DEI commitments is designed to address the needs of the underserved and underrepresented, with financial components totaling more than $2.5 billion by 2030. These commitments are informed by the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and include investments, products and services, supply chain, volunteering, and community efforts. MetLife's global DEI efforts are guided by three strategic priorities: Champion Inclusion, Strengthen Our Diversity, and Grow Our Impact.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) commitments with financial components totaling more than $2.5 billion by 2030.

Charles Schwab

 86 44

Environmental protection

Charles Schwab is actively engaged in various environmental stewardship initiatives aimed at minimizing its environmental footprint. The company has implemented a real estate energy management program that benchmarks every major Schwab site using the U.S. Environmental Protection Agencyâs ENERGY STARÂ® program. This program is designed to reduce energy use and carbon emissions through energy-saving projects that offer favorable returns on investment. Schwab follows U.S. Green Building Council design and construction guidelines for all new facilities and uses the LEEDÂ® green building programâs rating system to guide site selection, materials, and technology strategies. In 2020, Schwab installed a 2.5 megawatts AC solar field in North Texas to power a newly built data center, with the excess power sold back to the grid to offset energy costs of other corporate buildings in Texas. The company is also moving towards paperless workflows and works with vendors that use recycled-content and sustainable products. Schwab tracks and manages its corporate real estate performance data, including carbon emissions and energy and water consumption, and discloses its environmental performance annually to CDP. Additionally, Schwab participates in the Newsweek Green Rankings, aiming for annual improvement in its standing.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Charles Schwab is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued. The company is an equal employment opportunity employer and an affirmative action employer, focused on advancing women, racial and ethnic minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities in the workplace. This commitment to diversity and inclusion is seen as integral to the company's success and its purpose of serving every client with passion and integrity.

Oxygen

 86 42

Environmental protection

Oxygen, through its initiatives, is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts. The company emphasizes the significant role of oxygen in achieving sustainable industrial operations, highlighting the importance of minimizing the environmental impact associated with oxygen production. Oxygen's approach to reducing the life-cycle cost and environmental footprint of oxygen production involves focusing on the power required to manufacture oxygen, particularly through methods like Vacuum Pressure Swing Adsorption (VPSA) compared to traditional methods such as Liquid Oxygen (LOX) with offsite power. This strategy not only aims to reduce operating costs but also to lessen the carbon footprint associated with oxygen production, thereby contributing to environmental sustainability1.

Additionally, Oxygen Conservation is committed to growing natural capital at scale, recognizing the critical role of natural capitalâforests, water, soils, and oceansâin providing essential benefits and mitigating climate change by removing carbon from the atmosphere. The company is dedicated to reversing the decline of natural capital through the restoration and management of unique land holdings, each with its own set of environmental and ecological challenges. By focusing on land management practices that protect and expand rare and endangered habitats and biodiversity, Oxygen Conservation aims to deliver significant positive environmental and social impacts while generating economic returns2.

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Scaling Conservation to deliver positive environmental and social impact2
    • Adopting land management practices that protect rare and endangered habitats and biodiversity2

Ivory

 86 57

Environmental protection

Ivory Homes has launched a significant environmental initiative known as the 30,000 Tree Initiative, announced on Earth Day 2018. This initiative is a part of their mission to be an innovative, eco-friendly, and sustainable homebuilder. In partnership with the Clark and Christine Ivory Foundation, TreeUtah, and UCAIR, they aim to plant 30,000 trees across Utah to enhance beauty, shade, and improve air quality in neighborhoods. As of now, 15,793 trees have been planted. These trees are expected to produce over 3,000,000 pounds of oxygen annually, meeting the oxygen needs of over 23,000 people, and sequester an estimated 560,000 pounds of carbon. This initiative also focuses on water conservation through their Waterwise landscaping approach, emphasizing the planting of trees in areas that maximize their impact on both air and water quality. Ivory Homes' commitment to environmental sustainability is further demonstrated by their move to include an energy-efficiency package standard in all of their homes starting in 2023, featuring EnergyStar, smart thermostats, and sprinkler controllers at no additional cost to home-buyers. This approach not only aims to save homeowners money in the long term but also contributes to reducing the environmental footprint of their homes.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • ISO 20121:2012 (International Standard for Event Sustainability)
    • ISO 14001:2015 (International Standard for Environmental Management)
  • Commitments
    • Planting 30,000 trees in Utah communities
    • Moving all homes to include an EnergyStar, smart thermostat, and sprinkler controller package by 2023

Carnival Cruise Line

 86 37

Environmental protection

Carnival Cruise Line, under its parent company Carnival Corporation & plc, has made significant strides in environmental protection and sustainability. The company is focused on decarbonization, with a commitment to achieving a 20% carbon intensity reduction relative to its 2019 baseline. This is part of a broader goal to achieve net carbon-neutral ship operations by 2050. Carnival Corporation is pioneering the use of liquefied natural gas (LNG) as a cleaner fuel alternative, with eight LNG-capable ships already in service and three more on order. The company has also invested in energy-efficient solutions such as service power packages, shore power capabilities, and air lubrication systems to reduce fuel consumption and emissions. Additionally, Carnival Corporation is exploring new technologies and alternative fuels, including batteries, fuel cells, and biofuels, to further its decarbonization efforts.

In terms of waste management, Carnival Corporation aims to enhance its circular economy model by reducing single-use plastics by 50% as of 2021, achieving a 30% food waste reduction per person in 2022, and setting an interim goal to achieve a 40% unit food waste reduction by 2025. The company is also increasing its Advanced Waste Water Treatment System coverage to over 75% of its fleet capacity and partnering with vendors to reduce upstream packaging volumes.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Carnival Corporation is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce that mirrors the diversity of the 700 ports and destinations it visits worldwide. The company has been recognized as one of the World's Top Female-Friendly Companies and is the only cruise company listed among the 800 top-performing global employers for talent development, gender equality, and social responsibility. Carnival Corporation has set goals for 2030 to ensure its overall shoreside employee base reflects the diversity of the world and to expand shipboard and shoreside diversity, equity, and inclusion across all ranks and departments. Additionally, the company is committed to job creation, establishing measurable company culture metrics, implementing global well-being standards, and reducing the number of guest and crew work-related injuries.

sources: 2, 3

Animal welfare

Carnival Corporation is committed to supporting biodiversity and conservation initiatives through select NGO partnerships and regularly conducts audits and monitors animal encounter excursions. The company has set goals for 2030 to support biodiversity and conservation initiatives and aims to supply 100% of its seafood needs through sustainable fishery programs by 2050.

sources: 3

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Achieve 20% carbon intensity reduction relative to 2019 baseline by 2030
    • Achieve net carbon-neutral ship operations by 2050
    • Achieve 50% single-use plastic item reduction by 2021
    • Achieve 30% food waste reduction per person by 2022
    • Achieve 40% unit food waste reduction by 2025
    • Increase Advanced Waste Water Treatment System coverage to > 75% of fleet capacity by 2030
    • Achieve 100% cage-free eggs by the end of 2025
    • Achieve 100% responsible chicken sourcing by the end of 2025
    • Achieve 100% gestation crate-free pork by the end of 2025

Pandora (jewelry)

 86 46

Environmental protection

Pandora is actively working towards becoming a more sustainable and environmentally responsible company. They have set ambitious goals to reduce their carbon footprint and increase the circularity of their products. By 2025, Pandora has committed to only purchasing recycled silver and gold for crafting their jewelry, highlighting their move towards circularity and reducing the demand for newly mined metals. This initiative is significant given that silver is their most-used metal. They also prioritize giving primary production waste at their crafting facilities in Thailand a second life, demonstrating their commitment to waste management. Furthermore, Pandora has improved its packaging to reduce plastic usage, making it easier to recycle while maintaining high quality standards.

Pandora aims to halve its greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and achieve net-zero business operations by 2040. Their climate targets have been approved by the Science Based Targets initiative, ensuring that their objectives align with the global effort to limit warming to below 1.5Â°C. Since 2020, the company has sourced only renewable energy for all its crafting facilities. Additionally, Pandora is committed to becoming carbon neutral in its own operations by 2025, implementing energy-saving measures across its crafting facilities, offices, retail stores, and warehouses.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Pandora places a strong emphasis on creating an inclusive, diverse, and fair working environment. The company provides safe and healthy working conditions for over 13,500 employees at its crafting facilities in Thailand. Pandora has set diversity targets, aiming for gender parity in leadership positions by 2030. This goal underscores their commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace for all employees. Additionally, Pandora's Human Rights Programme aligns with the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGPs), further demonstrating their dedication to respecting the dignity and human rights of everyone touched by their business.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to purchasing only recycled silver and gold for jewelry crafting by 2025
    • Aiming to halve greenhouse gas emissions by 2030
    • Becoming a net-zero business by 2040
    • Becoming carbon neutral in own operations by 2025
    • Achieving gender parity in leadership by 2030

Bertolli

 86 64

Environmental protection

Bertolli, under its parent company Deoleo, has launched significant initiatives aimed at enhancing the sustainability of the olive oil category. A notable effort is the introduction of sustainably sourced versions of Bertolli and Carapelli extra virgin olive oils, which underscores the company's commitment to sustainable production practices. Deoleo has established the industry's first-ever Sustainability Protocol for extra virgin olive oil products in collaboration with Intertek, a leading total quality assurance provider. This protocol has led to the certification of 70 olive oil mills and nearly 680,000 acres of olive groves across Italy, Spain, Tunisia, and Argentina, propelling over 40,000 farmers into a new era of sustainable olive farming. Additionally, Bertolli Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil has been launched in the U.S. in 100 percent recycled plastic bottles, marking a significant step towards reducing plastic consumption. The company is also working on optimizing the weight of its plastic packaging by up to 10 percent, which is expected to result in a global reduction of approximately 110 tons of plastic annually. Furthermore, Deoleo is making strides in reducing greenhouse gas emissions through investments in energy-efficient and low-carbon technologies, alongside conducting energy consumption audits and viability studies. Its Tavernelle and Alcolea plants have been recognized as "Zero waste plants" by PreZero, an international waste and recycling management leader, and the Alcolea plant is set to receive photovoltaic panels to generate clean energy, aligning with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Transition to 100 percent recycled plastic (rPET) for packaging
    • Reduction of plastic packaging weight by up to 10 percent, aiming for a global reduction of approximately 110 tons of plastic annually
    • Achieve and maintain "Zero waste plants" certification aligning with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)

DeWalt

 86 65

Environmental protection

DeWalt is actively working towards sustainability through various initiatives. Their brushless motor technology is designed to run cooler and more efficiently, offering up to 57% more runtime compared to standard brushed motors, which contributes to energy conservation. DeWalt's cordless outdoor power equipment, powered by their 20V MAX and 60V MAX batteries, is designed to provide gas performance without the emissions, further reducing the environmental impact. Additionally, DeWalt is an active participant in battery recycling and disposal programs, partnering with Call2Recycle to ensure responsible end-of-life management of their products. Their ECOSMARTâ¢ program highlights the company's commitment to sustainability, focusing on early identification of product sustainability opportunities during the design phase to minimize environmental impact. This includes efforts to improve energy efficiency and runtime of their products, emphasizing the development of high-performance cordless tools that reduce the need for electric cords and pneumatic hoses on job sites.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

DeWalt demonstrates a commitment to worker welfare through its Perform & Protectâ¢ line of power tools, which is designed with features that provide a high level of control, dust containment, or low vibration. These features are aimed at lessening worker discomfort without sacrificing performance or durability. By focusing on creating tools that reduce potential health risks associated with dust and vibration, DeWalt is actively working to protect workers on the job site.

sources: 1

Nothing found

  • Commitments
    • Active participation in battery recycling and disposal with Call2Recycle
    • Commitment to sustainability through the ECOSMARTâ¢ program, focusing on product sustainability opportunities during the design phase

King's Hawaiian

Miracle-Gro

 86 58

Environmental protection

Miracle-Gro is actively engaged in several environmental protection initiatives, focusing on sustainability in product development and operations. The company uses over 3 billion pounds of green waste annually in its products, transforming yard clippings and tree branches into beneficial gardening materials. This effort not only recycles organic waste but also contributes to the production of environmentally friendly gardening products. Additionally, Miracle-Gro is committed to reducing its environmental footprint through sustainable packaging practices. The company's natural, dye-free mulch bags include post-consumer recycled (PCR) materials, sourced from items consumers recycle every day, demonstrating a commitment to minimizing waste and promoting recycling.

Miracle-Gro also emphasizes the importance of sourcing materials sustainably. By procuring materials close to its manufacturing facilities, the company aims to limit the transportation of heavy input materials, thereby reducing carbon emissions associated with logistics. Furthermore, Miracle-Gro offers peat-free options, such as the Miracle-Gro Organic Raised Bed & Garden Soil, which utilizes wood fiber and compost. This initiative not only provides a sustainable alternative to peat, which is a non-renewable resource, but also enhances soil aeration and drainage for better plant growth.

In terms of local production, Miracle-Gro ensures that its soils and mulches are generally manufactured within 150 miles on average from the stores where they are sold, excluding Alaska and Hawaii. This practice supports local economies and reduces the carbon footprint associated with long-distance transportation of products.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Utilize over 3 billion pounds of green waste annually in products by 2023
    • Include post-consumer recycled materials in natural, dye-free mulch bags by 2023
    • Source materials sustainably close to manufacturing facilities to limit transportation emissions by 2023
    • Offer peat-free options like Miracle-Gro Organic Raised Bed & Garden Soil by 2023
    • Manufacture soils and mulches within 150 miles on average from the stores they are sold, excluding Alaska and Hawaii, by 2023

Schick

 86 55

Environmental protection

Schick, under its parent company Edgewell Personal Care, has initiated several efforts to enhance sustainability and reduce environmental impact. A significant step in this direction is the introduction of the Schick Xtreme and Schick Intuition Bamboo Hybrid Razors. These razors are designed with sustainability in mind, featuring handles made from certified sustainably sourced bamboo and flexible blades composed of 75 percent recycled steel. The packaging for these razors is 100% recyclable, aligning with the company's Sustainable Care 2030 strategy. This strategy aims to reduce virgin petroleum-based plastic materials by 50 percent in its disposable razor handle offerings by 2030. Additionally, Schick has transitioned the handles on its men's and women's disposable razors to be made with up to 100% post-consumer recycled (PCR) plastic and has launched a nationwide recycling program to further mitigate plastic waste. These initiatives reflect Schick's commitment to reducing its environmental footprint and offering more sustainable product options to its consumers.

sources: 1, 2

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments

Kohler

 86 57

Environmental protection

Kohler has been actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on reducing the environmental footprint of its operations and products since 2008. The company has made significant strides in waste reduction, achieving a 58% reduction in global operational waste to landfill. In terms of water conservation, Kohler has reduced water withdrawal intensity by 57%. Additionally, Kohler has made progress in emissions reduction, with a 62% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions intensity. The KOHLER WasteLAB initiative is a notable project that repurposes manufacturing waste into products, diverting 54,000 pounds of waste from landfills since 2019. Kohler also emphasizes water-efficient products, with WaterSense-labeled products saving 560 billion gallons of water in the U.S. alone since 2007. The company is committed to net-zero greenhouse gas emissions and zero waste to landfill across global operations, developing energy- and water-saving products, and promoting the adoption of environmentally friendly products. Kohler's Design for Environment (DfE) program optimizes product and process designs for sustainability, and the Environmental Resource Impact Calculator (ERIC) measures the positive environmental impacts of products. Kohler offers products with third-party-verified Environmental Product Declarations (EPDs) and Declare labels, indicating a commitment to material health and sustainability.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • Declare labels

    • Zero waste to landfill across global operations

Johns Hopkins Medicine

 86 62

Environmental protection

Johns Hopkins Medicine has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability within its operations. The Johns Hopkins Hospital General Services Office of Sustainability is dedicated to enhancing policies, programs, and practices that avoid harm to human health, promote a safe patient atmosphere, and improve environmental quality. The hospital has a Green Team that engages in activities such as storm drain stenciling, neighborhood cleanups, and protecting the Chesapeake Bay. They focus on decreasing waste through reuse, repurposing, and recycling. The hospital has also made strides in reducing energy costs and stormwater runoff by installing over 65,000 square feet of green roof on the MRI building. Efforts to support alternative transportation include telework and telehealth services, participation in regional transportation planning, providing free electric vehicle charging stations, and installing bike racks to promote cycling. Additionally, the hospital has removed Styrofoam products and plastic straws from its cafeterias, equipped operating rooms with energy-efficient LED lighting, and uses green certified cleaners to reduce the use of harmful chemicals. The hospital also engages in community cleanups and has expanded the collection and bio-decontamination of unused clinical supplies, saving over $200,000 annually. Furthermore, more than 118,600 pounds of electronics have been recycled through community drop-off events and on-site collection.

sources: 1, 2, 3

American Greetings

 86 57

Environmental protection

American Greetings has initiated the Actively Green program to enhance its sustainability efforts, with a focus on five key areas: Responsible Sourcing, Recycled Paper Use, Reducing Throwaway, Recyclability, and Corporate Responsibility. The company has set ambitious goals to be achieved by 2025, which include sourcing over 90% of all paper from sustainable sources, offsetting more than 90% of its world headquarters' carbon footprint through reforestation efforts, eliminating 200 tons of landfill waste at its company headquarters, reducing the amount of municipal waste sent to landfills by 50%, and ensuring that at least 10% of the paper fiber used is post-consumer waste content. These goals reflect a comprehensive approach to environmental stewardship, focusing on both the sourcing of materials and the reduction of waste and carbon footprint.

Avis

 86 42

Environmental protection

Avis is actively engaged in several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment and reducing its carbon footprint. The company has developed a comprehensive approach to integrate electric vehicles (EVs) into its fleet, focusing on customer journey, infrastructure, and technology. Avis has made significant progress in reducing its carbon footprint, achieving a 17% reduction since 2018 through direct and indirect emissions management. The company has set ambitious targets to cut greenhouse gas emissions by 30% by 2030. Avis is also investing in fuel-efficient, hybrid, and electric vehicles, with a notable achievement of its electric vehicles being driven 23 million miles in 2022. In Scandinavia, 60% of Avis's fleet consists of hybrid or electric vehicles, with Norway operating a rental fleet of 55% battery and plug-in electric vehicles. The company supports the growth of the charging network, having installed around 180 chargers in Europe and partnering with EverCharge in the US to launch charging points at George Bush International Airport. Avis is also exploring vehicle-to-grid technology in Scandinavia, training maintenance teams in the repair and maintenance of high-voltage EV vehicles, and boosting car-sharing through the growth of the Zipcar fleet, which included more than 600 electric vehicles in the UK in 2022. Additionally, Avis is focused on increasing energy efficiency across its locations and has implemented water-saving car wash systems in the US and Denmark to reduce water usage.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Avis is committed to promoting diversity in the workplace and ensuring a fair and equal work environment for its global team of more than 24,500 individuals. The company's corporate responsibility efforts extend beyond philanthropy and volunteerism to include business practices that are friendly to customers, employees, and the environment. Avis strives to be a strong community leader and role model, involving both corporate and employee participation in civic and charitable activities. The company's dedication to diversity and inclusion is part of its broader Environmental Social and Governance (ESG) goals, which are reviewed and recognized annually through its ESG report.

sources: 1, 2

Safelite

 86 55

Environmental protection

Safelite AutoGlass has demonstrated a strong commitment to environmental protection through its windshield recycling program. Since 2012, the company has recycled over eight million windshields, preventing more than 139,000 tons of glass from ending up in landfills and reducing carbon dioxide emissions by over 23,000 tons. This initiative not only benefits the environment by reducing landfill waste and carbon emissions but also contributes to the circular economy by repurposing the recycled glass into new products such as fiberglass insulation and carpet backing. Safelite's efforts in this area have seen a year-on-year increase of more than 20 percent in their recycling efforts, showcasing their ongoing commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Safelite AutoGlass engages in various social responsibility initiatives aimed at supporting the welfare of its workers and the broader community. Through volunteerism, the National Giving Campaign, the Safelite Challenge, and the Safelite AutoGlass Charity Classic, the company fosters a culture of giving back and community involvement among its employees. These initiatives provide Safelite's workforce with opportunities to engage in meaningful community service, thereby enhancing their sense of purpose and well-being. Additionally, the Safelite Foundation offers impact grants to non-profit groups, further demonstrating the company's commitment to supporting causes that benefit both its employees and the wider community.

Casio

 85 55

Environmental protection

Casio is actively working towards a sustainable future by focusing on environmental protection and the shift towards a circular economy. The company has identified the use of eco-materials and the promotion of solar charging systems as key strategies. Eco-materials are selected for their potential to reduce environmental impact and support the transition to a circular economy. Casio's solar charging technology minimizes the need for regular battery replacement, further reducing waste and environmental impact. Additionally, Casio supports environmental groups and initiatives, demonstrating its commitment to living in harmony with nature and realizing a decarbonized society. The company's efforts are aligned with its sustainability goals, which include contributing to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and addressing climate change in line with the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) recommendations.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Casio is committed to providing supportive workplace environments and promoting diversity and inclusion. The company focuses on making the most of human resources and maintaining optimal workplace environments. This includes human resource development, occupational safety and health, and respect for human rights. Casio's initiatives aim to ensure a respectful and inclusive work culture that values the contributions of all employees. The company's efforts in this area are part of its broader commitment to social responsibility and sustainability.

Life Lock

 85 43

Environmental protection

NortonLifeLock has demonstrated a commitment to environmental stewardship, notably through its efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Between FY21 and FY22, the company achieved a significant reduction in Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gases, decreasing emissions by 39%. This reduction was primarily attributed to transitioning to more efficient data centers and reducing physical office space. These actions reflect NortonLifeLock's dedication to minimizing its environmental impact and contributing to global sustainability efforts.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

NortonLifeLock has placed a strong emphasis on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) within its workforce. In FY22, the company reported that 33% of its global workforce self-identified as women, and it continued to achieve gender parity among the independent members of its Board of Directors. Additionally, in the U.S., the percentage of employees self-identifying as having underrepresented racial and ethnic backgrounds increased from 13% in FY21 to 17% in FY22. These statistics highlight NortonLifeLock's commitment to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace environment.

USAA

 85 53

Environmental protection

USAA has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability within its operations. The company has made significant strides in recycling, achieving more than 2 million pounds of paper, glass, plastic, and other materials recycled, which reduced landfill waste by more than 50% in 2022. In efforts to conserve water, USAA's San Antonio headquarters saves more than 130 million gallons of Edwards Aquifer water annually through the use of recycled water for landscaping and efficient cooling towers. Additionally, USAA has focused on energy savings, with its main headquarters in San Antonio being the largest financial office building in America to earn the ENERGY STAR certification award from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. The company also participates in green programs such as the LEED Green Building Program and the Fitwel Building Certification Program, demonstrating its commitment to energy performance and prioritizing occupants' health and wellness.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

USAA is committed to improving the lives of its employees and the communities where they operate. The company was the first U.S.-based insurance company to earn the WELL Health-Safety seal, indicating excellence in facility operations and safety protocols, and a commitment to employee and visitor safety. Furthermore, USAA supports its employees' engagement in community service through donations and volunteer work. Each year, USAA provides all employees with up to 16 paid volunteer hours and matches their first $1,000 in donations, empowering them to be change-makers in their communities. This initiative not only enhances worker welfare but also strengthens local communities.

sources: 1, 2

Aetna

 85 43

Environmental protection

Aetna Group is actively engaged in enhancing sustainability across its operations, focusing on the optimization of traditional packaging materials and the exploration of innovative, sustainable materials. The company has integrated sustainability into its decision-making processes and evaluates its production processes, technologies, and daily operations through a sustainability lens. Aetna Group has made significant investments in digitalization to streamline internal and customer processes, adopted advanced systems to improve energy efficiency, and reduce CO2 emissions. Additionally, the company is committed to finding increasingly sustainable materials and has introduced standards and behaviors that respect the environment.

The TechLab, Aetna Group's research laboratory, plays a crucial role in reducing plastic material consumption by developing technologies that precisely measure the amount of film needed for packaging and testing packaging materials under real transport conditions. This initiative has led to a significant reduction in plastic usage, with savings of 96.120 kg of film per year based on a volume of 100 pallets per day. Aetna Group is also exploring recycled, biodegradable, and paper packaging solutions.

Furthermore, Aetna Group's Holding aims to reduce compostable material, save energy, and maintain reliability and safety in its operations. The company has introduced the PACK2GREEN packaging machine and the ReCYCLE machine for compacting packaging waste, both designed to support recyclable and recycled materials. Aetna Group promotes a circular economy and a corporate culture focused on sustainability through various initiatives, including the use of natural gas company fleets, the separation of plastic materials for easier disposal and reuse, and the installation of photovoltaic systems to reduce CO2 emissions.

sources: 1

  • Commitments

Four Seasons

 85 54

Environmental protection

Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and reduce its carbon footprint. At the Four Seasons Hotel London at Park Lane, they have introduced electric vehicle (EV) and bicycle charging stations for guest use and arrange bicycles for guests through external partners. The hotel sources its energy from renewable or carbon-free sources and has installed energy-saving guest room controls and building systems. Additionally, they employ water-efficient landscaping using drip irrigation to conserve water.

In terms of waste reduction, the hotel has eliminated single-use plastic water bottles, food and beverage containers, and coffee pods. They have a recycling program in place and ensure that all food waste, including used cooking oil, is diverted from landfill and sent to external facilities for biomass fuel and fertilizer production. Non-food waste is used for energy production through an in-house combined heat and power (CHP) cogeneration plant. Soaps and toiletries are recycled and donated to those in need through their partner, Clean the World.

The hotel also focuses on sustainable food and beverage practices by offering local, sustainable, and seasonal menu items, using cage-free eggs, sustainability-sourced coffee, responsibly sourced seafood, and banning endangered species from all menus. A food waste reduction program is also in place to minimize waste.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts is committed to creating a positive and lasting impact on the communities around them. This commitment extends to their employees, with initiatives aimed at enabling diverse teams to reach their full potential and giving back with genuine heart. Employees at the Four Seasons Hotel London at Park Lane volunteer in the local community and support charitable organizations, including UK Youth and The Terry Fox Foundation and its official Terry Fox Run UK. Additionally, employees complete annual Human Trafficking Awareness training to further contribute to social welfare and awareness.

sources: 1

  • Commitments

Amazon Fresh

 85 50

Environmental protection

Amazon Fresh is actively working towards environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting renewable energy usage. The company has set ambitious goals to power its operations with 100% renewable energy by 2025, which is five years ahead of its original target of 2030. Additionally, Amazon Fresh is committed to achieving net-zero carbon by 2040. To support these commitments, Amazon Fresh has implemented innovative packaging solutions to reduce materials and ensure grocery items remain chilled, thereby minimizing waste. The company offers over 300,000 Climate Pledge Friendly products, allowing customers to participate in its sustainability efforts. Amazon Fresh also adjusts the amount of insulation and packaging based on weather conditions to further reduce waste. In terms of infrastructure, Amazon Fresh is seeking certification from the International Living Future Institute (ILFI) for the world's first certified Zero Carbon grocery store in Seattle. This store, along with others, incorporates sustainability features such as a natural-refrigerant-based refrigeration system, all-electric kitchen and hot water heating systems, electric-vehicle charging for customers, and low-carbon concrete floors. These efforts have led to significant carbon savings, with the Seattle store saving over 100 tons of CO2e since its opening. Furthermore, 80% of deliveries in Manhattan are made via e-bike, with plans to increase this percentage, showcasing Amazon Fresh's commitment to reducing emissions from transportation.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Amazon Fresh has committed to sourcing cage-free whole shell eggs in North America and Europe, demonstrating its concern for animal welfare in its supply chain. Additionally, the company offers sustainable coffee certified by Rainforest Alliance, Fairtrade International, or Fair Trade USA, indicating a commitment to ethical sourcing practices that also consider the welfare of animals in coffee-growing regions. The paper used in Amazon Fresh's paper towels, toilet paper, and facial tissues comes from third-party certified sustainable sources, further reflecting the company's commitment to responsible sourcing practices that can indirectly benefit animal habitats by promoting sustainable forestry.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

  • Commitments

    • Achieving net-zero carbon by 2040

Environmental protection

QVC, as part of the Qurate Retail Group, is actively working to protect the environment through various sustainability initiatives. These efforts include sustainable packaging, energy-efficient operations, and optimizing shipping and logistics to minimize environmental impact. The company is committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, increasing recycling efforts, reducing the use of single-use plastics at their locations, and educating customers on how to properly recycle packaging. This comprehensive approach to environmental protection demonstrates QVC's dedication to contributing positively to the planet's health.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

QVC, under the umbrella of Qurate Retail Group, is committed to ensuring worker welfare through various programs and initiatives. The company's Global Sourcing Social Responsibility program includes proactive regular audits of all factories for proprietary products and most factories for vendor products. This ensures that the working conditions meet the company's high standards for human rights and labor practices. Additionally, QVC and HSN are helping customers find clean products with their Clean Beauty and Conscious Choice Cleaning initiatives, further emphasizing their commitment to responsible sourcing and manufacturing practices that prioritize worker welfare.

Amazon Echo

 85 43

Environmental protection

Amazon Echo is designed with environmental sustainability in mind, focusing on carbon reduction throughout the lifecycle of the device, from production through customer use to disposal. The company aims for each generation of Amazon devices to be more carbon-efficient than the last. Over 60% of devices in customers' homes had Low Power Mode by the end of 2022, a feature that reduces energy consumption. Amazon has also committed to investing in renewable energy, with enough capacity contracted through new wind and solar farms to equal the expected energy use of Echo, Fire TV, and Ring devices globally in 2025. These farms are expected to be operational between 2023 and 2024. Additionally, Amazon incorporates recycled materials into many new devices, including up to 75% recycled plastic, up to 100% recycled yarn, up to 100% recycled aluminum, and up to 90% recycled magnesium, depending on the product. The company has set an ambitious goal to make Amazon device packaging 100% recyclable by 2023 and is working to source 100% of the wood fiber in its packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Invest in wind and solar farm capacity equal to the energy use of Echo, Fire TV, and Ring devices worldwide by 2025
    • Make Amazon device packaging 100% recyclable by 2023
    • Source 100% of the wood fiber in our packaging from responsibly managed forests or recycled sources

J.Crew

 85 45

Environmental protection

J.Crew is actively working towards environmental sustainability through various initiatives focused on the materials used in their products. By 2025, J.Crew aims to have 100% of its key fibers sustainably sourced, including all of its cotton. They are a member of the Better Cotton initiative, which supports cotton communities and environmental protection. Their efforts extend to wool, which is processed without chlorine, and silk, dyed without hazardous chemicals in a LEED-certified facility. J.Crew also utilizes ECONYL, a 100% regenerated nylon yarn made from waste, and LENZING ECOVERO, a more sustainable viscose. Additionally, they use TENCEL lyocell and modal fibers from sustainably managed forests, and TENCEL X REFIBRA technology for creating new fibers from recycled materials. Their commitment to sustainability is further demonstrated by their use of organic cotton, PRIMALOFT insulation made from recycled plastic bottles, recycled nylon and polyester, and materials certified by the Responsible Wool Standard, U.S. Cotton Trust Protocol, and regenagri for regenerative farming practices. sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

J.Crew is committed to the welfare of workers within its supply chain. The company sources its cashmere responsibly, certified by The Good Cashmere Standard, which supports the welfare of cashmere goats and the lives of farmers and farming communities. In 2020, J.Crew founded a program with the Sustainable Fibre Alliance to support over 1,000 female herders in Mongolia, providing them with financial knowledge and techniques to improve the quality of their products. Furthermore, as of fall 2023, all J.Crew cashmere sweaters and accessories are produced in Fair Trade Certified factories, ensuring additional income and better conditions for workers. sources: 1

Animal welfare

J.Crew's commitment to animal welfare is evident in their sourcing of cashmere. All J.Crew cashmere sweaters are certified to The Good Cashmere Standard by the Aid by Trade Foundation. This certification supports the welfare of cashmere goats, the lives of farmers and farming communities, and the environment. Additionally, J.Crew has launched a model farm program in partnership with The Good Cashmere Standard, investing in farms in Inner Mongolia to develop and share best practices. sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Better Cotton Initiative
    • bluesignÂ®-approved mill for silk
    • LEEDÂ®-certified facility for silk production
    • The Good Cashmere StandardÂ®
    • Responsible Wool Standard
    • U.S. Cotton Trust ProtocolÂ®
    • regenagriÂ® certification
  • Commitments

    • 100% of cotton to be sustainably sourced

Equifax

 85 43

Environmental protection

Equifax is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact with a commitment to achieving net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2040. This commitment is supported by their transition to the Equifax Cloudâ¢, which is expected to significantly reduce their on-site technology and data centers, leveraging the enhanced energy efficiency of their cloud service providers. Equifax has set near-term greenhouse gas emissions targets validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and has begun purchasing renewable energy. They have also implemented Salesforce Net Zero Cloud as the system of record for GHG emissions and have certified their Heredia, Costa Rica location as carbon neutral. Their environmental priorities focus on carbon emissions, primarily from electricity, and waste management. Equifax's strategy includes decommissioning data centers, optimizing HVAC systems, implementing cold aisle containment processes, and purchasing renewable energy. They have also taken steps to reduce waste by implementing central trash and recycling bins, shredding and recycling paper documents, and responsibly disposing of electronic waste. Their sustainability efforts are further supported by employee engagement through the Sustainability employee network and initiatives in Costa Rica focused on recycling and waste reduction.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • Certified Heredia, Costa Rica location as carbon neutral

Modelo

 85 48

Environmental protection

Grupo Modelo is actively working towards environmental sustainability through its "Every Bottle Counts" initiative, aiming for all its beer bottles to be returnable or made primarily from recycled materials by 2025. This initiative has already seen significant success, with 478 million bottles recovered, preventing the release of 110,177 tons of CO2 emissions. This effort aligns with the company's broader sustainability strategy, which includes objectives for smart agriculture, water management, climate action, and circular packaging. The company's commitment to circular packaging is evident in its current operations, where 34% of its glass containers are made from recycled materials, and 51% of its glass bottles sold are reusable. Despite the strong returnable system, Grupo Modelo acknowledges the loss of some bottles to waste and has launched programs to recover these bottles, enhancing the circular packaging value chain and contributing to environmental sustainability. The company's sustainability goals for 2025 are based on science, with clear measurement methods aimed at having a global, environmental, social, and transformative impact across its entire value chain.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Grupo Modelo's sustainability efforts also extend to worker welfare, particularly through the "Modelo Recyclers" entrepreneurship program. This initiative works with 80 recyclers to recover and deliver bottles to nine processing plants across Mexico, generating hundreds of jobs within the circular packaging value chain. This program not only contributes to the company's environmental goals but also aims to enhance the community's living conditions by fostering productive development and creating employment opportunities. The company's commitment to improving people's quality of life is evident in its efforts to integrate sustainability into its business model, aiming to create a greener future with more reasons to celebrate.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Achieve 100% of beer bottles to be returnable or made from recycled materials by 2025
    • Recover all bottles lost in the value chain through the "Every Bottle Counts" initiative
