Schwinn

 85 61

Environmental protection

Schwinn promotes the use of bicycles as a means to reduce carbon emissions and fight pollution. By encouraging the switch from car trips to bike rides, Schwinn highlights the potential for significant reductions in carbon dioxide emissions. The company points out that even electric bikes, which may be charged using electricity generated from fossil fuels, offer a dramatic decrease in carbon emissions compared to traditional motor vehicle usage. Additionally, Schwinn emphasizes the role of cycling in reducing noise pollution and preventing the discharge of toxic vehicle fluids into the environment. This approach not only contributes to cleaner air but also protects wildlife by reducing roadkill incidents. Schwinn's advocacy for biking as an environmentally friendly alternative to car travel aligns with broader efforts to combat climate change and protect natural habitats.

sources: 1

Children's Claritin

U.S. Bank

 85 41

Environmental protection

U.S. Bank has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and reduce its carbon footprint. The bank has set ambitious goals under a 2014 baseline to reduce its operational greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 40% by 2029 and 60% by 2044. Remarkably, it achieved a 40% reduction in GHG emissions by the end of 2019 and reached its 60% reduction target in 2021, well ahead of schedule. U.S. Bank invests in renewable energy projects through its U.S. Bancorp Community Development Corporation (USBCDC), focusing on solar and wind energy, which not only benefits the environment but also creates jobs. In 2021, the bank invested $830 million in Renewable Energy Tax Credit (RETC) equity. Additionally, U.S. Bank has 26 LEED-certified branches and is committed to sustainable design principles for new facilities. The bank has also introduced a U.S. Bank VisaÂ® Debit Card made with recovered ocean-bound plastic, aiming to reduce plastic waste. U.S. Bank's environmental efforts extend to partnerships with organizations like the American Indian College Fund, GRID Alternatives, and Evergreen Climate Innovations to support renewable energy, environmental sustainability, and economic development. The bank has also set a goal to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Reduce operational greenhouse gas emissions by 40% by 2029 and 60% by 2044 (achieved 40% reduction by end of 2019 and 60% reduction in 2021)
    • Achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050

Neiman Marcus

 85 46

Environmental protection

Neiman Marcus Group (NMG) has outlined a comprehensive strategy to enhance environmental sustainability within its operations. A significant focus is on reducing carbon emissions, with a goal to cut Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 50% from a 2019 baseline by 2025. This ambitious target demonstrates the company's commitment to mitigating its impact on climate change. Additionally, NMG is advancing sustainable products and services, aiming to extend the useful life of 1,000,000 luxury items through circular services. This initiative not only promotes the reuse and recycling of luxury goods but also supports the broader goal of reducing waste and encouraging a more sustainable consumption model. Furthermore, NMG has made strides in reducing its carbon footprint, achieving a 23% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions to 58,612 MTCO2e between 2019 and 2020. This progress underscores the company's dedication to its environmental commitments and its role in leading the luxury retail sector towards a more sustainable future.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Neiman Marcus Group is actively working to cultivate a culture of belonging and equity within its workforce. The company has set clear goals to advance workplace equity in line with prominent external standards, aiming to increase racial diversity in leadership roles (Vice President level and above) to 21%. This initiative reflects NMG's commitment to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment. Additionally, the company has achieved notable milestones, including a 57% female board and a 68% female workforce, demonstrating its dedication to gender diversity and equality. NMG has also introduced new paid parental and caregiver leave policies, further supporting its associates' welfare and work-life balance. Moreover, the company has committed to providing Belonging training for 100% of its associates, ensuring that all employees are equipped with the knowledge and skills to contribute to an inclusive workplace culture.

sources: 1, 2

Tubi

 85 55

Environmental protection

Tubi is actively engaged in environmental protection through various innovative practices and technologies. The company emphasizes minimizing its environmental impact by focusing on pollution prevention, reducing the consumption of natural resources, emissions, and the reduction and recycling of waste. A significant innovation in their approach is the development of Tubiâs Mobile Modular Extrusion plants. These plants are designed to be environmentally friendly, recycling heat into energy during all modes of operation, which underscores Tubi's commitment to sustainable manufacturing processes. Additionally, by operating on-site, Tubi aims to minimize project road transportation time, thereby reducing energy use and greenhouse gas emissions. The company also prefers using rail for transportation, which complements its mobile system and helps achieve unparalleled goals in energy efficiency compared to other industry leaders. These efforts are part of Tubi's broader commitment to addressing global concerns such as climate change, carbon footprint, renewable energy, and water availability, showcasing their dedication to building a safer and more sustainable environment.

sources: 1

United

 85 47

Environmental protection

United Airlines has embarked on a comprehensive journey to address its environmental impact, focusing on reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and innovating in sustainable aviation. The airline has committed to becoming 100% green by 2050, aiming to reduce its GHG emissions by 100% without relying on traditional carbon offsets. This ambitious goal is underpinned by significant investments in sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), carbon capture and sequestration technology, and the modernization of its aircraft fleet to improve fuel efficiency. United has launched the UAV Sustainable Flight Fund to support startups focused on decarbonizing air travel and has formed partnerships to develop and commercialize SAF technology. The airline is also investing in electric aircraft and battery technology to reduce emissions from ground operations. United's commitment to environmental sustainability is further demonstrated by its participation in the Eco-Skies Alliance, a program that allows corporate customers to contribute to the purchase of SAF, and by achieving validation from the Science-Based Targets initiative (SBTi) for its emissions reduction target.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

  • Commitments
    • 100% green by 2050 by reducing greenhouse gas emissions 100%
    • Mid-term goal of reducing carbon intensity by 50% by 2035 compared to 2019

Knorr

 85 63

Environmental protection

Knorr is actively engaged in environmental protection through sustainable sourcing of its agricultural ingredients. The company collaborates with farmers and sustainability experts, including the Rainforest Alliance, Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO), and the Fairtrade Foundation, to adhere to the Unilever Sustainable Agriculture Code (USAC). This code encompasses 11 aspects of sustainable agriculture such as soil quality, water usage, and biodiversity. Knorr ensures compliance with this code through self-assessment and verification processes. Additionally, Knorr supports innovative water-saving techniques like drip irrigation and recycles water in its farming processes. The company also employs natural pest control methods and encourages biodiversity on farms by creating habitats for beneficial species. These efforts are part of Knorr's broader commitment to sourcing 100% of its agricultural ingredients sustainably.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Knorr has established the Knorr Partnership Fund, which invests â¬1 million annually in co-funded projects with suppliers to help farmers meet or exceed the requirements of the Unilever Sustainable Agriculture Code. This initiative has funded over 70 projects since its inception in 2011, demonstrating Knorr's commitment to supporting farmers in adopting more sustainable and beneficial practices. Additionally, Knorr's efforts to improve the farming techniques and provide training and support to smallholder spice farmers in its supply chain further illustrate the company's dedication to enhancing worker welfare.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Knorr is committed to ensuring that farmed animals are reared in good conditions and treated with high standards of welfare. The company has co-developed its animal welfare standards with the NGO Compassion in World Farming, aiming to achieve what Compassion defines as âLevel 3â animal welfare for chickens, cows, and pigs. This level ensures that animals have adequate space, light, and an environment that allows them to live in conditions suited to their natural behaviors.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Rainforest Alliance
    • Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO)
    • Fairtrade Foundation

  • Commitments

    • Sourcing 100% of agricultural ingredients sustainably
    • Achieving âLevel 3â animal welfare for chickens, cows, and pigs

KIND

 85 57

Environmental protection

KIND has launched several initiatives aimed at environmental protection, focusing on sustainable agriculture and reducing its environmental footprint. The company has committed to exclusively sourcing its almonds from bee-friendly farms by 2025, aiming to protect pollinators by increasing habitat and eliminating harmful pesticides. This commitment involves expecting almond suppliers to reserve 3-5% of their farmland for dedicated pollinator habitat and eliminating the use of neonicotinoids and chlorpyrifos. Additionally, KIND has embarked on the KIND Almond Acres Initiative, a three-year pilot project testing regenerative agriculture practices on 500 acres in California. This initiative aims to source 100% of KIND's almonds from farms leveraging regenerative agriculture practices on a mass balance basis by 2030. The practices being tested include whole orchard recycling, cover crops, compost and biochar, off-ground harvesting, low carbon fertilizer, and subsurface irrigation. KIND has also signed the Ellen MacArthur Foundationâs New Plastics Economy Global Commitment, aspiring to reach 100% recyclability, compostability, or reusability across all its plastic packaging by 2025 while reducing its use of single-use plastic. Furthermore, KIND has committed to purchasing enough renewable energy credits to cover its US offices and manufacturing sites and will begin integrating renewable energy sources into its direct operations starting in 2021.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Transparency

    • Nothing found

    • Reach 100% recyclability, compostability, or reusability across all plastic packaging by 2025
    • Source 100% of almonds from farms leveraging regenerative agriculture practices on a mass balance basis by 2030

Ritz-Carlton

 85 53

Environmental protection

The Ritz-Carlton has implemented several initiatives to protect the environment and promote sustainability. Through its Community Footprints program, the company engages in activities such as supporting vertical farming at The Ritz-Carlton Abu Dhabi, Grand Canal, where guests can learn sustainability tips. Additionally, The Ritz-Carlton, Amelia Island participates in seasonal sea oat plantings to help protect the barrier island from shore erosion. The Ambassadors of the Environment program, in partnership with select Ritz-Carlton and Reserve properties, is based on principles that emphasize the importance of energy conservation, waste reduction, biodiversity, and the interconnectedness of ecosystems. This program aims to educate younger generations about nature and how to preserve it. Activities include aiding in the removal of ghost nets through drone research at The Ritz-Carlton Maldives, Fari Islands, and exploring kelp forests and tide pools at The Ritz-Carlton Bacara, Santa Barbara, among others. These initiatives demonstrate The Ritz-Carlton's commitment to environmental understanding and preservation for future generations.

Jose Cuervo

 85 48

Environmental protection

Jose Cuervo has launched The Agave Project, a sustainability initiative focusing on creating more sustainable alternatives to traditional products using agave by-products. This initiative includes the development of biodegradable, bio-based drinking straws made from upcycled agave fibers, which decompose up to 200 times faster than traditional plastic straws. These straws are designed to replace around a third of the polymers used in traditional straw production and can fully biodegrade within one to five years in landfill conditions. Additionally, Jose Cuervo has explored the use of agave fibers for other products, such as bricks for building homes, surfboards, and guitars, showcasing the versatility and sustainability potential of agave beyond tequila production. The company's efforts aim to reduce the environmental impact of its products and promote a more sustainable future for the community that has supported it for generations.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • FDA approved for agave-based composite used in straws
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Nordstrom Rack

 85 49

Environmental protection

Nordstrom Rack, as part of Nordstrom, Inc., is actively engaged in various environmental sustainability efforts. The company is focused on reducing its greenhouse gas emissions through investments in energy efficiency, renewable energy, and fuel efficiency. It aims to conserve resources such as water, paper, and food across its operations. Nordstrom Rack is also committed to enhancing the sustainability and responsibility of its products, starting from the materials used and manufacturing practices to the product's end-of-use. This includes establishing a science-based target to reduce Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions, reducing single-use plastics in its value chain by 50%, ensuring 15% of its product assortment qualifies as Sustainable Style, and using sustainably sourced raw materials for 50% of Nordstrom Made products made primarily of cotton, polyester, or cellulosic fabrics. Additionally, the company is working towards a circular economy by taking back 100 tons of beauty packaging for recycling, helping customers extend the life of 250 tons of clothing through donation, and establishing an internal working group to support the development of circular Nordstrom Made products. Nordstrom Rack has also committed $1 million in corporate grants to support industry innovation for textile recycling.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Moderna

 85 47

Environmental protection

Moderna has committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2030 for Scopes 1 and 2. Additionally, the company is working towards defining science-based carbon reduction targets for Scope 3 emissions. Their environmental sustainability strategy emphasizes sustainability by design, including LEED design in new sites and buildings, natural resource conservation, and decarbonizing their value chain by partnering with suppliers to reduce Scope 3 carbon emissions. This approach demonstrates Moderna's dedication to minimizing its environmental impact as the company grows.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Moderna is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that supports the well-being of its employees. The company has implemented benefits such as professional development programs, 401(k) matching, stock options, and generous paid leave to empower its team. Moderna has achieved a workforce comprising 50% women and 41% racially/ethnically diverse employees as of 2022. Additionally, 41% of leadership positions (VP and above) are held by women. The company has also taken the CEO Action for Diversity and Inclusion Pledge, outlining specific actions to cultivate a trusting environment where all ideas are welcome, and employees feel comfortable and empowered to discuss diversity and inclusion.

Forever 21

 85 37

Environmental protection

Forever 21 is actively engaged in several initiatives aimed at protecting the environment. The company provides 100% recyclable and reusable plastic and paper bags in many of its stores, demonstrating a commitment to reducing single-use packaging waste. To further minimize its carbon footprint, Forever 21 prioritizes sea freight over airfreight for transporting products. The brand has also taken steps to reduce energy consumption in its new stores by installing energy-efficient lighting systems. Additionally, Forever 21 recycles shipment boxes daily at its distribution center and in stores, and is in the process of developing apparel collections using environmentally friendly materials. These efforts reflect Forever 21's ongoing commitment to environmental sustainability.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Forever 21 places a strong emphasis on the welfare of workers within its supply chain. The company insists that all product suppliers ensure their employees work in safe and healthy environments and that their legal rights are respected and protected. To achieve this, Forever 21 has implemented a Vendor Audit Program as part of its Corporate Social Responsibility program. This program requires all suppliers to agree to a Social Responsibility Code of Conduct and undergo regular audits to ensure compliance. The audits are conducted by highly trained factory auditors who inspect non-US Vendor manufacturing facilities on a random basis. The Vendor Compliance Standards cover a wide range of issues, including legally qualified workers, fair wages, safe working environments, and the prohibition of human trafficking and forced labor. Forever 21's rigorous approach to worker welfare aims to improve factory efficiency and product quality standards while ensuring the protection and respect of workers' rights.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Forever 21 has taken significant steps to promote animal welfare in its product sourcing. The company established a permanent fur-free policy in 2004 and a permanent ban on Angora (rabbit hair) in 2014, working with PETA to meet guidelines and avoid cruelty to animals. Additionally, Forever 21 instituted a permanent ban on mohair effective January 1, 2020, in response to reports of abuse in mohair production. These policies demonstrate Forever 21's commitment to ethical sourcing and animal welfare.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Nothing found

  • Commitments

    • Nothing found

Bridgestone

 85 55

Environmental protection

Bridgestone is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on harmony with nature, valuing natural resources, and reducing CO2 emissions. The company is committed to operating in environmentally responsible ways, which includes maintaining certified wildlife habitats at its manufacturing facilities and participating in water conservation initiatives. Bridgestone is also dedicated to diversifying the world's natural rubber supply and adopting circular economy principles by reducing, reusing, and recycling wherever possible. A significant commitment is the goal to reduce CO2 emissions by 50% compared to a 2011 baseline, alongside contributing to a reduction of more than five times the amount of its CO2 emissions across its value chain. These efforts are part of Bridgestone's broader commitment to moving toward a waste-free mobility industry and caring for the Earth's natural resources with integrity.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Bridgestone is committed to ensuring worker welfare through various initiatives focused on human rights, labor practices, safety, industrial hygiene, and procurement. The company emphasizes respecting diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I), enhancing job satisfaction, pride, and engagement among its employees, and maintaining fair employment status. Bridgestone has implemented a grievance mechanism and a global sustainable procurement policy to ensure ethical and responsible procurement practices. These efforts are part of Bridgestone's broader commitment to creating a safe, secure, and dignified society for all.

sources: 1

Ramada

Environmental protection

Ramada Hotel & Suites across different locations have implemented a variety of environmental protection measures. These include energy efficiency improvements, such as the installation of LED lighting, and water conservation efforts, like the use of aerator taps and dual flush toilets. The hotels are committed to recycling, with initiatives encouraging guests to recycle and the responsible disposal of recyclable waste. Efforts to reduce single-use plastics are evident through the elimination of plastic straws and the use of compostable or sustainable materials for takeaway containers and cutlery. Additionally, the hotels focus on maintaining environmentally friendly practices in their gardens and use saltwater in swimming pools to reduce chemical usage. The Ramada by Wyndham Santa Barbara has gone further by installing solar panels to heat the pool and offering electric vehicle charging stations. The Ramada Hotel & Suites by Wyndham KemalpaÅa Ä°zmir emphasizes sustainable energy and water management, efficient use of chemicals, and waste minimization. They also aim to enhance air quality through renewable energy sources and have a waste management plan in place.

La Quinta Inns & Suites

 84 47

Environmental protection

La Quinta Inns & Suites, under its Green Initiatives, has implemented several measures to reduce its environmental impact. The resort's efforts span across various aspects of its operations, including waste management, water conservation, and energy efficiency. In waste management, La Quinta has introduced the ORCA food waste disposal systems, which convert food waste into environmentally safe water, alongside comprehensive recycling programs for materials like cardboard, fluorescent bulbs, batteries, and metals. They also engage in composting all grass from the resort and golf courses. Water conservation efforts include a linen and towel reuse program, installation of low-flow toilets, shower heads, and sinks, as well as the use of drought-tolerant plants and turf to reduce water waste. Energy efficiency is addressed through the installation of new VFD pump stations, purchasing kitchen equipment that is 60% more energy efficient, and replacing plastic straws with paper straws. Additionally, the resort participates in Hiltonâs âClean the Worldâ Soap Recycling Program, aiming to reduce waste and improve sanitation globally.

Spirit Airlines

 84 30

Environmental protection

Spirit Airlines has taken significant steps towards environmental protection by operating one of the youngest fleets in the U.S., with an average fleet age of only 7 years as of December 2022. This younger fleet contributes to better fuel efficiency and a reduced environmental impact. Additionally, Spirit has introduced new, lighter, and more comfortable seats, which further contribute to weight reduction and increased fuel efficiency. These initiatives are part of Spirit's broader strategy for fuel and fleet efficiency, positioning the airline as one of the most fuel-efficient in the U.S. when considering factors such as passenger seat miles, load factor, fleet age, and revenue miles.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Spirit Airlines has been recognized for its commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, earning a spot on Forbes' list of Americaâs Best Employers for Diversity in 2022. The airline has transformed its talent management strategy to take a holistic, forward-looking approach to talent decisions. This includes empowering team members through leadership development programs such as Leadership Altitude and Leadership Accelerator. These efforts are aimed at fostering a sense of belonging among team members and leveraging the company's diverse culture to attract, engage, develop, and retain diverse talent.

Jergens

 84 56

Environmental protection

Jergens is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through several initiatives focused on packaging, product formulas, and production processes. The company has committed to reducing the use of virgin plastic in its packaging by 30% by 2025 compared to 2017 levels. This effort includes designing packaging with post-consumer recycled materials and exploring new reuse and refill formats. Additionally, Jergens aims to ensure that all its products are safe for land and water by 2025, by formulating products with biodegradable ingredients that will not harm aquatic life.

In terms of production, Jergens has been using 100% renewable electricity in all its US-operated factories and owned offices since 2019, certified by Green-e. The company has set ambitious goals to reduce waste to landfills to zero by 2025 and is implementing new wastewater treatment technology to recover and reuse wastewater. These efforts are part of a broader strategy to reduce carbon emissions, water consumption, and waste generation, with significant reductions achieved since 2010.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Jergens has taken a clear stance on animal welfare by ensuring that all its Western market products are cruelty-free. The company adheres to the European Union's regulations on animal testing for cosmetics, which mandate that all cosmetics must be cruelty-free. These regulations have influenced other global bans on animal testing. Jergens acknowledges the importance of animal welfare in all its activities and complies with laws and regulations that may require testing of materials outside the cosmetics category, ensuring that such testing does not involve cosmetics.

sources: 1

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • Green-e certified renewable electricity

  • Commitments

    • Reduce the use of virgin plastic by 30% by 2025
    • Ensure all products are safe for land and water with biodegradable ingredients by 2025
    • Achieve zero waste to landfills by 2025
    • Implement wastewater treatment technology to recover and reuse wastewater by 2025

H&M

 84 48

Environmental protection

H&M is actively working towards environmental protection through various sustainability initiatives. The company has committed to becoming net-zero across its value chain by 2040, aiming to operate within planetary boundaries. This includes efforts to have a net-positive impact on biodiversity and scale circular models and systems for its products, supply chains, and customer journeys. H&M has also launched a garment collecting program in all its stores since 2013, encouraging recycling and repairing as part of its commitment to circularity. Additionally, H&M Group has partnered with Vargas Holding to launch Syre, a venture aimed at scaling textile-to-textile recycled polyester, and signed power purchase agreements to build three new solar parks in Sweden, further demonstrating its commitment to renewable energy and sustainable materials.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

H&M's sustainability efforts extend to ensuring worker welfare across its value chain. The company aims to have a positive impact on people by supporting and promoting inclusion and diversity in everything it does. This includes a commitment to gender equality in its supply chain, improving working conditions, ensuring fair wages, and engaging with communities. H&M's approach to sustainability encompasses human rights, with a focus on respecting these rights through due diligence processes. The company's actions in this area are designed to benefit not only the environment but also the people involved in the production and supply of its products.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

H&M addresses animal welfare within its sustainability framework, ensuring that the materials used in its products are sourced responsibly. While specific certifications or programs directly related to animal welfare were not detailed in the provided context, H&M's comprehensive approach to sustainability, including its focus on materials and chemicals, suggests a commitment to minimizing negative impacts on all aspects of its operations, including how animals are treated. The company's efforts to innovate in materials may also include exploring alternatives that reduce reliance on animal-derived products.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Become net-zero across our value chain by 2040
    • Have a net-positive impact on biodiversity
    • Scale circular models and systems for our products, supply chains, and customer journeys

BFGoodrich

 84 57

Environmental protection

BFGoodrich, through its partnership with the Clemson University International Center for Automotive Research (CU-ICAR), has contributed to the development of a sustainable rallycross car. This vehicle, designed by graduate automotive engineering students, features a clean, fuel-efficient hybrid powertrain, highlighting BFGoodrich's commitment to supporting innovations that reduce environmental impact. Additionally, BFGoodrich has been actively involved in the Tread Lightly! Outstanding Trails Program since 2021, providing grants for the conservation and education of off-road trails across the United States. This initiative has led to the installation of educational signage, infrastructure improvements, and trail repairs, demonstrating BFGoodrich's dedication to protecting outdoor recreation areas for future generations. Through these efforts, BFGoodrich has contributed over $245,000 in grants to organizations focused on conserving off-road trails, further emphasizing its commitment to environmental stewardship.

Emergen-C

 84 53

Environmental protection

Emergen-C has taken steps to reduce its environmental impact through packaging innovations. The company has reduced the size of its boxes by 6%, leading to decreased manufacturing requirements, reduced shipping needs, and less paper waste. Furthermore, Emergen-C has transitioned to using bio-renewable, solvent-free, vegetable-based inks for printing on their packaging, which helps in keeping harmful chemicals out of the environment. Additionally, their packaging is 100% recyclable, and the new smaller boxes have achieved FSC certification, ensuring that the paper used comes from responsibly managed forests that provide environmental, social, and economic benefits. These efforts demonstrate Emergen-C's commitment to minimizing its environmental footprint and promoting sustainability in its operations.

sources: 1

Dillard's

 84 48

Environmental protection

Dillard's has implemented several measures to reduce its carbon footprint and promote environmental sustainability. The company has achieved a 20% reduction in electric energy consumption from 2017 to 2022, excluding the anomalous year of 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This reduction is attributed to shorter operating hours and energy-saving initiatives. Dillard's has installed energy management systems (EMS) in all company-owned buildings to monitor and control energy use, particularly for HVAC and lighting systems, ensuring minimal energy usage when buildings are not occupied. In partnership with ControlIQ, Dillard's analyzes data from its EMS systems to optimize energy control and identify needs for HVAC unit repairs or replacements.

Dillard's is committed to building new stores to U.S. Green Building Councilâs LEED standards, incorporating energy-efficient HVAC systems, highly reflective white roofs, insulation, automated energy systems, and LED lighting. Existing stores are upgraded with LED lighting and efficient HVAC systems. The company also evaluates new technologies to further reduce energy usage. Dillard's participates in the EPAâs Energy Star Program, with approximately 70% of its buildings operating more efficiently compared to peers. Efforts to reduce paper use include paperless payroll and credit card statements. Additionally, Dillard's explores opportunities to incorporate renewable energy into its facilities, with a portion of its electric purchases designated for the supplierâs research and development of renewable sources.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Dillard's has established a Social Accountability Policy based on the International Labor Organization Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work. This policy sets minimum requirements for private label vendors, emphasizing the importance of maintaining production, legal, and ethical standards. Dillard's conducts yearly factory assessments to ensure social compliance, focusing on preventing human trafficking, forced labor, child labor, and workplace harassment or abuse. In FY2022, Dillard's conducted 284 factory assessments, with factories required to follow up with Corrective Action Plans (CAPs) for any non-compliance findings. The company partners with suppliers to monitor CAPs and works towards continuous improvement in factory conditions, reserving the right to terminate business relations for any violations of its policy. Dillard's also trains its associates responsible for direct imports on compliance with the Social Accountability Policy.

sources: 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Cetaphil

 84 54

Environmental protection

Cetaphil, under its Clear Skies Initiative, is actively working towards creating a healthier environment through a strategic, science-based approach that aligns with the United Nationsâ 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. The company has set ambitious goals, including transforming its current factories to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2022 and reaching carbon neutrality in its current production facilities. Since 2010, Cetaphil and its parent company Galderma have made significant strides in reducing their environmental impact. They have reduced water consumption by 33% per ton of product by implementing recycling and reuse programs in their factories and research facilities. Additionally, they have cut annual CO2 emissions from their factories by over 60% through the use of more efficient technology and renewable sources of electricity. Currently, 95% of their factories' electricity comes from renewable sources, and they have achieved zero waste to landfill.

Worker welfare

Cetaphil demonstrates its commitment to worker welfare through its partnership with Camp Wonder, a summer camp for children with chronic and life-threatening skin diseases, founded by the Childrenâs Skin Disease Foundation. The company, along with its employees and partnering healthcare professionals, volunteers annually at the camp. This initiative provides a safe haven where children with skin diseases can enjoy their childhood without being defined by their condition. Since 2012, Galderma and Cetaphil have contributed $1.5 million and donated over 50,000 products to support the camp. As part of the Clear Skies initiative, Cetaphil plans to expand its efforts to identify and support organizations worldwide that align with its mission of caring for sensitive skin.

Animal welfare

Cetaphil is committed to formulating products with cleaner ingredients that are kinder to the environment and animals. The company is reformulating its most popular products to create readily biodegradable formulas that are free of parabens, sulfates, and animal origin ingredients. Furthermore, Cetaphil ensures that its products are not tested on animals at any stage of product innovation, development, or manufacturing processes. This approach reflects Cetaphil's dedication to promoting animal welfare and minimizing animal suffering in the beauty industry.

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Achieving 100% renewable electricity in current factories by 2022
    • Reaching carbon neutrality in current production facilities

Environmental protection

Safeway is actively engaged in environmental protection efforts, focusing on reducing its carbon footprint and implementing more sustainable practices in its day-to-day operations. The company has taken significant steps to limit greenhouse gas emissions and has retrofitted stores with energy-efficient lighting and heating systems that meet LEEDÂ® standards. Additionally, Safeway is committed to waste diversion and reducing packaging, demonstrating a broad approach to sustainability that encompasses various aspects of its operations. These initiatives reflect Safeway's dedication to preserving the environment for future generations without compromising the wellbeing of its company, customers, and community.

This commitment could encompass various practices aimed at ensuring the humane treatment of animals involved in the production of products sold by Safeway.

Turtle Wax

 84 55

Environmental protection

Turtle Wax Pro is deeply committed to environmental protection, driving innovation with new, environmentally friendly car wash chemistry that produces the cleanest, driest, and shiniest cars. This commitment is part of their promise of superior technology and unmatched service. They are dedicated to reducing their environmental impact worldwide through careful product and packaging development. All product formulas do not contain phosphates, Ammonium Bifluoride (ABF), or Hydrofluoric acid (HF), adhering to environmental regulations of all municipal, provincial/state, and federal sewer-use by-laws. In Europe, Turtle Wax Pro works only with raw material suppliers that have surfactants listed on Cleangredients or meet the requirements of the European Detergent Directive or exceed the biodegradability requirements of EcoLogoâ¢ Certification Criteria Document for UL-2770: Commercial Car Wash Services. Additionally, their parent company, Transchem Group, has helped establish the guidelines for the Canadian governmentâs Ecologo Certification Criteria Document for Commercial Car Wash Services, showcasing their leadership in environmental conservation and stewardship.

sources: 1, 2

Johnnie Walker

 84 50

Environmental protection

Johnnie Walker is actively working towards environmental sustainability through several initiatives. They have announced the development of a recyclable, paper-based spirits bottle, aiming to revolutionize packaging in the spirits industry. This initiative is part of their broader commitment to sustainability, which includes reducing their carbon footprint 'from grain to glass'. Johnnie Walker's parent company, Diageo, is striving to achieve net-zero carbon whisky production by 2030, utilizing 100% renewable energy across all direct operations. They are also working towards helping their farmers and grain suppliers adopt new practices to achieve gold accreditations in the Sustainable Agriculture Initiativeâs Farm Sustainability Assessment (FSA). Additionally, by 2025, Johnnie Walker plans to manufacture their Red Label and Black Label bottles using at least 60% recycled glass, aiming to increase this to all their glass bottles by 2030. This effort is expected to save 13,000 tonnes of carbon. Furthermore, any plastic used in their packaging or marketing materials will be made from 100% recycled plastic by 2030. They are also committed to reducing water usage by 20% during their production process without compromising the quality of their whisky.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • By 2030, any plastic used in packaging or marketing materials to be made from 100% recycled plastic.
    • Reduce water usage by 20% during the production process by 2030.

Morgan Stanley

 83 42

Environmental protection

Morgan Stanley is actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at protecting the environment and promoting sustainability. The company has committed to mobilizing $1 trillion for sustainable finance by 2030, with a focus on supporting the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), including $750 billion in low-carbon initiatives. As of 2022, Morgan Stanley has mobilized $700 billion in capital, including $550 billion in low-carbon and green solutions. Additionally, Morgan Stanley became the first major U.S.-headquartered global financial services firm to commit to achieving net-zero financed emissions by 2050. The firm has also set interim 2030 targets for its lending portfolioâs most carbon-intensive sectorsâauto manufacturing, energy, and power. In 2022, Morgan Stanley achieved carbon neutrality, covering direct Scope 1 emissions from operations, indirect Scope 2 location-based emissions from purchasing energy, and Scope 3 emissions from business travel and owned assets that are leased. Furthermore, the company is working towards helping avoid 50 million metric tons of plastic waste by 2030, supporting the prevention, removal, or reduction of nearly 14 million metric tons of plastic waste from entering the environment and landfills by 2030.

Hush Puppies

 83 54

Environmental protection

Hush Puppies has introduced an eco-friendly shoe line named "The Good Shoe," focusing on sustainability and environmental protection. The uppers of these shoes are made from 100% post-consumer plastics and natural algae bloom, showcasing a commitment to reducing waste and utilizing sustainable materials. The textile upper is crafted from 100% RPET, derived from recycled plastics like water bottles. Additionally, the mesh lining and sock lining feature bioDEWIXâ¢ Dry RPET, emphasizing the brand's dedication to recycled materials. The inclusion of Nzymâ¢ pro-biotics in the shoes aims to keep them smelling fresh, further enhancing their appeal. The Good Shoe also incorporates Bounceâ¢ technology in the insole for comfort and uses recycled materials in its lightweight sole, demonstrating a blend of eco-friendliness and user comfort. These efforts highlight Hush Puppies' steps towards a more sustainable future by maintaining natural resources and reducing environmental impact through innovative product design.

Xfinity

 83 39

Environmental protection

Comcast, through its Xfinity brand, is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact with a comprehensive strategy that includes carbon neutrality, energy efficiency, and sustainable product design. The company has committed to becoming carbon neutral for Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2035. This ambitious goal is supported by significant progress, including the elimination of 960,000 tons of greenhouse gas emissions since 2019, which is equivalent to removing 200,000 cars from the road for a year. Comcast has achieved a 38% reduction in emissions from its operations since 2019.

To further its commitment, Comcast has joined the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and is reporting its carbon footprint data in alignment with the Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Protocol, the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB), and the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) frameworks. The company is investing in clean and renewable energy, having sourced more than 1.2 million megawatt-hours of such energy in 2022. Additionally, Comcast is improving its fleet's fuel efficiency and piloting electric and hybrid vehicles.

Network efficiency is another focus area, with Comcast deploying energy-efficient technologies across its network, aiming to avoid the equivalent amount of electricity needed to power half a million homes for a year by 2030. The company is also innovating in product and packaging design, introducing the worldâs first TV certified as a CarbonNeutralÂ® product, Sky Glass, and The Xfinity Eco Capsuleâ¢, a 100% recyclable and reusable modular packaging system made with renewable materials.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Wells Fargo Advisors

 83 35

Environmental protection

Wells Fargo is actively engaged in various initiatives aimed at environmental protection and sustainability. The company has established a comprehensive framework focusing on climate action as a core part of its corporate sustainability strategy. This includes scaling clean energy, increasing sustainability in operations, advancing climate finance and innovation, and supporting an equity-focused transition to a low-carbon economy. Wells Fargo has committed to deploying $500 billion in sustainable finance by 2030, with efforts already underway, including the launch of the Wells Fargo Institute for Sustainable Finance. This institute aims to enhance understanding of sustainable finance and promote initiatives supporting a low-carbon economy. In 2021 and 2022, Wells Fargo originated, committed, advised, or facilitated approximately $129 billion towards building the low-carbon economy and strengthening community resilience. Additionally, the company has set ambitious operational sustainability goals for 2030, including reducing GHG emissions, energy usage, total waste stream, and water usage by significant percentages from 2019 levels, and driving new renewable energy projects to meet 100% of its annual purchased electricity needs. Wells Fargo also meets 100% of its electricity consumption with renewable energy, primarily through unbundled Renewable Energy Certificates, with a goal to transition to long-term agreements that directly support new sources of renewable energy.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Wells Fargo demonstrates a commitment to respecting human rights throughout its operations, products, and services. The company's efforts are guided by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights. These guidelines identify a responsibility for corporations to respect human rights in their operations and through their business relationships and to provide remedies when adverse impacts to these rights occur. However, specific programs or initiatives directly related to worker welfare, such as living wage programs or community building activities, are not detailed in the provided context.

sources: 1

UGG

 83 46

Environmental protection

UGG has committed to several environmental protection initiatives as part of its sustainability journey. The company joined the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC) in 2016, demonstrating its commitment to responsible environmental practices among other principles. UGG has set sustainable development goals, known as "7 By 2027," which include specific targets related to environmental protection. These goals focus on waste reduction, water usage and quality, sustainable materials, chemical management, and climate & clean energy. For instance, UGG aims to reduce waste generation among key factory partners by 50% through prevention, reduction, recycling, and reuse. Additionally, the company is working to ensure that 90% of its core factory/supplier partners apply industry best practices on water treatment and usage. UGG is also seeking sustainable alternatives for key materials, aiming for at least 90% sourcing from suppliers certified by third-party benchmarking organizations. Another significant commitment is the reduction of energy consumption and the integration of climate change measures into policies and planning, which includes the installation of solar panels at all its California non-retail facilities.

Worker welfare

UGG's sustainability goals also encompass initiatives aimed at promoting worker welfare, particularly through its focus on human rights and gender equality. The company is committed to embedding human rights across its operations and supply chain, aiming to positively impact the communities where it operates. This includes promoting diversity, gender equality, female empowerment, and inclusion for all. Although specific programs or measures for ensuring worker welfare, such as living wage programs or community building activities, are not detailed, UGG's commitment to human rights and gender equality suggests a broader approach to improving the conditions and welfare of its workers and those within its supply chain.

Animal welfare

The provided context does not include specific information regarding UGG's initiatives or commitments towards animal welfare. Therefore, it's not possible to detail any specific actions the company is taking to promote the health of animals used in their products or to minimize animal suffering based on the provided context.

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Reduce waste generation among key factory partners by 50% through prevention, reduction, recycling, and reuse.
    • Ensure 90% of core factory/supplier partners apply industry best practice on water treatment and usage.
    • Source at least 90% of key materials from suppliers certified by third-party benchmarking organizations.
    • Reduce the discharge of hazardous chemicals among key factory/supplier partners by 50%.
    • Reduce energy consumption and integrate climate change measures into policies and planning, including the installation of solar panels at all California non-retail facilities.

Goobers

 83 47

Environmental protection

Eating the Goober is actively engaged in environmental protection through various sustainable practices. The brand emphasizes the use of upcycled and eco-friendly materials in its products, notably in its "Ethical Magic Sliders" sandals, which are made from recycled materials such as defective tires and non-woven vegan leather derived from pineapple or grape waste. Additionally, the company is committed to zero waste designs, utilizing the moulage technique to ensure no fabric is wasted during production. Smaller fabric pieces are creatively repurposed for other products, like covers for their sandals. Eating the Goober also runs upcycling projects, transforming materials like broken umbrellas and old men's suits into new products. Their physical store reflects their commitment to circular practices, with furnishings made from sea trash and other recycled materials. The brand's avoidance of polyester and efforts to replace conventional cotton with organic or eco-friendly alternatives further demonstrate their dedication to minimizing their environmental impact.

Worker welfare

Eating the Goober places a strong emphasis on worker welfare, ensuring that all products are made locally by individuals who are paid fairly and work in excellent conditions. The company highlights that 80% of its production is conducted in-house, with handmade procedures that allow for transparency and quality control. They welcome anyone interested in verifying their working conditions and meeting the team, showcasing an open-door policy that reinforces their commitment to ethical labor practices. This approach not only supports local craftsmanship but also ensures that the workers are treated with dignity and respect, aligning with the brand's overall ethical philosophy.

Animal welfare

The brand is committed to animal welfare, explicitly stating that no animal is harmed in the production of their sandals. They utilize vegan leather alternatives made from pineapple and grape waste, avoiding traditional animal leather, fur, and silk. While they have not completely phased out wool, they are in the process of sourcing "ethical wool" to further align with their animal-friendly practices. This commitment to using non-animal materials underscores Eating the Goober's dedication to minimizing animal suffering and promoting more ethical material sourcing in the fashion industry.

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Annieâs

 83 52

Environmental protection

Annie's is actively engaged in efforts to protect the environment through its product ingredients, packaging, and manufacturing processes. The company focuses on sustainable ingredient sourcing, particularly for its 10 key ingredients, to increase organic agriculture, ensure transparency, and measure impact at the farm level. Notably, 99% of its sugarcane and cacao are certified organic, and it has committed to sourcing responsible palm oil, with 100% of directly sourced palm oil meeting the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil standard. In packaging, Annie's aims to reduce its environmental footprint by optimizing design, sourcing sustainable materials, and ensuring proper recovery, with 90% of its packaging being recyclable or compostable. Additionally, Annie's manufacturing partners adhere to a strict Code of Conduct, emphasizing energy and water efficiency, waste reduction, and fair treatment of workers. The company also supports regenerative agriculture projects, including partnering with farmers for organic pasta ingredients and investing in the conversion of 34,000 acres of farmland to regenerative, organic management. Furthermore, Annie's has partnered to develop carbon farm plans in California, promoting climate-beneficial farming practices.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Annie's commitment to worker welfare is evident through its sourcing and manufacturing practices. The company prioritizes working with dairy co-operatives and family farmer groups, ensuring high standards for animal welfare and sustainable agriculture. Additionally, Annie's manufacturing partners are required to adhere to a strict Code of Conduct, which includes the fair treatment of workers. This approach demonstrates Annie's dedication to not only environmental sustainability but also to the welfare of those involved in the production of its products.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Annie's demonstrates a commitment to animal welfare through its sourcing policies for dairy, eggs, and meat. The company ensures that all eggs are cage-free and that all meat is produced without any added hormones or sub-therapeutic use of antibiotics. This commitment extends to its dairy partners, with whom Annie's works to set high standards for animal welfare and sustainable agriculture. These practices reflect Annie's dedication to promoting the health and welfare of animals used in their products.

Jaw Breakers

 83 44

Environmental protection

Jaw Breakers has outlined a sustainability strategy that includes a focus on minimizing their environmental impact. This strategy involves ensuring that any faulty items are either sold to third parties, repaired, or recycled, demonstrating a commitment to reducing waste. Additionally, the company works closely with suppliers to repurpose offcuts of fabric, ensuring that nothing is wasted in the production process. This approach not only reduces the amount of waste generated but also promotes the efficient use of resources. By manufacturing in small quantities, Jaw Breakers ensures that all stock is sold, further minimizing potential waste and contributing to a more sustainable fashion industry.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Jaw Breakers places a strong emphasis on ethical trading and the welfare of workers both within their own operations and across their supply chain. The company has implemented measures to ensure that there is no modern slavery or human trafficking in any part of their business or supply chains. This includes conducting in-person visits to suppliers to verify that working conditions meet their standards. Furthermore, all UK warehouse staff are compensated above the London living wage, and they are not subjected to unreasonable production targets or performance goals. By designing all clothing in-house and maintaining a known supply chain, Jaw Breakers can closely monitor and ensure fair labor practices throughout the production process.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Jaw Breakers has made a clear commitment to animal welfare as part of their sustainability strategy. The company pledges never to use real leather, fur, feathers, or buttons made from any part of an animal in their products. This policy reflects a strong stance against the exploitation of animals for fashion and ensures that their products are cruelty-free. By adopting such practices, Jaw Breakers contributes to the promotion of animal welfare within the fashion industry.

sources: 1, 2

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

NBA TV

 83 35

Environmental protection

NBA TV, through its NBA Green initiative, is actively engaged in promoting environmental sustainability within the communities it operates. The league has committed to reducing its carbon footprint by 50% by 2030, aligning with the UN Sport for Climate Action Framework. Efforts to minimize environmental impacts include reducing team aviation impacts by 50,000 miles for the 2022-23 NBA season and launching the NBA Arena Sustainability Task Force with all NBA arenas in April 2023. Additionally, the NBA has successfully reduced plastic bottle usage by 80% in its offices. The NBA Green initiative focuses on key impact areas such as Eco-Data Collection, Tracking & Impact Reductions, Environmental Justice & Climate Justice, and Education & Awareness. The league has also partnered with organizations like the Arbor Day Foundation, Clever Carbon, and the Green Sports Alliance to further its environmental goals. Notably, 10 NBA arenas have achieved certification in the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) system, showcasing a global commitment to sustainability, including eco-friendly projects in Senegal and Spain. The NBA's efforts extend to engaging teams and fans in sustainability practices, such as tree planting and beach cleanups, emphasizing the importance of individual actions in combating climate change.

 83 37

Environmental protection

Econo Lodge has demonstrated a commitment to environmental protection through various initiatives aimed at energy conservation, water conservation, and waste reduction. All Econo Lodge properties participate in these efforts, which include the use of energy-efficient lighting solutions such as compact fluorescent (CFL) or LED bulbs in guest fixtures, and a towel and linen re-use program to conserve water. Additionally, Econo Lodge hotels offer a recycling program for guests. Beyond these brand-wide practices, specific locations like the Econo Lodge Inn & Suites have taken further steps. These include the installation of LED lighting in all guest rooms and public areas, the use of phosphate-free laundry detergents, and the implementation of comprehensive recycling programs. The Econo Lodge Inn & Suites is also investing in solar heating for pool and hot tub water, installing Energy Star-rated flat-screen televisions, converting high water use landscaping to xeriscaping, and installing low-flow toilets. These initiatives reflect Econo Lodge's commitment to integrating environmental practices into their core business strategy.

TRESemmÃ©

 83 50

Environmental protection

TRESemmÃ© is actively working to address the environmental challenges posed by plastic waste, particularly focusing on the sustainability of its packaging. The brand has acknowledged the issue with plastic pollution and is taking responsibility for its plastic usage. TRESemmÃ© has set ambitious goals to reduce the amount of virgin plastic in its packaging by 50% by 2025 and aims to help collect and process more plastic packaging than it sells. In Australia and New Zealand, TRESemmÃ© shampoo and conditioner bottles are now made with 50% post-consumer Australian recycled plastic. Additionally, the brand has developed a pioneering innovation that allows its bottles to be made from detectable pigment, making black plastic recyclable. This innovation addresses the challenge of recycling black plastic, which has traditionally been difficult to sort at recycling facilities. TRESemmÃ©'s efforts contribute to reducing landfill waste and promoting a circular economy where materials are reused, recycled, or composted. The brand's commitment to using more post-consumer recycled (PCR) materials aligns with its goal to include at least 25% recycled content in its plastic packaging by 2025. These initiatives demonstrate TRESemmÃ©'s dedication to minimizing its environmental footprint and supporting sustainable practices.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

TRESemmÃ© is committed to animal welfare, as evidenced by its PETA approval. This certification indicates that the brand does not test its products on animals, aligning with ethical standards and consumer expectations for cruelty-free products. Being PETA approved showcases TRESemmÃ©'s dedication to promoting the health and welfare of animals, ensuring that its products are developed without causing harm to animals.

sources: 3

    • PETA approved

  • Commitments

    • Reduce the amount of virgin plastic in packaging by 50% by 2025

Ulta Beauty

 83 50

Environmental protection

Ulta Beauty is actively engaged in environmental stewardship, focusing on reducing its carbon footprint and enhancing sustainability across its operations. The company has made significant strides in utilizing renewable energy, with 34% of its electricity supplied by renewable sources in 2022, doubling the percentage from the previous year. This commitment is part of its broader strategy to respond to climate change by pursuing initiatives that align with its environmental goals and influence industry-wide change. Ulta Beauty has also made investments in energy efficiency, leading to an estimated annual energy reduction of approximately 1.5%. Furthermore, the company has achieved a 19% year-over-year reduction in Scope 1 and 2 same-store emissions in 2022. Ulta Beauty has submitted a target covering Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions to the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) for approval, demonstrating its commitment to reducing carbon emissions in a manner backed by data and in line with science. The company's investments in clean energy include procuring renewable energy, investing in energy efficiency to reduce overall energy demand, and collaborating on onsite solar installations. Additionally, Ulta Beauty has established the Ulta Beauty Green Group, a corporate associate volunteer initiative focused on promoting environmental stewardship across the company's operations.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Ulta Beauty is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all associates feel they belong and can be their true, authentic selves. The company reports that 53% of its associates identify as people of color, and 27% of its leadership team is comprised of individuals from diverse backgrounds. Additionally, Ulta Beauty's workforce is predominantly female, with women making up 91% of its associates and 66% of its leadership. These statistics reflect the company's efforts to build a culture that is people-first and diversity-forward, ensuring that every person can share their unique perspective, do their best work, have a meaningful career, and help advance Ulta Beauty's mission.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Ulta Beauty has pledged that by 2025, 50% of assortment packaging sold will be made from recycled or bio-sourced materials, or be recyclable or refillable.

Grey Goose

 83 51

Environmental protection

Grey Goose has implemented several measures to protect the environment and minimize its carbon footprint. The brand focuses on using natural French ingredients, specifically Picardie soft winter wheat and natural spring water from Gensac-la-Pallue, France, ensuring that every grain of wheat is 100% free of GMOs. France's strict regulations against GMO-grown wheat and the SAI certification of Grey Goose's wheat highlight the brand's commitment to sustainable agricultural practices, including no irrigation and crop rotation for soil regeneration. Additionally, the sourcing of ingredients from a small area in France, close to the distillery, significantly reduces transportation emissions.

Grey Goose also emphasizes the importance of water conservation and purity. The brand's spring water is drawn from a well located above a natural, underground aquifer, protected by an EU Conservation Order. This ensures the water is naturally filtered by limestone, removing pollutants without the need for artificial purification processes.

The brand's commitment to the circular economy is evident in its waste management practices. Grey Goose utilizes wheat by-products for eco-pasture and repurposes leftover wheat products from milling for animal nutrition, demonstrating a no-waste approach. Furthermore, the iconic Grey Goose bottle has been designed with sustainability in mind, featuring a dimple in the base to reduce its overall weight by approximately a fifth, which contributes to reducing the environmental impact of packaging.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Grey Goose collaborates closely with three farming cooperatives in France, ensuring that every grain of wheat is grown and harvested by small, local farmers within 30 miles of the distillery. This partnership not only supports small businesses but also ensures that the farmers who are integral to Grey Goose's production process are partners in the storage, milling, and distilling facilities. This model promotes a seamless operation from sowing to delivery and ensures that the farmers have a stake in the product's success. By working with cooperatives, Grey Goose helps protect small farmers and their crops, fostering a community that thrives together and supports one another.

sources: 1

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • SAI certified wheat
  • Commitments
    • Nothing found

Alaska Airlines

 83 43

Environmental protection

Alaska Airlines is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives aimed at achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2040. The airline has set a comprehensive five-part strategy that includes operational efficiency, fleet modernization, sustainable aviation fuels (SAF), new technology, and high-quality carbon removals to close any remaining emissions gap. Notably, Alaska Airlines has made significant strides in expanding the supply and use of SAF through new purchase agreements, advocating for public policies to support market development, and establishing programs for business travelers to reduce their carbon footprint through SAF purchases. Additionally, the airline has adopted AI-enabled route optimization software, Flyways, across more parts of its network, resulting in over 12,000 metric tons of CO2 savings, equivalent to saving 1.3 million gallons of fuel. Alaska Airlines has also restarted its onboard recycling program and became the first U.S. airline to eliminate the five biggest sources of plastic waste from onboard service, including plastic bottles, cups, straws, stir sticks, and citrus picks, saving over 2.2 million pounds of plastic from landfills annually. The airline partners with organizations like the Bonneville Environmental Foundation, Surfrider, and travel2change to restore habitat in critical ecosystems, balancing its company-wide water use.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Alaska Airlines is committed to investing in its workforce and the communities it serves. In 2022, the airline hired 8,000 new employees, launched the Ascend Pilot Academy, transformed its recruiting pipeline, and established multiple programs to connect more people with aviation careers. These efforts aim to make progress toward the goal of diverse representation in leadership. Additionally, Alaska Airlines held its first all-company Safety Day, emphasizing the importance of safety and specific behaviors that keep both employees and guests safe. The airline's commitment to creating an inclusive environment where everyone belongs is further demonstrated through its investment in communities, including welcoming students back to its hangars for Seattle and Portland Aviation Day and flying students on Our Commitment airplane for learning opportunities and college visits across the country.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Committing to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2040

Maserati

 83 49

Environmental protection

Maserati is actively participating in the shift towards sustainable mobility, primarily through its involvement in the FIA Formula E World Championship, a fully electric racing series aimed at promoting clean mobility and developing future automotive technologies. The company's commitment to environmental sustainability is further evidenced by its participation in Formula E, which has maintained a net-zero carbon footprint since its inception. Additionally, Maserati has embarked on an ambitious electrification strategy, with the introduction of its first two Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs), the GranTurismo Folgore and Grecale Folgore, already available in Italy and EU markets. This move is part of Maserati's broader commitment to electrification, with plans to launch additional electric models, including the Maserati GranCabrio Folgore and the MC20 Folgore, as well as a new large E-UV BEV and the next generation of Quattroporte BEV in the coming years. These efforts are aligned with Maserati's strategic plan for sustainable long-term growth, focusing on electrification to meet evolving customer aspirations for luxury mobility.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Maserati is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognizing diversity as a key driver of growth. The company embraces employees from various ages, cultures, ethnic backgrounds, sexual orientations, religions, and gender identities. This commitment to diversity and inclusion is seen as essential for employee engagement and overall success. Maserati also prioritizes employee wellbeing, implementing programs that promote a healthy lifestyle, including sport activities, good eating habits, and mental health care. These initiatives are designed to improve the quality of life for the Maserati Family, both within and outside the workplace, thereby enhancing the community's overall wellbeing.

sources: 1

XM

 83 46

Environmental protection

Impact XM is actively engaged in environmental protection through various sustainability initiatives. The company has adopted the U.S. National Environmental Policy Actâs four pillars of sustainabilityâHuman, Social, Economic, Environmentalâto guide its operations, aiming to create and maintain conditions under which humans and nature can coexist in harmony. Specifically, Impact XM has committed to reducing the environmental impact of the events and experiential industry, which is known for contributing to solid waste and CO2 emissions. They are working towards this goal by educating their employees, clients, and the industry about sustainable practices and what can be done to help combat climate change. Additionally, Impact XM has established a sustainability partnership with the International Tree Foundation (ITF), focusing on reforestation and the protection of natural capital such as land, air, water, and energy. This partnership aims to restore forests and ecosystems, transform communities, and improve Earth and human welfare through strategic tree planting and protection efforts. These actions demonstrate Impact XM's commitment to environmental sustainability and its efforts to address the environmental challenges faced by the events and experiential industry.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Impact XM is committed to ensuring the welfare of its workers through various initiatives aimed at promoting health, safety, well-being, diversity, inclusion, and fair wages. The company ensures all employees are trained in safe event planning and execution practices, provides adequate safety equipment and training, and promotes a positive and supportive work environment. Opportunities for professional development and growth are offered to employees, alongside community engagement initiatives that provide volunteer opportunities. Impact XM also focuses on creating an inclusive workplace, welcoming employees regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, or other personal characteristics, and ensures that employees are paid a fair wage and work in safe and comfortable conditions. These efforts are part of Impact XM's broader commitment to sustainability, which includes investing in the human capital of society and preserving social capital by contributing to the framework of a changing society.

Telemundo

 82 36

Environmental protection

Telemundo, under the umbrella of Comcast NBCUniversal, has made significant strides in environmental protection through the establishment of its new global headquarters, the Telemundo Center in Miami. The 500,000 square-foot facility, built on 21 acres, incorporates advanced sustainability standards and initiatives aimed at reducing the environmental footprint. Key green initiatives include a digitalization and archiving policy to reduce paper, ink, and electricity usage; the use of 100% LED lighting and strategically placed skylights to minimize electricity consumption; the provision of non-disposable silverware and eco-friendly packaging in the cafeteria; the installation of water refilling stations to eliminate plastic water bottle waste; a robust recycling program; and the establishment of a clean desk etiquette to manage organic waste efficiently. Additionally, the Telemundo Center promotes sustainable transportation options through electric car charging stations and a carpooling service via the RideFlag app. The center also prioritizes doing business with eco-friendly vendors, exemplified by the choice of a dry-cleaning company that uses biodegradable bags and environmentally friendly solvents. A dedicated Green Team at the Telemundo Center ensures the implementation and progress of these sustainability initiatives.
