Intuit

 81 44

Environmental protection

Intuit is actively working towards environmental protection with a strong focus on carbon reduction efforts. The company has committed to reaching net-zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across its value chain by FY2040, aligning with the Paris Agreement to limit global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. Intuit's near-term and long-term emissions reduction targets have been validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi). These targets include reducing absolute Scopes 1 and 2 GHG emissions by 42% by FY2030 and by 90% by FY2040, from a FY2022 base year. Additionally, Intuit aims for 80% of its suppliers to have science-based targets by FY2027 and commits to reducing Scope 3 GHG emissions by 97% per million USD value added by FY2040. The company has launched the Supplier Emissions Reduction Program to encourage suppliers towards sustainability and has invested in decarbonizing its facilities and expanding renewable energy procurement. Beyond its operational footprint, Intuit has pledged to reduce two million metric tons of CO2e emissions by 2030 through its Climate Positive program, which has already reduced nearly 500,000 metric tons of CO2e as of FY23. Intuit also offers a Climate Action Marketplace to help businesses reduce their carbon footprint through sustainable solutions.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Intuit is committed to enhancing worker welfare through various programs. The company offers a Well-Being for Life program, providing reimbursements up to $1,300 annually for sustainability-related purchases, such as e-bikes and solar panels, to encourage employees towards sustainable living. Additionally, Intuit partners with EnergySage to facilitate solar energy exploration for its employees, whether they are homeowners or renters. The company is also focused on creating a sustainable workplace with initiatives like sustainability-driven menus, waste diversion efforts, and sustainable commuter programs. Intuit has piloted International WELL Building Institute certification to ensure its design standards and operational protocols prioritize occupant health and well-being. A new LEED Platinum building on Intuit's Mountain View campus will feature energy efficiency, on-site renewable energy, and waste conservation features.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)
    • International WELL Building Institute certification (Pilot)
    • LEED Platinum (for new building on Mountain View campus)
  • Commitments
    • Reach net-zero GHG emissions by FY2040
    • Reduce absolute Scopes 1 and 2 GHG emissions by 42% by FY2030 and by 90% by FY2040
    • Ensure 80% of suppliers have science-based targets by FY2027
    • Reduce Scope 3 GHG emissions by 97% per million USD value added by FY2040
    • Reduce two million metric tons of CO2e emissions by 2030 through the Climate Positive program

Hawaiian Tropic

 81 51

Environmental protection

Hawaiian Tropic is actively engaged in reducing its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. The company has taken significant steps to protect marine life and ecosystems by pioneering the removal of oxybenzone and octinoxate from their formulas, ingredients known for their potential harm to coral reefs. This proactive measure goes beyond current regulations in some resort areas that have banned these substances. Additionally, Hawaiian Tropic is committed to improving its packaging by reducing material use, increasing the use of recycled and recyclable materials, and supporting consumer recycling efforts. These efforts demonstrate Hawaiian Tropic's dedication to minimizing its environmental footprint and protecting the natural beauty of the tropics and oceans.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Hawaiian Tropic has made a strong commitment to animal welfare, as evidenced by its policy against animal testing. The company refuses to test its products on animals or sell in countries where animal testing is required. This commitment is further solidified by Hawaiian Tropic's receipt of the PETA Cruelty-Free certification, ensuring that all its products are developed without any animal testing. This certification is a testament to Hawaiian Tropic's dedication to ethical practices and the welfare of all living beings.

sources: 2

Transparency

  • Certifications

    • PETA Cruelty-Free

  • Commitments

    • Removal of oxybenzone and octinoxate from formulas to protect coral reefs and marine life
    • Continuous improvement in packaging to reduce materials, use more recycled/recyclable material, and support recycling efforts

Bosch

 81 53

Environmental protection

Bosch is actively working to minimize its environmental impact through various initiatives aimed at protecting the climate, conserving water, and promoting a circular economy. The company has achieved carbon neutrality (scopes 1 & 2) across its more than 400 locations worldwide since 2020, partly by offsetting residual emissions through carbon credits. Bosch is committed to reducing its absolute scope 3 COâ emissions by 15 percent by 2030 (from a 2018 baseline) and has already achieved a reduction of approximately 16 percent to 382 million metric tons of COâ in 2021. In terms of energy efficiency, Bosch has initiated over 4,000 projects worldwide, capturing savings potential of 805 GWh in total, which corresponds to 47 percent of its goal. The company aims to increase its own renewable energy generation at its sites to 400 GWh and achieve 100 percent green electricity by 2030. For water conservation, Bosch has launched over 260 projects to reduce water withdrawal by 24.2 percent compared with 2017 at locations in regions with water scarcity. The company also focuses on improving the quality of wastewater flows and adheres to globally binding wastewater quality standards. In the circular economy, Bosch is working on improving materials efficiency and extending the product life cycle by reusing materials and components, analyzing around 80 different product groups that account for more than 80 percent of Boschâs sales revenue.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Bosch is committed to ensuring worker welfare through diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, as well as promoting health and safety in the workplace. The company aims to increase the proportion of female executives to 25 percent by 2030, with the proportion of women executives across all management levels within the group rising to 19.2 percent in 2022. Bosch also focuses on promoting inclusion at its locations and in the communities around them, donating 27.4 million euros to charitable causes worldwide in 2022. Regarding human rights, Bosch is dedicated to ensuring that human rights are respected along the value chain and has updated its Code of Conduct for Business Partners to further specify requirements relating to environmental and social standards. The company has also established a new management system to implement human rights and environmental due diligence obligations. In terms of health, Bosch aims to reduce the accident rate to 1.45 accidents per 1 million hours worked or less by 2025 and is continuously upgrading its IT-based Material Data Management for Compliance and Sustainability (MaCS) system to responsibly handle substances of concern.

sources: 1, 2

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • Achieved carbon neutrality (scopes 1 & 2) since 2020
    • Lowering absolute scope 3 COâ emissions by 15 percent by 2030 (baseline year 2018)
    • Saving 1.7 TWh through increased energy efficiency by 2030
    • Increasing own renewable generation at Bosch sites to 400 GWh and 100 percent green electricity by 2030
    • Reducing absolute water withdrawal at company locations in regions with water scarcity by 25 percent by 2025
    • Ensuring equal opportunities and increasing the proportion of female executives to 25 percent by 2030
    • Reducing the accident rate to 1.45 accidents per 1 million hours worked or less by 2025

Benjamin Moore

 81 54

Environmental protection

Benjamin Moore is actively engaged in various environmental protection efforts, focusing on energy management, sustainable transportation, waste management, and conservation. The company has implemented a robust Environmental, Health, Safety, Security (EHSS) management system to ensure compliance with laws and regulations and to reduce the adverse impacts of its activities on the environment. In terms of energy management, Benjamin Moore has made significant strides by installing solar panels at its Clifton, NJ Distribution Center and replacing conventional light fixtures with LED bulbs at its Oakland, CA, and Pomona, CA distribution centers, resulting in a reduction of 68,900 kilowatt hours (kWh). The company also hosts a 1.7-megawatt solar array that generates more than 2.4 million kWh of electricity annually, covering about 70% of the facilityâs yearly electricity needs.

For sustainable transportation, Benjamin Moore has increased load efficiency by 2% since 2020, reducing the need for approximately 200 trucks over two years. The company also focuses on replacing older equipment to increase fuel efficiency. In waste management, Benjamin Moore has redirected almost 3 million gallons of wash water and wash solvent into low-grade products and recycled over 380,000 gallons of paint. Additionally, the company has recycling programs for various materials, including wooden pallets and shrink wrap, with over 90 tons of shrink wrap recycled by its distribution facilities.

Conservation efforts are highlighted by the Conservation CertificationÂ® from Wildlife Habitat CouncilÂ® (WHC) for its research and development center in Flanders, NJ, and its manufacturing facility and distribution center in Pell City, AL. These sites provide habitat for native birds and pollinators and offer conservation education experiences for local students.

sources: 1

Fidelity

Environmental protection

Fidelity is actively engaged in reducing the environmental impact of its business operations. The company has taken significant steps towards generating clean energy, reducing and reusing waste, and working with suppliers who share its environmental commitments. Fidelity's approach to environmental sustainability is driven by what it terms the âInvestor Mindset,â which emphasizes data and factual analysis to inform decisions. This mindset fosters innovation among associates, aiming to safeguard the environment and improve health and well-being for current and future generations. Additionally, Fidelity offers a range of sustainable investing funds that prioritize environmental themes. These funds invest in companies responding to consumer demand for sustainable practices, including those involved in alternative and renewable energy, energy efficiency, pollution control, water infrastructure, waste and recycling technologies, or other environmental support services.

Adult Swim

 80 47

Environmental protection

Adult Swim participated in the "Sustainability Sideshow 2018," an event that showcased the lighter side of sustainability. This unique carnival featured activities and attractions focused on environmental sustainability, including carnival games, upcycled fashion and art, carnival-inspired local food, and live music. The event highlighted various green initiatives, such as a game of Family Feud with a green twist, a competition for the best sustainability epic fail story, and a trashion show encouraging participants to wear upcycled outfits. Additionally, attendees could engage in activities like crafting with upcycled materials, playing Climate Change MadLibs, and estimating their carbon footprint. This event was a joint fundraiser for Sustain Dane and Madison Childrenâs Museum, emphasizing Adult Swim's commitment to promoting environmental sustainability through community engagement and creative expression.

Clinique

 80 47

Environmental protection

Clinique is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various sustainability initiatives. The company has committed to responsible packaging by aiming to make 75% of its packaging recyclable, refillable, reusable, recycled, or recoverable by 2025. This effort is part of a broader goal to assess the impact of their products across their entire life cycle. Clinique has also taken steps to incorporate more sustainable materials into its packaging, such as plant-derived plastic and post-consumer recycled (PCR) material, starting with its All About Clean cleansers in 2020. These products now come in bottles that contain a percentage of these more sustainable materials, thereby reducing the use of fossil-fueled plastic on a per-product basis. Additionally, Clinique has committed to carbon-neutral shipping for every U.S. order placed on its website, offsetting the carbon emissions from shipping by funding emission reduction projects. The company's e-commerce data center in The Americas is powered by renewable electricity, further demonstrating its commitment to environmental protection.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nothing found

Transparency

  • Certifications
    • Nothing found
  • Commitments
    • By 2025, 75% of packaging will be recyclable, refillable, reusable, recycled, or recoverable.
    • By 2025, 100% of secondary packaging will be Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) certified.
    • By 2025, increase the amount of post-consumer recycled material in packaging to 25% or more.

Hitachi

 80 44

Environmental protection

Hitachi is actively engaged in environmental protection and sustainability efforts, focusing on decarbonization and resource efficiency. The company has set ambitious targets to become carbon neutral in its own factories and offices by 2030 and aims to achieve carbon neutrality across its global value chain by 2050. Additionally, Hitachi is working to avoid 100 million tons of CO2 emissions through its products and services by 2024. The company also plans to improve its resource and water use by 50% by 2050, compared to 2010 levels. These efforts are part of Hitachi's broader commitment to respect planetary boundaries and improve people's wellbeing. Hitachi's participation in the COP28 UN climate summit in Dubai underscores its commitment to accelerated decarbonization as a key strategy for tackling climate change. The company's sustainability strategy encompasses six material topics and 15 sub-material topics, aiming to make its large and complex business more sustainable. This includes advancing its environmental vision and long-term environmental targets, achieving a decarbonized society, achieving a resource-efficient society, and achieving a harmonized society with nature.

sources: 1, 2

Worker welfare

Hitachi is committed to enhancing worker welfare through various initiatives focused on human capital, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), human rights, responsible procurement, quality and customer satisfaction, and social contribution activities. The company aims to increase the ratio of female and non-Japanese executive and corporate officers to 30% by 2030, demonstrating its commitment to DEI. Hitachi's efforts in human capital development, ensuring human rights, and engaging in responsible procurement practices reflect its dedication to improving the working conditions and welfare of its employees and those within its supply chain. Additionally, the company's focus on quality and customer satisfaction, along with its social contribution activities, further contribute to a positive and supportive working environment.

sources: 1, 2

    • 30% ratio of female and non-Japanese executive and corporate officers by 2030
    • 50% improvement in resource and water use by 2050, compared to 2010

Lenovo

 80 52

Environmental protection

Lenovo is actively working towards environmental sustainability through various initiatives aimed at reducing its carbon footprint and promoting a circular economy. The company has committed to achieving net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, with its targets validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) under the Net-Zero Standard. Lenovo's environmental efforts include designing greener products that emphasize energy efficiency, recycled content, and materials management. They also focus on operational impacts, climate change, waste, water management, and packaging innovations using bio-based materials like bamboo and sugar cane to reduce packaging consumption, waste, and carbon emissions. Additionally, Lenovo offers Asset Recovery Services to give hardware a second life, responsibly recycling assets in an environmentally responsible way. These efforts are part of Lenovo's broader commitment to lessen its environmental impact and lower its carbon footprint, as outlined in their Environmental, Social, and Governance Reports.

Nissin Top Ramen

 80 51

Environmental protection

Nissin Foods has launched the EARTH FOOD CHALLENGE 2030, a comprehensive environmental strategy aimed at reducing their environmental impact and contributing to a sustainable society. This initiative focuses on addressing climate change and limited resources through various targeted actions. They have committed to minimizing CO2 emissions by 30% by 2030, with significant progress already made, including powering their USA headquarters with 100% renewable energy via solar panels and installing electric vehicle charging stations at their Gardena and Lancaster plants. Additionally, they have implemented plant-wide energy reduction initiatives, reducing CO2 emissions by 7% in FY22 compared to FY21 and decreasing their carbon footprint by over 66,000 pounds of CO2 in 2022. Nissin Foods also supports a green hydroelectric project to offset energy consumed by their plants. Their environmental strategy encompasses sustainable procurement, waste reduction, and the use of renewable energy, aiming to source sustainably, conserve natural resources, and create a world without waste. They have set targets for sustainable palm oil procurement, overall water use reduction, waste recycling, and increasing the share of renewable energy in their manufacturing processes. Furthermore, Nissin Foods is working on reducing CO2 emissions through the Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) method and aims to reduce the usage of petroleum-based plastic by introducing Biomass ECO Cups for their products.

sources: 1, 2, 3

Worker welfare

Nothing found

Animal welfare

Nissin Foods is exploring the development of low environmental impact plant-derived meat alternatives and cultured meat products as part of their sustainability efforts. They have developed "Soy Meat" as an alternative to livestock-derived ingredients, aiming to replace all ingredients originating from livestock with plant-derived ingredients in the future. Additionally, they have successfully produced bovine muscle tissue in the form of a diced steak through cultured meat technology, marking a significant step towards offering food ingredients with a low environmental impact. This initiative not only addresses environmental concerns but also has the potential to reduce animal suffering by providing alternatives to traditional meat products.

sources: 3

    • Minimize CO2 emissions by 30% by 2030
    • Sustainable palm oil procurement ratio of 100%
    • Overall water use reduction to 12.3ã¥ per million yen of sales
    • Waste recycling ratio of 99.5% and total waste reduction of 50% compared to fiscal 2016
    • Scope 1+2 CO2 emissions reduction of 42% compared to 2020
    • Scope 3 CO2 emissions reduction of 25% compared to 2020

Bud Light Lime

 80 31

Environmental protection

Bud Light Lime, under its parent company Anheuser-Busch, has taken significant steps towards environmental sustainability. Notably, Bud Light NEXT, a product within the same brand family, has achieved Climate Neutral Certification. This certification indicates that Bud Light NEXT has measured and offset its carbon emissions from the previous year and has committed to plans for reducing future emissions. This effort aligns with the standards set by Climate Neutral, a nonprofit organization focused on eliminating greenhouse gas emissions. Additionally, Bud Light NEXT has pledged to feature this certification on its packaging, highlighting its commitment to environmental responsibility. In a specific initiative, Bud Light partnered with the League of Legends Championship Series to offset 100% of the electricity used during a major event with clean, renewable wind power. Furthermore, Bud Light has joined the How2RecycleÂ® labeling program to promote recycling among consumers and has collaborated with Nikola Corporation and BYD Motors for a zero-emissions beer delivery, showcasing its dedication to reducing its carbon footprint and supporting renewable energy sources.

sources: 1

  • Certifications
    • Climate Neutral Certified
  • Commitments

Blue Moon

 80 43

Environmental protection

Blue Moon has actively engaged in environmental protection and sustainability efforts, aligning with China's "dual carbon" strategic goal. The company has focused on developing green products, such as concentrated liquid detergents, to reduce carbon dioxide emissions, electricity, and water usage. Over 90% of Blue Moon's products have attained the certification of China Environment Labeling, and its main liquid detergent products have earned China Water Conservation Certification. Blue Moon was among the first in the industry to obtain the Certificate of China Green Product. The company has also been recognized for its efforts in clean production, installing high-efficiency production equipment and adhering to low carbon footprint practices. Blue Moon's Chongqing and Tianjin factories have attained ISO50001 energy management system certification, and all manufacturing facilities have been ISO14001 environmental management system-certified. In 2021, Blue Moon (Tianjin) Co., Ltd. was honored as a National "Green Factory." Additionally, Blue Moon has earned the first product carbon label evaluation certificate in Guangzhou and is committed to carbon emissions management and addressing climate change issues.

sources: 1

Worker welfare

Blue Moon places a strong emphasis on worker welfare, focusing on creating a workplace where employees feel a strong sense of belonging. The company promotes full-cycle talent training and multi-channel career development for its employees. It also arranges a variety of activities to provide a harmonious, warm, and pleasant atmosphere for its staff. As of the end of 2021, the overall training rate of employees was 91.4%. Blue Moon cares about the physical and mental health and welfare of its employees, providing comprehensive health management care and services. All manufacturing facilities of Blue Moon have attained ISO45001 occupational health and safety management system certification. The company has been recognized for its human resources efforts, obtaining several awards including "China Best Employer Award TOP100."

sources: 1

Nothing found

  • Certifications
    • ISO 9001 Quality Management System Certification
    • China National Accreditation Service for Conformity Assessment (CNAS)
    • ISO50001 Energy Management System Certification
    • ISO14001 Environmental Management System Certification
    • ISO45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management System Certification
    • China Environment Labeling Certification
    • China Water Conservation Certification
    • Certificate of China Green Product

Verizon FiOS

 80 40

Environmental protection

Verizon FiOS, as part of Verizon's broader sustainability efforts, is actively working towards reducing its environmental impact through various initiatives. The company is focused on achieving operational net zero, with over 90% of its operational carbon footprint stemming from electricity used to power its networks. To address this, Verizon is maximizing the energy efficiency of its networks and facilities and transitioning to renewable energy. Verizon has allocated the net proceeds of its fifth $1 billion green bond entirely to renewable energy investments, aiming to accelerate the transition to greener electrical grids across the U.S. The company expects to source renewable energy equivalent to 50% of its annual electricity usage by 2025 and aims for 100% by 2030. Additionally, Verizon has installed 37.6 megawatts of on-site green energy since 2013. The company's solutions have enabled the avoidance of over 73 million metric tons of CO2e since 2018, with over 15.2 million metric tons avoided in 2022 alone. Verizon also focuses on recycling and waste diversion, having reused or recycled approximately 43.4 million pounds of e-waste in 2022, and aims to collect and recycle 10 million pounds of e-waste from communities by 2026. Water conservation is another priority, with a 23% reduction in water usage from 2016 to 2022. Furthermore, Verizon is transforming its fleet to use clean energy technologies and is developing charging stations for electric vehicles at its locations.

sources: 1, 2, 3

    • Source renewable energy equivalent to 50% of annual electricity usage by 2025
    • Source renewable energy equivalent to 100% of annual electricity usage by 2030
    • Achieve net zero carbon emissions in operations by 2035
    • Collect and recycle 10 million pounds of e-waste from communities by 2026
